dn-RrTOmsoHUXERGB9J3WQ.review_text: Disappointing that a fine restaurant like Hillstone can't keep the children and dogs out of the bar!  At 9pm we were surrounded by a table of shrieking two and five year olds and a crying baby in stroller at one table and on the other side 8 & 10 year old siblings playing an electronic game. Across from us was a couple with a cute fluffy dog that they let sit in a chair with them before going over to pee on the rosemary!  Felt like Chuck E Cheese than an expensive, romantic San Francisco.  Isn't there a health code to control these thoughtless people? Or at least a trained manager?

VoyMYXTMDDqXfAbyZsM5pQ.review_text: We made reservations for a group of 8 on Saturday night for a friend's birthday. Everyone actually got there early! Unfortunately our entire group of 8 sat around for well over a half hour before they ended up seating us. We made reservations for 9pm not 9:45. We had plans that night for our friend's birthday so it was incredibly inconvenient to say the least. The Manager did end up apologizing and giving us all our appetizers for free (we must have had 5) so that was a nice gesture.  We sat down, had our appetizers, a drink, then... ended up sitting around for another 20+ minutes before I had to frantically wave my hand in the direction of a couple of servers, who were standing there talking to one another for them to fetch our waitress. We finally ordered our food and they gave us another appetizer for waiting so long for our waitress. That's nice and all but we don't want to stuff ourselves on appetizers, we just want our dinners and to go out and have fun!   Even though they have a tiny menu. to be honest though, the food was all delicious. They definitely know how to cook their meat. We got prime rib, pork ribs, a filet and another steak. It was all delicious! One of our friends fish was raw and had to be remade, so again we had to wait for him to finish. We didn't end up getting out of there until 11:30.  On another note, they do have nice decor, some nice fireplaces, and live piano.   4 stars for food, 2 star for service = 3 stars.

-Ca1wV6l1paaFinQ9zdylw.review_text: The Barbecue Pork Ribs here are the best I have ever had in my entire life!!!  They are fall off the bone ribs.  I have literally picked up a bone to eat a rib once and I only picked up a bone, because the meat just slide off it.  I can't come here without ordering this dish (or at least someone at the table willing to share).  The ribs come with cole slaw and fries, but I prefer substituting them for a fully-loaded baked potato.  That is the only down side, you have to substitute 2 sides for 1 baked potato, but is worth it!  One of their other great dishes is the burger!  They grind the meat every morning, and is the juiciest and best burger you will ever have.  I am not huge into burgers, but I have come back to Hillstone just for their burger!  As for appetizers, I would definitely go with the artichoke!  It's the combination of the grilled artichokes and the rémoulade that make them so good.   They grill them in house.  So great, and I always finish the rémoulade before the artichokes and have to get more.    I have got the prime rib here.  It was good, but if your going for great prime rib, I would suggest you to go to House of Prime Rib.  I would recommend my friends on one of the other options.  They have a good wine selection and reasonably priced.  And a great modern steakhouse atmosphere.

ZdVLDQbs-ekcFOTDznhgeQ.review_text: My favorite place for prime rib.  The cut is thick and when you ask for RARE it comes out medium-rare but it didnt really matter . All their steaks are good from the fillet to their specials, all seasoned greaT.  If you're one of those people who needs to have A BIG ASS COW when you go out for steak, then this isn't the place for you.  But if you're looking to pay around $30 (not $50+) for yummy steak that will comfortably fill up your tummy, then Houstons is the place to be.  THE ONLY PROBLEM IS THAT ITS A CHAIN BUT WHO REALLY CARES ANYTHINGS GOOD IN THE CITY       .......    EXCEPT CHINATOWN FOOD =]

U4XJPeD6paZsyQp-tSCrWQ.review_text: Huge disappointment.  We've come here for years and tonight was probably the last.  The manager complained that our two children dancing with the jazz band were annoying other customers.  Though I was watching them the entire time and saw nothing, I still felt compelled to apologize to the band and 3 adjacent tables.  No one even understood what I was apologizing for.  By the way, the band played Charlie Brown specifically for my kids.  We went without napkins for a large portion of our meal, had fruit flies swarming our table (and consequently in my wine) and were asked multiple times to clear our plates before we were done eating.  We also had the check delivered without asking us if we wanted desert.  We happened to be celebrating an anniversary and the end of the school year.  Did I mention that my kids brought some money from their piggy banks to tip the band?  Very disappointed by our old family go-to that used to have such great service.  We will be moving on.

nYy_9YCHYKAzUd4uIC-Z9w.review_text: Always a solid choice, especially in the winter when they have cabbage as a side.  It's a bit off the beaten path, but easy to get a reservation and the food comes in hearty portions that rarely allow for dessert.  If you have to wait for your table, the cocktails are fantastic.

BQ73YHpyADiz-Wf1OQ0EPg.review_text: I had a business dinner at Hillstone on a Thursday evening.  The place was bustling and there was a live jazz band in the corner to the left of the dining room, pretty cool.  My party ordered the spinach/artichoke dip that didn't seem to have much artichoke in it, but it was still tasty.  Hot and bubbly, I tried to contain myself so as not to embarrass my colleagues.  I went with the crab cakes, which were great.  They had tons of crab and not a lot of filler which made me really happy.  The accompanying fries were just ok.  Not particularly tasty but since I have this habit of eating potatoes in any form I ate most of them anyway.  We ordered the apple walnut cobbler for dessert, which was pretty good but had too much caramel sauce.  All in all the service was pretty good, attentive but not overly so, and she brought everything we asked for.  For the prices I'm unlikely to eat here unless there's an expense account involved, but the quality of the food seems quite good overall.

RKwuvLBMWaXSzVmaZD5zpw.review_text: My favorite restaurant. Period.  Everything I've ever eaten here has been beyond amazing.  Ive had the ribs, burger, salad, fries, mashed potatoes... everything... so good!

ImnSEf2zOlzu0sZJ-BI3gA.review_text: Overpriced and know flavor in anything  Great service though Had kale with chicken salad  Over dressed and chicken flavorless apple Cobbler too sweet with hardly any apples

tERbi3yzjRIQ6p6HADFeZQ.review_text: Still as good as it gets!

MvzUoye4DKsBdB4dylgpDw.review_text: Hillstone is a wonderful place to park if you don't want to spend too much at the Embarcadero parking garages. The restaurant boasts a beautiful interior, great service, wonderful views, and pets are allowed to eat outside (with dog bowls included). If you want meat, I would absolutely come back and enjoy their steaks and chicken.

nO_5OkDDWYHe_GE6iYQa1w.review_text: Hawaiian Rib Eye is super delicious! : ) The environment is very cozy and busy, I like how the kitchen is open so you feel like they are cooking in front of you, well not really in front of you but you get the idea. Parking is easy just pay the meter, it is weird how the meter over there is until 11pm, so remember to pay!   Overall I will recommend people to come here and try the Hawaiian Rib Eye, you won't be disappointed. : )

4sVhCJsCYTf5ufEXMJWd6g.review_text: I've been here a few times before, but apparently haven't written a review yet. It's a solid 4+ stars, and good for a special occasion or to bring an out of town visitor to. Some highlights: they do take reservations (even though I swear they didn't used to) and you can byob with no corkage fee :)  Oh and there was live music.  Last night we had the chips and guac/salsa to start (although later I wished we had gotten the smoked salmon), followed by the special of lamb shank w/ mashed potatoes and veggies and the sea bass with veggies. Both dishes were very tasty. For dessert I was initially sad to see that each option involved nuts... don't they know that some people don't like nuts?? But, then I was happily surprised when our waitress came over to tell us there was a chocolate mousse special! So, we got that. yum yum.   On previous visits I know I've gotten the grilled artichoke starter and the ribs for a main dish. All in all, a great spot that I would definitely recommend.

I7rFke4reJVPDawRuDbPAQ.review_text: Just OK. Not bad, but hardly worth the money I mean $36 for ribs!!! Their prices are in line with Boulevard with no where near the same dining experience-or food quality. Very noisy too Someone earlier summed up Hillstone perfectly --- an overpriced Cheesecake Factory without the menu selection

ENtSjbekFHjltp2TFkstHg.review_text: Here goes nothing.  We walked in at about 900 on a Friday night and waited about 30 minutes for a table. Not a problem b/c we didn't have reservations, so we checked out the menu (way more expensive than it should be) while we waited and everything sounded great! We were standing right next to the kitchen and on a few occasions I started to salivate when I noticed a giant rack of ribs grilling away. I also saw a very large, nice steak on that grill, so that's what I had my mind set on.   We sat down at our table and the restaurant is very nice, a bit dark for my taste. Our waiter, remains nameless, got our drinks and took our order, so far so good. I ordered the Hawaiian Rib Eye (we were on a budget so we decided to share) and the Tuna Salad. Both came out at the same time, which I'm not a fan of b/c a salad, in my book, usually comes before the entree, but what the F do I know. The salad was giant, tasted great, although they skimped on the avocado and I'm Mexican, so you know I'm all about some avocado. The steak look great, was cooked exactly as we asked, BUT, for $30, trim the fuckin fat off that bitch!!! I mean come on, I had a lil pile o fat on my plate and that's just fuckin nasty!  Mr. Waiter was too busy folding napkins, with his back to the tables, to come over and hook me up with some more soda, which is cool b/c I asked another waitress and she hooked me up. Overall I'd say the food was good, not great and a bit overpriced.  Pet Peeve #1 in the guest handbook: DO NOT leave me the check while I am eating my dessert! That's just not cool b/c nobody wants to spend that kinda cash and be told GET THE FUCK OUT, I have better things to do. What did Mr. Waiter do during dessert?? Yup, you guessed, check on the table while eating dessert with the casual "Whenever your ready sir" comment. That's boots dude. I wasn't pissed, I was trying to be compassionate, maybe he had a long day or a shitty day, whatever, but you know I had to mention that on my yelp review. FFFEEEWWW, now I can go about my day in Peace.  I would go back again, not soon, but I would and I think the food was really good, despite the minor detail mentioned above.

JVr9QqrLA4cyw_NKrEyvaw.review_text: Love this place! My wife and I bring our now two year old son here for lunch whenever we feel like making the 40 minute drive up to the city. We sit outside and enjoy a nice lunch. The best thing about this restaurant is that the service is impeccable....every single time we visit. The staff will always go out of their way to make sure everything is perfect. The one drawback is that the French Dip is so good, that I refuse to try anything else. My wife raves about the Biltmore Chicken Sandwich. They recently changed this sandwich to grilled chicken instead of rotisserie, but as long as they still make it the "old school" way, no problems from us.  If you are looking for a great lunch place with outside seating...look no further.

yZM8bO0dbhffVp6RCTFN5w.review_text: BYOB, no corkage fee!  In theory, a perfect way to enjoy a long lush-tablious dinner with some inexpensive New World gems.  In practice, this place has no concept of pacing and serves your entrée while you're still picking at your appetizers.  Granted, they don't rush you out the door at the end, but the social pressure of drinking your own wine with no food left could preempt the experience.  The food itself was decent, but not out of this world.  I much prefer Fog City Diner for BYOB no corkage fee meals at a more leisurely pace with better food!  Spinach & Artichoke Dip: So why are they wasting plate space with sour cream and salsa?  The headliner had awesomely tender artichoke, non-bitter spinach and enough cheese to make my cardiologist afford a U.C. school for his kids!  The nachos were standard, but fresh.  Really wish they ditched the sour cream and salsa for more spinach & artichoke dip.  Rib Eye: One of the specials with a creamy mushroom sauce.  Better than Tad's, but not up to steakhouse quality.  Too thin.  Definitely not a repeat.  Barbecue Pork Ribs: Friends and Yelp reviews were right, the ribs are so fall of the bone tender.  I like how they grill them up before serving to give a crispy edge.  Was not a fan of the BBQ sauce, was way too generic.  They need to take lessons from Oola's sauce.  Baked Potato: Huge.  The real bacon was a nice touch.  The sour cream and cheddar was tasty, but far from sophisticated.  Brussels Sprouts: Pretty bland.  I'm so used to pancetta, truffle oil and parmesan that I forgot mainstream brussels sprouts are unpopular for good reason.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text: completely and utterly whelmed. not under, not over. just whelmed. youtube.com/watch?v=yHDc… did i ever mention i love this movie? anyways.. there was nothing terribly bad about our meal. there was also nothing great. the steak were just fine. nothing great, nothing terrible. the service wasnt bad, but it wasnt good. being the first table of the night, youd think the server would be a bit more personable. she wasnt. would i come back again? for dinner, no. for drinks, sure why the hell not. i liked my 06 flowers pinot noir we had.

YVWVVh1pZoadVD_oea-8dA.review_text: I don't care what the attire suggests this is fancy date night.  Nice cuts of filet mignon, great house wine, and live jazz.  It's not stuffy at all.  You can chow down with your elbows in the air and no one will judge you.  If you book in advance there are large booth tables for bigger parties.  Service was attentive even when we got a little rowdy from booze.  Everything here is classy.  I could easily live off of the spinach dip from here.  Keep bringing those plates over.  My filet mignon was generous without going overboard.  Oh and the view of the coast is so Embarcadero date spot.

dS1IiGLBGdjsminL2c6qyQ.review_text: FOOD -  3 STAR SERVICE  - 2 STAR VALUE 2 STAR OVERALL 2.5 STARS  Would have given 3 stars but since Hillstone tried to scam us on charging us $3.50 per coke ( in a can by the way) I have a bad taste in my mouth and will not be returning any time soon.  Server says they have problems with the soda lines and have to go to cans, claiming that Hillstone also wants only the very best for their customers.  Then why not glass bottles?    The reply was a crock of &*&T and the server knew it.  My suggestion:  When we ordered the second coke server should have disclosed it will be another charge.  After all, days before it was a free refill policy.  I know this is a small petty complaint but sometimes it's the little things that make all the difference.  Hillstone does what is best for Hillstone not what is best for the guest.

8ZWYZwYjO9vrfmdhDLc4TA.review_text: Hooray for business-paid dinners.  I stopped in with some colleagues to preempt a 4-hour planning meeting and found myself in a corner booth right next to the 3-piece soft jazz band...which wasn't as bad as I though it would be for dinner discussion.  Service was attentive and the presentation of the food was great, but my halibut was lack-luster.  I mean halibut isn't a strong fish, but it was like eating air with creamy sauce.  The corn/zucchini side was great and so was the artichoke dip, but come on...if halibut is the special, it should be savory.  I really wanted the rib-eye, but decided I had had too much red meat in the previous 3 days...darn you genetic predispositions.  The ambiance was classy and there's a sign on the door that says "Proper attire required" so watch out if you're a tourist just dropping in.  It's still a Houston's chain, but renamed to try to ditch the chain rep.  Everyone else had a nice time though even if some of the orders didn't come with the sides that were actually ordered.  I couldn't vouch for their cocktails or wine since I was hopped up on Vicodin (pulled a muscle that morning - no I'm not Dr. House), but we ordered 2 bottles, so it must've been good.  For some reason, our server said the wine cellar inventory was low...so we didn't get our first or second choice.  I hear the ribs are legendary so that will be the only reason I come back, because for the dough, there are better restaurants.

NpU44ANnUUNQWY4U0eUGvA.review_text: hilltone, houstons, whatever you want to call this place.  i dont think restaurants should really bother patrons with name changes.  i think its such a owner/ego thing.  yes i just said that.  my first experience here was not all that great.  probably would not come again.  no corkage fee is a good lure though.  we come at 8 and they say there are plenty of tables open for our party of 7.  not everyone is there yet so we wait.  15 minutes later, they say several tables are getting ready leave, sweet.  another 30 minutes later what looks to be our table is being given to someone who make a "reservation"  wait i thought you didnt take reservations?  9pm we still havent sat down.  i wander over to tables that look like they might be and watch.  the lady comes over and acts really apologetic and then offers us free appetizers to make up for this ridiculously long wait.  the spinach artichoke dip, artichoke, mashed potatoes, ribs are good.  my halibut was very much undercooked.  i didnt want to make a big deal and send it back so i didnt.  the 5 nut brownie is also delicious.  i guess this place is worth the money since we spent about $40 per person and got appetizers, a big main, and dessert. and alcohol.  oh and during the one hour wait, we got eaten alive by mosquitoes since we were standing by the door.  it was that or smell like smoke.  which we ended up smelling like anyways.

VgY4hbDf5gDSdQtt-7xiCw.review_text: Delicious crab cake, tender steak and tasty tuna.  You can't asked for better appetizer.  Spinach dip is a bit salty but sure goes well with white wine.  Best part? No corkscrew fee up to 2 bottles.  Great place and live jazz music, woohoo!

cJhXxwz6Q9YzOXXHcOY7Mg.review_text: Love this place!  I Always try to take my friends and family here when they visit because we don't have a Hillstone or one of their associated restaurants back home in Detroit :(  I usually get the burger or when I am feeling extra manly I get the pork shank.  Both are amazing!  Good selection of top shelf spirits and their coffee  makes Cafe Trieste jealous.

XJ4igeCvZ-nvBXpTMZr9Kw.review_text: Loved this place. More points given for ambiance and service than for food. However even food items were well above average.  Attentive table service made for a good experience. I wish seating was a little more comfortable.  I tried a Waldorf salad which was awesome, my steak was cooked well, the baked potato could have been better.   All in all, a good experience. Thanks

5p2nFQJy1YVqzYCbq7JuYQ.review_text: My first time at Hillstone turned out to be a nice experience! We arrived a bit later in the evening on a weekend and parking was not an issue for us (although I understand how it could be difficult during peak dining hours). We were seated immediately and upon request, were able to get a table next to a window which overlooked the Embarcadero.  We ordered the spinach dip to share and a prime rib for each of us. The spinach dip was good and the prime rib was a good thick cut - it was a rather big dish, if you ask me! I was pretty much begging my BF to finish my prime rib with big, puppy eyes... in which he had to decline because he was surprisingly full as well. The meat was tender and overall it was pretty good (I would order it again). I had requested to have my prime rib come with a baked potato but somehow the server confused it as me wanting the alternative side dish. When the prime rib came out with the other side dish, I told her about the confusion and she quickly apologized and gave me a baked potato on the house! Man, that baked potato was good! I think I was talking about the baked potato more than the prime rib (but then again, I'm pretty much obsessed with baked potatoes, haha).  I love the atmosphere of Hillstone! It was rather dark with a lot of wood elements and the pine cone-looking lights were beautiful. Definitely intimate/romantic! The noise level wasn't too bad either, especially since we sat near a corner of the restaurant.  I definitely would love to come back here and try out other dishes! Oh, and their cocktails too!

M_j-Ix4K0Q0EMzed-sAehg.review_text: Better than we expected. Went here for lunch with my coworkers. Looks like a diner because of the booths but the interior is pretty modern.  Dishes are pretty pricey but excellent quality. May not come back because of parking and the price.

HO5EQkttwiO-i_Zsytke_w.review_text: Pork Ribs, French Rib Sandwich & Artichoke dip. NOTHING was outstanding. As a matter of fact, I would give it two stars if they didn't have nice decor and good customer service. I came here with three other girlfriends and we were all SUPER HUNGRY! Yes, the portions are big, but that does not make up for mediocre taste (that's coming from a hungry gal too!)   I guess I am a bit harsh because the overall 4 star rating on YELP deceived me.   1 appetizer & 2 entrees= $80 bill = Mediocre food= NO BUENO.

8iEOk-X9GA9sXhbJmAYnrg.review_text: Loved the place till they took away fountain sodas for a  $3.50 can of coke. That to me is cheap nickel dime stuff. I asked them why they stopped the fountain soda and started the $3.50 can and they said people complained about the taste. Huh? Call up Coke and have them fix it. Something tells me the profit is alot more on a $3.50 can of soda. Only in San Francisco ( I live 3 blocks away) havent gone back since.

cX-AD3Ul6CaSLU3T1Pe4TQ.review_text: This was my favorite restarurant in San Francisco.  Used to love the atmosphere, great food, drinks, and jazz.  The prices have ballooned thanks to the America's Cup, I guess...  but unfortunately the quality of some of the dishes has declined.  We had the artichokes and steak salad which were great!  Normally I would never order this but it sounded really good so I ordered the Hickory Burger.    First of all, the burger was cold and the cheese on it was cold and just piled high like grated and to tell you the truth, I believe they forgot to stick it in the oven for the cheese to melt and the burger to get hot.   Next, the burger did not taste one bit like hickory!  WTF!  Really!   Why is no one supervising the plating?  My friend ordered the french dip, and they forgot the jus!  WTF!  They have enough help and all that but just someone should make sure each plate is served properly.

nKBKQlN1UjFh5bORqcn_Mw.review_text: RIBEYE!!!! Hillstone's Hawaiian Rib-Eye steak is EVERYTHING!  Although there are several tasty looking options on the menu, it's soo hard for me to get anything OTHER than the rib-eye! The second my knife touches the meat, the steak literally melts...cooked to complete perfection! The Hawaiian glaze sauce compliments the steak well and isn't overly sweet!   Aside from the awesome steak, the spinach artichoke dip is a great starter. The restaurant has a classy / chic - yet casual feel to it.  Also, they have a live band that plays every Friday and Saturday night, which sets the mood right!

tlm0oSO_4zAytjev77ZIDQ.review_text: Good steak and amazing dessert. I've heard their Hawaiian steak is the best, so I'll try it next time. I made the mistake to go without reservations - had to wait awhile (expected with a popular restaurant though).  Give yourself enough time to find parking - especially Thurs-Sat nights. Nice place for a date or even to watch a game on TV at the bar.

X-NuzqOxc4HS2cUrapSt4A.review_text: I can't believe I haven't reviewed Houston's considering i've already been here twice since i've started my love affair with yelping. Honestly, both times I"ve been here, Houston's has just been mediocre. I really don't remember the first time at all so I'll review the second time. I ordered the roasted chicken with mashed potatoes as did my boyfriend. The chicken was really dry and you really had to smother it in the juice in order for it to get any flavor. But there wasn't enough juice. The potatoes were mediocre and weren't great tasting or anything.  We did order thsi brownie dessert that was actually pretty good. Not overly sweet. Oh and we also ordered the cheese toast. Now the cheese toast is good. If you go, you have to order that. I think it's pretty unique and i haven't tasted anything like it anywhere else before. These were the only highlights of the night though.  Service isn't exceptional or anything, nothing to rave about. Not bad not good.  Not worth the wait, time or money.

idrkOLEkfsdWEZrkiCsa8A.review_text: Fantastic. Hillstone (version 1.2 of Houston's) was excellent. They have added a few things to the menu and they are all great. The atmosphere is great, food is great, service is great, and Rachel, our server was par excellence.   The only thing wrong with this place is the bar scene, which is basically comprised of only people whop are waiting for their reservations. It is not that vibrant! No sexy girls in black dresses getting loopy on cosmopolitans, and no guys getting their "drink on" before the hitting the town. The bartenders make seriously weak drinks. They use a jigger, which to me is a death sentence. This place would a regular hang out for me if they figured our their bar scene. That being said, though they have weak drinks, not having any corkage fee is a huge compensating factor.   Everything on the menu rocks. The crab cakes are some of the best I have ever had because they don't grind up the crab. They use chinks the size of of a small Asian's pinky finger. Excellent!!    My only criticism on the food  is that the two best meat dishes they have (double cut pork chop and Hawaiian rib eye), though cooked to perfection, have very sweet seasoning, which takes away from the true flavor of the meat.   Overall this place is fantastic, and the change from Houston's to Hillstone has added a few more arrows to its quiver.

lWPec3U_TSIAEpqLuzvyQg.review_text: This is my favorite American restaurant anywhere. I first patronized Houston's when I lived in Chicago. Service is excellent, they could teach a lot of restaurants in this city a thing or two about service. Menu - very American - very good.  Artichoke dip, burgers, you can blindfold yourself and pick at random and you're not going to be disappointed. Atmosphere is very comfortable and relaxing with out being sloppy.

9TSaxQfjvhars1NdQGwNYQ.review_text: Why is this restaurant still open?  Every time I go here (I end up here quite a bit because my friends and family think this is the SPOT!) my food tastes like WOOD!  And when I go at night, I can't even see what I am eating.  The last time I went there, I got a salad...thinking "How can they mess up a salad?"  But they can and they did...probably because the chef couldn't see what he was putting on the plate...TASTED LIKE RAT BUTT (please don't ask me how I know what rat butt tastes like).  The people that work here are always so nice.  But, I wouldn't know them if I saw them on the street because of the dimly lit interior of this place.  TURN on the lights and improve the food or MOVE OUT and give the dawgs some room.  Chef Ramsey!!!!!  You are needed at Houston's on Montgomery!!!!!  COME QUICK!!!!!

HDPn9zJvTUDU8g4cYUjkzQ.review_text: Although it's a chain, it is one of my favorite restaurants on the planet. I always start with the artichoke dip - it is absolutely delicious. The hawaiian rib eye is incredible. I love the teriyaki marinade, and the steak always comes out perfect. I also can't leave without getting the 5 nut brownie. It's very dark inside, but I enjoy it, especially with the live music.

Q9dKRgLVP_r3H9P8ObR-PQ.review_text: One more review of sheer pleasure from eating at Houston's. I had the Prime Rib and I fell in love. The starter salad was even greatly prepared.  I ate so much that I did not have room for dessert. Next time I will not eat as much, so I can try the fudge.....   No complaints.

AJ3HgRkVP4NzK-wVNKQzew.review_text: I know this is a 'restaurant group' (aka chain) but it was very good for lunch.  Did try the spinach/cheese dip which was very spinachy and the chips were super fresh and crisp.  Did love that.  Had the cheeseburger and tabouli side - cheeseburger was huge and cooked as I requested (rare).  Tabouli was good but a bit too much lemon juice.  Service was fine but a bit neglectful with the water refills.

6XCZoufB_S-sY6vsxMGd8Q.review_text: When you think about prime ribs, you think about HOPR, Broadway Prime, San Mateo Prime, 5A5, Brazenhead, and a few of the other steak houses that have prime rib as their specials.    Hillstone has probably the most underrated prime ribs in San Francisco.  The service is welcoming, the ambiance is vibrant, the open kitchen makes you feel as though you are home, and the prime is fantastic.  I still can't believe how good the prime rib was.  It comes with a mug of Au jus so you would never have to ask for extra sauce.  I usually always get horse radish with my prime rib.  It was so good that I forgot to ask for horse radish.  By the time I finished, I realized that I didn't have any horse radish.  I would recommend this place for a great prime rib.

AfTCKQlhSMImRF1bxMQlcA.review_text: We like to stop by Hillstone for lunch on our way home from morning city meetings.  We typically eat at the bar and the staff there is always on their game.  I was surprised by the jump in prices lately ($18 for a hamburger and $38 for fish).  Can't say it is worth that kind of money.  AND the fries with my burger were soggy and cold.  I asked for another plate and those eventually arrived after I was 90% through with my meal.  Great bar staff -- kitchen management lacks the focus required to deliver value on an $18 hamburger.

shw6PfGIr7RmCltbUX89Ow.review_text: Great bar, great food, great atmosphere. Would be a five but I'm not a big fan of the impersonal multi-staff type service. Probably a little pricy too!

s2heZodKkq4Qq57bAIqQ_w.review_text: Service, FOOD, and ambiance! Best we have had in awhile. I have had my yelp account for quite some time - and I have yet to find a place worthy of a high rating review, until now.  My husband and I have been to plenty of places to eat, spending hundreds of dollars - and neither of those places topped off the experience we had here.  We found our new SF spot to enjoy a steak and a glass of wine.  I look forward to having a date with my husband at their Napa location.  Thank you, Erin and Hillstone for your supreme hospitality (and service).

NxxmeuEYqOp6459O6WmauQ.review_text: Their food and ambiance is great, but their service is extremely low class.   If you want to take a date, or take a business contact here avoid it at all cost. They keep pushing you with 2 minute intervals to order desert, you tell them you need to slow down and will let them know when you want it and, they come back in 2 minutes and ask you if you're ready. They don't care if you're having a conversation, they don't watch your face, and they don't care about anything. If you're proposing to your future wife, they will gladly come and ruin the moment for you to sell you their dessert. We ordered cognac to have the waitress go away for a while, and she came back with the bill without us asking for it.  Basically, they took the initiative to end the night, our conversation on our behalf.   I spoke to the manager after this, she came back and she interrupted our conversation as well to apologize. So they have no clue to service people from the low level staff to the high level staff.   I also called corporate headquarters. The lady hung up on me.  They claim this is their "Style of service". Classless.   Avoid at all cost if you want to impress anybody with your manners and a good quality service.

-V-fzFw34tpy-AjOzx4e0A.review_text: We always pass by Hillstone while walking on the Embarcadero, so we just had to try it. Made reservations...got there 5 minutes early...waited another 35 minutes before being seated, but one of the cooks was kind enough to give us some fries while we were waiting. Plus if there's room outside to wait, they have this awesome fake-wood fireplace next to some small tables, so it's pretty relaxing.   My boyfriend had the Hawaiian Prime Rib and it was excellent. I had the Flying Tuna Platter and while the fish was really good, it was the honey-lemon vinaigrette chopped salad that really stood out. I am a ranch dressing type of girl, but this really did it for me. In addition to the greens they add mango and avocado. I'd go again just to have the side salad!

Snio_QiJPDPrtrL6GXkb9Q.review_text: Good french dip sandwich Good service Price is not cheap but it is a nice place. It is 5 min from home so I will be back.

gyT1E10Z9fv1bieVWSMI6Q.review_text: Shockingly two visits in a row the bartenders could not make a basic mixed drink. After the second failed attempt had to go for a beer. Going elsewhere from now on.

oiZNrO8Z4q0h-Qg41_odhQ.review_text: I would recommend the Hillstone for lunch on a sunny day. Ask to be seated outside, order a mimosa, and sit back for some quality food and equally great people watching. So far I have only tried one item on the menu, but I have no reason to try anything else. The crispy chicken sandwich is outstanding. The bread is soft, the battered chicken is crispy, and the tomato actually tastes like tomato. The best part of the sandwich is the kale salad that comes in place of plain old lettuce. It is dressed with honey mustard and it is delectable. Altogether, it is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had. The food is pricey but if you are looking for fine service on the Embarcadero, Hillstone is a great choice.

K5poIZjcAPqGcFvonTKilw.review_text: My favorite fine dining restaurant chain.    Go to items to order are:  Spinach Dip Waldorf Chicken Spinach Salad Thai Steak Salad Prime Rib (order it one level more rare than you want, they have a tendency to over cook slightly) Filet Mignon (same with ordering) Ribeye (Hawaiian or regular)  ***Make sure you try their fully loaded baked potato (you can sub for any of the sides) and make sure to ask for a 2nd full load on the side.  Service here is almost always good.  There has been a few instances where we have had a waitress we weren't happy with, but that is rare.  They biggest problem with this place is the seating.  It is 95% booths, so for large parties of 6 or more, it is very difficult to get seating or reservations.  My only complaint about this place is that they no longer waive all corkage fees.  I guess there are a lot of people who used to bring 3-5 bottles of wine and just sit and chill and the restaurant didn't make any money.  I believe now they will do one bottle free and anymore than that will be $15 each.

ZEeUaeLGNR_mWsqSPwNksg.review_text: This place is wonderful! The food were delicious!! For appetizers, we got the spinach and artichoke dip and also the smoked salmon. The Spinach dip was really good, but since i don't eat artichoke, i cant judge for its taste. The smoked salmon was not really my fave either. It came with a toasted bread and some dipping, but man that salmon was so fishy. It just wasn't my cup of tea. Anyways moving on...  For the entree we had the swordfish, pork ribs, prime rib, and i forgot the other one (it was the $38 one). Swordfish was great, my sister LOVED the mushrooms so much. The prime rib was just mmmm deliciousoo! It was very tender and tasty! And the pork ribs? Uh-mazing. Seriously that thing just melted in my mouth! Wish it had more sauce on it though, but hey i'm not complaining!   Why a four star then? Well we weren't pleased by our waiter's performance. He sucked and he was sucha fake. We knew he was tlkng crap about us to his other coworker. He never came back to refill our water; he was never around around table so it was hard to get any kind of help! Anyway i wish he gets fired. Even i have better customer service than that and i don't work at a steak house!! Stupid guy..

9eKk90OB9wKDacTDyYvFWg.review_text: The day before Thanksgiving Prince Charming and I headed out to Hillstone's in San Francisco. I was sick, so once I saw the french onion soup on the menu I knew that is what would make me feel so much better - that's until the server brought me something completely different at the same time deflating my excitement by letting me know that the french onion soup is only served on Sundays.. ugh! Then, there it was on the appetizer menu, a baked potato! I haven't had a baked potato in years! It was exactly what I needed - melted butter, creamy sour cream, and crunchy little bacon bits... heaven! I am on day #2 of my juice cleanse... so far kind of successful. I drank wine today.. it's technically juice - it's made of grapes! Pictures on my blog...

y_jl-bErj1mnb4KF04F74Q.review_text: Never a corkage fee.  Always friendly service - in the bar and restaurant. Best ribs.

B158jeBnZWLoFYoSYuLPLg.review_text: We LOVE this place, event though we always want to try a new place in SF, we always end up going to Houston's just because we know it will be great.  Probably the most delicious dish I have ever had is the Thai Steak Noodle Salad, this salad is just to die for!  Grilled Fillet Minion, succulent mango and avocado, Thai noodles, a tangy, toasted peanuts and  flavorful vinagrette make this dish so good.  The steaks, burgers, ribs, fries, avocados are all AMAZING too.  Service is always good and friendly, the atmosphere is really nice and relaxed, 5 stars!

EXkO-gR8EjkFWRbebHtxSA.review_text: Hillstone is literally a block away from my office so we it's our go-to place for lunch. Really...I'm so spoiled. Sit outside on a nice day and pop open a bottle of wine!  The service is always so attentive that I'm kind of convinced that they go through some sort of boot camp to get hired, hahaha.  Appetizers: - Grilled Artichokes- hands down the BEST thing on the menu. I will never  be able to find better artichokes. My mouth is watering just thinking about them... - Cheese Toast- warm, buttery, cheesy. How can you go wrong? - Smoked Salmon- definitely recommend as well! - Spinach and Artichoke Dip- nothing special, but nothing bad about it  Entrees: - Daily fresh fish- To be honest, I'm knocking off one star because I've never been impressed with Hillstone's fish specials. Every time I've tried one, they're really oily and overly flavorful. Although... - Grilled Salmon- It's cooked perfectly and I love the seasoning (or maybe I really just love salt, ok?!). Be sure to get the winter root vegetables because they're seasonal and soooo good! - Seared Ahi Salad- generous cuts of ahi with a really fresh and flavorful salad. Def recommend.  And I've always been too full to get any dessert...but they look really good!

aLDhyp7_JFtF7T8k5CvZLg.review_text: Quite possibly the best overall restaurant in San Francisco.  With all the amazing restaurants and variety of foods in this city, it takes a special kind of place to make me want to come back over and over again. And Hillstone is that kind of a restaurant.   The overall decor is very welcoming and cozy. There is a large bar as you enter, with screens if you want to catch a game or tune in the news. The staff is incredibly friendly and warm and are very attentive. There are comfy spacious booths, beautiful lighting, a fireplace and even a jazz  band on the weekends that ads a special touch to any visit.  And I haven't even gotten to the food yet.........omg. I am never dissapointed by this place. I've tried (almost) everything on the menu, but my favorite by far is the pork chop. The most perfectly cooked piece of meat I have ever had in my life. Trust me, everything on the menu is amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant, it is one of my favorites and frequent is at least once a month. 2 thumbs way up.

lMFGj1hELsTdBjAiw1f0fw.review_text: This place used to be one of my favorites... But recently, they let me down... First, I had to wait 20 minutes for the waitress to bring a menu and water to me (and I was sitting at the bar) and I watched her take orders from everyone else who walked up to the bar. Then I had to wait another 20 before I had to approach another bar tender at the other end of the bar to place my order. Second, I ordered the artichoke appetizer and 1/3 of the way through I found a WORM roasted right along with my artichoke...gulp! I didn't make a big fuss, but the manager never came over to apologize for the "gross error!"  The waitress was apologetic and once the restaurant crowd died down was much more attentive. But needless to say, I will wait for my next trip back to DC before I go to "Houston's" again.... :(

LKeRPtCjH7aLVENwjIACNw.review_text: I fell in LOVE with this place when it was Houston's, and I was so happy to see that not much had changed since the good ol' days!    As everyone is saying, the hawaiian rib eye is a MUST if you are a meat lover!  The bf and I came here on a random Thursday and shared the rib eye as well as the apricot glazed chicken which was to die for!  The fries were so good, we ordered an extra side of them along with our mashed potatoes, which were also tasty.    The only downside is the wait time at 9 o'clock at night, but I won't dock a star since we should've known to make reservations.  Highly recommended!!

ensMcP6OcK0bYlCEjwmsgA.review_text: **Friends of mine wanted to go - so we did...NEVER AGAIN.   SO, I'm not quite sure what all the fuss is about...this place is barely even a 1-star. The food is BLAND and boring to say the least. My house salad was  the best thing and that's not good. The people we went with got the burger, the rib-eye, the 'Cajun' fish (they should be ashamed to use the word 'Cajun' for that fish, it was cooked well but BLAND and flavorless). I got the veggie burger which was so dry and grainy that I could only eat half the patty and couldn't even have the bun. The whole thing was super dry. The fries were good, but really, how hard is that?   Our server was cheery which was a far cry from the gals behind the front of the house...they looked miserable and they were! When we left, they didn't so much as say a single 'Thanks' or 'Bye' - and there were three of them just standing there!   I cannot for the life of me understand WHY WHY WHY are so many people flocking to this place and what is it about their terrible food that hooks them? It's not upscale dining, the chairs at the tables are conference room chairs (with wheels!)...the booths are dated...I just cannot see the appeal. It's not a steakhouse, it's not a burger place, they can grill fish, but don't know how to season it and if you are vegetarian, forget it, you can have a salad or a super dry veggie burger...they don't even have a single pasta dish for vegetarians.   Meh/ Blah/ Never-again...to say the least...I'd rather go anyplace else but here. If you want steak, go to Harris' or Epic, not much more $$$. If you want a burger, there are several other places you can go. If you want fish, go to Catch on Market or Woodhouse on Market or Fillmore...there is no reason to come to this chain in San Francisco with so many other amazing restaurants waiting to be discovered.

f6_KXMhmGTaOHxi0p6R_ng.review_text: I'm amazed I never reviewed them while they were still technically Houstons, especially considering I like them enough to give their gift cards to clients around Christmas!  But hey, here goes.  Considering Hillstone is literally a chain they're out of this world.  They do a fantastic job  presenting as a local, high end steak house and it shows.  The service is spot on 95% of the time, from front to back.  The leather booths, rich browns and heavy wood, fireplace and seemingly low hung ceiling do a great job setting the mood, and the vegetables and Thai Steak Salad are some of the best in the city.  So good in fact I rarely waver from that order.  Everytime it's cold and crisp outside I get a hankering to head to Hillstone (still weird calling them by their group name) during an off hour and enjoy that salad and a Sundae.  I makes my day.

sw_fy8O9yYieDHdhv9xycg.review_text: The last time I was there, It was called Houston. Why the name change?  We actually went there because they had a chain in Napa that we liked. I believed it was called Rutherford Grill. They got great corn bread.   That night, we were a group of four. The wait was a bit long and we were hungry. We decided to order the shrimp cocktail which was very expensive (almost like $5 a piece).   Once we were seated, the waiter took our drink orders which we all got the sweeten ice tea. To our surprise, the ice tea was not a free refill like the ones in Napa. They did re-fill one more time for us thou, and told us the next re-fill would be charged.   As we all made our decision on what we wanted for our meals, most of us got the soup and one got the salad. To our surprise, we saw a tiny slug like worm moving really fast on the outer edge of the salad bow. We flag the waiter right away and she took it away. After that, the manager dropped by our table and apologized. He did ask if we would like another salad or maybe soup for replacement. The friend who order the salad didn't want soup or salad anymore. The manager at the time asked if everything is okay, we said that would be fine and he walked away. After the manager walked away, we started to compare how the service are with Olive Garden or Black Angus with Houston. At Olive Garden, the manager would of comp our meals after giving us such a bad experience like being stingy with the ice tea re-fill and the worm in the salad. We just laugh it off and try to continue enjoying our dinner.   After finishing our dinner, the checks came. We all chipped in and one of use decided to keep the cash while he charges it on his credit card. Dinner that night was about $180, but when the waiter brought back the receipt for signing, the charge on the credit card was like $1,800. We finally had enough of the disappointing dinner night and calls for the manager back. We informed him how they seemed very cocky and for a 5 star restaurant the service was a lot worst then Olive Garden. The manager was shock and said, "I can't believe you're comparing us to Olive Garden!". I informed him that if we were eating there, they would totally taken care of us. They would not being stingy on the refill, and they would of at least offer us desserts. With having a bad experience at a 5 star restaurant, not once they offer us anything, but instead they gave us their stingy attitudes and on top of it all, they over charged on the credit card about $1,600.  After that, the manager did comp our meals but he still gave us an attitude. Even thou our meals were free, we did leave a $40-50 tip at least just because that should cover the cost of the food itself and we're not there to take advantage of a free meal like the manager thinks we were. We will never return to this place again.   As we were about to drive off, the waiter stopped us and gave us a $50 gift certificate. Why? If they really wanted to give us that, they should of done so before we left. We suspected it's because of the tip.  With the new name and probably a new management, they might, should I give them another chance? There's still so many other restaurants out there to try.

riGhjerKPRZDSZsQaSCKQg.review_text: Simple, straightforward food and service done flawlessly.  You won't find the menu particularly interesting, but the execution deserves five stars.  It really does.

Yl2qVgQT8BlgDewxtk0oug.review_text: Excellent meal and vibe. Warm fireplace, nice soft jazz music playing played by a live band and excellent food. You must start with the spinich and artichoke dip. The ribs are fabulous. The best part for me is the free corkage!

OqH85SAF0oLijVY_SeAk8A.review_text: I've been here a handful of times, and have had dinner at the bar only, so I can't say anything about the dining area. However, each time that I have been here.. nothing has ever been mediocre.   For starters, I would highly recommend their Home Smoked Salmon, Oak Grilled Artichokes, or Spinach and Artichoke dip. They smoke their own salmon (to perfection) and it comes with some crostinis and a sort of aioli that is perfecttt with it. (Probably so bad for you, but so good, I can't stop myself from smothering the salmon with it, even though the salmon is sooo good on it's own..) The Oak Grilled Artichokes are also very delicious. If you want something more filling, than go with the Spinach and Artichoke dip. Tons of chips, tons of ooeygooey dip. Good stuff.  For an entree, If you want something light, but filling, go for the Thai Steak and Noodle Salad. Delicious! They give you tons of perfectly tender chunks of steak and avocado. The noodles are a nice soft noodle, and the mango lightens it up. Another light dish would be the Flying Tuna Platter. Perfectly seared tuna with mixed greens, chunks of avocado, and mango.   I've heard about their prime rib, but I've yet to try the actual dish. I did however try some prime rib from their Famous French Dip. Layers and layers of melt in your mouth prime rib on a lightly toasted roll, dipped in au jus.. Sooo good! If you're going for the serious meats, the Hawaiian Ribeye is very tasty option. I hear great things about their loaded Baked Potato also.. next time!!   Service is always excellent.  I don't stray too far on the wine list. I usually go for the white table wine, Conundrum. It's nice, light, and sweet. It's not too great with a red meat dish though. Ask Ben for a wine recommendation to go with your meal, or cozy up to a cocktail. I hear those sidecars are quite good...

skar1XyXyjTKKUawy-NlyA.review_text: Formerly Houston's, the place reminds me a bit of Los Altos Grill but with a much younger crowd.  There's a big bar near the entrance that is very welcoming.  We ordered a bottle of Round Pond (good), grilled artichoke with aioli (tasted good but it seemed a bit overcooked to me), and BBQ ribs with coleslaw and fries (finger lickin' good!).  The ribs are shareable, as you get ~9 ribs.  Nice atmosphere, TV screens for the sports aficionados, friendly service.  I can see why this is so popular!   Definitely worth returning.

ebb3TT8r2WTqRn5_ncKd_A.review_text: Eh... Okay.  But  Free Corkage for every two guests!

INi56PgdBBxz0i_V_-_cGg.review_text: I really like Hillstone. I've been here for lunch, dinner and even a work party that I threw. The food is delicious, and the portions are filling. The Chicago Style Spinach Dip is a must try appetizer. I love their prime rib as well as their Hawaiian rib eye (there is a sweetness to the rib eye due to a special glaze they use). I also like how their French fries are skinny and fried to perfection. One time after lunch, we splurged on the calories and got a decadent hot fudge sundae, two thumbs up!   The menu is more meat friendly, but they have a couple good vegetarian options as well. For example, their veggie burger is actually very flavorful.  Also if the weather is nice outside, the patio seating is perfect. It gets taken up very fast though since the restaurant has a great view of the Embarcadero.  ~A

CDEd_Nt4JYUvSKOYrIRdJA.review_text: Very friendly staff and all the selections are delicious!

Pc37TQY1FoosYlAnFNEVCQ.review_text: i went here for my birthday dinner with a friend. i am not sure why i have never been to this place before, but i will definitely return. the food was okay, but the ambiance and service was amazing! extra points for my server sarah and the jazz ensemble.

rxVOysYmCFVJVnECm4hRNw.review_text: Let's say... 4.5 stars!  It was my first time at Hillstone when I was visiting SF, and I must say I was quite pleased with my experience there! I went with my family and I have to say that each one of us LOVED our meal-- not one of us was disappointed by the taste and flavors of what we ordered. The only down-side is we think that our server was new so she wasn't as attentive to refilling our drinks and stuff, but it's okay-- we understand! So anyway... I ordered the Hawaiian Ribeye and my dad ordered the ribs-- my meat was succulent and flavorful, and my dad's ribs were fall-off-the-bone fantastic! It's a pricier place for my wallet, but I think it is worth it to go to for a special occasion or a let's-splurge outing.

XmzvUDzn4RITbh1PdlzIUw.review_text: Hillstone is the old Houston. As usual and consistent with my Houston's chain experience....service is always friendly and impeccable. Server recommended crab salad and it is AMAZING! Crab season in SF-large chunks of dungeness crabs perfectly blended with fresh avocado, corn and red onions (not too much). I didn't  like the grapefruit (but I never like fruits w/my vegetables!). otherwise...AMAZING!!!! A must!!

m1K-6xJOMVQscuArB4ZpJg.review_text: Very good cocktail shrimp, steak was amazing so were the mashed potatoes and creamy spinach

iOjwFYpHWo7P0rqmIfLm9g.review_text: So, Its kind of like Rutherford Grill but a distant cousin where you kind of can make out the same features...I have been many times for dinner but have recently enjoyed many a delightful happy hour here- a few old Skool drinks some grilled artichokes and the live band playing MJ's "Human Nature" and you are like "Thursday, really you were a-ok". I love to come here so I can actually have a conversation with someone and so I can actually sit down here. Remember the same rules apply- NO CORKAGE FEE...so bring your own wine and live it up baby!

hHPecSijz1wRsU_gXFdsbQ.review_text: We started with the grilled artichokes and since there were 3 of us it worked out fine since you get 3 halves.  I don't think grilling an artichoke does much once you get to the middle there's no smoky taste.  The artichokes are small taste good though but I think they were $12 so for 1/2 a med sized artichoke $4 is a rip.  I noticed glasses of wine $10 and up so I ordered a beer from their anemic beer selection- a stella (which in europe is known as piss water.) I had the veggie burger because when I asked the pedigree of the fish it was pathetic farm raised salmon.  I had one of the veggie burgers before and it was delish so I was looking forward to it.  This time it was a disaster, tasted like crap, completely fell apart and the fries were too salty.  This is a formulaic chain restaurant, it is loud (seemed quieter if you were to eat outside on the Embarcadero), and the food isn't good- what less can you want.

Ve-GIN1916iz3IQqIsdY9w.review_text: i always get thai noodle salad all the time..no matter what i am loyal to my thai noodle salad LOL...

eFZf6DRIyf6LswW_ChsLpg.review_text: Food: 5 Service: 5 Decor: 4 Atmosphere: 1  Today's work lunch hour proved rather disappointing as Butterfly (restaurant across the street from Hillstone) ran all out of chicken and hence, my favorite lunch mean.  I decided to try Hillstone for the sake of time.  My hosts and waitresses were awesome; the service was very fast considering I ordered the famous "Hawaiian Rib-Eye pineapple soy ginger marinade, with hand-cut French fries, $35".  Not being much of a meat-eater, the rib-steak was very delicious and cooked to perfection.  Also, I passed on both the fries and coleslaw, opting instead for what turned out to be the best part of my experience: Spaghetti Squash!  The squash is somehow cut into spaghetti slices and then topped with tomato chutney, basil and parmesan, a total vegetarian's dream!  I can't wait to try to figure out the recipe on my own at home!  Not to mention the restaurant is also very beautiful on the inside.  And now comes the reason for only 4-stars instead of 5-stars, most unfortunately no fault of the restaurant's own.  The clientele which visited this restaurant today seemed to be the condescending, snobby-affluent lot.  Granted I'm not caucasian, but I do not cherish the feeling of reminiscing America's southeastern states' extreme prejudice, less than that loud "whispers" and patronizing glares aimed rudely at me.  Thank gods for my iPhone...  Although the food, service and decor are all above par, I doubt I will eat here ever again due to the "stressful" atmosphere.

UVLamhEGcJ3u7_TxfnxbBA.review_text: Hawaiian Ribeye. That is all you need to know.  Perfect char on the outside, medium rare on the inside and packed with flavor.  One of the most flavorful steaks you will ever eat.  Didn't try anything else on the menu, but will be back for the ribeye.

PdpWp_j67Nfr_oQF-4yKUw.review_text: The experience of being here really is corporate, even if this particular Houston's is way better than average for the chain.  The place is completely pleasant, and the food is quite good.  However, some of the prices were a bit high (e.g., $13 for a glass of a chardonnay that sells for $24.99/bottle at BevMo); you end up paying one way or another for the high-toned ambiance and the "no corkage fee" policy.  My impression is that Houston's is a tad over-rated by Yelpers.  It's OK, but I'm not going to race back here any time soon.

sN-Q5DLPyfmv08ovoUcTfA.review_text: Dear Mr. Houston,  You rocked my extra dirty martini just how I like it.  You'd be surprised how many folks can't seem to get it right.  The service was right on point too.  The smoked Salmon appetizer was some of the best I've had.  The spinach dip, well, it was just that.    Moving onto the main course.  My Ahi Tuna salad was really fantasic with the chunks of avocado and mango as little flavor explosions!  Everyone in our party enjoyed the food.  I'll be back for the steak next time!  Yours truly, SS

NvXEm-xjurWn1RtEn_8JtA.review_text: Nice place to dine across from the Pier buildings with a awesome SF Bay vibe. The patio in front of the restaurant is a great place to hang out and people watch while enjoying a cocktail.This place is very similar to the Rutherford Grill in the wine country. Nice up scale decor with open windows. The ribs here are really good and a large portion. The ribs fall off the bone.  The ribs come with Cole Slaw and fresh cut fries. Hubby had the Roasted Chicken with Cous-Cous and thoroughly enjoyed it.  As soon as I tasted the ribs I thought of the Rutherford Grill, I would know those ribs anywhere and the delicious grilled Artichokes. Dinners average $25-30 a plate.

ZMocFA2lNMJeiKjguUKu7g.review_text: The TOP TEN Reasons Why I Love Hillstone  10) They always give me plenty of honey for my Peppermint tea, and the tea comes in a cool cast iron pot 9) Their sundaes are the bomb with the chocolate on the side, and crunchy nuts and whipped cream make this as good as Ghiradelli's sundaes 8) They have fresh squeezed orange juice 7) If you're waiting for dinner reservations occasionally they will give you complimentary french fries to prevent you from starving 6) Their baby back ribs are sweet, and I like sweet BBQ sauce 5) They grind their own meat for their burgers 4) Their honey mustard dressing is to die for with their fresh cut fries 3) They smoke their salmon in house, and their smoked salmon with toasted point bread is one of the best starters I've ever had 2) Their grilled artichokes are so tender and flavorful with their chive dip 1) I LOVE their Hawaiian Rib-eye and almost cried when awhile ago they took it off their menu. But they have it back now, and it's one of may favorite steaks. Even better (for me only) than Wagyu.  For a chain restaurant, I am a huge fan. 3% of my paycheck goes directly to this place LOL

yA8O2QvAxTVtMSRuddnyfw.review_text: We go for the grilled artichokes. I don't love pork chops but I ordered them here and they were so delicious I went back and ordered them again. They are not on the menu so I have the ribs when they don't have them which are also very good. I'm a very big fan of clam chowder. Their chowder is soooooooo good.   Make a reservation or take a chance on missing out on a great meal. Pics included :)

vwzK0DGwyYaL-MANGhfsmg.review_text: Great service, great ambience, good quality and delicious food, very simple and short menu, we had a great time there!

Jg-dWKV9juyEPNfO20zP5g.review_text: It's a chain, I know, but I've always loved Houstons/hillstone ever since it opened up in Santa Monica.  Warm interior, excellent food, and a great bar.

72HBbs1zbbsoo4t_UpEIaQ.review_text: Good food, but pretty expensive and the service isn't amazing. If you find yourself there give the burgers a try, the beef is great.

51f-gzLdOCAeSNyhdXJX6Q.review_text: Came here for a friends birthday dinner last week. We had a reservation and they refused to seat us until our entire party had arrived, there were 11 of us, so it took a little while for everyone to get there.   Once we were seated our waiter came over and started opening the wine we had brought. (best part about this place is that there is no corkage fee!)  I had a really hard time finding something on this menu that I found appealing and that I could eat without having to alter the dish, I have a few nut allergies and a mango allergy that prevented me from eating a lot of their salads and fish dishes.   For dinner I ended up ordering the veggie burger with fries. (Hoping that it would be a "lighter" option than a regular burger...) The burger was huge and the fry portion was also very generous. The burgers are house made with brown rice, black beans and oat bran, it was served on a house made bun with jack cheese, lettuce, onion, pickles and tomato. The burger was OK, I felt the patty was a little bland it could have used something else, I'm just not sure what...the fries were pretty good. They were pretty thinly cut so they didn't hold a lot of the oil they were cooked in, which was nice.   I think I would come back to Hillstone for their no corkage fee, if anything. I heard that their french dip is good, maybe I'll try that next time...

swmrfBnaqU0nyJ3pFBfNgQ.review_text: My BFF's hubby picked Houston's to celebrate his BD.  He wanted "MEAT" but not necessarily steak. We started off with the Chicago spinach dip ($13) which came piping hot in a ramekin, creamy and neither too salty nor ingenious. Served along side with (I swear that's what it exactly tasted like) Pace Picante' salsa and 2 sm. scoops of sour cream and thin, crispy tortilla chips.  (the chips were good!)  We had the cheese toast ($6) which was 4 triangular wedges of French toast type bread, covered with melted cheese.  It was OK.  We shared 2 orders of the sashimi salad ($18 each) which was really, really good.  Sashimi -grade Ahi seared on the outside and  dusted with some blk sesame seeds and a mixed baby salad with a delish dressing.  BFF & I had the prime rib, a thick 1 in cut slab with bone.  It was so large that I ended up taking home 1/2 of it.  It was tender and cooked just right. Some Yelpers have commented that it's better than HOPR, I'd have to disagree.  They do serve it with a large bowl of au jus and a large baked potato ($28) and "everything" comes with sour cream, cheese & real bacon.  Hubs and BFF's hubs had the BBQ pork ribs.  Heavily darkened with a nice rub and both would comment "The meat falls off the bone, must've been cooking for hours!"  I had a bite, it was OK.  Came with a cole slaw (good) and DELICIOUS shoestring French fries ($27).  BFF's hub gave her a few and told me he didn't want to do that becuz he knew she'll be back for more.  True to form,  she helped herself to his fries continuously.  We finished with coffee ($3) or ice tea ($3.50) and hubs had the apple walnut cobbler which was overpoweringly sweet ($8).  It reminded me of a loosely formed apple oatmeal dish with ample walnut halves over it and topped with a maple ice cream.  Our friend had the ice cream sundae ($8) which was a large bowl of vanilla ice cream accompanied by a gravy bowl of chocolate sauce (too sweet) to add accordingly.    What's cool about the take-home packaging is that they even boxed the horseradish and au jus from my plate in separate containers!  I loved that au jus, it was good enough to be soup!    Our waitress, Aleksi, was friendly and very fast in clearing our tables.  The place was loaded with people by the time we finished dinner and there were many souls at the bar.  An open kitchen affords you the view of the frentic rhythmic pace of the staff who all appear to know exactly what they're doing without colliding into each other in the milieu.  The restaurant has booths and tables for 2-4 in a pleasant atmosphere.   They do add 2% health tax to your bill.  Parking can be challenging but there is a nearby garage with $10 self-parking.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Ok, is it bad to like Houston's? Well if so, then I'm one baaaaaad mofo! This is place is always packed at lunch, but you can wait out your table at the bar.   Their burger is a classic, but their ribs, if you don't plan on operating heavy machinery later, are the way to go.  P.S. Did you know that Rutherford Grill in Napa is actually Houston's in disguise, much like Transformers are robots in disguise?

5mCf8H8ljJSpb6Lkmasc-A.review_text: Love it here! It's casual with a little bit of class. You can watch the kitchen at full throttle when you are waiting for your table. Great service every time. Food is delicious.  Sometimes I get take-outs from here but one time they told me they don't offer that.  I don't know what that was about.  No corkage fee!

HlmQtaWQCG1rKj02ELDNgg.review_text: Went here after cruise tour to Alcatraz. Very good taste of prime rib eye. The waiter was also very nice.

HFaorCX5fQE0WUPdb9bEjA.review_text: I loved the atmosphere of this place!  We walked in with a party of 6 because they don't take reservations for anything larger than a party of 4.  We ended up waiting about 40 minutes, which isn't bad for a Saturday night.    I read on here to ask for the bread and olives...sure glad we did because it was delicious!  We also ordered the spinach dip as an appetizer, also really good.  For main courses, 3 people got the BBQ ribs, which are just as amazing as everyone says.  So good!  I ordered the fish of the day which was sea bass...excellent!  Most meals came with 2 sides, which were pretty generous portions.    The service was great at the table, but really slow at the bar where we were waiting for our table.  Overall a good experience and would go back again!

nnmKt0M8TpxoJr9BJbJ75g.review_text: Of course I ended up here on Valentine's Day... its one of my favorite restaurants, I just had to!  Only an hour and half wait? No problem, I'll just chill outside on the patio under the heated lamps and have some spinach & artichoke dip and rum & cokes while I wait for my special VIP table.  And what a special VIP table it always is.    Every time I come here I somehow always get the cool booth in the corner near the fireplace and piano.  Must be my good looks.  I always feel so dang special at this place and I love it!    After inhaling the yummy dip and sipping 2 rum & cokes, the hostess came and found us and took us to our table.  No need to anxiously check on your table, or stand close by in case they call your name.  Just relax on the patio or the bar and they will come to you. Another reason why I feel so special here.    I always stuff myself silly here.  I had the grilled artichoke, the chicken sandwich and a brownie to top it off. My date had the french dip.  We inhaled it all.  My chicken sandwich came out a little undercooked, but I sent it back and they were extremely pleasant about it.  No stink eye.  No sooner than 10 minutes was it back in front of my face being inhaled alongside the fries.    Houston's, err I mean Hilllstone, is a consistently fabulous restaurants where you can have a classy time.  I highly recommend it and I hope you feel special like I do when you dine here.

Y8SZbysW5TNHAMn5mYKfNw.review_text: I've chosen Hillstone for a meat evening with friends from Switzerland and it was awesome. We all ordered the ribs and they were just fallin from the bone as the waiter promised. And it was super fast and tasted great. The french fries are cut thinner and are cute, but also very good in taste and crisp. I can really suggest to stop by here!

XHliUCWnHtbcPknHIpSM5Q.review_text: One of out favorite spots!  Never ever disappointed when we dine here. Ambience is nice and romantic :-) food is fantastic. We've had the artichoke dip, hacked chicken salad is really tasty and filling.  My favorite is the Hawaiian Rib Eye!!!  It's so delicious!  Let's not forget dessert :)), the apple walnut cobbler is to die for as well as their key lime pie when it's in season.  Order a cup of coffee, they brew it by the cup so it's fresh!   Love, love, love Hillstone, maybe because they're a part of Rutherfords too ;). Overall, a wonderful dining experience.

bgZaHkDf4BMxKlC7tSt1kg.review_text: Went there last weekend with my wife for dinner. OK, it may be our fault that we didn't do any research on their menu - both of us didn't feel like eating burgers or beef, but one look at the menu reveals that this place is pretty much a burger & beef place. Anyhow, we ended up sharing a sashimi tuna salad as a starter - awesome! As an entree, I chose the crab cakes with fries and super cole slaw - all extremely nice. My wife picked the grilled fish with veggies, which I think didn't taste all that good. Now, why only three stars? First of all, I'd say this place is a bit overpriced. We ended up leaving $160 for two (including two aperetifs and two glasses of wine, no dessert). The ambiance is ok, but not exactly what I'd expect for a romantic dinner place with your wonderful & hot wife.

jkn6J1-sl5AaYkfXvYrVWA.review_text: My BFF was in town since he's been stationed on the east coast all this time. So i decided to fly to norcal and meet him since he'll be stationed there next. I thought it would be awesome if we had dinner with some of my good friends in the bay. It was a party of 5.  We ordered the prime rib, crab cakes, hawaiian steak and a bottle of wine. Food was delicious!  Live music and the service was AMAZING! Can't go wrong with good food, great service and wonderful company! This was once known as Houston's. . .i've been to Houston's in OC and loved everything abt it. So I wasn't surprised at how great the service and food was.

XqSN1PtZkJ6QorOUa9AAdA.review_text: I would have given zero but if course that's not an option.  This restaurant is NOT, I repeat NOT dog friendly as it claims.  Even after calling to verify that they had a dog friendly patio I spent time looking for parking only to go in and be told the outside dining is serve your self at the bar and oh btw, not dog friendly.  There are 2 tables in the back which are only cocktail tables as in knee height where you can sit with your dog.  And again, apps only and self sere at the bar.  Needless to say with these prices, I will not come back here again.  Not should you if you want decent service in a dog friendly atmosphere.

qpnRnA8iWcC04grr3-0bIQ.review_text: Hillstone is my favorite American Steakhouse in San Francisco. The service, ambiance and the quality of the food is great.

UaLuvgBtzzAHYCqAFtOBtg.review_text: I love this place and have been coming for years. Food, service and atmosphere had been the draw. Lately however the consistency of the food and the willingness to accommodate what used to be has been less than impressive. I order food to go regularly and am disappointed by the inconsistency in quantity and quality, as well as the willingness to accommodate requests the last few months. There must be someone new running things and it's not working. It's making me not want to frequent what is a regular for me on a weekly basis just to make a point. Pls note, the staff is still welcoming and great, they're just marching to orders, and orders aren't being given by a big thinking leader.

jipgimnSNp3qdK2dKUQvBg.review_text: I took my bf here for his birthday dinner, since he's been dying to try out this place.  I think he was attracted by the big fire outside.  Wish we could have sat outside but they weren't seating anyone out there.  And the fire was teeny tiny..size may not matter for other things but with a fire to add to ambiance it sure does!  Regardless, it's a very nice restaurant inside & out.  Food came out fast.  First came the spinach & artichoke dip appetizer with a big bowl of tortilla chips, accompanied by a side of sour cream & salsa (tasted like Pace brand salsa).  The dip was sooo delicious..this will get you to eat spinach!  I was trying to scrape up every last bit of it, but some was stuck to the sides of the bowl.  My Thai Steak Noodle Salad, very tasty; the steak was grilled perfectly, the dressing was semi spicy; however there was too much overpowering cilantro & it could have used more noodles.  Oh & the big question..WHERE MY AVOCADO AT??!  It was listed on the menu but I picked through my dish & saw no avocado..GRR!  Though, it doesn't compare to House of Prime Rib or Harris, he loved his prime rib.  He asked for medium, but some parts looked to be a little more cooked.  I thought it was cute how the au ju came in a coffee mug.  It also came with a yummy fully loaded baked potato (butter, sour cream, green onions, cheese, & some bacon)..heart attack on a plate!  Service was great.  I really liked our waiter Ben; he was very nice, & had a sense of humor.  I didn't expect to get a comp b-day dessert for him especially after we said we were full & would skip on dessert; but he said he couldn't resist & out he came with a a big scoop of vanilla ice cream & a candle.  Great ambiance, good service, tasty food, pricey though.  FYI: They also charge 2% of your bill to help the San Francisco Health Access Plan.  And if you're lucky, you may catch local celebs eating here.

SGfeyptTiE089lp-w1Peyw.review_text: I could not believe the level of rudeness we experienced on Saturday afternoon July 5, 2014.  It was early afternoon and the outdoor seating was nearly empty.  When we arrived we indicated that we had a party of 4 adults, two infants, and one three year old.    We were told that the tables were for limited to 4 persons only so we would need to sit at different tables and that the tables could not be pushed together.  We were ok with this and asked for two tables next to each other.  After a ten minute conference by two staff members they said ok (rudely and as if we had annoyed them) and brought us outside.  Again the outside seating area was nearly empty.  The hostess directed us to two tables that were situated far away from each other.  We asked for two empty ones that were next to each other.  She looked stunned and confused.  After what seemed like a full minute of silence she acquiesced and let us sit.  One of our party members arrived later and was standing at the table when the waitress came out and said only four to a table.  She then said someone else had been in with kids before us and she didn't want to have an "incident" with us.  I have no idea what she meant by incident and asked her what she meant.  She looked completely confused and did not provide any answer (rudely just walked away).    If they don't want people with kids to sit outside, why don't they just say that.  I'm originally from New York and have never been treated so rudely.    I gave an ok tip, as the food was ok and I understand that wait staff rely on tips.  However, I have no idea why everyone acted so rudely and needed time to digest simple requests.  I tried to speak with the manager about this after our meal, but she just stared at me with disbelief and indicated that she had no idea what I was complaining about.    They serve burgers and beers in this place.  It was not like we brought infants to a 5 star restaurant.  It was early afternoon and the place was empty.  I don't understand what the purpose of the rudeness was about.

pHLCm78t02HQWmEE7eBcng.review_text: pros:  very friendly service  cons:  food was just ok.

GBj7DyTur3A0fL3CH-QGmw.review_text: This used to be Houston's, it is now called Hillstone. Came here during lunch with the fam. Very attentive/excellent service. They seemed kind of busy during lunch, but we made reservations in advance since we were a party of 6 people.  Highlights: *Portions are HUMONGOUS!!!! If you're a woman with a not so ferocious appetite, I highly recommend you to split an appetizer and an entrée with someone. Desserts are huge too. *Tortilla soup, only served on Tuesdays, is amazing. Chopped up tomatoes, cheese, and I especially loved the avocado chunks! *Their French dip is the best! It's basically a sandwich with just prime rib inside, and you dip it in au jus sauce.  *I liked how when I ordered tea, they served me hot water in a cast iron teapot. Very few restaurants do that.

-BLCnU5DzxeXUOFo9_diNg.review_text: It was a great day with cloudless skies and work decided to venture out for lunch. Sure, why not? So it was Hillstone's and it was packed! It's okay though, we wanted to sit outside and that's where we went. The seating was comfortable, but the tables were more like coffee tables, so they were below the knee. Either way, I was already uncomfortable with my hunger, so sitting uncomfortably wasn't an issue.   I ordered the Hickory Burger, which include 3 slices of Canadian Bacon (not BACON!), shredded cheddar, diced onions and a decent heap of potato strings (fries, but it's thin like strings!). I have to admit, Canadian Bacon wasn't something I really like, but in a burger, it's easy for everything to connect together. I like the combination that Hillstone's have!   The waiting staff were very professional and flexible from helping us take the orders outside to all the fine detail like ketchup and water. The pricing might be a little steep for some, so watch what you order. Other than that, solid location by the Embarcadero and great food in general!

RMiYBR1XL0GK0CALiB0kqg.review_text: Great staff. Great food. enough said! I recommend the Rib-Eye!

qf5Jx7et6LPLTPYU7VRQRw.review_text: Excellent food, great service and good music

IcLsjHb-4f0heQZjHgNyjw.review_text: NOT kid-friendly.   They recently got rid of their high chairs for the outdoor area.  Stupid.  We were regulars but eating a plate of ribs with a 1-1/2 year old on your lap is impossible.  We won't be back until they have accommodations for families outside.

8ozxJndeMSqObxZc4xDsbg.review_text: At first I was apprehensive about the fact that its Hillstone not Houston's anymore, back in LA, I was a Houston's regular, I mean honestly this place never disappoints.  So I picked it as our dinner spot for a girls' dressy going out night.
