I don't really remember this place being BYOB, maybe I never asked the folks in LA.  Even though the place has a decent wine list, they don't have a corkage fee; I mean how awesome is that!?!  So with three bottles in tow, amongst five of us, we got to Hillstone for our 8 pm reservation.  They seated us almost right away, right by the live music!  The server graciously brought champagne glasses and popped our first bottle open for us.    I was sad about the SF location not having the exact same menu, I missed their sushi.  I settled for the Veggie Burger, and I asked the server for avocado on the side which she noted down even before I completed my sentence.  My friends got the French Dip Sandwich, Thai salad, Texas Burger, and Veggie burger.  The food was amazing! After a really heavy meal where we tried to stuff everything that was on our plate into our stomachs, just so we won't have to carry doggy bags for the rest of our night, and while we were on our third and final bottle of wine, we ordered a walnut brownie to share.  And that took me back to LA, it was the same delicious brownie (wait did the one in LA have ice cream on top, I can't remember, oh well it was more than we could finish anyway).

nMgPzSnmSt-Oh9QCTMaXQg.review_text: This was my third visit to Hillstone. I made a reservation by phone for three persons. I mentioned to the receptionist that we were celebrating a birthday. When we arrived, we were promptly seated. I chose Hillstone because of their dinner menu.  Here are my reasons for a Two Star review:  1). Our silverware consisted of a fork and a steak knife rolled in a cloth napkin; I expected a formal set of silverware.  2). My bread plate was wet. It was obvious my plate was wet! I had to ask for a dry bread plate.  3). I ordered Two apps: Grilled Artichokes, Foccacia Bread; What I got was Grilled Artichokes and a plate of bread for $4.  4). My salad plate was wet; I was willing to accept that because the plate was chilled, the wetness was caused by being chilled. 5). The wait staff never refilled our water glasses.  6). We ordered coffee with our dessert; We were never asked if we needed a refill.  7). Nothing was done to recognize our guest's birthday; All we got was a "Happy Birthday," when we left. A lit birthday candle would have been nice with our dessert; we got nada.   Our meal was not remarkable at all.   I felt no warmth from the hostess or wait staff; They seemed very busy walking by us but avoiding eye contact throughout our meal, i.e., There was no dining experience;   I have been treated better eating at Denny's or the Olive Garden for ten times less money!   Bye bye Hillstone.

rj3oovNkalZTqUrJlqYZfA.review_text: Yes, I am reviewing another restaurant. I love to eat, nothin' wrong with that!  So...the great things about Houston's are that the staff is very tentative and helpful. Quick service at lunch and I love the fresh fish and veggie sides.  On the downside...WAY to overpriced, especially for lunch! The yummy veggies are super yummy because are swimmming in butter and olive oil. Some of their food gives me a headache, maybe a little heavy handed with the salt perhaps. Also, you can't call in an order to pick up???Why??? That is very inconvenient when you only have a few minutes to grab and go!  My work is so close to Houston's that it is hard to go anywhere else, but it is so expensive that it forces me to pack a lunch most days of the week.

gB7_kyOo5JmVAY0BrwyT_A.review_text: I fell in love with Filet at this place. Very tasty and so very tender. Has to be the best Filet Minion I have had as of yet.   The waitress would do a "drive-by" and snatch up our used sugar packets within seconds of us using a pack.... so we tried playing a "little game" and needless to say, every time we used a pack... she was right there to pick up the trash.  I thought it was a bit odd that there was a sign saying "no cell phones" though.

S0Pji5ZPQwlolC7vlq1lug.review_text: A and I stopped in after our cruise around the Bay.  We parked near Houston's so we checked out the menu when we were walking to Pier 43 1/2.  He spent the rest of our afternoon trying to sell the grilled artichokes to me.  I LOVE artichokes, so there really wasn't anything to sell, but I liked having him trying to convince me that I wanted them.  Anyway, it was kind of a really late lunch/early dinner - probably around 4pm.  We walked right in and were seated immediately.  I like the interior.  It's kind of dark, has some low ceilings.  Very intimate seating.  And the servers are all very uniform.  They all wear black.  The men have hardly any facial hair (or any hair for that matter).  The women all had their hair pulled back with absolutely no hair in their face.  And if their hair was even longer, they had to put multiple hair rubberbands down the length of their hair to make it look "neater."    So we ordered the grilled artichokes right as we were seated.  We also ordered some green tea and chili.  The chili came with some tortilla chips, which was a nice touch.  Our table was a little small for all the plates, cups, and teapots we had though.  The grilled artichokes were sooo good!  Very tasty.  A and I had seen a show on TV a couple of weeks ago where they were showing viewers how to grill artichokes.  That took the guy like 5 hours.  Seriously.  There's no way I'm ever going to grill an artichoke so the one at Houston's was definitely worthwhile.  They give you 3 halves.  So we each had one and then split the last one.  For our entrees, A had the halibut sandwich (which was one of the specials of the day) and I had the chicken sandwich (which A tells me he heard was one of the best things on the menu).  The chicken sandwich was HUGE and I only ate half of it and couldn't eat another bite.  It comes with shoestring potato fries.  Yum.  A had half of my chicken sandwich and half of his halibut sandwich.  I took the other half of his halibut sandwich to go and I just ate it today, two days later.  It was still really good, so I could only imagine how good it tasted when it was freshly made.  I'd go back to Houston's to try their full-out dinner.  I hear they make a mean steak!

oVR7BUs-uk3n_61RJOcoZA.review_text: Houston's menu is very simple, with not too many items on there. But every item on there is top notch.  Some favorites: French Dip, House Salad, Hawaiian Rib-eye, Spinach Dip, and any of their Fish Specials.  Even though there are countless other places to try in SF, we keep coming back to Houston's ever so often because food and service is consistently excellent.  A big plus is that they welcome bringing in your own wine by not charging a corkage fee. Also there is plenty of street parking.   Outdoor patio is perfect for weekend Lunches with small groups and couples.  The indoor dining room is ideal for dinner with your significant other or a small group of friends.

_78TE24hohTFMwURU2mehg.review_text: I can't find the words.  President Thomas Whitmore said them best:  "Good morning. In less than an hour, aircraft from here will join others from around the world. And you will be launching the largest aerial battle in the history of mankind. "Mankind." That word should have new meaning for all of us today. We can't be consumed by our petty differences anymore. We will be united in our common interests. Perhaps it's fate that today is the Fourth of July, and you will once again be fighting for our freedom... Not from tyranny, oppression, or persecution... but from annihilation. We are fighting for our right to live. To exist. And should we win the day, the Fourth of July will no longer be known as an American holiday, but as the day the world declared in one voice: "We will not go quietly into the night!" We will not vanish without a fight! We're going to live on! We're going to survive! Today we celebrate our Independence Day!"  A food experience so epic deserved the most epic monologue a 1996 blockbuster could provide.  When I walked in I commented how glad I was they were playing jazz.  About a minute later I realized it was live.  I couldn't believe how well they had the band mixed through the entire restaurant.  Major audio win.  Additionally, the decor and vibe in there were awesome.  The "artichoke lights" are great and the color scheme is solid.  It's a place you want to hang out in.  We showed up a bit early for our reservation so we grabbed two seats at the bar.  We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was handed to us in 0.0000003 seconds.  I'm not kidding.  It was the fastest appetizer I've ever received.  Wow.  Christina at the bar was awesome.  You could tell she takes pride in her work and connects well with folks.  Ariel was our waitress and she was also great!    After reading Ruthie V.'s review I went for the Prime Rib.  I'm glad I did.  It was absolutely delicious.  My wife got the Thai Steak Salad (also from Ruthie V.'s review).  My favorite part about the entire night?  John with the water refills.  0.0000003 seconds after placing my empty glass on the table (seeing the theme?), John (who had to have been at least 6' 6") was refilling my water.  This happened at least twice more.  For a guy running around refilling waters, even he had great customer service!  Yea, they might be a chain -- but they've got it down.

AEvn6o5KbSUgjbsgqmHeLA.review_text: Came here on a Friday at 5pm. Really empty but then again it was an early dinner.  As recommended by previous yelpers, I ordered the complimentary bread and olives; which came in really handy when the spinach & artichoke dip came around, since it only comes with tortilla chips - it was SOOO GOOOOOD!  I had the chicken hacked salad - really good, but I saw that there was dark meat. Just wasn't used to that, but the salad was good overall.   BF had the cheeseburger, which I was drooling over. I loved the fries he had. They're small and remind me of those potato chip "sticks," but I like it when fries are small and crispy. I added some to my salad =)   Service was great - our server was so nice and prompt. Even other servers acknowledge you to let you know that someone'll be coming by shortly. The ambiance reminded me of Chicago for some reason.   Would come here again but not on a frequent basis. On the pricier side, especially considering these days, and my low standards. If you go, GET THE SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP.

FY0xR5Q5JCUJO7Wk8Icvyg.review_text: Had the prime rib, and it did not disappoint! The loaded baked potato was the perfect side. Just wish they had better steak options on their menu since they're listed as a "steakhouse" on Yelp, though I'm not sure if that's just the Yelp categorization or if they actually call themselves a steakhouse. The only steak items on the menu were the prime rib and some kind of Hawaiian marinated ribeye, though they will do the ribeye without the marinade, upon request, which was nice. Okay service, very generous wine pours (wine on tap!), and great ambiance!  Also, I like that there is no corkage fee, but I totally forgot about it -- will definitely take advantage of that the next time I come.

Er2yi-WarNgZL2pG7a4MlQ.review_text: Love coming here. Great atmosphere with awesome live music. The food is always delicious as well. I love the blackened rib eye, but my husband always goes for the pork chop which is sooo good! Their cocktails are also pretty good If you want a few drinks ;) Service has always been good and this is definitely one of our go to spots.

nc6hwsnBU_YYKQRjzGavWA.review_text: It's official I like a chain restaurant.   Grilled Artichokes - v. nice Ribs -AMAZING, fall off the bone, not drowning in bbq sauce  Coleslaw - perfect Fries - hot, skinny and spicy (gawd I wish I was talking about myself!) Summer corn - sauteed in a curry butter! WOW!  COLD SIERRA NEVADA  Someone pinch me, am I dreaming?!   Ps. Brought the Rugrat with me. No problem to Houston's. They set up a baby seat that hangs off the table in a far off booth and plopped an etch-a-sketch in front of him. Kid happy = Mama happy! I'll be back my love...I'll be back...

geIR6iZA11XnO-nMaOYLfA.review_text: Service was good, but damn, did i really pay $22 for rotisserie chicken?!   oh why did i get the chicken...  Just don't get the chicken.

TwqZ5Yqo3bfPCnBrYnuzJg.review_text: From now on, I REFUSE to go anywhere else BUT Hillstone with colleagues. Saturday night was the best experience I have had at a restaurant in the last 2 years. They know the perfect balance of making themselves available yet allowing you to discuss business. My clients were beyond impressed with my choice. I would be remiss if I did not acknowledge Maja, our server, for making the experience wonderful. The food is great but she made it superb. Hillstone, you have my money and my company's money for years as long as you keep the cooks back there and professionals like Maja for every experience.

7O8Osqx6pHbLgIBsQ-RxNw.review_text: First of all, I've been here many many times. Always great, but something has changed. Quality of food is different. First time I've ever had to send food back to kitchen, my ribs were cold. And baked potatoes were not available so I ordered french fries, they arrived but weren't crispy.... Limp like the oil wasn't hot. Granted it was a dine at 5:00 pm, but they were willing to take my cash at this early hour. Wait staff had to be tracked down. Not a happy diner.

63RGOpfG38zD1fGBNQ3pZQ.review_text: I LOVE this place.. I'm always happy, everything is delish, and the prices aren't bad for what you get!  I've had lots of their dishes: Hawaiian Rib Eye Rutherford Rib Eye Baby Back Ribs French Dip Thai Noodle Salad Crab Cakes Cheese Toast and a bunch other that I can't remember.  The service is awesome. I didn't like the couscous I had and they gave me any side I wanted.. they are sooo friendly :) sigh* love this place... everything tastes yummy (i just don't like couscous)

Zy_Rw00SjE47uhv-WuHTDw.review_text: 4/24/14  Dinner  The BF craved Hillstone's burger so we went on a Friday night. Love the fancy, loungy atmosphere and the live cello/oboe performance.  Love the classy ambiance. But Hillstone is very down-to-earth establishment. I feel casual and classy here at the same time. It's my go-to place for a simple, tasty meal.  Reservation was done through OpenTable but upon arrival, we were informed that their system was down. The hostess wrote down my name and reassured that we would be seated promptly, even before the stipulated 7PM.   Hillstone service is a choreography. No sooner did we sit down at the booth were we greeted by server (who wasn't our server) for drinks order. Then server came to tell us the specials and took own food order. Smooth and efficient.  *Hillstone Cheeseburger ($19): is one of the best burgers in town. Served in a fluffy homemade brioche bun is a juicy beef patty cooked medium. The cheddar cheese is melted such that it's completely glazed over the patty. Served with cole slaw or shoe string fries.  *Thai Steak & Noodle Salad ($23): always my favorite. I honestly cannot finish the entire Filet Mignon plate and I don't care for mashed potato so I always get this salad instead. They are very generous with the filet mignon, also cooked medium rare. Big clumps of meat tossed with avocado, basil leaves, tomatoes, Thai noodle and crushed peanut. The only downside is that they don't make it spicy like in Bangkok.  Moscow Mule ($11) is a welcoming bubbly drink with a touch of lemon. The Fiddlehead Pinot Noir (Santa Rita, $14/glass) has a velvety blackcurrant finish. Great drinks to accompany the meal.  Another excellent tasty meal.

drvVOxJxdakl_sQhr28uJA.review_text: This is one of my favorite lunch spots.  I usually sit at the bar.  The staff is stellar and the food is fantastic.  While I have had almost everything on the lunch menu, my favorite has the be the crispy chicken sandwich. That thing is to die for (though you wouldn't really think it by reading the menu).  Atmosphere is nice and it is usually quiet enough to meet with people over lunch.  They also have a patio that is staffed on nice days.

nFXGTcuVBrCDbAnvJIFTsQ.review_text: Always reliable. Always good. Perfect for lunch - they have a knack for getting you in and out in an hour.   It's a chain, but you wouldn't know it. Solid restaurant.    Start with the spinach and artichoke dip. If you get a salad (hacked chicken is my favorite), ask for easy on the dressing. Fries are to die for. Wine list is great.

YFNAYiWUDuNqv57VS5tXPg.review_text: Solid American food. This is one of the few chains I visit in SF. The dishes are made with care and have great flavor. The Salads are awesome and creative, and the ribs are a bbq go-to.

Ki63sCyQGGUSksbFK6SRQQ.review_text: Cassie at Houston's is the dream-server! I go to Houston's often with a great friend of mine to eat reliable tasty comfort food and get caught up on our lives. The service is never bad, the food is always delicious. But.......the other night Cassie was our server and she was so attentive, so engaging, helpful, and made honest and complete suggestions. She offered additional pertinent information and she did it all with a million-dollar smile.  My friend swears by the veggie-burger and it is really good - even from a red meat eater such as myself. I love their cheeseburger, their center-cut filet, and jumbo lump crab cakes. Oh and the Biltmore Chicken Sandwich. Their special fish selection has been excellent everytime I have selected it. Extensive wine list - good, solid local options. I love coming here. This Thursday looks good for a trip.

mXJyksCE4hCNtXBT4kDOng.review_text: While a vegan obviously couldn't expect much from a steakhouse chain restaurant, my meal at Houston's San Francisco location was the most ridiculous of my life.  First, you may ask why I was there in the first place. Well, my girlfriend's mother was visiting from Texas and refused to eat at restaurants that do not serve meat, so my girlfriend did some research and discovered that Houston's had a vegan veggie burger. We called in and confirmed that yes, the veggie burger is vegan.  Upon arriving at the restaurant, my girlfriend and I again asked the hostess what we could eat on the menu. She pointed to the roasted vegetable platter, grilled artichokes, and the veggie burger, when ordered without cheese or butter. None of these options are anything to get excited about, but we were satisfied to see that we certainly would not be going hungry.  After ordering, the waitress returned to the table to tell us that the burger's bun is in fact NOT vegan and contains eggs. She said that all their bread is house-baked except for Oroweat wheat bread, which was also not vegan. While this was bad news, we were happy that she came to us with the information and ordered the bare patty with a baked potato as a replacement for the bun.  Only a bit later, I excused myself to the restroom. On the way back, I noticed a bread basket by the kitchen with an entire loaf of Acme Bread Company 'herb slab,' which I know for a fact is vegan. However, the waitress had said that all bread was baked in-house, so I asked her in order to be sure, "Where is this bread baked?"  As I had thought, it was from Acme. "Can we please have our burgers on that bread?" I asked.   The logical answer would be yes - and the waitress seemed to know this - but she said "No, we can't make sandwiches on that bread."  Why?  She replied, "I asked the manager and she said it is not for sandwiches. But we can bring you some of it sliced."  I returned to the table defeated, and our food arrived shortly along with a plate of sliced Acme bread. We decided that this was too ridiculous and needed to talk to the manager about this non-sandwich bread policy. She arrived shortly.  The exchange lasted nearly 10 minutes. All we wanted was a simple bread replacement, but she acted like we were asking for them to create an entire new dish. "We have chips on the menu and we have cheese on the menu, but we can't make nachos just because someone wants them," she argued.  All we wanted was bread sliced horizontally in sandwich form. But since it was not "tested and approved by the company's lead chefs" they could not serve it. Even thought it was one of the only things we could eat on the menu.  "What if we served you the burger on that bread, but then you didn't like it? You wouldn't be happy, right?" she asked.  I responded, "I am not happy NOW because you are here explaining why I can't have this bread instead of just giving it to me. And isn't that what the restaurant business is all about - taking risks to satisfy the customer? Not everyone is going to like everything that you serve!"  She eventually relented and said she would bring us some bread. Five minutes later, we received more bread - but SLICED just as before! Remember, I saw a whole loaf in the basket, so this was as if the manager intentionally sliced it the wrong way out of spite.  In a surprise move, they did not charge us for the veggie burgers. But it's not like we would have paid for them anyway, so the gesture was insignificant.  The manager should be fired for speaking to customers in such a way. I have never been to a restaurant where I have been treated with such disdain. Houston's is an expensive place and I am baffled that they have a policy that dictates that managers cannot alter dishes to please customers. Seriously?!

3Icx1v7b6X880HHiSFf_Aw.review_text: My wife and I brought our friends visiting from Seattle here for a dinner. I recommend reservations as this place can get busy especially on the weekends. My wife always gets the salmon while I get their savory baby back ribs. Their drinks are great here as well. Always make sure you pay the meter because they do run later than regular meters. Their artichoke dip is a great starter as well.

G7tQzy6dCkeeUCZ6d9BSjA.review_text: why have i not written a review about this place?!?! the service is excellent. the place is nice. there's no corkage fee! though i haven't gotten a chance to take advantage of that yet, i'm sure planning to soon enough.   all i have to say is: grilled artichokes, bbq pork ribs, and hot fudge sundae!!!  tried the raved about hawaiin rib eye, but i just can't find myself liking it.... that's a no no in my book.  the prime rib is good, but i think the bbq pork ribs are better! i'll save my prime rib quota for house of prime rib instead.   spinach and artichoke dip is something i always get too, but i feel like the grilled artichokes might be healthier or something, i don't know. get them both if you can, that's what i do.   the only bad part is that they can't accommodate big parties because the tables are screwed to the ground or something. it's a shame because i would love to celebrate my birthday here with my loved onessss!

7ehzI-U6ln7tg81XjtxzmQ.review_text: I was in San Francisco to  visit my daughter.  We had gone to Alcatraz for the tour. Hillstone is my favorite concept and I was thrilled to know they were directly across the street. Not sure why it is called Hillstone now not Houston's but no worries same great food.   We had the roasted chicken and the vegetable platter.  So incredible.  Service was awesome and I love the environment.   The best -- Hillstone you ROCK!!!

Zb5k2PG22-78C8LBgQJ20w.review_text: This nice restaurant is in walking distance of my apartment, so I often go there when I want a nice dinner out and don't want to deal with driving/cabs. This is a nice place, so don't show up in your flip flops or t-shirts. Also, it's a good idea to make a reservation for evenings/weekends.   The food is excellent. I've had everything from the steak to the spinach and cheese omlette, and it's never been a disappointment. The focaccia and olive appetizer could be a meal all on its own, I get it every time I go. Also, the Hawaiian Rib Eye is ridiculously flavorful.   Hillstone also has excellent service and live music. It's perfect for a romantic night out.

gwjEfhI58al8tSkgzauSIA.review_text: I ate here with my sister last week on Thursday for dinner. We where debating on where to go and decided to eat at Houston's because there was not wait.   I've always loved the environment at Houston's but I don't like that fact that it's so dim there. I can't see my food. NE-wayz, we ordered the spinach dip for appetizer and she got the Hawaiian Rib Eye Steak and I got the Prime Rib.   The spinach dip was good, it came out hot and the chips was crunchy and not salty. When our entrees came out, I was kind of stuffed by gobbling down the spinach dip. My sister loved her Hawaiian Rib Eye Steak because she said they made it just right. I liked my Prime Rib but I liked it at House of Prime better. I should've ordered something else other than Prime Rib. Oh wells.   The server guy was nice. I had on a chip and orange juice run all night. I felt bad so I gave him a good tip for all the hassle.   If you never been to Houston's, it a cool place to take your date. The food is good but I would recommend the spinach dip and the Hawaiian Rib Eye Steak. The light is dim so it gives it a nice romantic feel. Also they have a fire place outside.

NbdKctpJhm8iktZrrLpULg.review_text: I love Hillstone for being the spot my boyfriend took me to for finer dining. The ambiance was classy but kind of casual at the same time. He made a reservation through opentable.com, and we got seated right away. It was intimate and noisy at the same time. I really enjoyed the noise level, because it was perfect for having a conversation and not having to use an indoor voice. For starters, we got the home smoked Salmon that was recommended by one of my bf's coworkers who said it was so good that it would make girls do...unmentionables. I don't really know if it was THAT good, but it was definitely delicious. It was baked, but not completely, so the texture was super tender. Came with tarter sauce and bread. Yum. For entrees, I had the special which was the Lame Shank and my boyfriend had the Prime Rib which apparently is one of their top dishes. Super large portions, good flavor, and actually cooked the way we asked them to be cooked. Service was really attentive and friendly. One disappointment: My boyfriend reserved at a time where he knew they were going to lit the fireplace, but apparently in order to sit near there you have to specify or have a big group? We were a bit disappointed because those tables were near the music and the window which was featuring a beautiful SF sunset while we had to strain to have a change to glance at it. My boyfriend was a little more disappointed than I was I think. He said it was a bit like Applebee's turned fine dining because this restaurant is a chain. Overall, great restaurant, but I don't know if I would necessarily come back because of all the other choices for finer dining.

XHmsNa9tHPk8yt_MmkXREA.review_text: Great French Dip and tabouli on the side.  Location is convenient though street parking can be tough.  They have a good kale salad if you like that sort of thing.

CK_RgAzCBZI0V16xR96byQ.review_text: I've been here a dozen times and have yet to have anything besides a five star experience.  I've sometimes strolled in wearing a hoodie and jeans and still get amazing service.  Smoked salmon is the best thing on the menu-- I think I have a problem.  Every server, every bartender, and even the manager Jonathan are all the most gracious hosts.  I usually avoid the embarcadero area, but this place is a destination

rtTpEZSTIDSurdw12xZK1Q.review_text: Went there last night... their Hawaiian Rib Eye is AMAZING!!! We also had their grilled artichoke for appetizer which was also reallllly yummy.  It was sooooo busy last night since we had WONDERFUL weather and everyone is out for thursday happy hour.  Just one star off for waiting 20 mins for our table even though we had reservations and after we sat down and ordered a NICE bottle of wine... they can't move us to another outside table AFTER we offered ANOTHER nice bottle of wine...

-8SXYc5eqSzqX9EjfaFHzQ.review_text: No happy hour here.  Came with a group of 7 people.  No corkage fee for 2 bottles only; $15 after that.  Live jazz band (piano & bass) played "Happy" last night.  LOL!  I'm surprised to find a chain restaurant that taste quite ok.  Prime rib was pretty good and my fillet mignon was perfectly cooked (medium rare as I wanted)!  Portions are quite big.  We shared two jumbo shrimp appetizers and steak noodle salad.  They weren't kidding about the "jumbo" shrimps.  They were huge!  I really liked the steak noodle salad.  Delicious cubes of steak with noodles and chunks of mangoes that weren't drenched in dressing (thank you!).  If I recall correctly, it was all booth seating, we hate it when someone sitting inside needs to step out.

6LIQgjTdfyrBTxMcfL7R9Q.review_text: Growing up in Georgia, I knew Houston's--the nice restaurant across the street from my high school that my parents took me to when I got a good report card. The cheesy bread was divine and the French fries in a league of their own.   Then I discovered in other parts of the country the same restaurant was branded "Hillstone." I've eaten at the one in Boston and the one in New York, and was passing by this location and started bragging to my friend about their veggie burgers. Coincidently it was lunch time, and 10 minutes later we were seated at one of their white tablecloth tables near a window.  SETTING: Like other Houston's/Hillstone's, interior is classy and a little bit on the darker side with richer wood and red tones. White tableclothes for both lunch and dinner.  FOOD: Famous for the veggie burger (one that is probably not healthy), Houston's also has great Spinach and Artichoke dip and salads. Back in my non-veg days I ordered the Hickory Burger. Unfortunately, the cheesy bread has been off the menu for nearly 10 years.  SERVICE: The service at Houston's/Hillstone is good on the whole. But the fifth star here is for today's service. When we ordered our food, I mentioned non-chalantly that we were going to split our dishes. The burger then came split into two pieces and they brought an extra plate with no further request from us.  It's the small things folks, it's the small things.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: easy parking on street or meter...simple online reservations...hillstone signage outside and houston's inside...short, but diverse menu with many safe choices...stiff cocktails all around...gin and ginger ale...vodka tonic...greyhound...water too...starting with a thai noodle salad with rotisserie chicken $23..sweet and tangy..shredded moist and tender chicken...hawaiian rib-eye steak the main course $36...sweet and marinaded...so tender and extremely juicy...finishing with a nutty brownie and vanilla bean ice cream...more nuts than brownie...rich and tasty with ice cream melting fast...excellent service staff...good mix of food choices in all price range...safe bet for a good casual meal...

O_aeeT6FuCEif2CSMMRAcw.review_text: Love, love, love this place! The service is excellent and food is always fresh and very tasty! The cocktails are so delicious, too. If the key lime pie is in season, ORDER IT!!! My go to's are the burger and the prime rib. Always fabulous. I love the ambiance, too. Comfortable and classy. I wish they would build one on the Peninsula!!!!

5AgMe_UtUSugOQ4_GxpUFQ.review_text: No corkage fee, which is always a plus. The Flying Tuna Platter is delicious...great, now I am craving it!

gmxMFRIaFg8gB8BLf_svhA.review_text: $30 for a BBQ rib entree and $15 for a burger; yet this restaurant still charges $2 extra for bread and an extra 4% for Healthy SF.  WTF!  Also, the ribs came out lukewarm.

I-E1pOirEiw7-X-mFbxmIA.review_text: I had friends in from out of town on a whirlwind trip, who wanted to have lunch.  They have a two-year-old, so I was on the prowl for something with good food and relatively kid-friendly.  I decided on Hillstone based on--you guessed it--Yelp reviews.  I concur--good place, and it fit my particular needs that day just fine.   There isn't a kids' menu per se, but our two-year-old dining companion did well with a hamburger.  I ordered a cheeseburger, and may I just say, taaaasty.  Really, really good.  We also had the spinach and artichoke dip, and another of my friends ordered the chili.  Good stuff all around, mellow atmosphere, nice place but not super dressy (for lunch, anyway).    Soooo, this is a good little spot right off the Embarcardero, and I'd recommend it if you're in the hood.

2Aj529Qci5qpI1FKC6V9Rg.review_text: Mmmm... yummy.  This place is pretty convenient for where I live and their burgers are the jam! We were a pretty big party last time I was there and they seated us comfortably (with a reservation), which was great. There is also a bar area and a nifty little outdoor patio to have pre-dinner drinks on, nice when you get the weather.   Now for the important part, the food. Everyone in my group was happy with their meal, there were a few burgers going around, plus steaks, salads and fish, all of which looked fab. It's a good choice for if you're catering to different tastes, you can go all out or have something healthy too. Finally, order the brownie for dessert, scrummy.

yN2vBa_ZIr2i8oErFNqPJQ.review_text: Typical hillstone experience. Great consistent food, clean/comfortable atmosphere, and average service. Highlight... The TCHO sundae. Seriously delicious.

YWV2xZA6TLBUT_1eVPHWZw.review_text: I always enjoy this place. Lunch or dinner. The atmosphere is classic yet somehow modern. The food is traditional but somehow experimental.  So many things make this restaurant my go-to when we have company in town. The food is delicious, the artichokes are a very social appetizer option and the no corkage fee lets you splurge on the food. I think my only want is that the martinis were a littler larger. Other than that I've made my way through half the menu and recommend it all, especially the Hawaiian Rib Eye and the Hot Fudge Sundae.

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: I'm only reviewing their lunch takeout. we have cheeseburgers, fries and their Thai noodle salad. good burger, the salad got so much ingredients but it works and I like it. I've been here long time ago when they were called Houstons. will definitely try dinner.

dPdH8TqeRVNHe_1kQSLBUA.review_text: Ambiance was very nice.  Not too loud and the food was good.  Live Jazz was awesome!!!  Parking was the problem.  They validate at 80 Francisco, but the hostess said that they validate for two hours.  When I returned to my car, I was given a five dollar discount. after a 2 hour 18 minute stay.  The non-discounted rate was $17.00.  And... This was on President's Day.   There is nothing on their web site about parking and their validation.  Needs to more clear.  This establishment needs valet parking.

sMBysnEguwsF1kc2ol0NZg.review_text: This is such a convenient restaurant for all types of meetings. Good consistent food and service, in a perfect location. I end up sitting for hours in those comfortable booths.  Wonderful wine selection, I love that they regularly carry Conundrum. The Murphy's Law blend is my personal favorite.

-peYN3aSOm8375ChOOLUYw.review_text: Had no idea this was part of a chain. For a chain restaurant, it's pretty nice.   Came here with a huge group of people, some kinda tipsy and loud, and all hungry and not willing to wait for a table. So we just ordered at the bar.   Mixed service. The bartenders were friendly but the wait staff was slow and uninterested. Maybe they were just annoyed haha :P. But still, TRY to put on a happy face since you're stuck working anyway!  Otherwise, the food was good and the atmosphere was lively. I would definitely come back based on these two things and hope that the staff is better the next time.

UsHxO3TTNJf8ijn9FvDRCw.review_text: Positives:  1) You can bring your own wine!  No corkage fees! 2) Service is great and the waiters/waitresses are trained very well. 3) Great location. 4) Good atmoshphere.  Negatives: 1) Food is inconsistent.   Spinach/artichoke dip is awesome.  Prime rib was delicious until I got to the last few bites and it tasted like someone had dumped a slat shaker on it which still not sure what happened here....I didn't use the salt.  Strange  Anyway, it is was good enough that i would give them another chance with my favorite bottle of wine that I bring in myself.  Cheers

JwQ8oI5iXKaqfBgZSpm19Q.review_text: Love Thai Chicken Noodle Salad. Soo yummy! Spinach & artichoke dip also great! Great service as always. :D

pwuBqBf6VnC0JPTHP18Tfw.review_text: I've never been to Hillstone, but I have been to Houston's (in New Orleans)! Each time I go, I always have a good experience, and Hillstone was no different! I made a reservation weeks in advance as my bf and I planned to have a nice dinner date. Highly recommend to make a reservation because the Saturday night we came, it was packed! Not just speaking about the dining tables, but the bar area too (Giants vs Royals World Series)! Parking is hard to find on the main street of Embarcardero & Montgomery. When my bf & I arrived around 7 pm, there was plenty of parking behind the restaurant where the apartments or office buildings are (turn on your nearest right in front the restaurant and "circle" the block). The restaurant is dimly lit with a causal/romantic ambiance. The Houston restaurant that I went to in NOLA had a sign by their waiting area that said no sandals, shorts, hats, etc. because it was a semi-formal restaurant. I thought that was the case here too, but this place seems more casual and I felt over dressed.. but its kewl, it's nice to dress up time to time! The dining tables consisted of 2-4 seating by the walls/windows and the tables in the middle of the restaurant were mainly booths. They also have an open kitchen by the side of the entrance. I loved where we were seated because it by the wall/window and there was great lighting for taking pictures of our food (yes, I'm one of those Asians..)! The light was shining just above the center of our table. Look at my food pics and you'll know what I mean! ;) The menu (hillstone.com/pdf_menus/…) has five categories: Starters, salads, burgers & sandwiches, house specialties, and side dishes. They also have a good selection of wine - Sparkling & Champagne, Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Rose & White wine, Cabernet Sauvignon & Cabernet blends, Merlot, Pinot Noir, Zinfandel, and more red wine! You can order them by the glass or bottle. For glass, they range between $10-18, and bottles range from $28-120. According to other yelpers, they don't have a corkage fee, so bring your own bottle if you must! *Remember not to drink & drive! If you need a DD, the restaurant can call a cab for you :) Our waiter was Greg, was great! He was attentive and gave us time to finish our 2 appetizers before placing our entree orders. Side note: Don't order 2 appetizers if it's 2 people eating.. cause it started to fill our stomach! FOOD! Appetizers: Spinach & artichoke dip ($14): yelp.com/biz_photos/hill… Honestly, I would've never thought about trying this but because my cousin recommended it when we went to Houstons, I fell in love! This consists of tortilla chips and 3 dips - spinach & artichoke, salsa, and sour cream. My favorite is the spinach & artichoke - it has a warm taste to it and it is just delish! A must try! House-Smoked Salmon ($17): yelp.com/biz_photos/hill… My boyfriend loved this dish and it is one of my favorites too! This dish has smoked-salmon, toasts, and the Chef's dressing. What I do is grab a toast, cut bits of salmon onto it (not wholes cause it'll be complicated to eat when you bite into it), and slab a bit of dressing on top. The best thing about this dish is the salmon itself. It has a unique and tasty flavor to it, and just makes the dish stand out. According to my bf, this is what he said, "If I could, I would order 3 plates of this just for the salmon!" Shows how good it is ;) and he also said, he would come back just for this! Highly recommended. Entrees: Roasted Prime Rib with Baked Potato ($37): yelp.com/biz_photos/hill… If you are not a steak person, like my bf, you shouldn't order this. He wanted to give it a try but did not really enjoy it because it was so 'rare' in the middle and didn't expect that out of a prime rib.. tsk tsk. I tried a piece and I thought it was good, but there wasn't anything that stood out to me. They also have a fully b Hawaiian rib-eye ($36) yelp.com/biz_photos/hill… One the best rib-eyes ever! It is to die for! The rib-eye looks like a 10-12 oz. It has pineapple soy ginger marinade, with hand-cut French fries and everything about it just yummy. When you first bite into it, you can taste the juicy pineapple soy ginger marinade, and just feels like it melts in your mouth... I highly recommend this dish! Their fries are also good, as they are hand-cut and not from your typical frozen food fries. My bf tried a piece of mine and wished he ordered this! Because we had 2 appetizers, we were too full and not able to finish our entrees..sad face. Don't be like us!! Everything was great & I'd definitely love to come back again!

FelsFPG67CFqRS2AAOu3pg.review_text: TLDR: The Prime Rib is amazing, but its going to cost you a little extra.  Came here today with a large, rowdy group of friends without reservation and surprisingly enough, they had a table ready for us in minutes. Our waiter Michael was very helpful throughout the whole meal without being overbearing.  A couple of us got the Prime Rib done medium, but I had mine medium-rare and it was done perfectly. Its a rather large plate that left even a big eater like myself satisfied.  I would recommend this place to anyone who has a little more to spend and loves their meat.

I7SPZdW5rRF2_g1XAQLhLw.review_text: Ahh...what can I say about this place except that this is my favorite lunch spot when I'm craving classic American fare. I love the salmon burger, the cheeseburger, the french dip, the rib eye steak, and the yellowtail sandwich when it's available as a special. The service is excellent from the host, servers, and bartenders. This place is always clean. I wish that the BBQ sauce on the ribs was saltier and spicier. It's a tad too sweet for my taste. I brought my parents here for lunch on Saturday and they loved it. The wine list is good and they make a great mojito.

D2epirooWNjvwTI6MFhNGw.review_text: I was pretty intent on prime rib but I was enticed by their special cedar plank smoked rib eye with balsamic reduction special of the day.  Should have stuck with my original plan.   The rib eye was nothing special, and the reduction was terrible.  No corkage fee so all the bottles of wine my girlfriend brought was nice.   I miss Houston's.

P_nbsruhcpc5eTx8lS_X7g.review_text: The artichoke appetizer is awesome.  The dipping sauce is yummy, and not your usual mayonnaise blah glop.  I had the lamb, which was good, although slightly overdone.  The mashed potatoes were so good (still has little chunks of potato too!) that J kept sneaking bites from my plate.  My greens were too salty, but overall I was still happy.  J had the salmon, which came only with a handful of steamed broccoli.  He did clean his plate though, so I assume it was good.  Others at the table had the crab cakes (which were a good size and not skimpy like most), and another had the veggie burger (which she swears by....even though she isn't a vegetarian), and chicken (which was huge).  The service is friendly and pretty fast.   I want to give it a 3.5 stars overall.  I like the place, but would probably head over to Epic Steakhouse if it were a tossup between the two.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: One of the BEST ribs in NorCal.  I used to walk by the restaurant everyday (when it was Houston's) and i would always get a BIG whiff of the ribs. MMMmMmm My other faves here include the Thai Noodle Salad which has yummy filet mignon, avocado, mangoes and noodles. There's nothing "salad" about this dish at all (Yay!) And i also love the brownies here!

LvdC1y5QlN9Ll3G7IVDXLA.review_text: I loved it!  My date took me there for a romantic dinner and this place was just what we needed. Great service, beautiful design, great food.  I love the blinds at the windows...those turn me on as well as the delicious Californian Cab. If you're planning to give your date what he wants to...this is where he should take you!

SrGIw7QejC8Zm1ofs4XOXg.user_location: North Beach/Telegraph Hill, San Francisco, CA
SrGIw7QejC8Zm1ofs4XOXg.review_text: Stopped by for takeout ribs but their grill was down. Argh. But as all great businesses do, they go a bit further to accommodate their customers: alternative meal was on the house.  Got prime rib instead and leaving happy.  Back to Hillstone soon again.  Smart.

cBSXEldudlpiYQEriEew6g.review_text: I go to Houston's for their rack of ribs, extra bbq sauce on the side.  Well, actually, I've never gone on my own will yet since the two times I've been there was for work paid department lunches... but I am now a faithful and ready to start bringing others there that do not yet know of this place.  The decor is nice, but don't plan on bringing parties over 8 to this place.  Their individual booths are not big enough to seat more than that together.    This is a $$$ restaurant and you get what you pay for.  Well prepared, tasty food with the best decor and fanciness that a joint named Houston's can offer.  The service is great.  As I mentioned, I've had the ribs twice there and both times did not disappoint.  The meat falls off the bone... which means you can eat with a fork and knife if you wanted.  I've also had their tomato soup - divine - and cobb salad, also very good.  I've sampled a variety of their appetizers which are decent and the huge sundae for dessert.  It took four of us to down it!    LOVE IT

xkZ759FuqPiA6ROY20jH9g.review_text: This place has become one of my new favorite restaurants, and it's very kids friendly.  I love their artichoke, fried chicken sandwich, and burger.  Great service!  Will come often!

19AsA-NxULdMRjtyyjHmhQ.review_text: Update: only 2 complimentary corkage (not unlimited) starting a few months ago.  Pros:  -Nice ambiance...eh not much else  Cons:  -Staff was rude to me; when I ordered fries with my entree, they brought mashed potatoes, but when I told them they had the order wrong, the waitress rolled her eyes at me, WTH.  Completely unprofessional. -Food overpriced and mediocre  Def would not come here again.

JxNuHm-7cSOTyelrktrLcQ.review_text: I remember walking by this place when I was an intern and seeing all the fancy people eating here and thinking, "will i ever get to eat here?"  A few months later, here I am reviewing it on yelp.   I came here for a business lunch and had the artichoke hearts, seared ahi tuna burger, braised red cabbage, and an arnold palmer.   Overall, fairly underwhelming. All of the food tasted good, but was nothing special. I felt like I could have eaten at Boudin's and felt the same way about lunch.   Honestly, it isn't the price that turns me off (I didn't even see the bill), but if someone wanted to take me out to Hillstone for lunch again, I'd probably suggest somewhere else.   Maybe I ordered the wrong things? I don't know. Everyone else's food looked fairly mediocre as well. I wouldn't mind drinking wine and sitting outside on a sunny day though. I would probably just eat somewhere else beforehand. After all, Butterfly is right across the street and has a gorgeous view of the water!

-HXpF9E-YwE0g-mInWSRuA.review_text: This place rocks it all. Great service, great food, great ambiance.    Everything I've had here has been amazing and the portions are generous.  I recommend:  SPINACH ARTICHOKE DIP HAWAIIAN RIBEYE - it's pretty sweet so some people may not like it, also it is pretty fatty since it's a ribeye but very tender PRIME RIB - my favorite. comes with a side of loaded baked potato but we opted for the mashed potato  THAI STEAK SALAD - delicious  Even on a Friday night, there's not a super long wait, so we love coming here if we need dinner and haven't made plans.

n68bs2UnrODZ86qU15rYDw.review_text: This place has the WORST service and the crowd is basically pretentious jerks that feel they are something special for some reason. The drinks are extremely over priced and just getting any attention for service from the staff is nonexistent. I would not step foot in this place even if I was on the brink of dehydration or dying of hunger. If this was the last place on earth that I could eat and drink to save my life, I would rather die than be surrounded by scum of the earth patrons that think they are better than the rest of the general population and a staff that is dead behind the eyes.  I am giving this place a negative 10 stars. I would give it a negative 5 fives stars only if it were to burst into flames and burn to the ground. Only then, would I up my rating.

0N89xty3orwYOM_c_RHuXg.review_text: The woman has wanted to go here for a while now and I finally indulged her and we went.  I was a little skeptical about a $14 burger.  Most places I have a burger I leave thinking I could have done just as good if not better on my Char-Broil on my deck.  This was by far the most amazing, delicious, filling and awesome burger I have ever had.  The reviews were spot on with the greatness of this place.  We went for an early lunch on a Sunday.  Doors opened at 11:00am, we were there at 11:01am.  Staff was just getting things rolling inside, but the place seemed ready to go.  The hostess was friendly and the waitress was very pleasant.  I am not an upscale diner, and this place was pretty out of my league, but they made me feel like I could come back in my shorts and cut-off!

OiepD4qVbB0xjYeTs8-yxQ.review_text: I came to Houston/Hillstone in LA a year ago and fell in love with their Rib Eye. It was huge and satisfying.  I have been craving for that juicy, tender, mouth-watering steak so I visited this place during our big day.  Parking was a little bit hard to find(it's SF) but we were so lucky to be able to find a spot right in the front of it.  Hillstone to me is a mix of fine dining and a steakhouse. It's dark and upscaled but at the same time it's loud. It was a full house on Saturday night and everybody talked so loud as if you were in a bar.  We ordered spinach & artichoke dip as an appetizer which is highly recommended. They offered to refill our chips for free which was nice.  They have a full bar but they do not have a cocktail menu, so I ordered a cosmo, It was good but nothing to brag about.  I ordered the rib eye(the one with the bone) because that's what I came there for and my gf ordered the Hawaiian Rib Eye.  Our rib eye came and let me just say that the rib eye met my expectation if not more. All the flavor, the tenderness, the juicyness that I have been craving came on that first bite. It was that damn good!!! Suddenly, there was no conversation between me and my gf. We were too busy enjoying our own rib eyes.  We couldn't finish the whole thing because it was so big. We had to bring it home. Even a few days late, I microwave the leftover and it was still good.  Price was reasonable for special events dinner, not every weekend though or I will go broke. They had live jazz too which was cool.

JGdKYphlPcJTBhHBjCfdig.review_text: Had my Christmas dinner date here. Loved that there was no corkage fee when my date brought a bottle of wine.   Oak Grilled Artichokes with rémoulade ($14): this was our first time having grilled whole artichoke...we had to YouTube how to eat it! (lol it was an enjoyable experience though) The rémoulade sauce was awesome,  but I don't think  I will get the grilled artichoke during a dinner date...  It was not cute having to pull the leaves through your teeth in front of your date!   Roasted prime rib ($37): I ordered the prime rib medium rare and that is what I got; however, the prime rib was not tender. I asked the server to provide me raw horseradish and it was actually sweeter than the creamed horseradish that came with my entree.  The baked potato was nothing special but it was a bit on the dry side.   Hawaiian Ribeye ($36): very tender but too sweet for a Ribeye.  My date liked the sweetness,  he wanted something different.  The winter vegetables were OK, I was not impressed. I think there was potatoes and spaghetti squash...   Apple Cobbler ($8): More like WALNUT COBBLER!! Totally not what I was expecting.  The supposedly apple cobbler was actually walnut cobbler! I didn't see any apples!   Service was great! The server came to fill up our wine glasses and made sure if we were OK.

pBNqvV5IkldL24s418ZzRw.review_text: I've been here 3 times in the last 10 days. Gotten the french dip everytime and am still craving it like crazy!!! IT IS OUT. OF. THIS. WORLD.  great service and great quality!

Ulxvb9kgIMKfT9XXTgU3xQ.review_text: Hillstone consistently has the best food.  Excellent ribs, prime rib sandwich, and burgers.  Everything here is always excellent.  I have yet to find better ribs in the bay area.  This isn't a cheap place to eat but it is quality.

9cuT4EEUbAi1pJKyQ5Y_5Q.review_text: Been here a few times.  First time here I ordered the hawaiian rib eye with loaded baked potato.  Great! very tasty! not sure how many ounces but it should be enough.  So I came back, this time tried the prime rib with loaded baked potato.  A little different than HOPR, they put the au jus sauce on a bown instead of having the au jus on top of the meat at HOPR.  Other than that, it's great, also worth mentioning the no corkage fee... except the wait time even after a reservation.

REGjppkq2IkDLRQVmRj_Bg.review_text: Hillstone is the old Houstons, and you're constantly reminded of it as you enter with old letters still remaining on the outside sign and "Houstons" still lit and hanging above the doorway as you exit.  Maybe it was missed...?  The service here is impeccable with ample time to enjoy company whether you're on a date or celebrating birthday's with friends.  Although they wont always sing with you there will be a candle in your dessert making for a perfect ending to your celebratory evening. The food was great!  Amongst us we shared the Pork, Chicken, Crab Cakes, and Prime Rib dishes.  Of course everyone has to start off with the grilled artichokes. How can something so incredibly simple taste so much more delicious then when prepared at home?  It must be the love.  I can't think of one complaint about this restaurant other than the fact that if you request a seat outside they can only serve drinks and do not allow food.  That's not much of a complaint but wouldn't it be nice to drink AND eat while enjoying the sun that comes ever-so-often in SF?    Great all-around dining destination.

2s2ALgceTomK1OYmkL3VDA.review_text: I finally made it back to Houston's and this time they completely renewed my faith. I got the most delicious Farmer's Market Vegetable plate. It had green beans, asparagus, a giant tomato with basil leaves, and cous cous salad with mint, tomatoes, salty almonds and other stuff...it was really fresh and exactly what I wanted. I felt myself getting healthier with every bite.  My BF had the French dip again. He described it as: larger than average and the beef was delicious, but there was some mayonnaise secret sauce on it that wasn't mentioned on the menu. Sauce makes him angry. Literally. BUT he said that dipping it in the au jus kinda rinsed the sauce off and he could deal with it.  Since my meal was perfect, I'm only taking off one star for his input. The service was still super-speedy, but I guess that's part of the deal when you eat there...empty plates are cleared immediately so it's a good idea to keep pace with your friends.   I want to go back and try the Vegetable Plate every season. I'm a believer.

I3pkMKbRJaRYXwIFH1-HHw.review_text: Wow!  Ok, my fiancé and I don't usually patronize the finer establishments, but v-day, so you know. This place was one of the best restaurants I've been too. It's not expensive classy, but it feels like it. Great live jazz that is not obtrusive, real fireplace to drink by while you wait for your table. The best food!!!!! The artichokes are phenomenal. You can eat the whole thing! No immediate flossing required! I almost lost my grip on my cutlery when I tasted the prime rib. Wow, another planet.  PLUS!!! Bring you own wine! No corkadge for the first bottle, whaat!?!! OH, and THE BEST service! We had Leah, she was so sweet, cute, attentive, timely, and everything a great server should be. Highly recommend giving this place a chance!

G0-1gXLQBYuCkFcl322mlw.review_text: Never had a bad dish here. Yum! And great drinks.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: Houston's, we have a problem...NOT! (...spoken with Borat's sense of comedy timing)  Yes, yes, I know it's a chain....do you think my epicurean pride would prevent me from chewing like an obsessive carnivore incautious about "mad cow" disease?..."HA!", I say as I pick my teeth for residue meat.  My friend and I were lucky for a Saturday evening. Immediate seating. A nice-sized booth. A truly service-oriented waitress amid the heavy foot traffic. The spirits of Borden's Elsie the Cow and Stuart Andersen's Black Angus steer must have been smiling on us. Taking no prisoners, I went for the $28 Roasted Prime Rib on the Bone. Extravagant, I know...but I just salivated at the thought of a juicy thick slab of beef with a big baked potato.  When it came, I may have clapped my hands like Ross the Intern did when he met Christina Aguilera for the first time. It was a huge cut, medium rare and pink with a crusty edge to it...not Christina, the meat. It came with a bowl of warm au jus and a ramekin of creamy horseradish sauce. The potato had the works - sour cream, crispy bacon bits, chopped scallions and butter. My one disappointment was that the potato was a tad lukewarm with the ingredients not nearly as melty-melt as I wanted them to be. Does anyone make twice-baked potatoes anymore?  I actually think the service is great here. Water glasses were filled quickly, and refreshers on beverages came responsively. My friend's fervent desire for a fish sandwich - not on the menu - was met with enthusiasm as he was served a special one with the catch of the day and a pile of fries. Dessert was not an option, at least until we pretended to exercise by walking to North Beach for gelato. The place is awfully dark. The search for the restroom in the back became a spelunker's adventure. And the bar next to us was loud and raucous with semi-drunken regulars staring dead-eyed at our meals.  **Please note that since I wrote the above review, Houston's has changed its name to Hillstone.  FOOD - 4 stars...stellar prime rib balanced by a lukewarm potato AMBIANCE - 4 stars...Papa, can you see me?...Papa, can you hear me? SERVICE - 5 stars...really prompt and friendly TOTAL - 4 stars...gimme the meat....GIMME THE MEAT!

0UhouJS_CtO6N4lvf2FGhQ.review_text: Grub in a great location.  Hard to pass up the patio seating on this sunny day, very nice interior with friendly & helpful staff.    Loved everything about the AHI BURGER, including the RED CABBAGE side.

vGFEoYo7i50-L0sihqBQdg.review_text: This place is soo awesome. Watched the fireworks at Pier 39, then decided to grab some dinner. The place was packed, but we were seated immediately! The whole setting of the place is beautiful. Our service was GREAT! Our server name is Greg, and it was honestly the best customer service I ever had! He constantly checked on us and made sure we were enjoying our meal. Wonderful dinner, and we will most definitely be coming back!!

phyyo3kbdL4iVoyLy7lNpg.review_text: I like this place: just far enough from Pier 39 not to be filled with tourists, just close enough to Pier 39 to see the crowds passing by. There's an old steakhouse feel to it: cosy boots, it's dark and sometimes there's a jazz band playing. The food is good although maybe a little bit on the expensive side. My favourites: the ahi tuna burger, kale salad and artichoke dip. Steak is worthwhile too.

XxTf-dF1lfOBgLGV-mbyfg.review_text: I got a chance to have a lunch at Hillstone's this week and always look forward to it.  We had a large party & sat in the back corner next to the fireplace, after spending a little time in the bar.  Service was top-notch.  I especially enjoyed the chicken, which is all that I've ever ordered before anyways.  We started with the artichokes (which is a go to appetizer,) and the house wines are perfect.  Hillstone's is a very nice restaurant!  Park well!

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: The food is tasty and in big portions. Which is good since it's lies on the Embarcadero and the tourist will love the huge plates of well presented and tasty dishes.   The service here is really smiley. They greet, seat, serve and bus all with the same wide smiles. It's kinda creepy. I'm a little turned off by excessive cheeriness. People who smile profusely unnerve me...seriously.  (You should note that I'm a cynical black-hearted emotionless hag and happy people irk me).  My real complaint are the french fries. I somehow always end up with french fry bits. Small little brown burnt fry pieces and very few actual long french fries. It's happened at least three times which is fine actually..the less carbs I eat the more validation I have for ordering their Scharffenberger Sundae. I could swim in that fudge...or lick it off some hot sexy man.  Either way...burnt little pieces of french fries will be the last thing on my mind.

bRG2rmKDff2tn4p1L84hGg.review_text: I know this is a chain, but this is the only Houston's I have been to, so I am unable to compare it to another, unless you count Rutherford Grille in wine country, but that still has a different name, so I really cannot compare.  I love the barbeque ribs, but I am a rib kind of guy. Recently, in an effort to cut costs and calories, I decided against get most expensive item, the ribs.   Instead, I ordered the ceaser salad, that does not have an egg dressing and a very-loaded baked potato. In reality, I saved some coin, but I did not cut calories. It was all delicious, especially my baked potato.  I did something worse, I got an ice cream sundae for dessert, which was also delicious!  And Houston's, you can sit outside by the fire, with the water, which is a great aspect, as you can look at the water, the fireplace, and/or your date....

0eQ1KkgU21qQO1qunPw_ng.review_text: I went here and had the grilled artichoke for an appetizer and the ribs for dinner. Absolutely amazing - I couldn't be happier - the ribs just fell off the bone as I picked them up - I've never been able to clean ribs off as well as I did here - and the grilled artichoke! The flavors locked into them on the grill with the intense garlic locked in - fantastic. I will definitely be back!

_LuUja6q_ClLj157y4XMqg.review_text: I'd love to give this place more stars because I really like the decor and the live jazz music. But the food is missing some love...

KURUGmYN2kwDpr6BcEcrRA.review_text: Yummy! Came here for a bon voyage party for two of my good friends - we were a group of 7 loud gossipy girls. :) Each one of us thoroughly enjoyed our dishes. The restaurant can be quite loud...but because of people like us! Fun times for sure!  We shared the spinach dip (delicious!) and an order of fries. The fries were thin and perfectly fried and salted. I ordered the French Dip, which came with more fries, and a side of horseradish sauce. The sandwich was really tasty, and bread was nice and buttery and full of goodness. I finished every last bite!  Free corkage. woot!

j9cs_sWakmhReSGX4cK_Ag.review_text: This place is owned by Houstons, but not close to as good. They don't serve clam chowder except once a week (seriously?  you're at the wharf in san fran....). The cesar salad was loaded with dressing, but tge artichoke dip was decent. The service started out friendly,  but got horrible within minutes of sitting down. Unfriendly staff.

AzUi--1McRUYdMg15H05SQ.review_text: Wellllll, I've been there a gazillion times and it always hits the spot. Always great and the service is always friendly and attentive.

4OrFB2TDRsbokoYMhUf1EA.review_text: 4 1/2 stars easy  this place knows how to cook, any resturant that can make me try fish and like it, this is one of those spots, there's a sashimi tuna salad is by far the best salad i've eaten tuna doesnt even look like fish looks like rare steak, the taste though wow..  there steaks also speak for themselves lil on the small side but definitely makes up for size with the taste tender lightly sauteed with a vinegary sauce that yells take another bite. food presentation for these folks is serious stuff everything comes out looking picture perfect, good for big or small groups, cant go wrong with a place you can bring your own bottles of wine, yes bottle service is offered, spot is dark but it gives it a feel of being at a snazzy steakhouse but not payin full price for that steak.  food ***** 5 stars on the food service **** 4 stars you may have to ask for a refill of water it is kinda dark in there, they can't see when your beverage is empty ambiance **** dark mohagany wood with gray slated rocks on the walls, followed by red bricks walls and wide windows to let the view of the bay seep in.  good for first dates, of group of friends looking for good food in the city with a view of the bay.

-shHTy1CEmSMPVSehdASaw.review_text: Dropped in on a Monday night.  No problem getting in.  Parked a block away at a private lot (use credit cards here) on the Embarcadero for $15.  Hillstone is a beautiful restaurant.  Very dark, lots of can spotlights, lots of fine finished wood, very modern.  Nice jazz trio.  Service was very good.    My Caesar salad wasn't that great.  Their egg-less salad dressing really wasn't like a Caesar dressing.  I liked my hickory burger and fries.  The ahi tuna entrée was good.    I'm likely to give a higher rating the next time I'm there because I'll order something more elaborate and expect a better meal.    The only real negative here was the bathroom.  Modern, but smelly.  No reason for a place of this caliber to have a smelly bathroom.

y_qBQ4oWQI1dJnCUBI8sig.review_text: My family enjoyed a fabulous dinner at Hillstone recently. We agreed that that the burger was the BEST burger ever! The atmosphere was embellished with the music of a jazz trio and a cozy booth table. We will definitely return on our next trip to San Francisco.

aURXctTpENUmTuCQSs_0yw.review_text: Solid 4 star restaurant that has good service and fresh quality food. All at a reasonable price. Best thing is the location opposite the Alcatraz tour terminal so you can go straight for a drink or dinner after seeing the Rock. The Beef Salad was great and features a tender steak inside and the Cheese burger was huge.

2oD-vur-aVCsOVdW0iUevw.review_text: November 2011:  Excellent filet mignon - cooked to order (medium) extra thick, super juicy filet. This filet was on par with the awesome filet at Bobo's but in a more casual atmosphere.   They seated us at 10:30pm as walk-ins on a Friday, they close at 11pm, but we weren't rushed and none of the staff appeared even remotely rushed or concerned (and there were still quite a few full tables as we were leaving).  We easily found parking at this time of night and enjoyed attentive but not inappropriately hovering service throughout our meal.

UukhDhQ4abwC-S-691Vc0g.review_text: Food was actually great. Make sure younasked for grilled vs broil. Tastes much better. Only reason why the rating wasbt higher was because they made us wait 45 minutes after our initial reservation time. But do recommend

r3Jx0cQHedSOTv_orV7PUA.review_text: Skylar the manager tonight was fantastic. She went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing experience. The key lime pie was great. We missed having it on the menu. We are glad it's back. The live music added to the already relaxing atmosphere. Nice end to a great Saturday night.

LTx_jCFYwoiXpbYXUwjqbw.review_text: This is a follow-up review to "Hillstones" (fna: Houston's). Scratch what I said about the free foccaicia bread and nuts/olives. They've caught on and now charge $4. Many of the items on the menu have SOARED in prices-- the smoked salmon used to be $14 now $19; Burger used to be $14 now $19, many other items including liquor. OMG. Hubby ordered his favoritedry  blantens manhattan with a twist $17. Yes, you read right. When you factor in 9.25% tax+ 15% tip+4% health fee= $20.76 MARTINI!!!!!!!!!!!!!That's a lot compared to many bars that charge $9-14 TOPS. $20.76! Are you friggin' kidding me...? A fifth of Blantens costs like $35-40. WOW. The head-honchos at Hillstone's are getting really greedy. I'm sorry to say that I will not be visiting Hiilstone's anymore That's too bad. I haven't seen many of our favorite restaurants raise their prices like Hillstone's has. Ohhh-nooooo :( Farewell.

zQ5ykTqamkS5lsdzhHfVfg.review_text: best steak house in town i could eat their every day lunch and dinner its that good i really recommend the ribs one of the best in town

XC1hR8oi5YT-f2i9Eb11kQ.review_text: Hillstone is always like going home for me.  It was a rainy day and there were 5 of us that wanted to go to lunch.  The staff put us in a booth by the fireplace in the back and we stayed for a couple hours.  As always the food was fantastic and the staff was a pleasure.  You can't go wrong here!

iseQkNIUjf_Qslqc0TL31w.review_text: The food is delicious and the service is excellent. The menu isn't cheap but the experience is well worth it, especially if you're lucky enough to get Marissa as your server. She was truly a delight and went above and beyond to make sure our evening was perfect...

6pNftAvuCGpkaXBgL-4QdQ.review_text: Cute restaurant across from Pier 33. Dark lighting-perfect for a romantic date in the city :) Convenient parking lot nearby.  The food here is pretty average. *Spinach artichoke dip: taste just like other spinach artichoke dip I've tried at other (less expensive) restaurant *Famous French dip sandwich: though it was good, I wouldn't give it the "famous" title *Pork ribs: the portion is impressive and looks appetizing but it was a bit dry. LOOK CAN BE DECEIVING!!  Good restaurant to try once but I wouldn't come back, there are plenty of better options in the city.

VarPmrQsBeeLZ9suKpxYug.review_text: I was so eager to try this place and hoping for the best. So many people and fellow yelpers convinced me that this was the place to have a good cut of meat, namely a great prime rib. Finally Hillstone, your number was called and when you stepped up to the plate you did come swinging but dribbled a grounder to short.  That pretty much sums it up in terms of the prime rib. It was a good mighty serving. However, it lacked taste and I'm not so sure it was the best quality meat. It came with a loaded baked potato and that was awesome but what does that say about the prime rib when I rave about the potato?   We had two appetizers...the smoked salmon and the roasted artichokes. Both were delicious and items I would have again. I know artichokes are plain and simple but too many places mess it up. Here it was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. The smoked salmon was my favorite. It was served with a tartar sauce on a crunchy toast. My wife had the bass and I'm not sure that was bass. It didn't look like bass and it certainly didn't taste like it. It was served with Brussel sprouts and almonds and when you took a bite with the almonds it was good. But I'm still not convinced it was bass. The bass is called the Loup De Mer and should just be advertised as Bronzini. To me it looked and tasted more like a slightly bigger trout. I feel Bronzini itself is completely different from the American expectation of sea bass.  My buddy had the blackened ribeye and that was tasty. I'm not sure I like the preparation though. I'm not sure that something blackened the way it was should be pre sliced. They tried to give it the seared ahi effect and I'm on the fence about it. The dessert was a walnut Apple cobbler. That was delicious and a good close to the meal. It was well balanced in taste and was generously served with walnuts.  Their wine list was decent. Lots of local offerings and I appreciate that when I'm here in my favorite city. I feel we should serve the best of local. We had a bottle of the Sangiovese and it was good. My only beef was that it was advertised as a 2010 and they gave us a 2012. We also had a bottle of the Malbec and it was probably one of the best I've had.  The waitress was friendly, attentive, and even shared a story to our table. They still have the old Houstons sign up inside. Why?  It was dark there and a little too dark for dining comfort.    Overall it wasn't a bad meal. It just didn't meet expectations. I mean HOPR is still where anyone should have prime rib. I would rank 5A5 ahead of this in terms of steakhouses. But I also wouldn't mind going back. It just wouldn't be my first choice.

J75B9VpYDzPkg4JAKBBv-A.review_text: I not one to usually give a place 5 stars but if any place deserves it that would be Hillstone. My family has been going here since before it was Hillstone & it was called Houston's. Although the name has changed the food, ambiance, service & overall experience it always wonderful. I've been here over 30+ times and have never once been disappointed.  My favorite dish is the Prime Rib French Dip but everything is good. The service is impeccable! The bar is very nice and its not cheap but not outrageously over priced like you would expect a fancy, pretty place like this would be.   Thank you Hillstone for being one of those great go-to restaurants that never fails. You're the best!

ih0Zjj8g8fXMCGJ4VJSQsw.review_text: Wait, where have I been? Where's Houston's? Oh, well...I had no complaints this place is bomb! I had a rib eye steak w/asparagus and a salad!

IV26Uq_tJfY6cBwg8bLveA.review_text: We waited to be seat, like for half an hour, having a reservation. My steak was Good, I ask for it raw, and it was RAW that normally does not happen in any place, but they did it right, it is just that it was not seasoned deliciously. Service was ok, nothing special... we had hard time finding parking around. It is a nice pretty place.

WjFNvs4RxGdKdhKndaoPIQ.review_text: The setting was pretty romantic and nice. But service wasn't that great. I am all about service.   I had ordered the Cheeseburger and I wanted it to be medium rare. I was a bit disappointed that it was overcooked. For the price I paid, I expected it to be superb. My friends also order salon and it was pretty dried.   love the setting but dislike the overcooked food.

qDhO98GPfYntjduleeS7ng.review_text: My first visit to Hillstone's last night pre-Giants game was fantastic. We sat at the bar as our dinner reservation was 20 minutes behind schedule ( disappointing), but I was pleasantly surprised at the great time we had dining at the bar. Our waiter/bartender was friendly, fast, and gave great food recommendations: the pork ribs = amazing! I never order ribs because they're so messy , but these were off the charts. So tasty and fell right off the bone. Not to mention they came with fries ( obvies) and the tastiest coleslaw I have ever had. Turns out one of the ingredients is horseradish. Who knew! We topped it off with a simple, sweet sundae and a little Olympic Opening Ceremonies. Great Friday night!

_6HoMXvfWptU8BB8-k41pw.review_text: 10/28/2009    My friends took me hear on my bday and it was good food. I appreciated the tastey steak. Cooked perfect and juicey. Every thing was very tastey! Nice place to go for a date or with professional folks. Service was uncomfortable since I felt they sized me and my friends up. They looked at us as if we were too young to drink even though we were there for dinner. Thats why I knocked them down one star. But I'd go there again for some more delish food.

8ytOAXbI_mahdzWriC_KYA.review_text: Bandera, Rutherford Grill, Hillstone.. You can't hide from me, Houston's. I WILL FIND YOU AND LOVE YOU.  The menu isn't extensive, but they do everything absolutely right. Clubby atmosphere with cozy booths, dark wood.  The servers work in such concert. I tested them by placing my empty sugar packet on the table. Six seconds later, someone I'd never seen before picked it up. Teamwork.  I've eaten at this chain (oops, did I ruin your unique unbranding strategy?) at least 50 times in DC, Scottsdale, Yountville, Sacramento, and now the City. Excellence routinized is the highest achievement, and they do it.

0H-YSQVybMYENjt5ESMlMA.review_text: I loved Hustons, but Hillstone has done a good job of keeping up my high standards.  The food is as good as ever.  I still try to get a taste of the original menu by visiting Rutherford Grill at leas once a year.  Hillstone is always a great date night!

kQ8Z_IPaRSY-g9dfxOQEvw.review_text: Wonderful food, great atmosphere and nice people. Will definitely be coming back! I love their ribs and spinach dip!

zuXnPmYNVD9tv93UaT5qAA.review_text: I have to say that this place is okay.  It's not amazing, it's not bad.  The ambience is nice, parking is easy and the food is good.  Nothing special but consistently good.  I wish the menu had some more vegetarian options for the days you are not in the mood for a steak.   I have eaten here many times and I am sure I will be back many more.   I wish I could give them 3.5 stars.

JjqDGZUwz0aCAPG8PjmFqA.review_text: This restaurant wants to turn away customers because of a hat. What's wrong with someone wanting to wear a hat to dinner. Is it that serious?!??  It's not like they are French Laundry or anything of that caliber. If you want to turn away business than so be it. There are far more better restaurants with better tasting food in the city anyways.   At least be consistent on how you treat your patrons because we have eat here a dozen times before with a hat on and now you say NO HATS all of the sudden. Tell the person who wanted to be all mighty and have power to take it to the grave. As I foresee this restaurant having but luck in the near future.

YkVBp_UVxzEwSEgwDv-kEQ.review_text: I thought this place was going to be like going to the Elephant Bar , I don't know why it reminded me of it anyways boy was I wrong. Nothing resemble chain restaurant, the service was excellent, we ordered :   Grilled Artichokes = delicious  Pork ribs = unbelievably good, truly like the menu says fall-off-the bone you can eat them without teeth.  Coleslaw and fries = fabulous as well   I'm a fan !

zst5ol5eBsx-Uz6wfKDzAA.review_text: Hands down one of the best restaurants in the USA. I've been to several of these in NYC, SF, and LA. Always consistent, always excellent service, at tables or the bar.   The most consistent dining experiences you'll ever get.  We always prefer the bar, more interaction, but it's always professional and nice.   Get the grilled artichokes, French dip, burger, salads are all great too. And don't forget your veg! Any of the sides of the day are always amazing.

_FF4cS3esjjw8uAZZMqxdQ.review_text: I've been here 4 times in the recent 30 days and have been pleased each time.  Very similar dishes to Rutherford Grille.  The Flying Tuna Platter is one of my favorites.  The Veggie Burger is also delicious.  I had the filet once and loved every bite, although petite, the quality was all there.  I'm not a big dessert guy but the Hot Fudge Sundae is fantastic and sits just right every time we order it.
