The service is good although I would suggest that each server smile more.  Sometimes the service feels robotic but that could be at the fault of the trainers or management.  Service is always good though.    I would like to see a cocktail menu as well.  They have a full bar but we've never been given a drink menu aside from the wine list (which is very good) on the back of the dinner menu.

ch7FC95tvDoCFCWsUWbYGA.review_text: The service and atmosphere was great and dinner was excellent

mwZcu42rU5dEgFwyCHZcFg.review_text: We have been huge fans of Houston's and Hillstone ever since it opened.    Love the food, love to service, enjoy the drinks, atmosphere is awesome.  Why only 4 stars?    * 7 open tables but a one-hour wait?!?    * Frustrated by unnecessary waits * Frustrated that they won't take my name on the phone for the wait list (they say because it's easier for them to manage the list). Never mind what is easier for their customers.    Used to be a five stars but lost a star due to process.

BzLUyHSJrl-lUVWw9rqlvQ.review_text: I saw this restaurant on "Check Please" and it was a Houston's and is part of the chain. On Saturday my wife and I headed out to get some brunch in the City before furniture shopping. Originally, we had set out to go to the Wild Hare to get an omelet but the wait was over 90 minutes, so we decided to give Hillstone a try since I saw a Spinach and Cheese Omelet on their menu.   We arrived and got "rock star" parking the 1st space #28 in front of the restaurant. After being seated and looking at the menu. We asked if they could change some of the ingredients of the Omelet in instead of the cheese. The server " insisted " that they could only leave out the cheese and nothing else could be substituted. So we had no choice but to order the "Spinach Omelet" along with the Thai Beef Salad, and a Hickory Burger.  Before the food came the server brought two plates with silverware. After picking up the plate I felt some left over stuck on the bottom of the plate so I checked the bottom of the other one. Both had food stuck on the bottom. "Yuck". I pointed this out to a server walking by and without a word they just exchanged the plates. humm....   The Thai Beef Salad was good except for the beef. The meat was so so salty and must have sat in the soy marinade for days. 2 stars.  The Spinach Omelet  no cheese was plain and none descript. 2 stars.   The Hickory Burger was good 4 stars.   Asked for the check, normally I only glace at the check but this time I found that they charged us for two coffees but we only had one. The server took it off. We were disappointed with the Saturday experience.

wy1cWrxa7iKbmdzVeCK0Dg.review_text: So we went in because it looked like a nice Steakhouse and I heard the Jazz music playing. We entered the bar and sat in the corner and No One even greeted us not acknowledged us.. We sat there for 15 minutes not a menu or drinks... We sat there as everyone around us was served food and beverages. At least five workers passed us and not a word.. We got tired of waiting so we left! Poor service and if no one acknowledges you why would I want to eat here or deserve my patronage. We ended up at Il Fornaio who gave us excellent service and food.! Don't waste your time at this place! If I can give a negative 0 for service I would. Highly disappointed!

l7fulhbjd-8YpHy0vOHmDA.review_text: Went there for dinner after spending the day in San Fransisco. It was a Saturday night and a full house, the wait for a table was going to be a good 45 minutes. I slipped a fifty to the hostess and we got a table right away. I ordered the baby back ribs which I ate with my fork cause the meat just fell off the bone very good.

YrgVqQKtKFcJGg5RoE8cvg.review_text: I must say I was really impressed by this place!  Across the street from Pier 33, where cruises to Alcatraz are ran, Hillstone is a perfect place to grab lunch after escaping The Rock!  A felon on the run could only dream of having it so good.  The service here really stands out, Anna, our server, was on point the entire time.  Her presentation of the day's specials was next to flawless, her presence was spot on, and she showed a genuine care that is usually lacking in the more tourist heavy areas of The City.  On top of Anna's craft, every single server would check our table as they elegantly passed by, helping clear plates, refill drinks, or running the bill while Anna was busy assisting others.  My buddy and I were so impressed we hardly realized our main courses were running long, but not the management on the floor.  A manager was quick to stop by and apologize for any delay, I must say this place is well run and should be commended for it's commitment to quality.    The food was on par with the top notch service, the Tortilla Soup served on Tuesdays and Thursdays is a real treat, and my buddy has had it everywhere so when he says it's great, it really is.  The fish was fresh and perfectly prepared in the exact way Anna explained and the salad was also delicious.  I look forward to heading back to Hillstone, it really was a perfect spot to relax after fighting tourists throughout the morning!

0qkIcZ_wl97mmeadvWS6zA.review_text: I chose Hillstone as the location for dinner the night I proposed to my fiancée. The food was excellent and the service was second to none. She had the Filet Mignon and I had Prime Rib. Both were cooked to perfection. The dessert was equally impressive. Though it's a bit on the expensive side, you get what you pay for and it is well worth it. I like to think they helped in her decision to deal with me for the rest of our lives :) We'll definitely be going back.

l6EpXbPVzNPJUHpVCfMqeA.review_text: Well, we made a reservation for 9:15 got there a little bit early(around 8:30) asked if we could be sitted they told us table wont be ready until around our reservation time. So 8 of us just stood there , had few drinks at the bar, it's 9:15 and our table is not ready yet, at 9:30 I asked for the manager she said the previous group of guest are not leaving and we can't make them leave!!!!!I was like what's the point of making a reservation then. Anyways they said there's nothing they could do. We waited another 15 min and at 9:45 we got to sit. It was a terrible experience since we had to be somewhere else afterward and had to rush the dinner. They didn't even try to make it up to us!

d8XRz-6Qy30I0F20PON7gg.review_text: My meal at Hillstone was good but not great.  There are better dining experiences at better values among top-rated restaurants in San Francisco.  The one that immediately comes to mind is Piperade - just a short walk from Hillstone but miles ahead in interesting food offerings.

52_JuusMlwlAdYLlf0q_DQ.review_text: This is a great place to eat if you are not hungry or are in any sort of hurry.  We dined on a Saturday around 1:30.  There was no lunch rush and  the place was far from crowded.  We waited 30 for our salads and another 30 for our main entrée.  Both were good and a bit over priced.  $10 for a slice of key lime pie.

UqMmCHqERc3bIzHdBG16Tw.review_text: Excellent night out with friends. The wood grilled artichokes are spectacular!

pKIaL_P__ePqmr63Vdsx4Q.review_text: Amazing! I had the ribs. Meat was falling off the bone. The side of coleslaw was delicious. Fries were eh; nothing out of the ordinary. It would had been nice if it was seasoned better.

eEy2Yc5Fg3opaPorF0lkqw.review_text: The food was amazing!  Most of my group had the ribs and they were the best I ever had!  The one person who had the roast chicken said that it was excellent as well.  We also shared the grilled artichokes and the bread appetizer and liked them both.  The biggest problem is that we were treated as if it were a casual dining restaurant but the prices are more like fine dining.  We had a reservation, the hostess seated us in a corner booth next to a family with three kids one of which would crawl out of their booth and come pound on te piano next to us.  No one stopped her.  The hostess plunked the menu down in the center of the table and walked away.  She came back with water for three of us but not all six. When the waitress came to take our order, we asked for water for the remaining three and we were provided with one glass.  After asking for water fr the third time we finally had water all around and a carafe to refill our own water with!  Success!  The family with the errant toddler left.  Livemusic started playing next to us and we had a great time after all.  Great ribs and the coleslaw was excellent.  Very light and fresh tasting.

7KnLMwVAi1DMrqHaod9jmg.review_text: I live really close to Hillstone, and I visit a few times a year. Everything about Hillstone is very pleasant, but the biggest draw for us is FREE CORKAGE. Although Hillstone is a bit on the pricy side, the free corkage more than makes up for it.   The grilled artichokes are always a great way to start a meal, and prime rib french dip is incredible. Although I'm a carnivore, I secretly enjoy the house made veggie burger, with bacon on top.  If you do get the veggie burger, it's very important top it with bacon, otherwise it'll taste like a normal veggie burger.

eg7ZVmUQSSTwuLhkdU8y5w.review_text: This is a nice, fancy place that I'm sure the locals love. But it's situated in a touristy area so you can enjoy it too. We walked from Pier 1 to 39 since the tram didn't work and when we saw this place we went right in! We were tired, hungry and thirsty so anything would have done it, but this place was great! The Sundae ice cream was to die for! No wander that this restaurant was packed at 1030pm!

FnerkhXZy1M0pgappwZ1TQ.review_text: First time experience.  HIGHLY disappointed. This has been my least favorite of places to eat in San Francisco. My girlfriend and I ate here after roaming around Embarcadero. We came here in the late afternoon, which wasn't busy. It was fairly quiet which was nice. It does look very nice on the inside. But right away we felt we were out of place. We just didn't get that good or comfortable vibe.  They have a very small menu. And for what they offer, the prices are a little on the high side. $17 for a Caesar salad with chicken added. The Caesar dressing was eggless, so it was a clear thin consistency. Very disappointed with this. I love a good Caesar dressing, and this wasn't it. The rest of the menu items didn't appeal to us and was just to high for a simple lunch. That's why we stuck to our salads.   This restaurant just wasn't for us. The service was average. Nothing spectacular.  Personally, I can't recommend this restaurant, even if it's for a special date night.  Sorry Hillstone. We wanted to like you. Just not a great first impression.

3nie2a6SfbWWv_GW0mlIdg.review_text: NO CORKAGE FEE.  and did i mention the prime rib is amazing?

eD0MZHRK5FlE73s_CCaITw.review_text: Everything on the menu is superb. The house smoked salmon is one of the best starters as well as the roasted artichokes (secret is in the sauce). I wish they would bring back their massive jumbo shrimp cocktails. Those things were ginormous!  For lunch you can't go wrong with a Hillstone Burger esp when you're craving for some good ole fashion protein (best burger in the city I might add) or a french dip.  Forgo the fries and try their braised cabbage with goat cheese, mmm mmm good. The kale salad is nice, light and filling but do go for the filet mignon if you're indeed having a power lunch.  Dinner there is a lot less casual than lunch with the sound of soft live jazz in back of the room and the best perk, NO CORKAGE FEE, like ever. Although there is not much of a mark up on the prices of the wine menu but it's nice to pull that special occasion bottle off your self and pop it here with that handsome filet.  My go to place for happy hour and the legendary three-martini-lunch.

0jkhkPGkKyJORH2-Cz8__A.review_text: Hillstone is a great place for a ladies' night out. Read  my illustrated review here: sfbay.ca/2012/05/29/hill…

tsx__TEqsP7OP5XzxFCUIg.review_text: Houston's recently renamed themselves Hillstone for reasons I can't understand, but I love love love this place regardless!  I come here at least twice a week on average and the food is consistently top notch, despite that it's a chain (I generally look down on chains).  The service is incredible - everyone who has been here knows this.   The ONE MAJOR MAJOR problem with Houston's SF is that they do not serve sushi the way they do at the Houstons' in LA.  Why, in one of the great seafood capitals of the world, they would not serve sushi is entirely beyond me.  Who wants to back me up on this?

QWHlfUKZw_NWk-HIM8QXJg.review_text: Fiance and I had dinner here on Saturday around five thirty pm. We had a reservation and were seated immediately.   Decor was dark wood and I don't know what else. It was forgettable but definitely a fancy west coast steakhouse feel. The view of the pier and the crowds was nice.  Fiancee wanted to know about the crab cakes which come with two sides. You only get two cakes and they are about average size so he asked how much would it be to add two more. The answer was that he would have to pay the entire price of the plate. What? But it's just the crab cakes, not the side dishes as well so he changed his order to something else.   We ordered two diet cokes and the rosemary foccacia and olives first. The focaccia and olives were great although since the dish was so salty we quickly ran through our first round of cokes. We then discovered that there are no free refills; their soda comes from a glass bottle brought to the table.  The bottles are only 8 ozs and so is smaller than even an ordinary can. We were also offered no water at the table until we asked ourselves. Our very kind waiter waived our second round of cokes from the bill.   I ordered the Veggie burger that came with fries. SO had BBQ Pork Ribs. He was very disappointed in the ribs. The ribs were neither hot nor cold. I would say, tepid. They had a strange aftertaste, too. The creamy coleslaw that came with them was very lovely. I should have ordered that! The fries were nice as well; they were thin and crispy and properly salted. I tried the dipping sauce with Siracha in it but didn't like it.  The Veggie burger was quite large. I couldn't finish it, although it was very hard to eat. The patty was comprised of vegetables (of course) and lentils but it fell apart very quickly. I suspect it only held together so long due to the large piece of cheese melted on top. It came with the usual trimmings. After awhile of me trying to keep my burger together long enough to eat it, it got kind of soggy and gross so I gave up on it. I did eat about 75% of it maybe.  It tasted fine but wasn't very memorable except for how hard it was to eat it.   It was a bit too early for us to eat dessert so we didn't try anything.  Also, as for price I was unhappy with it. I have no problem paying good money for good food but this place was a crap shoot.   Our waiter was great. He, as mentioned above, waived our second round of cokes, and kept up with SO's odd humor. He also was pretty knowledgeable about the menu.  If we're in town, we probably won't come back.

WW094KLqzK2B2xODKmqxAg.review_text: I absolutely LOVED Houston's!   I went with my coworkers and ate like rockstars. Everything we tried was delicious. The Spinach & Artichoke Dip was so creamy and decadent. The guacamole was just lovely with huge chunks of avocado and bits of fresh corn.  The cheese bread was also to die for. Soft bread wedges with melted cheese on top. YUM!   I had the roasted prime rib with baked potato. The plate was covered with a HUGE slab of meat that was perfectly cooked. Juicy and succulent. Wow, I never ever had meat so good. The baked potato enveloped a huge serving of butter, bacon bits, cheese, green onions, and sour cream.  It was a heart attack waiting to happen but I didn't care. I tried my coworker's barbecue pork ribs...just fell off the bone...DELICIOUS!  I thoroughly enjoyed my gimlet cocktail with mint and cucumber...refreshing! We finished the lunch with the harvest cheesecake and fudge sundae. I think the cheesecake was suppose to be pumpkin flavored but all I could taste was the orange zest (or something citrusy)...a bit disappointing. The sundae was absolutely sinful! :)  All in all, the food was absolutely delicious and our waitress was extremely attentive and sweet. I will definitely go again...for sure!

O_X7OOjwZb2a3ZkwatL30Q.review_text: My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday celebration tonight, and I have to say, I am loving this place!   To begin: we came on a weekday. I hear on weekends, they get pretty packed, so reservations are recommended for weekends! Make them early!   We were seated really quickly when we got there. Maybe it was because it was a weekday. Either way, we actually arrived an hour later than our reservation and didn't mention that we made one.  Their setting was nice. Dim lighting, candle light, and interesting lights. It was a very nice interior design.  Our waitress was extremely nice and enthusiastic. She just had an aura of happiness around her. (I think her name was Nicole Anne.) So, good job on service! She was very excited that it was my birthday celebration! (:  I went for the Rib-Eye steak while my boyfriend went for the a salmon dish. It didn't take them long to take it out. It was delicious! When I order steak, I'm always worried that they will over cook it or under cook it. They did a good job cooking at medium rare.   My boyfriend also ordered a brownie a la mode, and it is delicious. Just order it regardless of occasion. It's delicious. The brownie just melts in your mouth ....   Overall, great experience and great food. Wonderful services! And the place just looks amazing!

5axLA9GqQ5I7oogL9qT94A.review_text: This is my friend's favorite steakhouse, so we end up here on special occasions. I really like the food - I'm just not into spending that much all the time! Hillstone has great ribeyes, prime rib, french dip, and even burgers! Every meal I've had here was great, so I can't complain. The staff is exceptionally friendly and knowledgeable and they let you have a grand old time!  Another great thing is no corkage fee for the first bottle or two, depending on your party size. Sweet.  I like that you can see into the kitchen, and I heard if you stand there, eventually they will give you some fries. Haven't confirmed because they ended up seating us pretty quick.  For a great steak you don't have to pay a hundred for, I recommend it.

BIdFgt_4owlS1VUcTuZ4fA.review_text: Perfection!  We ate dinner here last night and were pleasantly surprised with everything from beginning to end.  We had a 5:15 reservation but arrived 30 minutes early.  We were asked if we'd like to be seated early and of course we said "yes" because we were quite hungry.    I loved the ambience and service.  We started off with the artichoke appetizer.  OMG, were they over the top delicious!  They served them halved (3 halves) and grilled with amazing flavor all the way through.  They must have used a special oil on them like truffle mabye?  And the dip that came with it was a perfect pairing of flavor.  I was literally licking my fingers and didn't care if anyone saw me!  I think we even moaned a bit during this heavenly experience.  Dale had the prime rib with baked potato.  He said it was about as good as House of Prime Rib.  I had the Thai Steak Salad.  It was seriously the most delicious combination of fresh ingredients.  I can't say enough about how much I loved this salad and it had noodles in it too but not too much.  The pieces of steak were good size and super tender like filet mignon.    They don't serve complimentary bread but that was fine because I usually eat too much and am full before the food arrives.   I took half of my salad home to make room for dessert.  It was a warm apple walnut cobbler with vanilla ice cream on top.   Yet again, super delcious and super sweet.  I put some of the ice cream and sauce in my coffee and I think I could market that stuff!  The restaurant is clean, romantically lit and pretty darn busy.  Now I know why.  You can see it from Embarcadero Street and we parked on Montgomery in the street.  There is a parking garage nearby too.  And one more thing.  I ate the rest of my salad when we got home and it tasted even better.  The mango had soaked up the dressing and so did the noodles.  I'm hoping to go back once more before the diet starts!

GVl1aL9Qjx4cGrGHQY1JtA.review_text: Living just down the street from this place- Houston's is the Best.  A TRULY GREAT EXPERIENCE.  Great Service-Food-Atmosphere and Yes!!! No corkage fees. Bring your home made wine and enjoy a really great night.   Feel good about spending your hard earned money here.  The food is much better that the photo's look,.

4D813f4CjDGyuazqVWKkXg.review_text: My office is right next to Hillstone so I occasionally go there for lunch.  It is really a Houston's but because of San Francisco's rules for chain restaurants, they changed their name.  Food is always high quality and service is excellent.  I get the Ahi Tuna Salad almost everytime.  It is so good with the mango and avacado.  Prices are a little high but the quality is definitely reflected.  Last Friday I went with two co-workers for lunch.  The food was definitely taking a very long time and I assume our orders were never put in.  We were deep in conversation though so we did not make a big deal of it.  At a certain point someone other than our waitress came out to apologize and tell us our food would be out shortly.  I appreciate the gesture. Food eventually came and it was great as always. When we finished we asked for the check and they said that lunch was on them today!  Wow!  The wait was definitely long, but we never complained and they still comped our entire lunch for three people.  That is a sign of a resaturant that knows service.  I know I will always be taken care of at Hillstone and will definitely be back despite the prices being a bit on the high end for lunch.  Also, they have a great patio for lunch or post work cocktails and apps on a nice day.

pkehgEEBJa4i6EAKT1rJmw.review_text: My husband and I make the 40 minute drive to Hillstone for dinner every time we get a chance. The staff is awesome, and the veggie platter is to die for - I get it as an entree but it works as a starter. My husband is an avid meat eater and even he approves (we had to start ordering an extra one or he'd eat all of mine. :-)). We bring our toddlers occasionally for lunch, and get a veggie platter for them to share.My husband loves the pork chop too.

ew9IiI39GyH2vGyVhKSqaw.review_text: Just came back from Hillstone. Great selection, great food, great service, great ambiance. If I had to select a go-to place for dinner, this would definitely make the cut. Although expensive, but it is totally worth it for special occasions. Special mentions : 1)The lighting. I don't really know what it is, but the lighting kind of makes you focus on your own table and food. It is very subtle and relaxing. 2) Live music on weekdays, great ! 3) Food was served quick, and I really appreciate that since I was starving 4) Wine on tap, amazing 5) THE HOT FUDGE SUNDAE.. I could drink the fudge all day nom nom nom Will definitely visit again.

qoGi6_Yya5PUEZu7gcGbwg.review_text: One of the best Prime Rib Dip sandwiches ive ever had. Quite crowded at lunchtime which is always a good indicator of the food quality. Food came out quickly, staff was great. New lunch spot for when i have out of town guests.

zO9Z4y6JbyiMYDplbmUc8Q.review_text: This place was a nice mix foodie yet casual dining with some nice background music and excellent food not to mention no corkage free, that's right you heard me right.  We had some sort of cheese bread appetizer which was fine, just a way to sate our appetites and then had the crab cakes, ribs and steak.  The crab cakes were amazing!!! It was all crab meat, no fillers of any kind, just chunks of amazingness.  The ribs were to die for, next time that's what I will be ordering and the steak was great too.  I have to say the fries were just OK and probably worth substituting, they just lacked the crunch and golden tone.    We didn't make it to dessert because we were full.  I think this is a great place to go to with friends, a date or just sit at the bar and have a meal.   It was a bit noisy but I just expect that when a place is full of happy, satisfied customers.

-0RDFB1MfYbET0cj0Ksa5w.review_text: I'm going to keep this short and sweet, as there's not much to add to all the positive reviews. Have dined here at least a half-dozen times this year and this is truly a 5-star establishment. Consistently, every time.  Ambience: 5/5 - cool & classy, yet inviting. Great live jazz band! Service & attention to detail: 5/5 - absolutely exceeded expectations. Wine selection & bar/drinks: 5/5 - no corkage fee, are you kidding me?!? Food: 5/5 - outstanding, frequently near-orgasmic! Overall: 5/5 - to quote our ex-Governator, "I'll be back"!  BEST in TOWN: --------------------- rib-eye steak grilled artichokes hamburger/cheeseburger thai noodle salad veggie burger french fries tuna burger

iAT6Ah-N7QWd6XbafVYSsQ.review_text: First time here this past weekend and it certainly won't be my last. We were staying at the Hyaytt Embarcadero so through a recommendation, we decided to check this place out. We were certainly not disappointed. I liked that this restaurant was casual but yet classy at the same time with an open kitchen area which I can always appreciate. We were lucky to find a place to sit in the bar area at a table next to the bar (far right side at you are facing the door to the front entrance of the restaurant). Excellent bar seating location to have an intimate dinner. Our server was Allison, she was wonderful! The other servers that also assisted us in the bar area were also very helpful. The complimentary live jazz music was a nice touch.   OK, now to the food. We ordered the following: Nice little house salad, 14 oz. roasted prime rib (end-cut/medium) w/ a large baked potato, flying tuna platter that came along with a amazing mixed greens that included: avocado, mango, and a light but perfect vinaigrette, and last but certainly not least, a five nut brownie with french vanilla ice-cream which came sprinkled with what tasted like espresso shavings? Everything we ordered was simply perfect!   One note, this place was busy throughout the entire evening which is another sign of a good restaurant but I can imagine that getting a reservation may be tough, especially during the evening on a weekend but if you can get seat in the bar area, you are set. The location was ideal, service and food was excellent, and the prices were very reasonable for what you may be paying for at a restaurant along The Embarcadero. I can't wait to go back to Hillstone! One more thing, no corkage fee. Score! We were able to enjoy a Sonoma Viansa Winery 2011 Primitivo that went along perfectly with our dinner. Did I mention, I can't wait to go back to this restaurant??? lol

NPRyDEG1D2taLdbdXhrNlA.review_text: Hillstone is in a great location has a nice bar and a real cozy feel to it. I would give it the highest rating if the prices were more reasonable.  I am probably in the minority but, to my mind, the restaurant is unnecessarily expensive.   The Bar  The bartenders are pleasant and observant and the wine list exhaustive; however, there is no happy hour and the cheapest wine that I could find was $9.00 a glass. Listen, there are many Bay Area restaurants and most of us appreciate finding a good deal: you will not find any here. Maybe I am cheap but come on now, can't you include a $7 a glass wine or two on the bar menu?  Two glasses of Alois Lageder Pinot Grigio was $22.13 after tax which is just plain ridiculous for average white wine.  Dinner  Our server, Brian, was terrific. He was really attentive, had a great sense of humor and great recommendations.  His helpers were not so attentive, especially when they bought four plates of food simultaneously and I was only half way through my salad. This made for a very crowded table.    I would recommend the "Nice Little House Salad." It was exceptional and a real bargain at $8.00. Unfortunately, this is the only bargain on the menu.  The cheeseburger was excellent as were the pork ribs and salmon. There is no arguing the quality of the food. They have well above average food, but $31 for ribs and $29 for salmon is ridiculous. We asked for bread and were told "there is bread on the menu," which is "restaurant speak" for we have no free bread. Again, come on now, would it hurt to provide some bread, a few olives and oil free of charge? For desert the "Warm Five-Nut Brownie"  is a bargain at $8.00 as is the Apple Walnut Cobbler so at least the evening ended on a sweet note.   In sum, Hillstone is billed as a unique collection of upscale boutique restaurants. I cannot argue with that. I can tell you that they are overpriced by about $5.00 per entrée which is entirely too much considering the fact that the restaurant is situated near restaurants having food of similar quality that are substantially cheaper. I go to Hillstone once a year to satisfy one of the people in out "restaurant hopping group." Frankly, I would never select this restaurant. I left full but I felt I had been cheated.

Qr0SLQMwdEBVDnYXft97qg.review_text: Overall an excellent chain restaurant. I have now been to four different houstons and the food quality and atmosphere is always above average. Smoked salmon appetizer is the fish pick. It's like salmon butter, it just melts in your mouth.  The prime rib is excellent, it is a nice sized portion and it has always been cooked perfectly each time I have ordered it.  The filet has been well cooked two out of the three times I have tried it. On one occasion it was charred on the outside and raw on the inside, but besides that experience; it is solid.  The Hawaiian ribeye just does not agree with my taste buds.  Maybe I am old fashioned but there is no reason in my world to make a steak sweet.  The pastrami sandwich is just a disappointment, fatty and not too much flavor to me.  The sides  The only complaint about the wilted spinach is that they do not give you enough of it. Nice texture with a pleasant yet not overbearing saltiness from the parmesan cheese: its wilted bliss. The mashed potatoes are excellent, using the green onion to give it texture and a nice taste is simply genius. The French fries are nothing to write home about. As you can see by the many times I have been there I recommend this restaurant to anyone, it has a nice atmosphere and excellent staff. Combine that with the consistent food and it is a great pick for any night out.  The fish has spoken.

PEkp7T-uOgUq5AIQ5obt2A.review_text: I don't know why, but Houston's always give me the 1940s men's club feel. It's decorated in warm hues with rich leather covered booths and dark stained wood tables. The only things missing are cigars and stockbrokers.   The servers wear crisp uniforms and long aprons. The menu asks you to politely turn off your cell phone while dining. The tables are set up for good noise reduction. The kitchen is exposed, giving more of a homey feel.  The food is delicious and worth the drive into the city JUST for the hot spinach and artichoke dip.   I know it's a chain restaurant and this fact alone might turn many people off. But just go to the bar, have a drink and an appetizer one night and see what you think.  It has been one of my favorite restaurants for over 10 years!!

SgMWIp_1SkQxXtliWcWSwQ.review_text: Food, decor and service is all good. My favorite chain no matter what concept. SF last night, Irvine location Friday night and Denver location next Tuesday. Have visited several of their locations and always great. Wish they would open a location on Las Vegas

a923ofqpLwcfneeNeNTJ4g.review_text: Hillstone has terrific service at each location I've been to. While I enjoyed my experience at this location, I've also been to the Midtown East location in NYC, and quality was the same there. This brings up a good point - Hillstone is definitely a chain, yet they make it feel like a bit more of a local experience in each of their locations. Service is capable without being overwhelming.  To eat we had:  Oak Grilled Artichokes - These were simple yet a nice way to start. I didn't dip mine in the remoulade, as I don't prefer very creamy sauces/dips, but the artichoke itself was nice. It was a fun change to get a whole artichoke, rather than a puny piece of one. Note that if you don't dip it in the remoulade, ask for a lemon to give the artichoke itself a bit more flavor. $14 was a bit steep for three artichokes, though not outrageous.  House-Made Veggie Burger - My boyfriend and I both got this and loved it! Again, this I've had in both locations, and each time it was fantastic! They are gigantic. I get mine with no cheese (again, try to avoid a fair amount of dairy), but the sweet soy glaze adds a nice flavor profile to the dish. Each bite has a punch of flavor - this was quite zesty with the perfect sweet and saltier mix. The burger itself is made with beets and some type of grain and I believe prunes - fabulous texture. This is no wimpy box-like veggie burger, but a truly unique burger that you can tell they put thought into designing. I eat it without the bun, as it's still massive and filling this way. Next time I may ask to get it wrapped in lettuce to make it a bit easier to eat, but I used a knife and fork. It may also be good to split it into two right when you get it and bring the other half home for lunch the next day. As the flavors sit, it may taste even better!  As a side, you have a choice between tabbouleh, hand cut fries or coleslaw - I went with the tabbouleh. While it wasn't anything you'd find at a more traditional Lebanese restaurant, it was refreshing with a nice mélange of vegetables and grain. The ratio between the two was nice - however, be warned that this is also a generous serving (save some room for dessert)!  Dessert - This isn't listed on the menu, but they keep it simple with two dessert options, an ice cream sundae and a brownie sundae. We went with the brownie sundae - not a huge brownie but a very good size to share between two or three people. The full top of the brownie is studded with walnuts and a delicious chocolate sauce. It really feels decadent and chocolatey - and I'm a huge chocolate fan, so I loved this! It was topped with a classic scoop of vanilla, which is always a nice mix with the dense chocolate flavors.  Overall, a fantastic meal! Worth it to make a reservation, as it can get a bit crowded. Nice outdoor seating area as well if the weather is good.

ZObHXI05ILUFpDo_m7DjzQ.review_text: Best rib eye steak I've ever had, hands down!  We've come here a few times over the past summer and have never been unsatisfied. The service is excellent! We were seated promptly, even when showing up early to our reservation. They have a respectable selection of wines and beers. Everything from the crisp salad and home made dressings to the sauteed vegetables were delicious. I've only had the rib eye steak (medium of course) for my main course when I've come here, but oh man is it good. And the brownie......aaahhhhh. The ambiance is comfy and inviting, especially on a cold day!  They Usually have live jazz piano and bass going in the evening. Reading some of the other posts it looks like  I need to try their Ruben.    But every place has their downside. When I ordered a beer, the glass they brought it in was only slightly chilled. HA! But if you can get past that, this top quality establishment will never disappoint.   We will be returning soon. Perhaps this weekend!

XkYE04GqIqibnQ2XE4qy2g.review_text: Probably the best chain restaurant I've been to.    I looove the cozy red booth seats and the different browns and polished wood tones of the restaurant.  French Dip sandwich and Pork Chop were both deeelicious!!  5 nut brownie drizzled with caramel was a good finish too.  Oh and good beer selection.  Seriously, everything was so good!  Service was nice too!  5 stars for food and ambiance, -1 for priciness

WRdXMEGqq1YzmjmwSJ-T-w.review_text: I can't believe they changed the name.  I still like this place, but I'm always going to call it Houston's.  Hillstone sounds like the name of a suburban subdivision.

_zkty5EuqtAEe5n1O8CHCQ.review_text: Rutherford its not (their sister place in napa) the food is pretty good but i got so screwed on the service.  took my boss and a couple of clients to this place for lunch. had a reservation for 12:30. waited almost 30min. i mean it was for lunch what were they thinking?  when we finally got a seat it was a both made for tops 5 and they crammed 6 of us in there. two of the guys asses were hanging off the edge of the booth.  needless to say i made a bad impression on everyone, especially me since i booked it.  it could not have been at worse time for me.

pUaF1gU5qkS1R6IzPtSxgg.review_text: It took a while for someone to help us when we got there (and it was a group of 6), but after that everything worked smoothly.   Our server was super friendly and we didn't wait much to get our food.   I got the Barbecue Pork Ribs and loved it. Ribs, coleslaw and french fries were cooked to perfection and really tasty, totally worth it.

4A3VNtFI71leVjWiyL4M4Q.review_text: First reason to come here for ...Hot Fudge Sundae!  The leather booths, service, food are the other reasons to come. Pretend to eat and enjoy the food while in the back of your mind you are telling yourself to save room for the sinful treat .. happy ending? Much better than the real thing.

zf8U3kpTdBbDHbK6hDuq-A.review_text: Great service! So nice & cheerful. They seem genuinely glad you are here. House salad dressing was delicious. The food is really good here too!

Q_TFz4TsVj_Qgb1akllpVQ.review_text: I still can't get used to calling this place Hillstone.  To me it will always be Houstons.  I was introduced to Houstons/Hillstone in NYC.  I used to go to the 53rd st location all of the time, they didn't take reservations and you just had to wait to get seated.  The SF version, has the same great food as the NYC version.  Good burgers, ribs, salads.  Nice selection of wine and other beverages. Prices are higher then a conventional diner but so is the quality.  It's in a good location (for me) right on embarcadero, very easy to walk to.  The place does get it's fair amount of tourists, office workers and 30 to 40 something marina types.  It's still worth while though for meeting up with family/friends and having a good meal.  Just be prepared to to pony up the $$$ for your delicious meal!

w-4nQ-PHW_U8CCR0S1jT_w.review_text: Definitely not haute cuisine but I'm always happy when I leave.  The portions are huge and I like sitting on the patio outside under the heat lamps so it's not so crowded or loud.  I always order the prime rib (the steak is bigger than my head probably), and when I'm with a group it's inevitable that the artichoke spinach dip gets ordered (very tasty, very filling though).  From my eating compatriots it seems that the fish is usually quite tasty too.

-0QDoF5BvMMvdLDyeuS2aQ.review_text: When my parents come to town, Hillstone, which use to be called Houston's, is always on the top of their list of places to go.  The parent company changed the name, but it's the same great menu and service.    The location is great along the Embarcadero and the ambiance is warm.  You have to try the ribs. They are fantastic.  They fall right off the bone and their is plenty of meat.  The best part is no corkage fee! Bring a bottle of your favorite CA wine and save some money.

yCV0FiobvSbX-bzjd3G77w.review_text: Houston's is like the nice guy in your life that is always there for you, the reliable, sweet "best friend" that you don't want to "ruin the friendship," with. You just can't commit to him so you go out exploring other guys but in the end, you always come running back to him.  Houston's is my safe choice. My typical meal here is the grilled artichoke, the artichoke dip ( which is one of the best I've ever had), and the filet. Surprisingly, they do their steak much better than a lot of fancier places out there. In fact, its phenomenol! Its tender , favorful, and always cooked to perfection.   The fries are also wonderful, and yes its true, if you stand near the kitchen, the cooks will just give you a plate of them. The service is always good and you can get a table relatively fast without reservations. On a nice day, they have outdoor seating, its nice to be able to sit out side and soak up the sun.  I spend so much time trying to hit all the hot spots and try all the other resturaunts that I always forget that Houston's is there for me. I've had so many bad steaks at other steakhouses and forget that I can get an awesome steak at Houstons!  The pricing is good compared to all the fancy places out there and the food is yummy and consistent. The portions are also big so you never leave still hungry.

TXginX5AqsLPhC0--NKVGQ.review_text: Let me preface this by saying that at at least four other Houston's restaurants in the country I have had great experiences. For me a city like San Francisco has such higher standards for restaurants that this place was a total disappointment to what else is out there in the city.  My complains:  1) Our bread came without anything (butter, olive oil, etc) and the waitstaff had to be asked to bring it to us. 2) My waitress didn't know the price of the specials 3) My friend asked for coleslaw on his baked potato instead of sour cream, butter, etc and the waitress said she could probably do that (he is English). Then she went and talked to the kitchen and they said they had to charge him for a full side order. In my opinion when you make an offer to a patron it should stick; the restaurant needs to eat that cost. 4) The fillet minion came out cold and had to be sent back. When it was sent back the manager dropped off the replacement steak with a pissed off attitude. IT WAS STILL JUST WARM! Sent it back again and this third steak was still just warm!  On top of all of these problems, and clear fact that  the waitress knew we were unhappy, there was NO apology nor adjustment to our bill.  This is not the way to encourage repeat business. This restuarant is obviously not service oriented, but rather run like a typical fast-food chain in trying to increase turnover and keep filling tables with tourists.  I will NOT be back again.  UPDATE: I did also fax a letter to Houston's general manager and they got back to me pretty quickly with an apology and asked me for the chance to prove themselves again. I went in, had a much better experience but I still felt rushed.   It was a bit odd that the waiter brought out the check as he brought desert. I told him to take it back until we are done eating, but what else could I expect? They stil have some work to do in my opinion at getting service staff trained to the point of providing the right service for the dollar.

1dW1kLdcKuQprnhi4pC_iQ.review_text: I really like Hillstone, I've been dining at this place for several yrs (Houston's prior). The service is so consistent and great. There Kale salad w/ Peanut dressing in to die for. I'm also a big fan of the homemade veggie burger w/ house made bun. No corkage fee on 1st Btl is awesome.  (- 1/2 star) I really wish you guys would start taking takeout orders over the phone (cut down on wait time). (- 1/2 star) your quick tip guide, %'s SHOULD be based off the subtotal NOT the balance due.

LdeBWbqDA3cCTFkcyUJFyw.review_text: I don't like eating in SF because i feel like the price simply doesn't match the food compared to what u can get from Berkeley or Oakland. Hillstone is one of those exceptions. I've been here several times and each time they provide excellent service without even a hiccup.   every time i've been here it has been consistent. the smoked salmon is the thing to have. hawaiian steak is interesting. center cut filet is always great. fries are crispy. caesar salad is amazing, and they have a vast wine selection. i know a caesar salad is weird to mention but it really is that good that i have to mention it.   overall this is the place i go for great food and great service. this is one of those restaurants i take ppl to impress them with service and food.

n3yuhFrDhXjW7c3xud7lnQ.review_text: Although I'm not a big fan of restaurant chains, this one turned out pretty well considering.  The menu was kinda boring, but the things they did have were done well at least.  I had a blue-nose seabass special with grilled artichoke, which was excellent.  My boyfriend had the french dip, which was also damn tasty.  two other friends both had salads and i was laughing at them inside for paying $16 for a freakin salad...and nothing special either.    SO, in other words, the food was good, the service almost too good (you know, the type who can answer every question you have with the most detail possible, kinda like a machine) it was slightly awkward.  The interior was very comfy with a jazz band playing and fireplaces burning.    My only real issues i guess were the high prices of a boring menu with non-adventurous standard American fare.  Worth a try, but as some other posts have indicated, take advantage of the no-corkage fees and you'll save quite a bit ($11-14 per drink avg can add up quick!).

kuRZJ2Xa6JDPVVXdlt6DJA.review_text: Ummm Houston's? Whatever their reason for the name change, at least the menu didn't. I miss the French dip sandwich..they changed their bread though...was definitely better before.

nwy823_MQYnnV8rPQ-VFhA.review_text: looks good 1 star for that or else service food is poor.

TN80OluTQXjOfk7ug71-1g.review_text: Sometimes I wake up and the first thing that pops into my mind is a little voice that says, "Treat Yo' Self!" Well, one day I woke up to a crack of sunlight hitting my face and that little voice telling me to do something special. So I did. I Yelped for the top steakhouses in San Francisco and got a reservation for two at Hillstone...or is it Houston's? I'll discuss that later.   *Sidenote* A trend I have noticed amoung restaurants is that it seems that the nicer and more expensive a restaurant is, the small and shorter their menu becomes. Compare the novella that is an IHOP or Cheesecake Factory menu to Hillstone's and it feels like you're reading off a cocktail napkin. That being said, simpler menus do allow the chefs to specialize and do those select dishes very well versus the general "meh"ness expected of your neighborhood 24 Hour Pancake House. *End Sidenote*  In the spirit of "Treat Yo' Self", I decided to splurge during my July 4th dinner date by ordering the Emerald Kale Salad and the Hawaiian Ribeye. The kale salad was easily one of the best I have enjoyed. The kale was crisp and not waxy and shredded finely enough that it was easy to eat and not at all tough. The peanut dressing was also very nice. The small chunks of peanuts added a nice textural crunch which contrasted with the crisp and light kale. My boyfriend got the clam chowder with bacon and croutons, that night's featured soup, for an appetizer. He enjoyed it but it didn't blow his mind. When our main courses rolled out, I was greeted with a beautiful, dark mahogany, and grilled marked ribeye and the smell of soy, garlic, adn pineapple. My mouth immediately began to water and I dug in. FIrst and foremost, my steak came out exactly as I ordered - medium rare. It may seem odd to be happy about this, but I have been to restaurants costing upwards of $100 per person who still don't cook steaks properly to order. As for the dish, the steak was tender, supremely juicy and well rested, and the glaze, while salty, was simply addictive. I used the crisp, thin fries to sop up as much of the sauce as possible. My BF ordered the Flying Tuna Platter, which despite being kind of a misnomer (The Tuna obviously never sprouted wings and flew off his plate), was met positively. Definitely a lighter dish, seared cubes of tune are served with a nice salad with mango and massive whole tomatoes. We aren't talking cherry or grape tomatoes, but whole tomatoes bigger than golf balls. Odd.  While we were both quite full with our meals, the spirit of "Treat Yo' Self" urged us to at least give the dessert menu a peek...if there was one. The dessert menu, like the regular menu, is quite tiny. So small, in fact, that it does not even exist. Instead, your server will tell you the three or so available that night. Slightly disappointing honestly. Fortunately, this does provide a convenient segue into the service at Hillstone. Our server was definitely new and it showed. He did not check in on our table very often and food delivery was slow at times but when we was there, he did his best to tell us as much as he knew which is always appreciated, Moving on to the space, the restaurant does not look very impressive from the outside. It's low, semi hidden, and pretty anonymous. Inside, however, the space is quite warm and cozy feeling. Thanks to those low ceilings, the use of dark woods, and a live jazz band, I would venture to call it "intimate" but not quite "romantic." It can become a litte loud as crowds and the wait area begin to grow and fill up. The only odd thing about the space is the red, lit-up "Houston's" sign above one of the doors, harkening back to the restaurant's old identity before it's rebranding. Curious they still had not removed it. Finally, we come to value. My salad, steak, and a drink rang up to about $70 after tax and tip. It's a pretty penny for sure, but it was overall a delicious meal.  If you're near Fisherman's Wharf and are looking for something a bit more intimate and away from the tourist bustle, call in a reservation and make the few block trek down Embarcadero to HIllstone. It isn't cheap, but you can avoid the crowds and enjoy some great food. Hey, go ahead and Treat Yo' Self. You deserve it.

0-bRRbJt-D1ShtXN6RjLfg.review_text: We had dinner at Hillstone's Sunday evening and had a great time.  We were seated by the 3 piece combo band and I was concerned that we would not be able to talk but the sound level was great and the live music was a very nice 'add' to our evening. We all started with a cocktail.  I ordered a Kentucky Mule and it was the best I have ever had, perfectly prepared!  We then ordered starters of Grilled Artichokes and also the Spinach Dip-both really good.  Some in our group ordered the French Dip, others the Ribs and I had the Veggie Burger.  We all really enjoyed our meals. We finished with the 5- Nut Brownie, also very enjoyable.   Our server was Jane and she was 'spot on' in her attention to detail and overall professional service.  It was a really fun evening.  Can't wait to go back!

iBCJRT-WhAz9IB3eM9UvGA.review_text: Sadly, the food eclipses the service. One tip to management is to step up "training". We had a secured reservation for two tables=14 persons. We checked-in at 7:15pm for a 7:30pm reservation, only to finally avoid an altercation with diners that refused to leave their table after occupying the table for over 2 1/2 hours. Our party finally sat at 8:45pm. The diners refused to leave telling the manager that he spent $600 on dinner for his family of 8 persons and had the right to sit there all night if he chooses. He then threatened the restaurant manager as well as the waiting diners. Dear god..."The Bridge & Tunnel Crowd" has arrived to the Bay Area. There is a way to handle these situations and the restaurant management was totally unprepared to handle thus situation. I noted that there was another party waiting in the bar and finally sat down almost 11/2 after their confirmed reservation time. It looks like an unacceptable trend here. I will avoid this restaurant in the future since management staff is very inexperienced in handling these situations. All & all a bad ending to a holiday celebration with friends and family.

jgwO4-EXZLcAgNSqNIzAlQ.review_text: Used to be called Houstons's lol. I have been wanting to come here since the early 2000's.. Seeing that I just live a block away I shoulda been on it.. My favorite part about this experience was that everyone from the managers, waiters/waitress, host/hostess, seats you, greet you, assist you, check on you.. this gives you a very warm feeling and plus it was game 5 of the NLCS championship series. My lady had prime rib and I had a burger.. I would give this a 5 star but the menu needs more variety for their pricing.. Seriously the wine list was way longer than the menu list.. Other than that its a place worth checking out

jgtHDLB5JSmwV5PX5ml_Tw.review_text: I was here again on Monday, the Memorial day. The smoke salmon was good as usual. However, I don't think it's a good idea to go out dining in a holiday weekend, because it felt like the real servers or maybe even the chef were taking a holiday off, too. Two out of three main entree were too salty. Service was not as good as usual. We 4 people were seated at a relatively small table while there are sill a lot of empty tables around. When we just started trying to taste the starters, all the entrees were already there. So foods were allover the small table and we couldn't  even move. And "she" keep asking if we were finished a plate or still working on it. It made me feel like they were trying to take off early while there were still new customers coming in... It embarrassed me badly because I was the one who suggested to go there.

DVIJhWm4o6HPFuwr3dwAbg.review_text: Here is a secret.  Hillstone is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  Here's the confession.  I often forget about it.  In a city where chain and franchised restaurants are frowned upon, Hillstone is one of the rare exceptions that deserves a native's visit.  Previously Houston's, Hillstone is a great choice for almost any occasion.  Going on that first date?  Hillstone's atmosphere, dim lighting, and live music (jazz or piano) is great for a romantic first get to know ya.  Going on a power lunch?  Great for that as well.  Catching up with a friend and want to grab a drink?  The bar is solid too.  I've gone to HIllstone on numerous occasions for numerous events.  I've never had a bad meal there.  My personal favorites include the Prime Rib and loaded baked potato or the French Dip, which is amazing.  I usually kick a meal off with the spinach artichoke dip which I highly recommend.  But even when I've strayed from the regulars, I've always enjoyed my fare.    Hillstone may be a franchise (they also own the Bandera restaurants as well as The Rutherford Grill in wine country) but it's worth a visit.  It really is one of my favorite restaurants in the city, even if I'm embarrassed to admit it sometimes because it's not unique to SF.  However, once I nestle down to eat, I tend not to care at all.  Oh, and free corkage.  A huge plus if you don't feel like splurging on their wine list.  The wait staff is always friendly.  Honestly, this place doesn't fail me on any level.  Definite 5 out of 5 stars.

UKsBKla6IjgOeKe_UC5Dbg.review_text: Great, Food, Bar, Servers, Hosts, and obviously the management is doing everything right. Its a chain, but it feels like a one of a kind in this location (some of the best outdoor seating in SF). One word: Swanky. I'm here about 4x a year, but hoping to change that stat....   Good Stuffs include:  - Spinach & Chicken Waldorf Salad - Double-Cut Pork Chop - Jumbo lump Crab Cakes - Cheeseburger  Only complaints: the service is a little inconsistent at times, and it can be very hard to get a table.   Either way... Enjoy.

j1sdqObsPXTIaBe9IRXolg.review_text: Wow, another place where I have to leave a negative review without ever tasting the food!  This time, they .. or really, I.. never got past a phone call.  I called to make a reservation for 5 adults and ... (before I could add two kids ...)  Houston's: We don't take reservations for parties of 5 plus.... sorry .. bye.  Sounds like Houston's doesn't need my business which is fine by me but wow -- Houston's you guys lost out we are big spenders when we have a birthday dinner party!  At least at Pazzia I sat down for 10 minutes.

MzXptQNd-juH4yi3GUhuHg.review_text: I love this place the chicken and Couscous is the best!!! The service is alway on point and the drinks always do the trick!!! I cant say anything bad about this place, everytime I take a date here they are always impressed. I LOVE IT!!!!

JSwDJCRltTElCvAGDZ9bNA.review_text: I heard about this restaurant on "Check Please" local PBS food review show and wanted to give it a try.  I do not like/patron chain food restaurants but from the show it sounded like they understand that SF diners demand quality therefore they have to compete.  We gave them a try last night (Sat.).  At 6 p.m. we walked into a very busy scene.  We put our names in for a table and was told 35 min. or so.  and we went to the bar for a drink.  Almost all seats were taken at the bar so we had to sit at a tiny tiny high table top next to the window.  I wasn't sure if the bar staff would come over to ask for our order, but one of them did within 10 min.  We ordered 2 tap beers....very disappointing to get a 16 oz. stem beer glass with 12 oz. of IPA to pay 7.00 for that beer.  We know the mark-up is high...but for 3.00 more we could have bought the 6 pack.  Tip...don't blatantly rip off your drinking patrons.  We were taken to our table within 20 min. so that was very pleasing!  Nice table, the room layout is very elegant and w/ nice partisans (love booth seats...nice too when it is a two top booth).    We ordered the grilled artichoke appetizer (heard it is the best!).  Oh my GOD!  It is the best artichoke I've ever had!  1 1/2 pieces (would have enjoyed 2 artichokes split for 2 people...at 14.00 that would seem a more fair price).  Grilled to perfection w/ a lovely herb and salted exterior w/ nice charred flavor.  The dipping sauce....YUM!  The menu is a bit eclectic American fare food.  They omit the side items that come w/ the entrees on some things (like the Arctic Char which comes w/ herb mashed potatoes but it isn't stated in the listing).  My partner did not know his meal came with a carb so I ordered a side of fries mostly for him.  I really wanted some seafood but the only choices were shrimp or trout or Char which wasn't what I craved.    I ended up choosing a Caesar salad to go w/ the fries. When the salad was delivered there was no offer of fresh ground pepper...but I found the pepper grinder on our table. The salad was just so so.  The dressing just didn't have a zesty flavor.  The oil (eggless) dressing had a muted flavor (not lemony or much hint of anchovy).  About 6 croutons w/ somewhat flavorless shaved but plentiful Reggiano cheese and lots of greens but a mix of baby kale w/ dark romaine lettuce.  I'm not real fond of kale...so it might have been good to know what the salad was made of.  The fries...plentiful shoestring fries, not too salty and not oily.  They were ok.  I just wasn't "wow'ed" by them.    My partner's Arctic Char was very good.  Nice size fish filet w/ yummy herb butter sauce on top.  Side of broccoli and very yummy herb mashed potatoes.    We shared a dessert a hot fudge Sunday.  This was very good.  It was really too much for one person.  I wish restaurants would offer two sizes of dessert so you don't have to get gigantic portions.  Ice cream was very good quality....not too creamy/thick...real whipped cream, the chocolate sauce was nice quality (not sickly sweet..lots of cocoa flavor) and bits of roasted pecans w/ some kind of light sweet crust on it.  This was my second favorite item of the whole meal.  Service....ok.  We almost got served someone else's meal when the food runner didn't know we were not the right table.  No big deal.  However, I would have liked to have known what comes w/ the entrees (since the menu lacked some of that info).  She wasn't very inquisitive about what we might be craving or selling us on a certain thing that might be extra good.  It was busy there, but I felt like the service was just mechanical (if that makes sense).    Bathrooms clean/nicely maintained.  Very nice jazz quartet in the room...the volume was pleasant and enjoyable.    I would go back for the artichoke...but I don't feel compelled to return otherwise.

TZatgTt9RyYGlBa7uZTgBg.review_text: I had the rotisserie chicken, he had the prime rib, and we shared the kale salad.  I love kale salads, so this was my favorite part of the meal, actually. The dressing was robust and perfect, thanks to the peanut taste and texture.  My chicken was perfectly seasoned and the tabbouleh went well with it.  I didn't really like my date's prime rib, I thought it was a bit tough even though it was cooked medium.  We had to indulge in the fudge sundae, and I wholeheartedly recommend it.  You're dining here... so you're splurging anyway, right?? The ambiance is definitely americana/older generation.

H8_WNsVhJsKexvqaV2Q6Rw.review_text: This place is right across the street from Alcatraz Landing, so it naturally receives many tourists and out-of-towners. I stopped here this past Sunday for brunch as I finished my run along the Embarcadero. It has nice patio and is also a great place to people watch. My boyfriend ordered the burger, which was avergae at best. If you want the best burger in SF, go to Spruce (Presidio Heights), trust me. We split the spinach artichoke dip, which was your usual run of the mill artichoke dip. I read reviews that the artichoke dip was great, so I expected it to be quite a bit better. I ordered the crab cakes, which were delicious and they came with fries and cole slaw! I have never been one for slaw, but theirs was fabulous! Service was medicore at best. We had 3 servers within the span of 45 seconds and one of which was rude. I like how they are on top of their service, but it gets confusing when three people come to the table asking the same thing. We got out check and it was $86 not including tip for lunch. Please note: we didn't even order alcohol and it was that much. Come to find out, those delicious crab cakes I was eating for lunch were $38. No wonder they were so good.

sgiF4xmzbq__evyAevKApQ.review_text: WOW.  Arrived Thurs at 12 with my team of 4, no wait.   Artichoke-superb Crab Cakes-perfection Salmon-smoked/tasty artichoke dip-Good Brussels sprouts-THIS IS WHERE IT'S AT .......Favorite   The boys got the ribs-looked like perfection.

gh614Mg2VR_ZJxIX8BcIxA.review_text: We had a great meal at Hillstone. Nice ambiance, loved the live music.  Started with Rosemary Foccacia and Olives. Wish they gave some more olives, but it was all delicious.  Husband got the Filet with Tabbouleh and loved it. I got the Veggie Burger and Coleslaw, delicious. Service was wonderful. Great meal.

vp3ZJlr4YT4wfRSUPtv7UA.review_text: The Smoked Salmon Starter was so buttery and flaky. Their Roasted Prime Rib was flavorful and tender, the sides complemented it well. The Ribeye was grilled to perfection crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside.

QWEYGZKydZ9KDpiQc2Avmw.review_text: Okay, honesty... I think I tend to be a bit of a food snob and a slight wine snob... I just love to eat and drink and be merry! So when I was with my ex and he dragged me to this place years ago- I was kind of a total brat about it... Only because it is what I would call a "chain restaurant" ... But I have to say this place hands down has not only food that is very good but also a wonderful local wine list. It offers a ton of selection including larger wineries that I love (Cakebread, Stags Leap, Trefethen, Grgich Hills) and has some of the smaller wineries I also enjoy ( Robert Keenan & Smith Madrone)... Not only is the wine list great but it is also very affordable... A glass of Cakebread for $13 or Trefethen for $10 I think is a deal... But what really keeps me coming back is their chili... YES, the chili is amazing- so good I dream about it.... They use to only serve it on Saturdays but I just found out they now serve it on Sundays as well- so I wanted to let all you yelpers know!!! BTW I also think the customer service is good...

xQOnDYYjS-Ocl3JmIukRDQ.review_text: I can't rave enough about this place!! My husband and I took our two boys overnight to the city. We stayed on the embarcadero and wanted somewhere fun to go to dinner. My husband's friend recommended Hillstone.  So, we made reservations for Saturday night...they only had a 5:15 open. A little early to eat but really wanted to try the place! Earlier in the day we stopped by to check it out...I asked if we could make our reservations maybe an hour later? The hostess with a warm smile said "Sure!" So, we got a 6:15 reservation, which is what we originally wanted.  We were able to walk from our hotel, Hyatt Regency, to Hillstone, which was fabulous considering the long taxi lines and $$ . We were also lucky it was a beautiful night in the city as well!  When we arrived the place was hopping! Ooohhh, the ambience was everything we love in a restaurant! It was lively, swanky and very low lit, which by the way is my FAVORITE thing in a restaurant! I had read one reviewer said the lighting was too dim...not at all!!! That's what makes this place so warm and inviting! I loved the red lights and cool ceiling lights. The jazz music was an awesome addition....so smooth and lovely to listen to. I give it a total thumbs up for ambience for sure. As for the food and service.........my husband ordered the prime rib! He thoughtt was fantastic! I went ahead and ordered the ribs.........WOW, I have never finished a rack by myself before...I couldn't stop eating them, total fall off the ribs! It is pricey at $ 32.00 but worth every morsel! The boys ordered burgers, which were also delish! Oh, almost forgot we had ordered the grilled artichokes to begin with! Out of this world if you love artichokes! A "must" for a starter!      We were surprised to see wines by the glass you rarely see by the glass! We were delighted by that.....only one tiny glitch! My hubby ordered a glass of cab to go with his prime rib and it showed up after he was finished. The server immediately told us it was no charge for the glass. By the way, our server couldn't have been nicer, great smile and charm! The manager also came over to make sure we were happy with everything. We had a nice conversation with her and told her how fabulous our evening had been and that we certainly made the right choice for an evening in the city!! By far!!   No room for dessert and the walk back was good for us after the amazing dinner!

UxJoHsSFqc3TcM6UkIPmeA.review_text: I had to try, just once in my life, a $17 French Dip. I mean, could it really be worth it? Would I finally have an oral-gasm? No. I wouldn't. But....  VERY VERY GOOD. Great meat, healthy portion, shoe string fries and the service...  The service: When my diet coke is 3/4 done the waitress walks up and plops a new one down in front of me without even asking weather or not I wanted another one...I love it! Food came out quickly and the place just smells wonderful!  Tables are a good enough size to have a business lunch and look over papers and there's no sense of wait staff turning and burning.  Highly recommended for entertaining clients!

p4FsOflitbyFKseYi1610Q.review_text: The location of this Houston's make it perfect for a (pricey) meal before/after an Alcatraz trip, especially since everything's been tried and true on Pier39. We stopped by for a quick lunch and had amazingly delicious and huge burgers. The boyfriend had the cheeseburger with couscous and I had the canadian bacon burger with bbq sauce and shoestring fries. Though everything was scrumptious, I was a bit disappointed that the burgers weren't cooked perfectly as ordered.  Definitely a must if tired of all the seafood options on Pier39 and actually within walking distance!

q794__U3CNgVY3hZEihipQ.review_text: Amazing food. Attentive and passionate wait staff. Great ambiance. Had live music the night we were there.  I would definitely recommend to make reservations first! Enjoy! Go at least once!

bKfeFC2Z4c9obKbB_ZKN8w.review_text: Amazing food! In still thinking about the amazing meal I had. Started off with the fire roasted artichoke. So yummy! Had the prime rib for dinner and it was so delicious! Can't wait to go again! Yummy!!'

JvQRbZYdMGuuDqTArles2g.review_text: Fantastic is all I can say... My girlfriend and I grabbed a bottle wine we had been saving (again - I have to plug the no corkage fee - is it very unpretentious of them) and went to Houston's for a great meal.  We split the Sashimi Tuna Salad and the Grilled Artichokes... both were great!  I tried the prime rib, which was like butter!  I love that, it reminded me of prime rib from when I was a kid... and my girlfriend had Hawaiian Rib Eye, also delicious!  I liked our server, she was very good at her job and had a way of showing up at the right times... she paid us just the right amount of attention... a great dinner with great service!

UcwmlwiHf7rRf96PryvrmA.review_text: OOOOOooooooooohhhhhhhhhh............  I LOVE LOVE LOVE HILLSTONE!  Walked here from our hotel.  Just missed a rain storm and got here just in time to beat the dinner rush on a Saturday night.  Corner table with windows on both sides, overlooking the piers, a bottle of wine, live music, friendly service---you just can't  beat it!  I really miss the sushi that many Houston's offer, but the rest of the meal made up for it.  We started with Rosemary bread and olives and almonds ($3 ??!!!!), toasty and warm with the most delicious olive oil.  I ordered the Atlantic Char, which was like a less oily salmon with the texture of trout.  It was cooked to perfection, light and flaky and moist.  Super Flavorful!  I was ecstatic with it!  Husband ordered the filet, which NEVER fails here.  One of the best steaks ever (Far preferred over places like Nick & Stef's, Mastro's, and Flemings).  Super tender, juicy and the steak had a nicely grilled beef flavor.  Delicious.  After my second glass of Gamba (Amazing fruit-forward Zin)---I was skipping on the boardwalk back to the hotel.  A little bit giddy!  (Gotta watch that 16.5% wine!---Whew!)  Did I mention that I love this place?

CMdFQ0y0zvzBS2x6tjZcWA.review_text: I haven't had a chance to really indulge here in meals since it changed from Houston's, but the appetizers I've had here are really good.  The spinach artichoke dip....omg....  Who needs the chips?  I could eat the dip!  The grilled artichokes are quite delectable too.  Other great things about this place are the excellent service and extremely reasonable bottle prices for a restaurant of this caliber.  You can get a bottle of the Orin Swift Prisoner for $56.  That's really not bad at all!  I didn't know until I read other reviews here, but apparently, there is not corkage fee?  Wow, very nice...  My bf and I will have to come back here more often.  It's easy to get to on the Embarcadero with little headache to park, and it's very cozy in here.

O6ZWwuCCe7rcKK-1JxB6rg.review_text: A couple of friends and I were hungry after unwinding at a bar.  My friends were craving prime rib and so suggested Hillstone; I've never been so we decided upon coming here since it was close enough to where we were.  Friends ordered the prime rib, I ordered the BBQ pork ribs that comes with a side of creamy cole slaw; I am soo glad I ordered what I did! For about $31, these ribs were fall-off-the-bone tender and finger-licking flavorful! They hit the spot just right!  Since the restaurant ambiance was a bit classy, I hope I wasn't too rude for using my fingers; good thing I didn't suck every finger like others potentially would at a more casual setting...lol.  Honestly, one can't help but use your fingers...there's no sense in using a knife because the meat and tendons slide right off anyways.  Price, is a bit steep, but hey, for its location, I can't complain; great view of the Bay Bridge, live music, and no need for over-the-top dressy apparel (and so long as you're not looking like you're coming in from the beach); an overall perfect place for lunch dates with friends and celebrating romantic date nights.  I'd come back again, then would try their lunch menu.

CkzTMVOwsQfvEIHR37Dl2Q.review_text: I came here alot when it was Houstons... So excited nothing has changed, food was delicious, scenery was sexy, and service was great! I wanted to recommend a great date night......Parked right in front of Hillstone, FED METER,  Walked across embarcadero to pier 33, took the Alcatraz night tour at about 4:30, (book weeks in advance) got back to dock about 8pm, crossed back to restaurant, ordered artichoke appetizer ( a must)  I had the ribs with caramelized carrots and my BF had the fillet. AMAZING!!!  Please order the Sunday, it comes with the fudge on the side and you can dunk and dunk...with extra candied nuts. BLISS.....

NfKrxI4hUlY3fFQfsFstYQ.review_text: Perfect spot for after-work glass of wine or martini and dinner. You'll see familiar faces if you go here more than once at or after 5. Bartender/waiter Ben is the best too!

47jYU6CunkW--4S9vYqyYg.review_text: I've come here for business lunches and most recently, dinner with friends.  For business lunches, the ambiance in this place makes you want to just relax and talk about non-business business.  For dinner, it's very romantical, darkly lit and feels like another city.  For some reason, Chicago comes to mind.  I have no idea why.  Anyway, the food is good.  Pricey, but good.  I love their thai noodle & steak salad w/mango.  The steak is always cooked to perfection and very flavorful.  A good sized portion.  Tonight, I had the Rubeunesque and thought that while the seasoned/buttered bread & cheese was a bit too much - the corned beef was tender and not too bland or salty.  Their fries are also very good.    Overall - this place has good looking servers, outdoor seating to enjoy the sf sunshine and good for most all occasions.

aW30Jnj_-JUN3t6xXcVF3A.review_text: Hillstone is fool proof.  Everything I have had is tops in quality and the service is great.  I often entertain friends from Europe and Asia.  I can take them to Hillstone with confidence.  The menu and wine selection meets everyones expectations.    I enjoy very rare prime rib and feel it is the best in town.  The portions are generous and all veggies are prepared fresh.

aikP02DBxGBjr0i883eQYw.review_text: SIGH....  I'm so disappointed.  Houston's usually does it for me... so good...  The smell of the grill alone is pure satisfaction.  But I'm trying to shed those holiday pounds and can't be stuffing a cheeseburger down my throat weekly anymore...  So I ordered the hacked chicken salad.  Last week, it was very good.  Today, I dumped nearly ALL the chicken in the trash.  (Well... the compost, we are in San Francisco, after all...)  Gross little pieces of fat and tendons were sticking to most of the meat.  Not to mention, it didn't taste as fresh as it normally does.  I already mentioned, that Houston's usually does it SO right.  But not today.  And when you pay $17.95 for a salad (to go, so not including any kind of beverage), it should be ON POINT every time.  Not the case...  So sad.  I guess I'll have to stick to my own salads and only go to Houston's when my body's ready to splurge for a burger....  P.S.  The bartender who took my order was fabulous, so 2 stars instead of 1...

YTJGi6Miaew9ukBy3ptKeg.review_text: Houston's is a go-to dinner spot any night of the week.  I've been for a relaxing Sunday night dinner to sit at the bar and watch football. I've been with my boyfriend for a nice date. I've been with a group of friends on a Friday night.  They always get it right.   The food is always the same, and thank God for that, because like I said, they always get it right.  The spinach artichoke dip is delish to start with. For the entree, personally I love the garden burger, it's homemade and has a nice sweetness to it.  Even my meat-lovin' bf is a huge fan of this one. Another entree worth mentioning is the omelette. It's cooked to perfection. And finally, french fries are my weakness, and the ones at houston's are quite tasty - thin, salty and crispy.   I love this place, in fact I think I'll go tonight.

xQSNfyCncvdUcdT5CMRtTg.review_text: I used to LOVE this place. I've been coming here for more than a decade.  My idea of heaven was to come in on a Sunday afternoon for a dirty martini, their amazing creamed spinach and artichoke dip, and a hot fudge sundae for dessert.  The drinks are really well made.  The food is hit or miss depending on what you order, but once you know what's good you can stay away from the average dishes. The items above are fabulous. The chocolate sauce they use is out of this world and is served in a gravy boat which is always a plus.  The prices on some dishes are a little exorbitant even for San Francisco, for instance, $36.00 for a rack of ribs that has nothing special about it. It's not a large rack of ribs for 36.00, and the BBQ sauce is your run of the mill basic sugar sauce. It comes with fries and a dollop of coleslaw. Given the choices in SF for BBQ, they should really just hang their heads in shame and give up on this item, or price it where it belongs, somewhere around 18 .00- 22.00.  My main issue with them is their service and their attitude. I ride, and for the last 5 years I've been coming in wearing my motorcycle jacket, with my helmet and gloves in hand. The staff tends to look at me like I am something that just crawled out from under a rock. In one instance they told me the restaurant was closed when the people in front of me walked right in and it was obvious to me they were still serving. Now if they had a dress code, I could understand this, but you are as often surrounded by tourists in flip flops, shorts, and tee shirts as you are by suit sporting business folks, and it's not as if I look like something out of Son's of Anarchy. I am a neat and put together person and so is my gear. I'm very tired of the attitude, and attitude is what permeates their service mentality. My feeling is that if you are laying out big bucks for a plate of mediocre ribs, they could at least deliver on service, but often they don't.  And, I've had it.  Hillstone: You are losing a customer you have had for a very long time. You are losing my Sunday Afternoons, You are losing my Birthday Dinners, You are losing my friend's Birthday dinners, and  You are losing the business dinners I used to schedule into you.  While I know that in the grand scheme of things my patronage is a small drop in your bucket, my point is that I am not willing to pay your prices for the sort of treatment I've been getting.

k3VaHk6DIMart7pLFJdWjQ.review_text: Just had a nice holiday lunch with my buddy and it was great.  The special was swordfish with speghetti squash...Y U M M Y!    If you want to treat yourself to a nice lunch for a special occasion or just to relax, definitely check this place out.

YqQqnCy0JlAU_ON9i-JIIA.review_text: No Corkage fee! So bring your own bottle of wine to cut down costs!!  I love that! I took the advice from other fellow yelpers and brought my own bottle. I have to admit by doing that, the cost of our meal was somewhat affordable.  The service was great and our server(Rachael) was very pleasant and attentive too. (Did I mention that there are hot servers over there?? =) )  This is what we've ordered:   - Grilled Artichokes --Must start your meal with this appetizer.
