The artichokes were nicely seasoned and grilled to perfection. I could this as meal by itself   - Ribs with Shoe String Fries and Sauteed Kale -- Absolutely delectable! The meat was SO tender, it fell off the bone! Fries was very good and addicting too. They were cut thinly and fried very crispy. Can't go wrong with sauteed Kale and it was good.    -Thai Steak Noodle Salad -- It was good but I wasn't too thrilled about. They put SO much peanuts in the salad that it should've been called Thai Steak Peanut Salad instead. There wasn't enough noodles in the salad and the meat was a bit tough for me. I wouldn't order it again.   -14 oz Rib Eye Steak Special with vine ripen tomatoes, bleu cheese and basil.  -- Love it!!! Rib eye was nicely cooked and very flavorful. I love meat and the piece of meat was delish!  Next time, I would definitely order Ribs and Rib Eye steak again. Skip the Thai Steak Noodle Salad.

QunQDpu4nJWDxLIBb9WvdA.review_text: One of my friends took me to dinner here for my birthday and it was a mixed experience.  We started off with the grilled artichoke and spinach-artichoke dip for starters.  I was really impressed with the grilled artichoke, absolutely a must at this restaurant.  The spinach-artichoke was more on the disappointing side... lots of spinach but not a very good mix of artichoke.  I love spinach but I would have enjoyed the dip if it had a better blend of the key ingredients.  We both ordered the prime rib and I wasn't wowed.  My husband was also with us and he had ordered the filet, that was fabulous.  The prime rib that we ordered was great on the rim but the core was not of great quality, the meat itself was of mediocre selection.  It was hard to cut and quite chewy... not a pleasant experience.    We ended the meal with two desserts: hot fudge sundae and apple cobbler.  The cobbler was so good but I was already too full from the grilled artichoke and bottle of red wine (oh, I forgot to mention NO CORKAGE FEE), the sundae was okay but the cobbler was excellent.  Summary: Less than 10 min wait from arrival and reservation time - A   Starters:      Grilled Artichoke - A+      Spinach-Artichoke Dip - C   Entrees:      Prme Rib - C      Filet - B+        side: loaded baked potato - A   Dessert:      Apple Cobbler - A      Hot Fudge Sundae - B  No Corkage Fee - A+

XQobjLO1qcy4SoKM84Gb6g.review_text: Absolutely love the ribs and spinache dip here..we drive an hour away just to have dinner here ..the atmosphere is very elegant and cozy ..the bar is a fun area too

uoDxYuDS4QMZ_pJhYfk9pg.review_text: Love this place. Very fancy as well. i had the ribs here and it was the best ribs i ever had. so worth it. pretty expensive, but u get what you paid for. the service was good. our server took good care of my table.

toiwHEkl300WUv1IsKKYLA.review_text: I loved my first time experience at Hillstone! The servers were very attentive and also friendly. I liked the environment too with the dim lighting and the live music.  Choices to think about -spinach and artichoke dip (the dip it self was good, but I wasn't much a fan of the combination with tortilla chips) -flying tuna platter (absolutely loved every bite, big portions)   I will definitely make a second trip here soon.

W7o-AY6Hpyb5WkgxwGH_Yw.review_text: Was a Houston's and now called Hillstone.  Same company and same good food.  The Rib's may be the best anywhere you can find in the country.  Great service most of the time, although on this visit very slow.  Did not matter since we were just relaxing and have a nice dinner.  The ribs along get the 5 stars.

1o2BFbsRN_dHRffX4-ob0A.review_text: Came here on Valentine's, even though we made a reservation we still had to wait 20 mins. It was fine since the bar had TVs and slam dunk contest was on :)  Artichoke appetizer was DELICIOUS! Perfectly grilled and tender, yummm I had the Hawaiian Rib Eye, so good. It was marinated perfectly, and the baked potato they served with it was HUGE and LOADED! My bf had the prime rib, it was good, but not second best compared to House of Prime Rib like some claim.  Dessert was ok, could have had a better selection.  Our waitress was really nice, but the other people that came by to help us, not so friendly.

8fFI0aEBFJZIHB07Wz-y_w.review_text: I did not know that we had this in SAN FRANCISCO .. This place I tried in NYC with the best people on Earth, so it has good memories. They have great food and a huge verity of food.

FRLHsMaXlVg9C4G4tO7GpQ.review_text: nice atmosphere, low light good food friendly and polite waitresses  negative: long wait time. we had reservation but we still had to wait 10minutes after out reservation time to be seated Caesar Salad was anything but Caesar: too little cheese, narrow cut lettuce, it also had Kale!!! dressing was not Caesar dressing! and the portion size was small.

B0yCM4Dgw5LFQYkSlBGmSg.review_text: I don't care if this is a chain restaurant.  You can always count on having a good solid meal whenever you dine here.  I go here specifically for the French Dip.  They do it the best in The City.  Choice slices of meat sandwiched between two pillows of butter toasted bread, each side barriered with creamy horseradish.  Fries on the side?  Nope...I always ask for a side of the colecannon potatoes.  Think mashed potatoes swimming in coleslaw, that's what these mounds of goodness are made of.  The only problem you'll find yourself facing here is leaving enough room for dessert.  And you'll definitely want to save room for the hot fudge sundae.  You know its serious buisiness when you get served hot fudge in a gravy boat!!!  And the candied pecans put this dessert over the top!  Dang, Hillstone, you know how to make a woman fall hard!  Until next time...

RsCUSyd-J0EPigTm_kuNaA.review_text: Way too expensive for the type of food they serve, but the food is good.  Their signature spinach dip is always a must.  Every time I come here, I am hoping that they have their crab cake salad special (I love crab cake...like really LOVE it).  Anyway, if you're here and they have it, I would highly suggest it.  Comes on a bed of salad, avocados and corn with this really nice dressing.    I've also tried their fresh fish.  Menu says that it's simply cooked...and it really is simple.  Fish.  Salt.  Pepper.  Grilled.  Was a bit bland to me, but I was warned.  I hear that their veggie sandwich is a good one.  Also their Thai something salad...but get it with beef instead of chicken.

9i_HSDhmAq2Eks9riAit2A.review_text: Great food and service at the bar or the tables. While there are a lot of restaurants nearby this one has a very nice ambience and is not over crowded at all. They serve typical American food perhaps with a slight pacific hint but everything we had was delicious and served by pleasant and friendly staff.

tGgTIueZy1JNTzQD9rkZLQ.review_text: Not gonna lie, their prime rib is to die for.  I love the wooden tables while you're dining inside, and the fire pit area outside while you wait with a glass of wine overlooking the Embarcadero.  A good cut of beef + cooked medium rare = Jenny a happy and full girl.

S5FcD9IDAaBh9-oV2evwkw.review_text: Very solid lunch. Not out of the park but very good. The location was great as was the service. The burger was middle of the road and so was the club sandwich. My only complaint was it was a bit pricey for lunch. I would go back and I would recommend the place.

F-6nP5TAnhTLtjhLPDnkOA.review_text: Love Houstons.  'nuff said.  it's dark, moody, and delicious.  They have a great wine list, and consistenly delicious food.  Waitstaff is attentive, and there is typically great people watching at the bar.  It's not the cheapest option for 'american' food in the city, but it's one of the tastiest.

F1bpfqIj0XWF73YUWrZ4Rg.review_text: Best veggie burger in the city, hands down. I'm kind of an addict. Get it California-style...you're welcome. Artichokes are also the best I've ever had. And the key lime pie... don't even get me started. Jamie is the BEST waitress too, I always sit in her section and she is helpful, speedy, and all-around awesome!

pbFIcKknRHjLj1aKi6WAhg.review_text: You cannot go wrong at this restaurant. Their menu is easy, everything is delicious, and the service was superb. Prime rib sandwich is very very very good. And you have to have the grilled artichoke appetizer.

YR0CcWbSasHEVoXzjCTREQ.review_text: Hillstone--I knew it as Houston's in Texas--is a familiar, and excellent, steakhouse.  Although the decor may be different, everything else, including the menu, the quality of service, and the execution in the kitchen, is right on par.

srC6EDHsMXWERPBopvgC6A.review_text: Went here for food when in Fishermans Wharf. Absolutely disgusted by the service provided.  DIdnt even get as far as ordering food, the staff were rude and pretentious. Would suggest you cross the road to the equally priced restaurant or walk to any of the others within a short distance.

VSINPig75DiGswnie1xxYA.review_text: Took the F line last night so super convenient and easy to get to with no parking worries....we used to always eat at the Los altos location and wanted to compare..  We think only the  dessert choices are different (Los altos wins that one), but sf wins with views.  We had the prime rib, ahi tuna salad and the grilled artichoke.  All fabulous.

fcnaLf9n35xD9mQjJ773ug.review_text: Consistently one of the best places in the city, for years. The ribs, pork chop and artichokes are always on point. They have the best margarita in town. Great views, no corkage fee. Me likey you Hillstone. Even though I still call you Houston's.   Minus 1 star for bitchy hostess (me no likey snotty people)  but let's face it, they really don't need stellar service. This place is always packed and the food is always good.

VCdP3RY871UmrlVZVI4dEA.review_text: One of my favorite dinner spots in the city! I always start with the artichokes as an appetizer as they are the best I've ever had. The Hawaiian ribeye is my favorite although the flying tuna platter is a great option if you're not as hungry. If you're going for a steak definitely pair it with the loaded baked potato and for dessert the hot fudge sundae. Its to die for!

_2h9MazCl88U4Bnry1jHFQ.review_text: yeah-yeah I know--It's Hillstone now, but I will always know it as Houstons. We used to frequent the Houstons in Pasadena until we moved to the bay. What a gem this place is. The food is still as outstanding as I remember, but the ribs--my o my--so good. You can eat them with a fork. Staff there is super friendly. Did you know they bake their own dog treats? A steady stream of neighborhood doggies came by for their tasty morsel. Our boxer loved them as well. Good vibe at the bar, sports on TV yummy cocktails--how could you lose?

-Ryl_0mZE_71CMPIcbzZhg.review_text: Came here on lunch with the fiance. Being it was my first time here, I didn't know what to expect, except from what reconnaissance I did beforehand on Yelp. I came committed to getting the steak.  Lunch crowd was the expected business types from the nearby financial district. Many people in suits and business attire. I suddenly became aware of the cardigan and jeans wardrobe my fiance and I were wearing and hoped that it wouldn't reflect upon the service we were about to receive. Especially since we looked like the youngest patrons there.   However, much to my pleasant surprise, our service was top notch. Food came out quickly, glasses refilled before I could even ask, and the occasional "How are you guys doin'?" without being overwhelming.   We shared a spinach and artichoke dip. Generous helping, but have had better. Mostly spinach and not enough artichoke. I actually think the spinach dip at BJ's is better.  I got the Hawaiian ribeye and she got the Prime rib. My steak, cooked to a perfect medium, was seared masterfully with a nice blackened crust on the outside with a perfect, pink center. I think the only think that made this steak Hawaiian was the distinct teriyaki flavor, which I liked. I sampled a few bites of the my fiance's prime rib. I would say it was a little above average, but not on par with House of Prime Rib or the prime rib offered at Alexanders.   Four stars for the food. Five stars for the service.  Would come back again.

ZFowP_Mc-XgEmI8cOzFh2A.review_text: Traditional American fare with a twist. I got the pineapple rib eye along with the tomato soup. Really tender, juicy and very flavorful. The tomato soup reminded me of home, a bit heavy but nonetheless super tasty (order a side of fries and dip em in if you're feeling adventurous and by that I mean if you're feeling FAT)   Margaritas are strong, jazz band was cool and the staff was attentive. Reasonably priced and they do have a nice outdoor area facing the piers. Pretty easy to get to as well so I def would recommend it,

3G9Jkn7hKc8fmbdK8_lC8g.review_text: kristina and i were self dubbed "the single couple" a long LONG time ago when we'd first become single. since we lacked boyfriends we did things for each other that we would normally do for a boyfriend. so on one occasion i took her to houston's since she'd wanted to go try it out for a long time. it was a "single couple date" if you will.  anyway the food was good and large in portions. the loaded baked potato was gigantic. the ribs were fell off the bone. the corn was really good too. the apple cobbler was disgustingly sweet and we hardly even ate it but oh. my. god. the key lime pie was the best i've had. really tart and the crust wasn't a normal crust. it was crumbly airy buttery goodness.  i will return

As6aCuiNpXcWhsqeEy6n1g.review_text: If you're looking for an experience of Hillstone Santa Monica, CA w/the attentive service and great food-go elsewhere. There's a reason why we hit 'chain' restaurants in another city. We're looking for a familiarity. The service, while a lovely girl was woefully inept-however she gets points for being accountable.  1. Took more than 8 mins for someone to greet us, get water etc. Everyone else avoided eye contact w/fervor 2. They charge for bread here, Santa Monica doesn't or didn't last I was there 3. I am very specific in the way I order and how I want it cooked and she noted she liked the hand movement Spinach dip was lukewarm Ribs came out, were not charred and my baked potato had everything on it-as opposed to on the side. This is where the server was awesome. After I pointed out the gaffe-she was apologetic and ran it back to the kitchen.  Apparently they don't often receive requests for 'charred' ribs. When the plate returned to the table the ribs were shriveled beyond belief.  I guess all wouldn't have been so bad if I hadn't gone to the manager and let her know of my experience, that it was my birthday, I'd been looking forward to coming and that I was really disappointed.  She basically said, "We don't do free bread service. And if everyone wanted free dessert after a meal..." She was nice about it, and I suppose if their bottom line is what she's protecting they found a bulldog. She offered to pay for dessert but at that point the taste was too sour in my mouth and we'd paid the bill. I was surprised she hadn't done more to ensure that I'd come back, but I suppose w/the killer view they don't need repeat business.

5c0kFVG6-Q0TwBT2yd1U9A.review_text: Houston's is a decent chain steakhouse.  The first one I went to was actually in Pasadena.  The artichoke dip is very good and the steaks are decent.  Ribeyes are by far my favorite steak and they do a pretty good job with them here.  The waiters are pretty good and the restaurant is clean.  The drinks are good too. A little pricey, but good.  You can definitely do worse than Houston's.  The only reason it gets three stars is because it doesn't really set itself apart from other steakhouses of it's type.  In comparison, the Outback would get probably 2 stars, and Houston's, while better for sure, isn't on the level of Flemings or even Ruth's Chris.  It's a good place for a good dinner and won't break the bank completely.  I usually like Houston's for business lunches because it looks good to clients (perception), and the food is above average, and you can expense it.  I would probably pick a different place with my own money but wouldn't be mad if this is where I ended up for some reason. I guess ambivalence is the key word here.

y2Y-iGnRMk7zqJidVnC_Lw.review_text: Overall, the food here is just decent. The prime rib and rib-eye is tasty and moist. It didn't seem as if they had the better cuts of meat. If you're looking for steak, there are plenty of other non-chain restaurants to choose from.   The service and ambiance is good.  What's with their "no reservations of parties greater than 4" rule anyway?

dsu43n2DOR_pB07P1sOOZg.review_text: I'm not particularly a fan of steak and potato type meals but if I had to, Houston's is a safe bet and mainly they keep bringing me back because their service and quality of food has been consistently good.  A friend who is particular about his meals, usually puts out at least 3 or 4 different special modification to the meal and  they have followed directions to a tee and considering how many hoops my friend puts out for the kitchen and server.  It's definitely a major accomplishment.  I'm not a huge a beef fan but for those that I've come with they all love it and i appreciate the fact that they have something for me, the non beef loving gal.    During busy nights, the bar area usually has ample seating and I also like how they don't go screaming out your name when they come looking for you.  It's quality food and service.

lfy-eyWCPADKx3QHx973XQ.review_text: Great standby, great food.  Not that into location or the decor.  But food always good and service is excellent.

Bx4TnEGP35miIwu3mek_4A.review_text: Coming back from backpacking for a whole month in Asia, I felt apprehensive on the idea of what looked like from the outside an expensive restaurant just because I was broke like no other.   The artichoke and spinach dip was bomb; it was my favorite dish! The artichoke tasted really fresh plus I loved its smokey taste/smell. I enjoyed eating it even though it doesn't fill you up. My friend also brought her own wine bottle and they didn't mind opening it for us. I'm glad she did because I didn't want to pay $$ for a drink, I know I'm so cheap... As for the entre, I ordered the Famous French Dip Au Jus; it tasted good not great, not very memorable but it satisfied me at that time.  Service was great too. I'm probably coming back!

1i_tFfn59SliMtxTDUrCsw.review_text: I still love this place.  My husband and I used to eat here almost 1x a week and now that we live further away we still try to get here as often as we can.  The food is amazing, the Tuna Platter is all I ever want to eat (literally every day I think about it) and the servers, bartenders, and hostesses are seriously so nice.  LOVE!

IBrL-6twlZmQBGLdV2DQiw.review_text: Those are some good ribs. You can cut them with a fork. Falling off the bone, tangy spicy sauce. Hot towels to wipe your dirty hands afterwards.  Grilled artichoke is super tasty too. No aioli needed.  Yelp, thx for the rec!

1L8lLWBUkEenJAHpHdJlzw.review_text: I was too late in making a Valentine's day reservation, and there weren't that many options left. Hillstone had a table, and my Valentine likes meat, so I booked.   Last year's Valentine's day massacre at Blue Plate, where seating was delayed by 1 1/2 hours, lead me to expect the worst so we arrived 10 minutes late. We waited another 15 and were seated. Whew!  The place is big, and has the feel of a well-oiled machine. As well it should since it's part of a 48 restaurant chain.   Prices are high but portions are generous. We had crab cakes ($38) which came with two sides. French fries were perfectly cooked, and a Cesar salad was unmemorable.The cakes themselves were almost all crab, and the crab was fresh (see my other posts for info on how sensitive I am to unfresh seafood...). There were two cakes, and each was about the size of a hockey puck.   For a main course, we shared the filet mignon ($42), which was also large at 10oz. It tasted good and was cooked well, and came with a choice of vegetables. We had the spaghetti squash, which was just ok. There were mashed potatoes included too, and those were not particularly smooth or interesting in any way.  Wine was not a great value, and the selections we had were only drinkable, not delicious.   Service was friendly and prompt, the place was comfortable and well run.   3 stars because the food is fine but not sublime, the wine isn't notable, and the prices are high.   Still, if you have no other great options and you want a steak, and you don't mind spending money, Hillstone is a perfectly reasonable, safe choice.

1MVJ99PbXHisYyE7xgOQGg.review_text: Look the service was fine and the restaurant was classy. But  40$ for a plate of ribs (no drink mind you) is a little ridiculous.

N7wVZmTpMI4Eg10DYSz00Q.review_text: Excellent veggie burger!  I am not a big fan of those fake meat burgers so in my opinion Hillstone's is doing it right.  I have heard that their secret ingredient is figs.  I love the grains and spices used to make this patty from heaven.

Ka3sTG2hnVP696O72HiJlg.review_text: This place has excellent food and the atmosphere is great.  I've been to a few of their different locations and they are all top notch.  My favorites include the pork ribs (obviously), the prime rib, spinach artichoke dip, Mexican tortilla soup, and I recently had the hot fudge sundae... wow!  The chocolate is sooo tasty, the whip cream is perfect; you don't want to miss this.  The prime rib is juicy and practically melts in your mouth, but sorry, it doesn't beat my moms.  We brought 3 bottles of wine with us last time and appreciated their standard no-corkage fee, that is a hard thing to find.  I can't wait to eat my way into a coma at Houston's again soon.

Q-kBgH-JZSLKqkdzUG9YQA.review_text: Houston's is great when you just want some meat. GOOD MEAT. Meat cooked right. I would like to try more things on the menu but I can't go to Houston's and not get the RIBS. Tender, succulent, delicious pork flesh that falls right off the bone (which saves me from sucking on the bones at the table). For dessert try the key lime pie. It's not always on the menu but when it is don't pass it up. We have frequented several times and have always left satisfied with the food and service.   I was a big fan of Bandera in Sacramento (part of the Houston's chain of restaurants) when I lived there so having Houston's in SF makes me very happy. If you are ever in Sac, try the french dip and grilled artichoke. Then top it all off with the banana cream pie with caramel and chocolate.

m5cBT7OYfn0HM0d-RCsdZQ.review_text: Enchanté  I had just attended a simple bash earlier in the evening and ran into an acquaintance I had not seen in several months.  Since we were already in North Beach, he volunteered Houston's for some steak action because earlier, I was apparently talking about my great experiences with steak.  It was a good time to catch up.  I know I know, so stab me for partaking in the bounty of a major chain, but honestly, I've never had one bad experience here.  Granted they were all evening visits, but this establishment makes me feel at home immediately: the warm and cozy feeling.  Not sure if it is because of the dim lighting, cushy bench seating or the simple robust menu.  Maybe because the company with which I was always blessed with were just wonderful people full of lively conversations and swathed in good intentions.    The wine menu is also extensive (had a lovely Meyer Family Syrah, sweet notes of fruit balanced with the spiciness of the tannins) and went well with my Center Cut Filet.  I usually order a Rib-Eye steak, but the Hawaiian Rib-Eye was not on my mind tonight (I prefer steak plain.  No marinades.  No toppings.  No sauces.)   The Center Cut was fabulous.  I always order mine rare, with a slightly warm center.  Tender and succulent.  Perfection.  A little salt and cracked pepper and I was in blissful heaven.  He ordered the Prime Rib, rare, and again, amazingly tender and savory.  I had to acquiesce to his urging of two samplings.  Both of our dishes came with a baked potato.  I barely touched mine.  Pricing on the menu is typical of a steakhouse.  If you are here for an early dinner, the crowd is usually business, with a bunch of men in suits.  It was amusing to see several of his associates at another table and they all assumed he was on a date when he introduced me (noooooooooooooo, no no no) He's my friend, see?  F-r-i-e-n-d.  Friend.  I pointed to the "friend" sticker so easy to see on my forehead.  Come on, now!  I am aware of the dessert menu and may have to plan on saving enough room in the future.  Our server was attentive yet never over bearing and I do so applaud the warning of  "no cellphone usage" in the dining room.  I would happily kick the shins of anyone whipping out a cellphone at the dinner table.  He picked up the entire tab as if we were on a date.  I felt bad, even though I almost threw my share at him.  He refused and said it was for his friends who caused a scene earlier at the table.  Awww, thankful for such a nice guy.      Love this place.  I'll be back!

c2dTAl2CehvrHl-Ov6Edog.review_text: Really disappointing service.  Supposedly pet friendly, but when I arrived with my dog, we were told we couldn't sit inside or on the patio, so we had to sit in the front outside area where there was no service.  I literally had to go to the bar to place my order, request my check, ask for silverware, and still received a bill close to $100.00. Not only that but when I asked for a box to take my food home, the waitress rolled her eyes.  Hoston's had class, Hillstone apparently not.

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: I like Houston's, I really do.  The location is great, the food is consistent, and the staff is professional and nice.   My only issue with Houston's is the price of a casual meal.  I can't remember the last time I saw a $17.00 salad on a lunch menu (The Seared Ahi Tuna Salad).  I ordered the salad, I ate the salad, and I enjoyed the salad immensely, and I even splurged on a glass of wine, which was also delicious.  And even though I knew what I was getting into, I thought, wow, I just spent almost $40 on lunch.  For one plate of food and one drink!  Unless you have an unlimited expense account, that's a little steep for a regular occurrence.  With so many great restaurants in the city, I'll most likely be getting my lunchtime greens elsewhere.

lEkKlFiaKyXfrDx6gWp1qA.review_text: The best place in the city without a corkage fee! The food is tasty, great ambiance and the service is excellent...only second to Rutherford Grill.

_LYs_lBpXDIGbI1QPESA_g.review_text: Came here with a group of 5 adults and a child. The food was decent but not worth the price. The service was horrible. We are all asian and felt discriminated by a  blond caucasian waitress who served us. We all ordered a plate each including the child but ask for small plates so that we could a share. The waitress was very unprofessional and rude by rolling her eyes and making big sighs when we needed her attention. We were there for about 2 hrs. and she stopped by only twice to check up on us. We did not even were asked or got our beverages refilled. If i was not with our guests i wouldn't have given her a tip but we did anyways. I know i will never come back here ever. What a waste of $50 person spent on a little above average food and crappy service.

CiJat5Up2jAO3B0qTbiN5Q.review_text: What started as a nice evening out with my hubby, slowly ended up being a long wait at the bar.  When we first arrived, I put my name down with the understanding that it would be about a 20 minute wait.  That was fine.  We went to the bar and enjoyed a cocktail.  After about 30 mins, my husband went to check and they said there were about five parties of 2 ahead of us, but a lot of people were leaving, so it should be no time before we were seated.  Another 15 minutes goes by, and when we checked again, turns out they not only crossed out our name from the list, but they had already seated other tables.  Of course, the hostess apologized, but she also said she didn't do it.  We didn't care who did it - they never once came to the bar to ask for us - even though we told them twice we were going to be at the bar.    Afraid they would skip us again, we left the bar and stood near the podium.  After we told another hostess (probably the head hostess)  what had happened, she seated us immediately, and was very apologetic.  And before we could even look at our menus, the manager came with a complimentary appetizer of their spinach and artichoke dip and also apologized.  Unexpected touch and it was nice that they cared.  Dinner went perfectly after that.  I had their grilled salmon special with vegetables.  The salmon was perfect.  Lightly grilled outside, and just rare enough inside.  The veggies has some kind of balsamic vinegar dressing on it.  Delicious.  My husband had the Thai Steak Noodle Salad.  I'm getting that next time.  Hunks of steak with mango and yummy noodles with a peanut sauce.  The food came very quickly - which was good.    No room for dessert.  Like I said, the evening started off a little rocky, but the restaurant pulled through in the end.

0smhwGl3qTQjsoG2eCwziw.review_text: Best Best Best Veggie Burger that I've ever had. I  only get that when I go. A+ Staff, Friendly, and really well trained. Note to cook's - Sometimes your fries are really salty...

I8qcBf_gSc9eWLDnSumW7A.review_text: Yes, 5 stars. Here's why: I grew up with Houston's in my hometown. It was THE place to go, there was always a line and fabulous food with a local flair.  When Houston's open in San Francisco in 1998 (I think?) I was so excited!  I feel like they had a hard time getting a good following but I'm happy to see that 10  years later, they are going strong.  A few tips: the BEST spinach artichoke dip on earth.  Amazing salmon, make sure get the chef's sauce too.  VERY tasty and unique Couscous.  I stole the recipe and now my family loves it. I should dock them one star for taking the chicken tenders off the menu.  They are the best chicken tenders on earth but, thanks to our "san francisco" ways, they have removed the fryer from the premises.  I suppose now there's still a reason to go to my original Houston's in my hometown.

IfoZzNRJsoUaEEiTL3KMDg.review_text: Me and my big brother and his boss that is from europe  went here after we went to fishingmans wharf.  I wanted to order pizza but they don't have that here so get the burgers or sandwiches.  I got some ribs but I dropped them on my shorts and had barbeque sauce all over them!  My brother was mad because he said not to eat them after they fell but I am super hungary. I wanted to get a brownie Sunday but we already ate ice creams before.  Definately come here if you want to get some goo d food and hang out with some of your best friends.

mS-4O56dx6wt5fWxbbx-LQ.review_text: This is seriously a meat lover's paradise. And I'm not even someone who enjoys red meat as much. I'm an avid chicken and pork eater but not a huge fan of steaks. Yet I am wholeheartedly giving Hillstone 5 stars.   The ambiance is romantic, intimate and classy and the location, right on the cusp of North Embarcadero, is one for the books. The waiters and waitresses are attentive, friendly and very helpful. We ordered everything our waitress recommended and were not disappointed.   Here's what we got:   Spinach and Artichoke Dip: YUM. It's creamy, smooth, flavorful and addicting.   Double-cut Pork Chop: Oh my. This is just too good. Juicy, tender, succulent, well textured and intensely flavorful. I love good pork chops and this just probed perfectly at my weakness.   BBQ Pork Ribs: Yes, the rumors are true. It is indeed "fall-off-the-bone" tender. This dish might just be worth the messiness.   Hot Fudge Sundae: This is definitely not your ordinary traditional sundae. It's unreal how good it is... so unreal that I cannot fathom words to describe it.   Drinks: Great wine selection (the Champagnes are especially noteworthy) and a decent cocktail menu.   Thus, I highly recommend Hillstone to both meat-cravers and those who are meat indifferent. However, obviously it's not the best fit for vegetarians. So give it a try on your next Steakhouse outing!   Happy Eating Yelpers!   TIP: Portions are huge so order accordingly - 1 entree per person and maybe share an appetizer instead of ordering 1 per person. You'll probably still end up with left overs.

TXkHPpuCaC_gkIQO1raOCg.review_text: Went to this restaurant for the first time, loved the atmosphere the hustle and bustle of the staff, nice live band in the background. The food was great, started with grilled artichoke, wedge salad and prime rib, all very good! Staff was great!

mcKtgUI5euf-VNzXmSVzvw.review_text: Of course, it's not cool to support a restaurant chain, but this place ain't TGI Fridays, Chili's or even Chevy's, it's actually f***ing great!  I have been to Houston's many times over the past two years and it's always good. The food, service, live jazz, and drinks are great. The restaurant is roomy and has a friendly vibe with a big exposed kitchen.  I started coming here when my girlfriend discovered that this place is very kid friendly. Since the restaurant is large, the tables are spread out, it's easy to bring a todler and not disturb the other diners (and we usually eat early). I always look forward to going to Houston's because I know I'm going to have a great meal with attentive service.  The food: the baby back ribs are excellent, the roasted artichoke is fantastic and so is the spinich and artichoke dips with chips. The young lad is always happy with his child's chicken and fries plate. The seared tuna with butter lettuce, mango and avocado salad is very good too.   It's always a treat when there is live music. The young lad likes to watch the jazz musicians and do a little dance. Too bad they don't play on Saturday nights when we were there last, but he was very entertained by the outdoor fountain and fireplace.  Houston's is a cool restaurant that has something for everyone. I am happy to eat there anytime. We used to drive up to the Ruthorford Grill in Ruthorford (Napa Valley) to eat ribs and I recently found out that the Houston's chain owns this restaurant (the ribs and grilled artichokes are virtually the same). My mouth is watering now.

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: Best thing on the menu: Jumbo crab cakes. SO GOOD. Best crab cakes ever. Their shoe string fries keep it from coming across too fancy and the cole slaw is pretty much my favorite cole slaw in the whole world.  It's hard for me to comprehend that this place is actually a chain. Really good food, great service, great atmosphere, always busy.   I actually love Houston's!

-x1516ZG5GllZiBjDQlRkA.review_text: Houston's was good. Very good. Not in a super fancy is that foie gras on my plate kind of way but in a meal that hits the spot kind of way. Plus it's cozy, hits the nail on the whole mood lighting thing and has these nice leather chairs you can just sink into.  We waited about 35 min for a table on a Wednesday night. Since it was so loud and dark indoors, we opted to wait in the outdoor seating area where it was basically empty except for one group who had just polished off a bottle. Happy hour indeed. It was a very cold summer SF evening and my only chance of warmth came from the outdoor fire pit. While the outdoor fire pit shoots mesmerizing orange flames, sadly it provided no warmth on this chilly night. Luckily, being the January baby that I am, I was fine.  When we were finally seated, it was if the loudness subsided and my friend and I were able to chat. There was a bit of confusion with the drink order and waitress but that was all settled quickly. We got the cheesy toast (yummy) as an appetizer and both ordered specials of the day. His was a fish we could no longer pronounce by the end of the meal and my choice was a flat iron steak in chimmi-churri sauce. And since he had raved about these hand cut skinny fries, we both got the fries as the side order. My steak was amazing! Perfectly cooked medium, it was still tender and juicy inside. It was just full of flavor and I ate the whole damn thing. This is the steak I had expected to have at Ruth Chris'. The fries were fantastic too. I did not try my friend's fish but I did look at it. It looked as if it were topped with sliced pineapple but the slices were in fact *ta da* dungeness crab. He said it was good.  In the middle of our meal I had recognized the song the band was playing. Yup Houston's got the whole baby grand piano thing going on. The band was playing the Beatles "There Are Places I Remember" and that is one of my favorite Beatle's songs. I am immediately propelled into reflection mode. Anyhows the live entertainment was impressive.   For dessert we both got the apple crumble. It was good except it was too sweet. After about 5 caramelized walnuts, I was done. The scoop of vanilla ice cream was the saving grace on this dessert because it cut down the sweetness.   If not for the dessert, I would have given Houston's 5 stars. When did I know for sure that it was four star worthy? When the waitress brought me out a new glass of coke and took my original glass away. I was a little confused and surprised since I had not asked for a refill nor was I even 1/2 way done with my soda. My friend explained,  You should never have to drink coke mixed with water, ya know when the ice melts." Ah yes. Some rave about always having their water glasses refilled, I can rave about not drinking a watered down soda.

9oAk1mL3fzC_2ixGcSkp3g.review_text: What is your preference?  Prime Rib or Ribeye?    I enjoy both, so today I did a little research to see the difference between the two meats.  Whats the difference?  Apparently rib eye and prime rib are from the rib section. Although they come from the same part of the animal, they are cut differently and require different means of cooking.  A rib-eye is a steak, a piece of meat that is cut across the muscle into a slice, with or without the bone, which should usually be cooked quickly. Prime rib is a whole roast, which is a larger piece of meat that will serve more than one person and should be cooked whole, normally in the oven.  So why the question of preference or difference?  Because I ordered both ribeye and prime rib today at Hillstone.  I had been to this location back when it was still called Houston's.  Now years later, it has the same ambience as I remember.  It's a great place for large groups or even couples.  A lot of privacy so people can socialize.  A comfy fireplace to sit and have drinks at.    The menu is fairly simple.  Only four simple appetizers, maybe 12 entrees, 5 salads, and a 1 soup of the day, and few desserts to choose from.  So here's what we ordered:  Hawaiian Ribeye:  this was an average cut of steak.  Charred nice with of course a sweet carmelized taste from the marinade they use.  It's tasty and prepared well.    Prime Rib:  my guess is this entree was about 16 oz. of prime rib.  It came with au jus and mashed potatoes.  Very tender and flavorful.    The rest of the folks at my table ordered ribs and chicken, desserts, etc.  All the food seemed to be prepared nice.  And while nothing was really lacking at Hillstone.  Nothing stood out either.   For ambience, being on the Embarcadero at a nice restaurant, Hillstone is great.  For food and my overall satisfaction I would say average.    But the question still remains, ribeye or prime rib?    While I enjoy both and I know some will disagree.  But I'm gonna go with ribeye.

vYIs7km9XGnYdsj9ynnWfA.review_text: The Fish That Died in Vain  After waiting 50 minutes for a table and falling asleep in one of maybe two chairs they had for folks waiting, little did I know the bland, market price fish that would await me.   The restaurant was dark which made me more confused and frustrated. Because dim lighting and good food creates an ambiance, dim lighting and scarcely seasoned fish is more like a bad dream in which you yearn to wake up and profusely apologize to your taste buds.   As I looked across the table to see my mother slowly and angrily chewing her veggie burger one thing was made clear. Houston's is one of the worst restaurants on the planet.   That fish had its whole life ahead of him. It's a shame it had to come to that.

OqtsEXNH8uW2zb8vw8Hm8w.review_text: Started off  with skyy martini, pretty potent and that is how normally like my cocktails. We had two different starters,  Bread plate and artichoke dip. The Bread plate was not worth it, it came with four pieces of bread, pitted olives and butter. The artichoke dip was ehh, they should named it hot spinach dip, there wasn't really an abundance of artichoke in it.  All of us ordered the rib eye, but I was the only who ordered the Hawaiian Rib Eye which was tastier compared to the regular rib eye. The Hawaiian rib eye was crusted with caramelize brown goodness, but I recommend subbing the mash or bake potatoes instead of the stringy fries.   Ambiance reminded us of the old Pepper mill with out the cheesy carpet and crystallized rainbow sugar, it was pretty loud due to our waitress flub a couple of our request.s They did have a two piece jazzy setup covering M Jackson and Whitney Houston songs.  IF you do try this place, take advantage of the no corkage fee.

KI3UabQCCJqU5axFxMKTIw.review_text: I've never had bad fod here, ever. Went recently with a girlfriend to catch up and 3 glasses of wine later finally ordered food. The grilled artichokes are a staple, please don't ever stop serving them!   The Thai Salad was delicious too with big pieces of rotisserie chicken in it.  Can't wait to come back at some point!

TQaORZNivV5NG21CBFMeRw.review_text: My top five favorite restaurants. Have been there numerous times and tried most things on menu. Consistently good, everything I've had there was cooked simply and perfectly.  Grilled artichoke lightly charged and soft.  Smoked salmon appetizer is great, salmon soft, flaky and moist.  Artichoke dip is good, wish it was served w/wheat chips not corn. Little salad w/goat cheese, beets, croutons and candied walnuts is perfect. Burger is one of the best.  Baby back ribs are soft falling of the bone. Yum! Filet mignon or rib eye steaks are good. Prime rib is just okay.  Arctic char cooked nicely.  Roasted chicken is flavorful and moist served w/barley.  Pork chop is unbelievably tender and juicy served w/mushed potato and cabbage. - A MUST!  All desserts are good.  No corkage fee.

4oOw9OyDs26jCOypIRzdGg.review_text: Ate there on Sunday looking for brunch.  Unfortunately, they do not have brunch.  We ate at 1130am and there were only a couple of full tables. Ordered a burger and Waldorf salad.  Both were pretty good.  Had a Bloody Mary; this is a pass.  Not very good.  Overall an ok experience, maybe a good place for a burger and salad before or after the Alcatraz tour.  Nothing special. Also, they do not allow the blinds to be open. Strange.  It was a great sunny day and it would have improved the lightning.  It's very dark.  Maybe it is too hide when the restaurant is empty.

CGyH2xvqpfeyg9svXOoV4Q.review_text: Consistently great tasting food & great service  My fiance and I come here often, mainly because they are so consistent in their delivery of great food and service.   We also have been big fans of their NO CORKAGE FEE policy, So we usually bring a bottle or two of wine with us, open one while we wait at the bar for our table, and save the other for dinner.    We usually always get the Artichoke Dip for an appetizer, and the entree's Thai Noodle Steak Salad and the Cheeseburger.   We also love the atmosphere.  It's dimly lit tables are nice, and while the restaurant is always full, the noise level is low, so you can have great conversations without interruption.

GzyBADzoEj7DBz9TYetAsg.review_text: Yum! Yum! Yum!  I have been missing out on the most delicious food for so long! I am so glad I finally decided to check out Houstons!  I had the sautéed spinach which was absolutely amazing! We had the spinach & artichoke dip which is made to perfection! It just melts in your mouth! We also had the cheeseburger which was Excellent!  Houston's is located right in the heart of the tourist attraction between Pier 39 & the Ferry Building! The place is small, they have outside seating, the service is excellent and extremely quick! We went on a Saturday night, waited about 30 minutes for a table for 3 but got our order within 15 minutes of seating down. It's so cool to see how the kitchen runs! Those workers are on top of their game!  I will definitely be returning to HOUSTONS to try other menus on the item but you can't go wrong with the delicious and mouth watering cheeseburger!

zpT7HWE3o77YVfG4S07H9A.review_text: Came here for the second time tonight and I must say ....meh. I love the interior, like the location and the service is great but the food is so-so. I've never ordered any entree from the menu, both times I've tried the special they served for the evening.  The first time I was there, I had the grilled salmon, I'm always hesitant about ordering salmon dishes from restaurants because they always seem to over cook it. Houston did....  Tonight I had the worcester sauce reduction rib eye served with tomatoes and blue cheese on the side. I asked my steak to be cooked rare and they did medium, my ex asked for his prime rib to be cooked medium rare and they did medium well.   However, our waitress was awesome so I was able to see past the mediocre food.

hkHq1VJn38h_xjlOCcSnsg.review_text: Yes, it's a chain, but an upscale one.  We came here with a group on one of their free corkage nights (definitely a must!).  We started with the grilled artichokes (delish) and the spinach/cheese dip (also delish).  I ordered the hawaiian rib eye, which is marinated in soy and ginger and then grilled.  The meat is tender and juicy and very flavorful.  I had a bite of my friend's aged prime rib and it was delicious -- really good flavor (I will have to order that next time).  The baked potato that came with the steak was gynormous -- although the cheese was not as melted as it could be (note to baked potato preparers -- add butter, then cheese, then sour cream, then bacon, then green onions -- that way, the melty items are melty).    We also ordered 3 desserts to share (the sundae, the brownie and the apple/nut cobbler), all of which came with vanilla ice cream.  Were we gluttons?  Definitely.  The service was really good -- the server chilled a bottle of our wine for us and opened all the bottles so they could "breathe" a little before we started our meal.  The only one mis-step was when a friend found a couple of hairs on his plate after he had finished eating -- no idea where it came from and the server even noticed and took the plate away and told us she would "take care of it".  Now, I don't get grossed out by hair like some people (unless you actually eat it), but I think most restaurants would probably comp you your meal or a dessert or something, neither of which Houston's did, which I was surprised by.  All in all, would definitely recommend.

oW482ezZtHMdK6_6eAKOVg.review_text: A Pleasant restaurant along the Embarcadero. Yes, it's a chain but don't let that put you off. Execution is not compromised here. This location has a nice outdoor patio area with a lovely fire that you can lounge by. The interior screams vintage SF (Think HOPR).   The food is consistent and I always leave with a happy stomach. The French Dip is easily hands down the best in town. Their burger is ground fresh daily and flavors are fresh and clean. The shoe strings fries are a perfect accompaniment to either sandwich. Service is friendly and a full bar always helps :)  You can bet I'll be back!

ubO529JjVSqYMUQlDCoVTw.review_text: It pains me to have to give two stars because I actually liked the food. Unfortunately, their reservation system sucks. I made a reservation for 8:00 for a party of 5 people, promptly arrived, and was not seated until nearly 9:00! My starving husband, the birthday celebrant, was ready to walk out. The host kindly picked up the tab for an order of grilled artichokes as an apologetic response, which was nice. Our meals were good (kale salad, prime rib, filet mignon, French dip), however, the timing of the service was rushed and our server was robotic. We were not offered bread, which should be complimentary and not a menu item. Our entrees came before we were done with our salads. Then our desserts came quickly before we received our coffees!  We were not offered refills either.  One more thing.... while waiting for my table, I closely observed the hosts and noticed that they gave away tables to walk-ins and made people with reservations wait at the bar.

VYnlTLqmQZIXY1NsSta7lw.review_text: I've been coming here to Hillstone formally known as Houstons since 1999 and I LOVE this place. Very very consistent with the food, service and prices. Hawaiian skirt steak the best. Spinach Artichoke dip awesome!  Great bar great attitude from the people that work their. Awesome atmosphere!

ZiAYbButt4NHsLv482LZgw.review_text: Houston's is a great place to go for dinner. They haven't disappointed me yet. I have had their roast chicken in apricot glaze with potatoes and it was great. My husband always gets the ribs. For desert I love their sundae; it is the very best that I have ever had. It is served in a huge cappuccino mug with hot fudge and incredible candied pecans on top. It really is too much for one person so you may want to share and because it was just a sundae it was only $8, I think that is pretty affordable for a semi fine dining restaurant that is big enough for two.   I am only giving them 4 stars instead of 5 because the first time I went there I was totally starving and expected bread but they don't serve any. That is pretty odd giving the type of restaurant this is. And also, they have a spinach omelet on their dinner menu that just stands out like a sore thumb and I don't think a spinach and cheese omelet belongs on a steakhouse menu. I mean, this isn't IHOP where you can get breakfast anytime of the day.   One more thing, their menu design leaves much to the imagination. Being that my major was in hotels/restaurants, menu design was one of the most, if not the most, important aspects in a restaurant.

4LSF_BgZdsNTWr-nqHBeow.review_text: Hillstone's ribs tasted more or less like bbq sauce was slathered at the end for flavor and came out lukewarm.  The prime rib was overcooked, I ordered the medium rare and it came out medium and tough.  When I requested a new cut, the waitress gave me an attitude, like I was the one that didn't know the difference between a tender and juicy medium rare cut, and a medium.  The servers were dishonest about the wine that I ordered. I asked the first server if the Silver Oak Cab $90 was a good selection? She told me "great choice and that's our best seller!" with enthusiasm.  Then, The second server told me "that bottle surprisingly doesn't sell that well." Umm, which one is it people!?!  Food "blah", service, "yikes", ambience, "sports bar-like."   Also, the check came out while I was still eating 8:23pm, I wasn't done til 9:30pm. Not respectful at all.   My advice: go somewhere else...

MU-dtpRgsAOu8-PpfH4aHQ.review_text: Wonderful Upscale Yet Casual Jazzy Atmosphere Attentive Service Delicious Food.  I've been here plenty of times before but never reviewed.  My boys and I came here for dinner after seeing a magic show on the pier. We wanted something that was well prepared, good quality and a nice relaxing atmosphere. The hostess greeted and seated us right away. It wasn't as busy as I have seen in my other visits but busy nonetheless.  The low lighting, wood tables and burnt orange leather seats makes the ambiance posh yet masculine and classic in design. As our server took our order live jazz music danced in our ears and brightened our senses putting us in a good mood. I love trout so I decided the order Cajun Grilled Trout with Wilted Spinach while the boys opted for Kobe Beef Burger & Fries.  The trout was delicious! It was grilled to perfection; slight crunch on the outside yet moist and tender on the inside. It was seasoned well- not overly salty or seasoned I could taste the freshness of the trout. The spinach was sooo good, wilted slightly with a crunch and topped with fresh shaved parmigiano. Squeeze lemon over both the trout and the spinach and we are talking heaven on a plate.  My boys said the burger was very good and I knew they were telling the truth because they finished 3/4 of it! I made it a point to taste a piece of the meat and it was very good- juicy yet charred.  Our server was ok. She wasn't friendly as the other staff and she lacked the attentiveness one would expect and as I have experienced during my other visits. She didn't smile, wasn't energetic and seemed liked she didn't know the menu very well.  Overall, I enjoy dining at Hillstone especially on the days when they have the live jazz band. The atmosphere is upscale casual, the food is delicious, the cocktails are great and the service is nice.

mJgjSsNnnZpf_WZ3H_WsHw.review_text: I like everything about this place such as location atmosphere food deserts service etc... Little house salad roasted chicken prime rib and everything else really worth to try.

O8ct5FuS9cU_KFjRaAR4-Q.review_text: Hillstone never disappoints me.  The service and food are always exceptional.  My kids enjoy the unwritten kids meals, and of course the spinach artichoke dip with tortilla chips.  They are always nice to refill the chips.  Last night I ordered the caesar salad, which was kind of strange. It was not really anything like a caesar, because the dressing had lots of lemon juice, was more like a vinaigrette, I had only 1 small crouton, and the lettuce was chopped so small that it was hard to stab with a fork.  It did not look like or taste like a caesar.  It wasn't bad, it just wasn't what I thought I ordered.   My favorite entree here is the Hawaiian Rib Eye.  OMG, it is my fave steak I've ordered anywhere, because the marinade is super tasty.  The french fries are perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Another thing we like is the live jazz music that starts around 6pm.  I could sit there all night!

IwA3tbbXhNdCx43G6qnnRg.review_text: This place has changed. We've come here for steak in the past. This time the blackened rib-eye, and the prime-rib, both ordered medium rare, were like leather. My hubs was wearing a cap, and normally he'd take it off before sitting down, but since this restaurant seems to let anyone in, including people in shorts and sneakers or sandals, we figured it'd be ok to keep it on. Nope, one of the maitre d's came over and requested he take it off. He complied, but come on, if you're going to put on airs, don't give your customers silverware wrapped up in their napkins. You might expect that from Denny's. In addition, they really should do something about their acoustics. It's really impossible to have a conversation there unless you're a narcissist. When we left, our ears were ringing.

UoPU3dtTSFpz3LvCgo633A.review_text: Food and ambience was perfect.  Had reservations and we were seated promptly which I appreciated.  Waitress was inattentive and lackluster.  Every customized part of the meal: water, horseradish, ketchup was overlooked and we had to request multiple times.  I'd still go back.  Artichokes to die for!

LaO4FZ2yPbqRjlv6QoaUJQ.review_text: This restaurant is pretty great. I'm not a huge fan of red meats or anything that really isn't chicken, but I was so down to eat at this place.  The atmosphere is great, the food is great, and the ambiance is just perfect. I don't recall the night that I came here, but I do remember a live jazz band preforming off to the side. It was a great touch and it just added to the whole vibe of the place.  The food (and drinks) was also pretty good. I ordered a rum and coke from the bar. The bartender had a pretty heavy hand for the mere price that he charged me. Love it! Also, we just came back from a day trip to Napa, so we definitely took advantage of the no corkage fee! YESSSSSSSIR!  I had the bbq pork ribs with fries. When they say "fall off the bone tender", they really mean it. It was just so good. Partnered up with some coleslaw and fries- no complaints there. I had a latte at the end of the night to top it all off, and for a meat joint, they make a pretty mean latte.   This place was well worth the money. Just a great atmosphere and a great place to sit and chat with friends in the evening.

37HswRimgBEf7_US-c3CDA.review_text: Taking an adage from Sade - "It's Never As Good As The First Time"  Sis & I brought our parents here after a day in the city & knowing Daddy likes a good steak & remembering them having delish veggie burgers, this seemed like a no-brainer for the whole family  Sticking true to form, Daddy got the ribeye steak & said it was alright.  Couldn't pinpoint anything specifically that was wrong w/ it or what exactly made it just okay but it wasn't outstanding & that's what I was hoping for  Mom ordered the Trout & loved her dish - said the fish was cooked very well  Sis got the Market Veggie Plate & it was a basic smattering of cooked veggies - it was okay but again, she wasn't raving over the deliciousness  I chose the Veggie Burger & this go-round, I wasn't impressed.  Just didn't have the depth of flavor that I've had in their previous burgers.  The bun was dry & the fries were cold....boo!  So given the smorgasbord of opinions & the fact none of us was bowled over, have to say this place is still okay but it wasn't as good as the first time

YKgrNyT29bfbMKMvQnhxVQ.review_text: Yum! Yum! Yum!  I'm obsessed with this place for a nice sit down lunch! It is on the expensive side but sooo worth it!  The first time I came here was on a work lunch. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich (that comes with cole slaw on top) and fries, which was DELICIOUS!    Today, I came here with friends who had just returned from a tourist ride to Alcatraz. Because it is right across the street from the Alcatraz Pier (Pier 33) and right down the road from my work, I suggested this spot for lunch and am so glad I did.  My out of town friends LOVED it and so did I!   This time I ordered the rotisserie chicken thai salad and 4 hours later, I am still stuffed but am also salivating at how scrumptious it was! Yum!   I can't wait to come back.  Note: some say this is a Houston's but with pricier food. I have never been to a Houston's so am not arguing that point.  Regardless of what it is and what it is like, it is some of the best food around the embarcadero/fisherman's wharf area, in my opinion.

C2iUp05zKi0u61SuVSLjrA.review_text: Yes, I know it's a chain, and chains are heresy in SF.  But Houston's gets a pass.  Those double-cut pork chops make my Top Cravings List.  The Thai Steak salad has a great sweet & spicy flavor.  And the tortilla soup and brownie are staples of my mid-week diet.  The pork ribs are what originally kept me coming back years ago, and 9 times out of 10 they deliver.    The only thing that concerns me are the menu tweaks they've been implementing in the last year.  In particular, the new bun on the French Dip.  Taking an item so spectacular and then changing one of the key elements makes no sense.  The new buns are denser, and don't have the crispy-chewy texture that make the French Dip overwhelmingly grubby. Now it's simply above average.  You lose a star for screwing up the FD.  If you ever mess with my DC chops, I don't know what I'll do.  UPDATE, 1/16/08:  Popped in for dinner last night.  Asked the waitress about the French Dip bun...  she said they're still using the new one, and she gets complaints all the time.  Head Houston's Chef...  step up and get your act together with the bread!  The good news is that the double cut chops were as tender and peppery as ever.  The better news is that the red cabbage and goat cheese was available, and the chicken and rice soup special (with avocado, jack cheese, and other goodies) was as good as ever.  My buddy got the Hawaiian Rib Eye...  I've never dared but got a bite of his.  EXCELLENT.

NHtbK5NKu2XwbZXfcgJu7A.review_text: This place is my go to place with my friends for a nice casual dinner.  The food is consistently good and the service is excellent.  Also love the free corkage!

WYz9rx9M9FHF_XXY0g-tsQ.review_text: ***If your looking for upscale "casual" dining, this is the place.*** A friend recommended that i take a first date to Houstons for a casual romantic dinner.  Thanks for the recommendation... Elements were all there. Location=Near the waterfront on the embarcadero. Food=Delicious steaks and burgers. Ambience=Cozy and romantic, kinda dark which made it even better. Price= I was a college student at the time so it definitely didnt break the bank. Loved this place then, and now that I've graduated and work down the street, I will be visiting more often. Definitely a local hit, and I can see why. Check out their menu yourself... hillstone.com/pdf_menus/…

t9rdfVCOg_HnaH7RN_r7mQ.review_text: Food and ambiance were good, but the staff there has a bit of an attitude. The desserts there are supposed to be really good, but the lack of enthusiasm and good customer service from the staff left a bad taste in my mouth.  We came in a big group, but regardless a smile or two would have been nice on a Sunday regardless if they wanted to be there or not.  Will not be returning.

Z2AuC5sWT4mjPgt2ga7S0Q.review_text: We went to Houston's Saturday evening and of course ordered the Spinach Artichoke dip as appetizer for me and my date and then decided to order their burgers. OMG!! The Baltimore Chicken Breast sandwich is amazing! one of BEST burger I have eaten everrrrr!! Oh man! you guys should try it. Rotisserie/Grill Meat just melts in your mouth and oh so juicy.  The House mad buns are the business. I know my date enjoyed her burger that was just as big as her because she ate almost the whole thing! I guess fresh ground chuck can have a special effect on you.  Their service is GREAT! Their waiters are professionals & courteous as always Big Thank you's goes out to the hostess and the bar staff for taking good care of us!  I'll Keep coming back

B158g1dMevC21kDwv52Quw.review_text: My wife's friend was in town, and we were going to head over to the Burger Bar because my wife really wanted to try the $60 burger after raving about the $40 version I had at the Burger Bar in Vegas.  But my wife's friend was craving a steak, so checking Yelp, I found Hillstone on the Embarcadero given 4 stars by my cuz Hyung L.  So, Hyung, you're to blame for my review.  As for ambiance, it's very nice.  Very classy with nice water and stone decorations everywhere.  But there was one problem, and I'll get to it in a bit.    So, we go for the big stuff on the menu.  My wife's friend and I get the prime rib and my wife gets the Filet Mignon.  And we start with the salad and spinach and artichoke dip to start.    The house salad, while very tasty, was tiny.  And at 10 bucks, a total rip.  The dip was delicious and plentiful, well worth the $13.  The fries we got for my son were just average.  It would have been nice if it were seasoned or had some truffle oil, and at $5, not very happy with it.  Onto the main course.  The prime rib and the fillet were well aged and very soft.  But it wasn't seasoned well (if at all).  And prime rib had a non-existent crust.  I have had much better at Ruths Chris or Donovan's.  So, for the price, it was just okay.    At these prices, would have thought that we would have a great view of the Bay and the Bay Bridge, but we were just 1 block inland and had a view blocked by Pier 23.    While it wasn't a bad experience, when dishing out almost 2 bills for 3 people, I would like to come away more satisfied by the experience.  I think I need to try House of Prime Rib next time.  I will say, the staff was very nice (albeit a little slow) and was very friendly to my son.  They had a toy for him to play with and I didn't get any stink eyes when he shouted a couple times.

dEFs9YW--07PyDKe-ya-OQ.review_text: Came here with my family and gf after touring the city.  We got a corner booth, near the piano and jazz and right near the fireplace.  Great atmosphere.    The food was very good, I sampled a bit of the prime rib and the ribeye steak.  Everything was very flavorful and tender, so no steak sauce was needed.  One of the better steak places I have been to recently.  It is a chain, but will definitely come back again.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: It was a beautiful day, perfect to sit outside with a drink.  Came here with my sister and grabbed the back outdoor seats.  Place your order at the bar and they'll bring everything to you.  What we had: fries - $5 - good, really like their bbq sauce (asked for it on the side) barley salad - $5 - good, with wedges of tomato, some mint, basil and radishes Anchor steam - $6  Lemon drop - $13 - they automatically use Ketel Citron

wZ13br0UIvwn_txbZ1vRvg.review_text: The sky was clear, the air was fresh and the meat was delicious!  I was looking for a slightly upscale steakhouse for my mother's birthday.  Initially we checked out Sam's on Belden Place and found that it was closed :(  This turned out on our favor though, because we ended up at my first choice, Houston's.    We were told it would be a 15 minute wait but it ended up being more around 5 minutes.  Our server was very friendly and made conversation in an honest way.    Cheese Bread: it is what it is and I love bread and cheese so it was worth ordering even though I felt a little full before my entree even arrived.   The Thai Steak Salad was delicious although I am wondering if it would have been better to order the dressing on the side.  The steak bites in the salad were not tough and perfectly prepared.  The Thai Steak Salad is a good way to go if you want a little meat but are not in the mood for an entire steak.  Also, the bits of mango in the salad added a fresh and sweet taste that complemented the noodles and peanuts nicely.   Flat Iron 9 ounce steak was delicious and served with flavorful mashed potatoes.  If you don't like your meat red you may want to ask for medium well.   Wild Salmon with sauteed spinach.  Perfectly seasoned and a good size portion.  And for dessert....the sundae.  The three of us, my mom, boyfriend and I shared the sundae and it was literally one of the best sundaes I have had in my life.  The chocolate was real and the whipped cream not too sweet.   The service was great and so was the food.  The outdoor seating was packed because the weather was perfect.  This is what you would want in a steakhouse.   The bill came to around 150 and that included four vokda cocktails.

-tGKxjzTe_hWTXgl7Ohicw.review_text: Terrible restaurant with terrible attitude! We made reservation at 8 pm. Wen we reaches here at 745, they told us they were putting tables together. But we had been standing just next tote front for 45 mins before our table was ready!!! Because the previous reservation at 6 doesn't know the next reservation at 8 pm and they took multiple pics when we had been waiting, waiting and waiting. The server kept lying to us. No seats, no water, but just waiting! Nothing is acceptable in a decent restaurant tonight!

NQeaA40wP66CZTAApFo9OQ.review_text: Seriously...as good as it gets. I've been on the search for a steakhouse that makes my mouth salivate at even the thought and I've found it. Well, let me back up...  I came here with two close friends for my 30th bday. We were going to go to Alexander's Steakhouse, but given the price difference between the two places, this was HALF the price and it didn't charge a corkage fee (double bonus)! I got the prime rib plate and instead of fries, got the yummy loaded baked potato. We also ordered the spinach dip for an appetizer and got the warm 5-nut brownie for dessert - holy shimolee...this was the perfect dinner if I ever had one.   The prime rib was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. It was like butter and I had enough left over to last me the rest of the weekend! Soooooooo worth the money.

ipKfyZgsLKmCDRQPg1Nf9g.review_text: It used to be called Houston's but the name changed because the local government didn't want chains operating in the city.  The food is good, service is very good and there is a great bar scene.

IxKVvGmFIEz77YYL-5_YxA.review_text: This place will always be Houston's to me. The food here is always so reliable and dependable. It's always delicious and the same as you remembered it. The brussel sprouts, when in season, are the side dish you should go for. The burger is great, the fries are great too, and the lamb chops are awesome. The ribs, of course, are still deliciously falling of the bone. The service here is perfect; each staff member is so helpful and knowledgeable. Really great.   This place can get busy, but it's fine during the week. Make a reservation if you plan on dining on the weekend, but they have a full bar with plenty of seating and tv's to watch, so it's okay if you just walk in.   Atmosphere is great. Good for a date or just dinner with friends. They have tables with chairs and booths available so Houston's, I mean Hillstone, is the perfect place for any kind of occasion.

hmo0f30W7enwpems5L_2HA.review_text: I can't say enough good things about this place, and I have only been once.  The food, the service, the ambiance, the location... doesn't get much better than Hillstone.  I am literally trying to think up occasions so I have a reason to go back.  I hope its very soon ;)

wBLFdknLbYKl71U0cOT5WQ.review_text: Most tender, delicious steak I've ever eaten. Hawaiian Rib-eye was amazing. Live jazz band makes for great atmosphere, very impressed.

WsC4GysNUklYfzyQ3oEyqA.review_text: Like the girl you loved, then liked, then loved again... Hillstone is back.   At the ahi tuna platter, the French dip and some great tequilas.  Jonathan was great and the place was packed and fun.   Go!

d70MJAvHf2O-pD7SkJlFfw.review_text: I had dinner there with my sister and dad.   I ordered the prime rib cooked rare, and it was delicious as the meat was soft and juicy. I also liked how I didn't encounter a gristle on the way, too.Their House-Cut French Fries come with either ketchup or spicy mayo...or both! I was surprised to see my sister dipping her fries into the spicy mayo! She typically doesn't like foods that are spicy, but I guess the flavor and spice was just that good!   My sister ordered the BBQ ribs. At first she was scared because she was wearing her brand new shirt, and later I looked at her plate and it was all just bones. It turned out she used her fork and knife only since the meat literally just glided off!   My dad got the Hawaiian rib-eye, cooked rare. It was definitely smaller than what I got, but the soy ginger marinade complimented the rib-eye very well.   Last, we got the hot fudge sundae. You actually pour the fudge on yourself. The fudge was really thick and sweet and just the fact you got to do the pouring was awesome! The ice cream was good and the whip cream was somewhat light, but the fudge really stood out for me the most.  The service is definitely nice with the surprisingly fast service and the waiters always checking up on you. So that's a plus.  I hope to definitely come back again. Mmmm!

rnskPt-c9hllJg3uytoVXw.review_text: My favorite restaurant of all time!!! Regardless of the fact that this is a chain restaurant, it is AMAZINGGG. The food never disappoints and always leaves you satisfied. I hate that the name has been changed because this place will always be known as Houston's. If you haven't been here before, you're missing out ;)

0VA4UWkK2FVaCMLgw7IpJg.review_text: Baby back ribs!! Every time I dine here, I order the baby back ribs. Fall off the bone yummy goodness. Just get the ribs!

ycZ5iwN9AyhkcPLbcme-1A.review_text: I have been here multiple times and the food is great.  However sometimes the service is a bit stuck up!  Went here recently and the server was not friendly and a little rude.  Will not be going back

3utKvLac876Okds0ynn_NA.review_text: Limited parking, suggest a garage. Always crowded, busy and noisy. The decor is dark and rustic but the seating is comfortable. Wait staff is good and overall excellent for being a chain restaurant. The food is good, best in that particular locale -  but still average on the scale of SF cuisine.

GcWXTgLffuZ5BsuZGcl02Q.review_text: 600+ reviews?!  gooohhhllleee!!!  Ok, this will probably be my shortest review to date then.  Food: It's so darn good!  This was my first stop after arriving in SF.  I went balls to the wall and got their prime rib and it was superb.  I'm salivating right now just thinking about it.  Their side dishes are delicious too!    Service: Great; very attentive staff  Ambiance: I don't know what it is about their booths, but it made me want to fall asleep after eating!  It must have been the food coma, but the booths are tres comfortable!    Location: Quietly hidden and parking can be a problem during busier hours.    Final note: My motto on yelp is not to review chain restaurants.  It's not my style, however, for this restaurant I will make an exception.  The food really is good here and you are assured to leave satisfied and full.  Don't forget the vino with your food!

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: THE GRILLED ARTICHOKES ARE THAAA BOMB HERE!   A girlfriend and I went here for dinner. I also ordered one of their specials, grilled halibut with a shiitake ponzu sauce with dirty louisiana rice as a side. It was so delicious and mouth watering in every bite.   Everything was excellent especially Cassie, our server. She was very attentive and friendly, helpful and down to earth.   I'd come back here again just for those artichokes. ;o)

kSCi9zYkeB9dTYtcz-jzNQ.review_text: The food is stellar and came fast. In fact, I received my Tortilla soup before we finished our order, a first. I could go on about the tasty food, perfectly cooked steak and delicate spinach side, but this review is about service. The staff is exceptional, knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Packed on Valentines day, but I never felt rushed and the staff was on top of their game with no shortage of smiles.

0jQDOstEQECkL9ylX4bwDA.review_text: Dear Houston's,  We first met in Dallas and I thought that it was going to be a long and passionate relationship! I really thought that you and I had something special...different, if you will. I was in a party of about 14 and you tended to us perfectly; nary a mistake was made! So imagine my delight upon finding you located right in my backyard!  With an 8:30pm reservation tucked into my back pocket, we were off to the city to enjoy everything that I so lovingly remembered about you...the perfect appetizers, the succulent meat, the way you placed your hand in the small of my back just so...Needless to say, I was very happy to be rendezvousing with you again.  Imagine my surprise as we walked in 5 minutes early and were told that our 8:30pm reservation couldn't be honored, but that you would be able to seat us "just after 8:30." Hmmm...as I recall, a reservation is supposed to RESERVE you a table at the specified time, no? Fine...we can be patient...FOR A MOMENT.  So, why? WHY? Why in the love of God were we made to wait for half an hour? 30 MINUTES? Standing. Waiting. WITH A RESERVATION?!?! This annoys me endlessly my love. My date was almost ready to walk out and eat somewhere else...in fact, he went back up to your hostess podium to inquire as to when our table would be ready.  Once you seated us at 9pm, after several apologies and the offer of a free dessert, we finally ordered dinner...now that we were STARVING!  But that's not all...Of course, the your waitress swapped the cooking orders for our steaks, so we had to send them back because one was too done and the other not done enough. You totally failed. TWICE.  When we finally got to eat dinner, your food was good, but when we had to pay your $100+ bill at the end of the night, the experience just hardly seemed worth it...  After the AMAZING experience I had with you at the Houston's in Dallas, your San Francisco restaurant has taught me that Texas Steakhouses definitely aren't overrated.  Where's your A-Game San Fran...pull your life together!  Yours Truly, Becky M.

6X1D7uMgjvk1xAVdfqO5bg.review_text: I had not been to Houstons (hillstone) in almost 10 years.  My first experience was in Dallas and the hickory bbq burger which was amazing.  Since we decided to go for dinner and bring our two small kids,  I figured to go with an dinner entree like ribs or the ribeye.  We ordred our entrees and the artichoke appetizer.  I took my son to restroom and we get back and our entrees are out before the appetizer.  I asked the server and she forgot.  Also I had to ask for water refills, we were in the first seating at 5:45 p.m. so it wasn't even busy yet.  After I eat the large rack of ribs, I was still hungry.  Maybe it's just me but I did not leave satified for $32 with my meal which is not a good sign.  The service was not attentive enough for me since an appetizer was forgotten and it felt like we always had to track down the server or make eye contact from a distance to get something.  I'd like to try the ribeye next time but if the service is spotty, may be better to eat it at the bar.

XP-XemWwq4Rmivgb9HKkFw.review_text: My friend took me here for my birthday dinner.   The prime rib was very good.   It wasn't as red as I would have thought and I think it might have needed to be reheated.  The fries it came with were delicious!   Very small and narrow fries....   You really got the crunch.     My friend had the rib eye steak which he seemed to enjoy as well with a side of mash.  We both managed to polish our meat dishes pretty well.  We started with the spinach dip, which I had had before on previous visits.   It was pretty good.   I had to keep myself from putting dip on bread for fear it may fill me up.     I'd have to say my favorite was the sundae.  Yes.   It was a sundae with a nice tureen of hot chocolate syrup you can keep refilling the dish with.   The pralines with the syrup and ice cream.... decadent...   I melted.   yummm......

u1SbGzB-QeFk3JrSWZHQbA.review_text: Best thing: No corkage fee!  Nice benefit: Music trio. Needs to change:  Can I finish my salad before getting my entree? Also what will it take to get hot mashed potatoes in San Francidco?

9he5kgX8GG2L4ggByOgBnQ.review_text: Flawless is the word that comes to mind. Incredible atmosphere that is comfortable for casual and appropriate for business. Live music most nights. Excellent service staff throughout the restaurant. Delicious meals, shout out to the 'french dip' and the ahi.  Can be a bit pricey, but for San Francisco it's more than a fair deal. Great location, walking distance to Pier 39, Levi's Plaza and the rest of the Waterfront district.

IvkWcJaknKBlrGzIC7uKtw.review_text: First off...shout out to Ben, our wonderful server (I promised you would be included in my review). I gotta love a man who will bring me a freshly frozen glass for my warming martini.   I need to thank those Yelpers out there who shared the free bread and olive secret with the rest of us...just ask and you will receive a tasty treat.
