Now, on to the review...the spinach artichoke dip was yummy, the ribs (baby back pork ribs) are to friggen die for, the crab cakes were tasty and crabby, the prime rib was cooked to perfection (but not better than House of Prime Rib, so don't use this as a substitute), and the french dip was meh (nothing to write home about). Finally, we shared two desserts  among 6 of us - hot fudge sundae was amazing and the apple walnut cobbler was....oh...my...god...good.   If you get there early, like we did, they will allow you to put your name in for a table, but you cannot make reservation (which sucks). So, if you are hungry and it is before 6 PM on a Friday, you will eat promptly...if you want to eat later, bring a snack, 'cause you'll be waiting for a while. But, make sure to ask for Ben's table, and he seemed to love it when I asked for the free olives.  Oh, I almost forgot...easy street parking which is a plus in the city, and the loaded potato contains green onions, not chives (in case you care, like my husband does).

CJ6b65FgsEZzBkSoqZnElg.review_text: I would give this place 5 stars if their Lump Crab Cakes were that.  I found them to be swimming in a sauce that I didn't recognize, and they tasted watered down if that makes any sense.    THe spinach dip is great.  The double stuffed pork chop is juicy and seasoned nicely.  The prime rib was thick, juicy, not as tender as I would have hoped.  The ribs were fantastic and fell off the bone, I pulled the meat off with a fork and they were not dry.  The fries were also very good, slaw was average and the cosmos were strong.  One more thing, it is incredibly dark in this place, perfect for a date...not so much if you want to host a party, not only is it too dark but it was a bit loud, although we were seated next to the bar.

VJlWmXMZXsRtEkmqMrzsUw.review_text: I have been to the Houston's in New Orleans and I really loved it, so I was excited to try Houston's in San Francisco. Let me just say that the entire staff of the restaurant are totally awesome!   We called and asked about the place and the hostess (Jill) stayed on the phone with us for a good 5 minutes telling us where to park, good and bad parts of town, comedy club near by, etc. She was the best.   The spinach dip was amazing and complementary from the manager since we raved about her hostess staff!! I got jumbo-lump crab cakes and they were to die for!!! The rest of my party got meat of all kinds and could not stop talking about it. They were men and still had food to take home!!   Houston's was on the pricier side but it was a lot of fun, our waiter Nick was awesome too and the whole place had a really beautiful atmosphere!!! There is also a no corkage fee if you want to bring your own wine!!

8icrAaVHZ71tuiobsW_SYQ.review_text: I was feening for ribs. My best friend wanted to take me out for my birthday, so we ended up at Houstons. It kinda sucks there are no rib places to sit down and have a nice dinner at. The place was packed and it seemed more like a date spot.   Got to our table and first thing, the chairs. THEY ARE FUN! its like a comfy office chair you can swivel and lean back in. That was a interesting experience. We started off with a soup of the day, a white clam chowder. We also had the oak grilled artichokes, which was my first artichoke experience. Very good although I was a artichoky noob. I am also Chinese so I tried to get as much artichoke out of the leaves as I could. That was pretty fail. I ordered the ribs and they were delicious. I swapped the cole slaw for a side of dirty rice and it was kinda like Chinese sticky rice to me. The ribs was delicious and the meat fell right off the bones. I was pretty stuffed and my friend finished off the ribs for me.   I gotta come back for the infamous Hawaiian ribeye.

HWP9dUXLCU0yO9cCRqKOZg.review_text: 3.6  My 100th review!!!! and a special one since I was treated to this place for my b'day (I love the prime rib @ Houston's Pasadena, CA)  Service was excellent and we were promptly seated upon arrival (reservations recommended). The ambiance felt just like the Pasadena location so I was really hoping that the taste would also be the same.  Also note that they have no private lot and tht they're directly opposite the Pier (forgot which number)...   So, gf and I both had the prime rib except she had corns seasoned with curry on the side and I had the skinny fries... both were super yummy!  The prime rib on the other hand was not as tender and flavorful as what I remembered... But, I'll definitely pick this place over Alexander's Steakhouse in Cupertino ANYDAY!!   Overall, "okay" experience... I'm still on the search for a better place for prime ribs (with good sides) in the bay area...

5bovTFg-O0TjjuzQhWfpIA.review_text: Really nice venue. The live band was pretty amazing. The staff was friendly and awesome. The wine was great. The food though...not so much.   Went with a group of 6 coworkers. We had to push our reservation out 30 minutes and the staff was more than accommodating on a busy night and gave us an incredible table by the band.  I'm only giving Hillstone 3 stars because of the food. I had:     -   Spinach & Artichoke dip    -   Caesar salad    -   Filet mignon     -   Ice cream sundae  The salad and sundae were incredible and up to standards.  The spinach & artichoke dip tasted like it was from a package. It was pretty bland and you didn't get much of it. We had two orders for our table and I found myself dipping the chips into the sides of sour cream because that's all we had left and it honestly tasted better.  The filet mignon was ordered medium rare and it was cooked perfectly. The problem was, it wasn't seasoned at all. It tasted like a steak you cook at home, you're so worried about cooking it for the right amount of time that you forget to do anything to the meat. Even a pinch of salt would've done wonders.  Overall, Hillstone is a fun experience. We had a blast and it's convenient if you work in the Telegraph Hill area. But I'm not going to be craving their food anytime soon.

CsguIDuWWwsy58seF52RoQ.review_text: Tip - Make a reservation or be prepared to sit at the bar for a while because this place gets packed!  Had heard many great things about Houston's from Ryry's friends and finally got to enjoy a meal with them and had them show us the ropes. Here's how it went...  We started with the spinach artichoke dip which I thought was like regular restaurant fare. The salsa that accompanied it, I believe, tasted a lot like Tostito's Medium Salsa. I personally like and buy that brand and heat-level of salsa but I was expecting more from a fancy schmancy joint like Houston's. Oh well. Onto the next course...  The house veggie burger was highly recommended so I chose it with an open mind as I am not a veggie burger connoisseur... but I was interested. And when it came... wow! It was huge! A huge mound of skinny fries came with it, too! I took my first bite and... thought it was okay. The burger was falling apart which was a little annoying but I still ate it. The burger itself was sweet, bean-y and rice-y. I'm glad I tried it but it didn't really appeal too much to my taste buds. I ate almost all the fries (as I usually do) and ate almost all of Ryry's garlicky brussel sprouts that came with his meat burger. MMMMMM! SOOO GOOD. Perfectly cooked - I could have made a meal out of those and the fries. Awesome.   3 stars for the brussel sprouts, the great service (the waiter accommodated my pickiness very nicely) and the fact that they don't charge you when you bring your own bottle of wine (thanks to Ryry's friends for the wine!). Minus two because I wasn't really wowed by my burger and because the bill came out to $50 for the two of us with tax and tip. Kinda pricey for 2 burgers, fries, veggies and a splitting of dip and chips. But hey, they've got to pay for the rent in the Embarcadero somehow.

ca0N3Fl3FckAWyupp6sDgQ.review_text: First off, there is one and only one reason I go to Houston's - their French dip sandwich. If you don't like French dip sandwiches, beef or me rambling you may as well stop reading here and check out what the rest of the fabulous Yelp community has to say about this joint.  Still here? A'ight (Hmm, does anybody still say this other than the count on 'Greg the Bunny' and old crackas like me?), let's roll.  Simply put, Houston's has one of the two best French dip sandwiches (the other being offered by Harris Ranch) that I have ever eaten. Featuring tender slices of beef piled high between a roll with some kind of glossy coating (butter, I hope), this sandwich almost melts in your mouth. It's complemented nicely by a huge pile of shoestring fries and the standard au jus for dipping, although it's so good you don't really even need the au jus!  I've had a few other things here over the years, but this sandwich has blocked out any memories of them...in comparison to the French dip they're kinda like the anonymous crew members who get killed in those old 'Star Trek' episodes...forgotten by the time Captain Kirk is tapping the alien chick.

GmLpBIfp2_lug_UPkCAFNA.review_text: Great steak joint off the Embarcadero.  Great bar scene and outdoor seating.  What I ate: 1. Spinach dip - OMG YUM!  Great for sharing.  Delicious! 2.  Hawaiian Steak - Slighly sweet but very tasty.  Not a bad steakhouse.  Great size steak and really juicy! 3. Ice Cream Sundae- THIS IS A  MUST!  This is just a simple sundae with warm chocolate syrup and simply wonderful!  You must order this sundae. That chocolate syrup was addictive.  I wanted to drink that syrup!  Great date place and great service!

FuzkZhkZKZHPOCSzWIjfGQ.review_text: Great food, ambiance and service. Extremely atisfied with the artichok dip for appitizer. The Gin martini is absolutly fantastic. The waiter would come by and switch out our martini glass with fresh cold ones. I had the famous french dip sandwich which was fantastic. The portions is great! It's gin And my boyfriend ordered prime rib which was just to die for. It's perfectly cook and tender. The five nut brownie dessert was AMAZING! Had a wonderful experience, I would recomand this place if you're looking for a romantic night out.

f0VmPuhqYVGXVl15r8x_uA.review_text: We love this restaurant.   The crab cakes and the prime rib sandwich are my favs.  The cole slaw is freakishly good.  Great decor and atmosphere.  Just wish they'd kept the name Houstons.

ee-nxKW_585xnGEyu3A84w.review_text: I've been going to this joint since i was 17..umm that was like last year..hee hee..maybe a bit more than that. Anyways... Very consistent and never disappointing.   The Spinach and Artichoke dip is very tasty but not for the dieter that's watching calories. I just cant seem to deviate from the Thai steak and noodle salad. they practically throw in an order of filet in it!! no joke! for $19, i'm a fan. I've had the cheeseburger and the chicken sandwich as well and they are both excellent and very filling, enough for two for sure. The service has always been positive with fun and enthusiastic servers. I need to go here more :)

n7wRp-1vNTM8wSVwwa_MLQ.review_text: I came here based upon a review from a fellow Yelper for my anniversary dinner. I was craving red meat and my bf didn't know where to go; we ended up at Hillstone. I'd like to think this restaurant choice was one of the better ideas of mine. GO ME! WHOOOO! Ok, enough of that...  We made a last minute reservation on a Sunday evening after a long day of doing touristy things (The SF Zoo & Fisherman's Wharf). We parked the car, exchanged gifts, waited for our reservation time and to my surprise I was happy that I did make a reservation because the restaurant was packed!   The ambiance was different from what I expected. It was dark, had mood lighting, live music but was quite noisy due to the boisterous laughter and chatting. It's a 'fancy' restaurant with a downtown vibe where conversation is ok and being dressed down is better. We sat down, ordered the Barbecue Pork ribs ($29) (like my friend and so many other tip leavers suggested) and the Hawaiian Rib Eye ($34). The food arrived and it was food fireworks everywhere! The ribs' meat was literally falling off the bones and the rib eye was juicy and flavorful. Heavenly sigh...  I must also add that our waitress was literally like a ninja. She somehow knew when we needed something and knew when we didn't. It's not like some other restaurants where the waiter/waitress hovers over the table constantly checking on you nor was it the kind of service where no one comes to check on you. The waitress was darling, well-mannered and efficient.   Thank you Hillstone for making my anniversary dinner a success!

21Of7O8EAJikNnKsNZBTvg.review_text: Hillstone (or Houston) is the model for consistently excellent food and service. We've been going to their restaurants all across the country (from Bethesda to NYC to Miami to Boca Raton to San Francisco) over the past 10 years and it never fails to disappoint. Start at the bar - I usually go with a gray hound since they have fresh squeezed grapefruit. My top 3 plates for a Houston's newbie are:  1. Crispy chicken sandwich - Ask for honey mustard on the side and spread onto buns. This is the one of the best sandwich you've probably ever had.   2. Cheeseburger - The best burger out there, IMO. Made with fresh ground sirloin every morning. Its great - up the game by putting some fries beneath bun.   3. Baby back ribs - Tender and flavorful. Not the biggest plate in the menu, so I order when I'm not as hungry or have had some appetizers.

cxPxX1EOnULJynuG9sS1xA.review_text: I'm not a fan of chains, but this is one of the best steak houses I've been to in the San Francisco Bay Area. They'll make your steak exactly the way you like it. If you ask for a medium-rare fillet minion, you will get it medium rare. Just add a glass of wine or some pomegranate juice and you're set.   I'm sure all the reviews here have talked about the grilled Artichoke appetizer, and there's a reason. Its freakin good. The seared tuna salad is to die for. The place is usually crowded in the evenings so you'd best make a reservation.

r0HUEzQhzsmE7MnbB8Hwqg.review_text: Now this is my spot for real. Hawaiian ribeye with a loaded baked potato. Don't forget the no corkage fee. You can bring your own bottle without a fee, that's the best part.

YU7W1l2xD0IVIkmvLf8KkA.review_text: If I could give them no stars I would... Since it was my wife's birthday she requested to be taken to this place since it was the closest to 5 stars, so I did. We walked in at 5 and we are told that since we did not have a reservation wait time would be 30-40 min max. Let's just say we ended up leaving at 6:50pm. Only reason we stayed that long was 1) it was my wife's birthday and she wanted to eat there, 2) One of the chefs saw how long we were waiting and was nice enough to give us some fries while we waited to be seated. While we were waiting to be seated I noticed that the guy who was encharge of giving the chefs the tickets and double checking to make sure that the order was right made 3 mistakes while we were standing there. On one of the plates that he was spicing up he over spiced one of them and wiped it down with his bare finger. Something I'm sure that the client wouldn't like to know or see.. After that I asked my wife if she wanted to go somewhere else at which she replied "yes" immediately. Never again will we go here. Just wanted to thank the nice chef who offered us some freshly cooked fries, didn't ask his name but he was the one working the grill where the salmon, steak, and burgers are made. Thank you.

hN10BjQjJgiRFZfTU9oO3Q.review_text: Okay, so let me preface by saying I've been going to Houston's for over sixteen years now.  I've been to two in New Orleans/Metarie, LA, two in NYC, three in South Florida (Fort Lauderdale-now closed, Boca Area, and North Miami Beach), and Boston.  The Boston location gets 5 stars, no question, as does the NMB location.  I'd give 4 to the other locations.  But I've never been treated more rudely than at the San Francisco location.  So this is a review of the treatment, not the food, which is consistent with Houston's quality. I've been to Houston's at least two hundred times in twenty years, maybe four hundred.  I was new to CA at the time (July last year), and I told the waitress how much I liked the Boston Location and was happy to be there at the SF location. She could care less, though she told me the name of one of the managers who work at the Boston location.  Since I was returning to Boston the following week, I asked her to write it down so I could ask for that manager when I returned to the Boston location.  She refused, then disappeared and must have passed me on to another server.  It was the first time I left a marginal tip at Houston's   I will never return to Houston's Embarcadero.  By the way parking is awful here.  The price was higher than I've ever paid at any other Houston's  and add to that the 1.5% San Francisco health tax and you have the recipe for a bad experience.  Okay, I can't blame the stupid tax or bad parking on that, but the service was awful. Maybe that's snobbish San Francisco, or a bad waitress.  Nonetheless I'll never go back.  Well I get my Houston's fix at Bandera in Sacramento-- nice folks, 50% same menu with the Evil Jungle Steak Salad, Spinach Dip, etc. I give them 4 stars since they don't have those shoestring fries.    I'll save my Houston's visits for Boston and Miami.  Skip this place-- it doesn't live up to the Houston's name.  It's amazing how a bad server and also an impersonal hostess, coupled with high prices can make a fan into a detractor.  Maybe they were upset that I came here alone-- well that's their problem.

2xs2qVVWv-b_hVMPZQXMDQ.review_text: Houston's - Embarcadero has a name change to the corporate parent "Hillstone".  It appears that the San Francisco location on the Embarcadero is the only Houston's to have this identity change. I have visited the Pasadena location recently and still a "Houston's".  Menu and selections are unchanged, still one of the best restaurants for gourmet dining along the San Francisco Embarcadero.  I have never had a bad meal at Houston's-Hillstone. The food is fresh, the meat dishes always tender and flavorful.  Two guests with me recently tried the gourmet cheeseburger plates and both said it was hands-down the best cheeseburgers they have ever had.  In-house ground sirloin with seasonings and spices added during the grind process.  The salmon has always been my favorite and never disappointing.  Desserts are a real sleeper, freshly made and delicious.   Hillstone isn't stingy with either main courses or dessert portions. You won't leave hungry.   Service has always been good, the wait staff attentive. The interior is low level lighting, dimly lit to give a very classy feel to the restaurant, yet at the same time giving off a warm glow.  Very comfortable seating with a pleasant level of privacy. Great location on the Embarcadero, easy to find, but street parking at times a bit difficult. There is a pay to park lot a short block away and Hillstone's will validate your parking stub to get half off the fee.  As San Francisco restaurant pricing compares, Hillstone is a great value and you are getting high quality fresh food, nothing touristy here.   Located roughly half way between the Ferry Building and Pier 39, a great location for lunch or dinner. Easy walking distance between the two or you can catch the F line streetcar out front that will take you in either direction along the Embarcadero..

ccjoL-gEBKBXiOApHn2Bhw.review_text: This was certainly a great find - Thanks Yelp!   I have always felt that Pier 39 lacks a good eating establishment so I looked on Yelp to find something good.  This place is about 3 blocks from the Pier - definitely within walking distance.  We made a reservation (definitely recommended) and went over for dinner on a Sunday night after the Xmas tree lighting.  We got seated immediately but it took quite a while for someone to come over, and she wasn't even our "main waitress".  I thought perhaps we were getting the shaft since we had a child with us and this isn't really a kid-friendly place..  But that's the only reason they lose a star.  The food is awesome.  The spinach dip is pretty good.  Kind of over-hyped on Yelp and not worth $13 but good.  The entrees were also great - Prime rib, ribeye, and the ribs, which I loved.  All the sides were good - Definitely get the fries & baked potato!    Desert was good too - We had the hot apple cobbler & tiramisu.    Overall, great joint.  Super pricey and maybe a little over-hyped, but good.  I just wish the service was a little better for the price you pay.  Oh and last but not least there is no corkage - Great for groups, BYOB!

2lbiEo93uCx9fUMFmdIuMA.review_text: Easy to access location. I love how dark it is inside so you can be low key but enjoy really good food. I recommend the pork ribs as they are to die for. The services has always been very good.

LgF2CBHx1HuuQKmfdQyD_A.review_text: Great food and service all around! Started with the Garlic Bread and Artichoke Heart, couldn't have had anything better! For our entree we had the fall off the bone ribs with the baked potato and they were the best I've had in quite a while! We also had a burger with fries and it was great! Burger meat perfectly seasoned and cooked to order. Would definitely recommend to anybody, especially because the jazz music.

slAdkxpyrkYu3h40fDPrwA.review_text: So my English In -Laws were in town. They wanted to spend the day in SF. (No, not really, they only believe San Francisco begins and ends with Pier 39.... yeah I know) We were going to meet they up for some dinner. They wanted to eat at one of the fish places in Pier 39. Ah no. This was the best reviewed place that was walking distance. And being rather stuck in their ways about food, most of the other great places in SF were out anyway.   They loved it. "Ooooooo that was a nice bit of fish there Amy" " Ooooooo that there was a nice bit of meat"   Sigh   The food was very good for a chain. Perfect as the "American" place to eat. I had the crab cakes, wonderful. My husband had the grilled fish of the day (halibut) best I have ever had. Service was not that great. Messed up our order 4 times. (Really, how do you do that?) But it made the in laws happy so that's all that matters.

l77yffWe4XFj3yjYRbJTew.review_text: We sent my boyfriend's parents here for their 35th anniversary tonight.  We wanted to send a special bottle of champagne to them, and ran into issues ordering with the website, but Valerie (the hostess/manager on the phone) took care of us, went above and beyond our expectations and made sure the champagne was taken care of and served on time.  Thank you for making this occasion extra special!

8weq06C-fHEK1PpeDbYeFg.review_text: Houston's is (1) a chain restaurant (2) that serves American food (3) near the Wharf (4) and is named after a Texas city.    Quelle horreur!  *Nose turns up*  ...That is until the food arrives...  ...At which point, Houston's is (1) pan-seared snapper with herb and caper butter sauce and a side of tender broccolini; (2) juicy Hawaiian ribeye with a crispy, caramelized exterior and a loaded baked potato (think sour cream, bacon, chives and more); (3) wines by the goblet--not the glass--generously filled for your sloshing enjoyment; (4) and prompt, knowledgeable service that won't leave you hanging.    Houston's, you won me over.  As for Texas...we'll consider you after November 2008.

ai7YrPSENopoo0F2syLqxQ.review_text: Went here for lunch last week to celebrate some birthdays... not impressed. The service was not very friendly, we told the waitress we were celebrating birthdays and instead of responding with "happy birthday" she stared awkwardly and said, "oh". We  are sure it had to just have been our waitress so we'll likely return at some point, just not anytime soon.  Also, half of the menu is burgers/sandwiches but for a to go container we were given a very weird shaped box that would have required the remaining half of the burger to be laid on its side (which would have caused it to fall apart) ... the only other container available was 7 times bigger... weird... shrug  On a positive note, the spinach artichoke dip is so yummy!

zqttuCEWI4-l4ZBCbfGk6A.review_text: Had I not been told that Hillstone was part of a chain of Hillstone/Houston restaurants, I would have never known based on the ambiance, menu and service. The restaurant is a far cry from run-of-the-mill mediocre chains, offering a great menu and no corkage fee! While the ribs were a go-to for a good portion of our party, I opted for the tuna plate and was a big fan; it's a great option for those that aren't meat-eaters. Their appetizer menu isn't short on deliciousness, either. Between seven of us, we grabbed an order of grilled artichokes, smoked salmon and spinach/artichoke dip. They were all great choices, but the salmon was definitely a standout for me!   While the food is not cheap, the fact that there wasn't a corkage fee really made it an affordable evening out. We each brought a bottle of wine to share and aside from a few cocktails that we had while waiting for our table, we saved a ton on what could have been super high drink costs. I should also note that our service was great. I recognize that handling larger groups can be a pain, but our waitress was spot on. Overall, great experience. I would definitely give it another whirl to see how it is for a party of two. :)

5vd9a7Xx_LlFfVogN1UsJg.review_text: I used to enjoy Houston's. The prime rib was good, the French dip incredible, I loved the skillet cornbread, and the free nuts (or was it olives?) on request were a nice touch. But everything has gone downhill over the years. My most recent trip with my parents was the last straw. Mom's prime rib was terribly disappointing, especially considering the price. My French dip wasn't even good, much less great. The dressing on my fiancé's seared tuna salad tasted like generic Asian-style salad dressing. The skillet cornbread isn't on the menu anymore and there are no freebies. I can't recall what Dad had, but we were uniformly displeased.  Hillstone is also very loud, too dark, parking is a pain, getting a cab is impossible, and it's pretty darn expensive. I'll try Rutherford Grill again, but Hillstone screwed everything up when they changed the name and the other good parts of Houston's.

JeVAVbT9lbYf6Azmt9g3uQ.review_text: What a great dining experience!   My boyfriend and I wanted an upscale, relaxing dinner after having a crazy/busy week and after considering a few places on our "to try" list, we ultimately picked Hillstone, which had great reviews on Check Please! Bay Area.   From making the reservation, to showing up early and sitting in the bar, to enjoying every bite of our meal, and then returning to the bar to watch the last half of the Warriors game, our experience with the service was second to none. Our server, Natalie, was sweet, genuine, and extremely helpful throughout our meal. And the bartenders (both ladies with brunette hair tied up in a bun--didn't catch their names), were also very charming, friendly, and skilled at making the array of cocktails we ordered (mojito, French 75, kamikaze shots). And the hostesses were very accommodating of our last minute reservation changes.  As for the food: we were very impressed with the kale salad (ordered without chicken) and the bread and olives appetizer. The entrees we ordered--Hawaiian ribeye and crab cakes--were both quite good, but overall, we felt that the range of entrees were a bit too limited and that there was nothing on that part of the menu that we couldn't make as good or better at a much lower cost at home. But that said, clearly you are paying for much more than the food; you're paying for an upscale yet consistent dining experience, for romantic, contemporary ambiance, and for a great location in the city.   The best part of all: no corkage fee if you bring your own bottle of wine! This was huge for us as we had a bottle that we were saving for a special occasion--and it went perfectly with our meal.  We had a lovely time at Hillstone and will definitely be back in the future!

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: 3.5 stars.  I had a good burger here today at lunch...the fries were skinny and crisp but not hot enough.  Why oh why do restaurants have trouble sending out hot fries?!?   My dining companions enjoyed their salads (the ahi tuna looked great) and in past I've had some tasty margaritas on the patio.  If this weather keeps up I'll have to do more research.

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: Another food joint in convenient stumbling distance of my abode.  I have been here many times, but this will be my first review.  The steaks are always cooked right (medium rare for me), and they are tasty.  They are also a better value than the joints like Ruth's Chris and come with yummy fixins like sauteed spinach and/or fries.  The quality at Ruth's Chris may be 50% higher, but you pay 200% the cost for a slab of meat with no sides - hrmmm.....  Plus, the service has always been pleasant, and the place is cozy.  They have decent wines on the list.  Hillstone is a super-solid dinner venue, in my book.    Also, if you have a dog, sit outside and order drinks and apps while your pooch keeps you company.  Hillstone is really dog friendly and has doggy treats and a water bowl for your buddy.  :)

Vlf0c3wZ78e9vg5RDENqwg.review_text: This is a safe spot to take a client. The food has been better in my past trips though. The french dip and hot fudge sundae are awesome! My girlfriend and I ate at the bare last time we were there and had a less than satisfactory experience. I've eaten at the bar plenty of times and had great service but this time the bartender spent most of his time trying to flirt with my gf and getting info on the menu was like pulling teeth. Perhaps table service may have been a better idea.  They are known for great ribs but it is hard to stray from the french dip. The veggie burger is also very good.  There is always parking and you can usually get a table or a seat at the bar within 30 minutes giving you enough time to watch whatever sports game is on tv and have a drink.  With any luck I caught them on a bad day because I will go back with the hope that next time it isn't like walking into the twilight zone.

hRekiyvNRvYd3nVwHAZfDg.review_text: Some of the best ribs that I've ever had! Really good food and really good service. I would definitely come back here. The parking was a bit of a pain but its the city so you have to expect that.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: Wonderful dining partner... Great wine...   But then...  Overpriced... Super mediocre food.... Unfriendly service...   Won't be back.

ZmEVWKz1IHk-cCbPb27xlw.review_text: I still really love Houstons, and I think that I've been there almost 100 times over the last 8 years-so you know I like it here.  However, last night we came here with out-of-town friends. And because I was reading reviews n our way over there, and everyone kept mentioning their great prime rib-I couldn't believe i've never had it. So I ordered it, and now i'm really disappointed. Its not very good, and way too fatty. really you end up about 7 bites of actual meat the rest is covered in fat, which I just don't eat. So for 32 bucks I thought it was a rip-off. Stick with the fish or french dip or ribs-those are good!!!

cPBHVePR3y9fxDJo2PwT_A.review_text: The Ribs and Hawaiian Ribeye are the two best things on the menu! Ribs are the best in city by Far! Only problem is the pigs they get are anorexic, but they make it up with the sides. The service is great and the ambiance is nice. The only bad thing is that its very expensive. The ribs are $35 and the Ribeye is $34.

FbiLiZIf9-rF_8W_UWjNEg.review_text: I love Houston's.  They're solid in pretty much every respect. Consistently great food, and consistently fantastic service. How attentive is the service? A gentleman at the table next to ours was drinking a martini.  Out of nowhere comes one of the servers to swap the contents of his half-empty glass with a fresh, icy-frosty glass.   When I asked about how the two zinfandels they offer by the glass differed, I was brought a very generous taste of both to help me decide. And then there's the fact that Houston's remains one of the only restaurants in the city to waive any charges for corkage.   HOWEVER.  Being raised in the bay area during the 70s and 80s has made me particularly sensitive to certain ridiculous PC extremes.  This one in particular has always grated me raw, and is broadcast in all its frosted glory above Houston's womEn's restroom door (photo courtesy of Cat C.).     yelp.com/biz_photos/_D1E… I still love you, Houston's, but really??!!

yZR88-D-95Z5xeyMqyYQ7w.review_text: I really love the atmosphere inside Hillstone, everything for me felt really romantic and chill.  All the dim lights and the soothing jazz music playing in the background. Also, all the employees were so nice and sweet! I came here for my 1 year anniversary and I ordered the ribs and let me tell you how delicious it was, the meat was so soft, so much flavor, and it just slipped right off the bones. I ordered two appetizers and the Spinach Dip was amazing!  As well as the chili soup, I left that restaurant satisfied and extremely full. A year later I decided to go again, and this time I got the steak... And it was amazing! I love how juicy and flavored it is.. It definitely got me bloated after.  I really recommend getting the Spinach Dip because it's just a great starter and it keeps you satisfied until your entree come!

HAw9ZsDb2Uu0Wfk44hazVg.review_text: Very good restraunt! Food was served fast and the service was very good. I would suggest making reservations.

DTJB569I4A4bfMnEgwUbyg.review_text: A very good friend of mine took me here for dinner. I am so glad we chose this restaurant. Everything we ordered was really good. We had the grilled artichoke dip (it was amazing especially the dip), crab cakes (best I've ever had..crispy on the outside and so juicy on the inside), and pork chop. I heard the ribs here is really good, I can't wait to come back and try it out. Everything was perfect, even the side dishes! Our waiter was very attentive and helpful too.  I am so glad this is not one of those super fancy restaurants where you empty out your wallet for mediocre food and have to talk really quietly....instead this place is filled with live music and delicious food. I really love the ambiance- it's romantic but cozy at the same time. The layout of this restaurant feels like dining inside a boat...I also love the artichoke lights they have, it makes the restaurant look extra nice.  There are very few restaurants that I love everything that is ordered but this is definitely one of them. I am already craving the artichoke and crab cakes.  Dining right on the Embarcadero water with dim lights, live music, amazing food, good wine, and great company just made the night oh so perfect!

YAG90mceVFQLdvl4wndvQg.review_text: A bit pricey.  I got the ahi tuna burger. It was odd. It tasted like ground up ahi tuna that was pack together into a bun (similar to how a meatball is made). I wish it was a full piece of lightly seared ahi tuna.

r1AVLdGIUI4pMjnTZgi1aQ.review_text: So, we went back to Houstons. I live to close to ignore. Plus they invited us back. I have to say, the service was way better. The food is solid. No matter what you order here you going to receive a great meal. I ordered the ribs and they just fell off the bone. We ordered a Mediterranean Sea Bass and it was amazing. The waitress was excellent and attentive.   I will go back again and probably again... BTW, I smell their steaks from my frigging bedroom and I actually want to go there every day...

qJaBubcxoyYbnnFrieOd6g.review_text: Three Stars - Above Average...  Food - Good food, slightly overpriced. Of the casual dining chains (Chilis, Applebees, etc) this place is the king of the hill.  I mean that as a compliment too.  Salads have always been excellent here.  Crowd - Skews toward the Bridge and Tunnel and touristy types.  Also a bit geriatric.    Location - Relatively easy to park here especially compared to other places in the City.   Service and Atmosphere. Nice clean atmosphere and decent service.   however for some reason they refused to give me the wifi password, which is annoying in this day and age.  Value - Slightly overpriced, but there is NO CORKING FEE. Take advantage of this.  Again, I recommend this place if you going to a Giants game or the Exploratorium and you need a place to take the kids and Grandma and Grandpa from the suburbs. It's a safe choice for groups.  However, its not for foodies or adventerous eaters..

H5tU70rJCqCES1FBCz8-NA.review_text: Shaking loose the baggage that comes from being a part of a "chain," Hillstone stands apart based on its own merits. The staff has been consistently outstanding on each visit. The room is a marvelous presentation of dark wood, rich, red leather, and smoke-infused brick masonry. ... and the food? There's nothing that tops the steak and the "a la cartes" from Hillstone -- it holds up to the more expensive offerings from places like Ruth's Chris, Harris's or The House of Prime Rib.   It's my favorite place on the Wharf, largely because it's barely on the Wharf. Simply outstanding.

ht3rxI-S3hFxasqs37Wljw.review_text: Ended up at Hillstones on a whim on Sunday night; happy with decision.  The staff is very friendly and I really liked their Waldorff salad.  Kids meals are a good deal at $10 and include a drink and cup of ice cream.   Crab cake dish also pretty good.

MjlNTynslY_aLDTfGODuIg.review_text: maybe a bit too noisy for my taste, and for the price you pay you'd probably except something more elegant and classy. its dark and a bit noisy.  the food was great though, hawaiin steak and prime rib for sure!

nSmHIBqInzdFikpAhl0Utg.review_text: Houston's is really (at least for now...) my favorite Steakhouse in San Francisco.   The food is, as many have said, consistently excellent. Best meat in San Fran, for sure. Drinks (and wine choices) are also great. The service and ambiance are amongst the best in the City. You have many options in terms of where to sit, including a nice outside area as well as great bar.   It's not cheap per se, but it is cheaper than many of the alternatives and still better than all of them, so great bang for the buck!  It's a great place to bring your loved ones or closest friends -- they will definitely thank you!

pYWjz9-5KcEYovkrXRnTow.review_text: I come here for two reasons. Grilled artichoke and the remoulade sauce that I want to eat with everything and the French dip sandwich accompanied with the au jus. I usually don't like chain restaurants but this one never disappoints. The service is impeccable and the food is always consistent.  Also, be careful if you are parking in the meters outside the Hillstone. The last two times I parked there, both times there were break-ins near where I parked. Do not leave your belongings in your car.

cssHndFiVtAbx7XUGli-eA.review_text: Drove by on the way home from the Wharf. We were hungry and were lucky to find street parking down the block.  Very pleasant ambiance after being in the hustle bustle crowd down at the Wharf.  We ordered the delicious Spinach Artichoke Dip with tortilla chips as an app.   Hit the spot, creamy with good flavor. My husband saw an order of ribs go by and they looked absolutely mouthwatering so of course that's what he ordered. My daughter & I split a cheeseburger & fries.   The ribs tasted as good as they looked. Meat falls right off the bone and comes with thin crispy fries and cole slaw. He cleaned the plate clean.  All he left behind were BBQ splash spots on his shirt!  Loved the burger, cooked well done on a nice egg bun. Fries are some of the best I've had in a while.  Both entrees finger licking good!  Thank goodness the waitress brought over warm hand towels after we finished our meal.   We will definitely be back!

9qr29K7tz-WR8RnrI57kcA.review_text: Good place for food, cocktails, hang out ...  There's a live jazz band who plays here most if not all weeknights.  I've only tried a few items on the menu, they've all been good, but I've narrowed them down to two items eventually that are the best by far.  The knife & fork ribs are so tender they fall off the bone.  I mean, really ... you don't need a knife for these puppies and barely any teeth are necessary either.  And their crab cakes are the BEST I've had ... anywhere.  There are just large lumps of fresh crab meat in there.  Not much mayo or filler either.  Always done to perfection.  Did I mention that they have a nice wine collection and there's no corkage if you choose to bring your own?  Espresso's a really great deal.  Much larger portions than you would expect it to be, and done right too with a lot of crema.  The desserts are a good buy as well and a nice way to round up your meal.  They would have gotten five stars had their service not be so inconsistent.  Sometimes, they're excellent, and sometimes, not that great ...   Ask them to pace out your meal and hope they remember.  The kitchen tends to bring out stuff very fast.  Your entree could be there about a leaf or two into your salad.

Lm4oFlebM1U6Yj0cYYbqow.review_text: I took my bf here for his 25th birthday because my friend highly recommended it.  I love the ambiance and the view, but the food was so disappointing.  We shared:  *Spinach & artichoke dip - I don't get all the hype..it was mediocre and greasy *Thai steak salad - nothing special although the steak was delicious *BBQ ribs - the ribs were amazing...we ate them all and saved the bones for our pup  The service was great and the ribs were finger-lickin' good, but next time, I'll definitely skip the apps and try their renowned steak.

PBxbN5GZqNiiX9a-lJ9RYw.review_text: I got a seasonal vegetable plate and I really liked it, but I like vegetables of all kinds.  The cheeseburger was really good, too.  Service was fast and it was a good stop for a quick lunch during their slow hours.

grzEglN1kcoXPzv0KDOpMQ.review_text: The best hamburgers in town.... they just melt in your mouth.  I highly recommend the Oak Grilled Artichokes and Sashimi Tuna Salad too.  You cannot go wrong with their hot fudge sundae... the hot fudge is delicious with a faint hint of malt flavor.  I really like that the outside patio is nicely equipped with a firepit and heat lamps.  Oh, how I miss the days of working across the street, and you too Myrna.    FYI: If you work in the area, Houston's offers complimentary coffee in the morning.  It doesn't get better than that... make sure to drop something in the tip basket.

DOiO769WMQD6GQja-2rv7A.review_text: Way too loud on a busy night. When the restaurant is packed, expect a noise level that requires your server to essentially yell the specials. It has a high-end atmosphere that is probably best enjoyed on a quieter evening or lunch.  The french dip is a good, but the burger was way over seasoned. Artichoke dip is a good appetizer choice though being strangely paired with sour cream/salsa. The prices are very high and something you would expect from a sit down on the Embarcadero. Remember, the no corkage fee only applies to the first two bottles. It's $15 per bottle after.  It's a good location with a parking garage next door ($10 after validation). Careful, when it gets late, you may have to call the security guard to help you get back into the garage. Two others were having this issue when we left the restaurant.

T32n_y9R2lucMf9P2Lc8Rw.review_text: I used to go in here when it  was Houston's pretty much same Rest just going under Hillstones since it is owned by the Hillstone group. The biggest plus for me is always the NO Corkage Fee who does not want to drink wine w/dinner right. 8 of us went for my bday dinner we sat right next to the trio and they played what we wanted to hear and more...some light Jazz standards they actually did not no as many Jazz songs as I would have expected but they did play alot of Stevie wonder, Sade music.  The food was great grilled Artichoke apps and I had the steak w/garlic mash and veggies. My friend had the hawaiian rib eye took a bite pretty good. My other friend ordered the prime rib loved it.  All in all great dining experience...great service I will be back

RkxNQAQTC-GG4BTIYdOjzg.review_text: Terrible Service!  First we ordered the Cesar salad and asked the waitress if it was big enough to share.  She barely stood around long enough to tell us that it was.  Shortly after she threw a big plate of Cesar salad with two forks in the center of the good sized round table.  There were no salad plates so it became a balancing act to put the salad on the fork and transport it to my mouth.  Halfway through our salad, my husband and I each received our Prime Rib dinner.  We would have like to finish the salad first and maybe have a few minutes to digest.  The Prime Rib was just okay!  To me it tasted like the flavor that stood out most was the heavily salted outside part of the meat.  To top this off we received our bill for $101.  I placed my credit card in the tray and when I received my slip back to sign, the bill was now $169.  Uh...the wait staff should slow down, pay attention to their consumers and be sure that their work is  accurate.  I really wanted to like this place as the atmosphere is nice and I really appreciate the live musicians employed (who were also great!)  However, I would not recommend this place at all!

1x20UhLScbJYiPyhEZr9FQ.review_text: Love this place! Been going here for 8 years now and have spent hundreds of nights at Hillstone, aka Houston's back in the day. Everything about Hillstone is great! I typically always sit at the bar and have cocktails and dinner. Two of the best bartenders, Caitlyn and Claudia always my night fun and take great care of all their customers. They are two of the reasons I am a constant regular here.   All the food is great. Very consistent every time. Ribs and kale salad w/ chicken are my favorites.

tXV9RNWbfhYq4Iru-A-X1Q.review_text: Great food and impeccable service. Highly recommend if you are in the area..

yrjV2EQm5XpN-qIFnqK1ow.review_text: the decor is calming and relaxing..the hosts and servers are always polite.  Only been here twice and will come back here over and over again.  First time i was there, i ordered the Hawaiian steak and i was told that they were out of the hawaiian sauce so i just took my steak plain.  When my steak arrived with my mashed potatoes and brocolli with parmasean.  Everything was soooo tasty and so well seasoned.  When i went here the 2nd time, i ordered the Hawaiian version and prefer it to be just without the hawaiian sauce.  The sauce isnt bad, its not drenched in like teriyaki glaze or anything.  Its a hint of this hawaiian sauce which you can taste but i dont need it.  After dinner, i sat outside with cess and we jus enjoyed the outdoor fireplace and the perfect evening..didnt realize we were there for almost 4hours!  Their warm 5 walnut brownie was unbelieveable. I can taste the brown sugar and it jus ended my night very nicely.  Houston's is a must to go to!

gXwFEje5ZNg2N-pXtcApJg.review_text: Great service. And food was awesome. I had the bbq ribs . Very polite staff .  I would like to thank the cooks there for the fantastic food.they prepare.

W7Fs1cFDsaj0bh-z0Desfw.review_text: I have eaten here a couple of times and sadly each time gets more sub-par than before. I have waited an hour and 45 minutes for my table WITH a reservation. This last time I ate here, the service was spotty. They would come to the table once and then disappear. They forgot to bring drinks and we had to remind them.   I brought home my chicken leftovers (boxed and bagged at the restaurant). The next day I put my food on a plate and started to eat it. A HUGE FLY crawled out from under the chicken breast. Disgusting. The fly could not have gotten in the box and paper bag that was folded over and shut. I showed the restaurant a picture of this and they did not believe me. Horrible service, they will make someone sick but I am sure they already have. I would give 0 stars if I could.

UCggpsDTX_6iekTJaqp__g.review_text: First and foremost, there is NO Houston's here!!! They moved locations and the new location changed names.  Their entrees appear to be Houston-like, but their service and atmosphere is certainly not!

9Vmqj86WQ6WTU8SdSkfBCA.review_text: Really hip and fun place.  I went there on Friday night at 8:30 and the place was packed even with a previous power outage(due to the thunder storm).  I had their clam chowder (quite tasty, not great).   I then ordered the double Pork Chop (which is ENORMOUS, trust me,  enough to feed a family of four enormous)  I also brought along a bottle of Chardonnay to test their no corkage claim, which is true, since I wasn't charge for any beverage.  All in all a terrific fun place.  Minus 1 star due to the not too friendly hostess who says I have to wait a half hour for a table.  I just snagged a Bar seat which worked great since the bartender(2 girls) were extremely friendly and nice.  Update: 1/25/08  Decided to try this place again because of the glowing reviews of the baby back ribs.  I went on Friday for lunch. The service of my waitress was OK.  The food was not.  They must have had a really really off day because I just had the most AWFUL baby back ribs (devoid of any moisture, it must have sat out in the desert for a week!) EVER! It was so bad I am amazed at how bad it was.  It does fall off the bones, however so does beef jerky! It was the worst $27 entree I have had in SF.  The coleslaw was the best part of the meal.  I still left a 20% tip since it wasn't the waitress' fault.  Stay away from this place if you like good food.

ajaAvXw_U4jnaJpQdoKb6w.review_text: I know that being an expensive chain restaurant in San Francisco is similar to a death sentence, so I am thankful that Houston's has been granted a stay of execution.  I had a friend who worked there for a period of time and compared it to a cult where they brainwash you, yet I still can't resist the robotic service and the timely, savory meals. There is never a wait on a Sunday afternoon and the food is immaculately consistent. I always find myself toiling between the handmade veggie burger (rice, beans, beets, heaven) and the colorful vegetable plate. I am never disappointed.  Little known fact: Ordering the Veggie burger "California Style" is a good idea. Avo, greens, honey mustard...

BYtcDPmOYTXRQKPLwYYpZg.review_text: I made reservations here for a Friday night to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. I was a few minutes late but was still seated very quickly.   We ordered the spinach dip for an appetizer and it was very very good! He ordered the Hawaiian rib-eye and loved it. I ordered the chicken and it was good! For dessert, he got a brownie thing (can't remember the exact name) and ate every last crumb. He enjoyed the entire meal and was stuffed. The portion size was larger than what we expected. Our service was great. There was a live band and the ambiance was nice. We would definitely come back here.

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: been here many times, just never reviewed.  this past Sunday as always food and service was excellent.  food is always cooked perfect.  good ol American fare, none of that foo foo gastronomical blah blah fancy work.  sometimes foo foo is good, but most of the time disappointing.   Hawaiian rib eye rare, pork ribs, paradigm cab for only $60!!  happy times.  oh, the cole slaw from the ribs was pretty spectacular.

cjJGQnketJwynr0MwtxXXg.review_text: First piece of advice, just get the baby back ribs here.  Hands down fall off the bone ribs, great slaw and skinny fries.  This is the meal you need to get no matter what, good for business meetings, dates, or a wind down comfort food experience.  Second note, I think the Houston's chains are different and better, experience and server wise.  Went against my own advice and got the burger here, and although it tasted fine, I was thinking ribs the whole time I was eating the burger.  Go with the ribs, enjoy it, and leave relaxed after an epic eat.

aMBkcgtRHVu2AnRczmtmAg.review_text: I vote yes. The ribs, crispy chicken sandwich and veggie burger are to die for. They have a great outdoor patio for sunny days, and the bar area is large and inviting if you just want to have a casual meal.   If your ordering desert - get the brownie!

tgUvk_rJXFr24q-X7I1U2A.review_text: I can't tell you how much I love this chain. My sister and her family met us to go to lunch. We ordered the artichoke appetizer and each of us had an entree. Well the appetizer came after the entrees and it was comped for us. We didn't care, because their food is AH-MAZING! Not on the menu tip: cabbage salad that is terrific!

kWyce8QGI9s5WfaxjL_Pmw.review_text: First of all, I was under the impression the name was "Houston's" as known to my colleagues.   Nice, dark setting with subtle candle lights on every table. Once you walk in, you can view the kitchen over the shoulder-height wall and see the delicious food being cooked up and served. Cleanliness is definitely a factor, making patrons feel welcomed and not deterred upon first sight. My party and I made a reservation, and service was fast, so fast that it made Denny's feel like the DMV line on a busy Friday afternoon before closing time. We came, we sat, we ate. In that timely order.  The food was delicious. I had the special that night (of which I have forgotten the name) served with a large, medium-well steak, fresh vine ripe tomatoes and super soft and creamy cheese. The flavors almost burst with every melting mouthful. With a great dish like this, came a not-so-great price. As expected, it was at least 30 dollars. However, I feel that night was worth the extra pocket pain. I left pleasantly full and satisfied. I hold service with a high regard and a necessary component to great customer service in any store or restaurant that I am a patron at, so I would love to recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves steaks, has a group, and like a real fireplace and not one of those cheesy propane-filled faux-pits.

SORwHZxyWwR8iv_ZrMICEg.review_text: This is my go-to place for downtown meals, whether it's dinner for two or a group.  Highlights are the Hawaiian ribeye and the ribs.  This also might be the only decent restaurant I know of that has no corkage fee.  Always ask for either Trevor, Andrea or Megan; they're my favorite servers and always take care of me and whomever I'm with. They're all super-friendy and highly competent, and help to pull a great meal together.

As3PGConLtPOKgfGtAizNQ.review_text: No corkage fee!! Need I say more?   I've only been here for dinner a few times, but I've been very pleased with my experiences here. Great service along with a cozy interior that has a nice fireplace.   I've had the prime rib and veggie burger here, and both were pretty amazing. The veggie burger is one of the best I've had in the city (they use quinoa and a buncha other ingredients). The prime rib was cooked perfectly, it didn't blow me away but it's definitely up there.  They also have live bands on certain nights and an outdoor patio. Recommend!

fVmasEUZmYEbYIkswLV63A.review_text: I know this is a chain restaurant, and there are so many wonderful places in the city, but we were hungry and it was close by so we just stopped in. Glad we did. Best french dip sandwich!  The roll was soft and the beef was incredibly tender and delicious. Hubby had the Hawaiian steak and enjoyed every last bite.  Service was attentive and our server was quite helpful with our wine selection. Great lunch in beautiful San Francisco.

wCD9p0v-s-3CzLiaTWoA0A.review_text: Always a fabulous meal and a good place to take kids out to a nice meal.  The staff is always very friendly and accommodating.  We enjoyed the live jazz music.

Uj6JNI3-1JTo2IdKrZGJ1Q.review_text: One of my favorite places to eat.  I recommend the spinach dip, beets salad, Thai steak salad, Hawaiian ribeye, and burger with a lemon drop.   And, don't forget the Warm Walnut Apple pie (OMG)....

esn9-Zp6CDrwouA_P-CRQw.review_text: We came here upon JL's suggestion after being turned away from another restaurant. Since SF has a general aversion to chains, we knew Hillstone would have more availability. We ordered:  - Spinach & Artichoke Dip $12 - Cheeseburger $15 - French Dip $19 - Apple Walnut Cobbler $8  Hearty American food, large portions and welcoming service. There was live Jazz playing, but being the crotchety old woman I am, I didn't care that much for it. JL's bf enjoyed it though, and even wanted to move to a closer table so that we had a better view of the performance--good thing we were already situated in our roomy booth!   I've been to the so cal locations (Houston's, which Hillstone was previously named ) and the food + service is always consistently good at those branches too. Nice to see that the Embarcadero Hillstone is no different.

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: Didn't care much for our lunch yesterday at Hillstone and I don't think we'd go back. Really the best thing about the meal was dessert, an apple walnut cobbler. Served with delicious ice cream, although for 3 of us to share it came with forks, which doesn't work for ice cream.  I had a "sashimi ahi salad" which of course wasn't sashimi since it was seared ahi, but whatever. The sashimi was good although over seasoned but the salad was so overdressed it was almost inedible. The husband had a cheeseburger which he said was ok, nothing special for $18. The boss had chicken which was fine. Generous portion for sure.   I'd rather eat at Butterfly across the street.

4BxI8ZBIpJiSbLhQfHtkng.review_text: Perfect location in San Francisco. Located right by Pier 33, it's a great place to grab lunch or dinner after a stroll to the farmer's market or visit to the pier. If it's a nice day I would highly suggest the outdoor patio. Great to kick back and soak in the SF sun.   I can see why people love love this place. To me It's just the typical over priced chain restaurant. I walk in there already knowing what to expect - great service, great food, and a big bill. I had the tuna sashimi salad ($17) and and a glass of wine ($13). Both were scrumptious but I was still a little hungry afterwards. Definitely going with the more filling cheeseburger next time.   Not my top choice to dine at in SF but a safe one.

XZ7gWj4cIbFJOhG03lYY7w.review_text: GM contacted me and sent me a gift card to be used there as reparation for my previous critique so naturally I went back the same day I got the gift card. This time I lived it up a bit more and got the filet mignon, which was excellent. The place was jam packed so their business isn't suffering. I also noticed the chefs were wearing chef hats, so maybe this will help with the minor problem I noted in my original review.  I appreciate their concern and it shows they know how to run their business and keep customers coming back.

yZxRl6Wp2ZSLv0Eeu9favA.review_text: I agree with a another reviewer that the spinach-artichoke dip was mostly spinach; the salsa served with the same appetizer tasted like a supermarket brand out of a jar.  I had the baby-back pork ribs for my entree. They were good and fall-off-the-bone tender, but Bennigan's ribs are just as good for less money. The side of fries was OK, but I've had better (for example, at The Counter whose fries are excellent). My partner had the prime rib which was too salty.  Given their premium prices, the food should be outstanding, not average. I won't be going back.

bWvELivVIa81tFEqiLxS4A.review_text: The prime rib was delicious, tender, and cooked just right!  The baked potato was well cooked and stuffed with my favorite toppings.  My friends had the Hawaiian rib eye and the ribs, and all were very satisfied with the food quality, taste, and abundant amount.  The spinach artichoke dip was also very delicious.  This night also happened to have live jazz music which added to the warm atmosphere of the restaurant.  The waiter was very professional, although I wouldn't exactly say friendly.    I know people in San Francisco tend to sway away from chain restaurants, and I wouldn't recommend this place to tourists as there are many unique restaurants to experience, but this place is a dependable place for locals looking for similar level of quality every time.  All in all, I had a great experience and recommend it to any lovers of prime rib.

9WlHKp-DlyRRDtY1RdWyBg.review_text: We've been Houston/Hillstone fans for over 15 years.  We love, love, love the crab cakes (didn't have it), love, love, love the cheese toast (didn't have it) absolutely love the dirty rice, didn't have that either.  They had to check and see if they had the apple walnut cobbler and it was only 3:30 in the afternoon! The apple walnut cobbler recipe has changed, it's close but no cigar.  We drove from Fairfield to San Francisco foe dinner through traffic to get to the restaurant only to hear no, I'm sorry that's not on our menu any longer or that's a seasonal item now.  We're in SF where crab are in abundance this time of year so how can crab cakes NOT be in season?  Spoke with the mgr. Jill and while she was apologetic, and listened to our disappointment with our dining experience, there was no effort to rectify the disappointment or make up for it.  What she said was to call first to see if what you like is on the menu.  REALLY!    The telltale sign that what a restaurant is doing isn't working is that there's no line at the front door!  We waltzed right in at 3:30 with no reservation and was seated immediately.  There was a time where we would have gladly waited 45 minutes.  No more.  There's a lot of competition in the restaurant business in SF. You've just lost us to you competition!  So long Hillstone not coming back any time soon!

ICUppJqYseNvMZCaXwyyZQ.review_text: Food was better than your local neighborhood greasy spoon.  It was nothing spectacular.  My guest had the steak and fries which looked great but the cut of meat needed more taste or seasoning.  Fries was just that French fries.  I had the salmon and it too needed more flare than what I had paid for.  Granted the size of the portion was generous but that's the best I can say about the fish dish.   Table service is superb, our waitress was very friendly personable and was there at every whim needed or not.  I would go back  just for that and try other entrees.  The martini - I had better elsewhere.  Now the only bad service was the two girls at the front.  We arrived 14 minutes early for our reservations. There were plenty of seating.  I had booked with special instructions (window seating and a surprise dessert with birthday writing or something special)  and nothing was carried through.. As they tried to seat us I asked why we could not have a window seat... There were 9 - 11 tables available and the young girl said with much attitude - "those are for people with reservations". I told them we have reservations - which was ignored.  I had booked with open tale two weeks prior and called days before to confirm!!! They did not know how to work their station!  Beautiful people working the front staton but moving with no brains or servitude.  Not impressed at all except for the table service - go there if that is all you want!

Khrk8Q2G6BhD46tBOSF02A.review_text: Go-to spot for whenever the guys are in town ... BYOW.

CqDluWPbCMtYT-jjhBecyw.review_text: Great place. Even better food. Had to wait to be seated tonight and they brought me french fries. Needless to say the service here is excellent.

PFv_v-hEebIktD7WLrltLw.review_text: I was surprised to learn that Houston's is a chain.  It really felt like one of those San Francisco business lunch places that has always lived in the financial district.  I have to say it changed slightly how I feel about this place, but overall I thought it is worth going back to.    I really liked the HUGE booth the server sat the two of us.  It was comfy and I felt like we were part of the restaurant without having to hear every conversation in the places.   We started with the Spinach & Artichoke Dip-- which was totally amazing.  And then shared the barbecue pork ribs.  I'm not a huge fan of the red meat, but these ribs were totally melt in your mouth. We had some forgettable calorie-filled dessert and got out under a hundred bucks.  Very successful night out.

pEUccJ6MxdaXPdnFfWT3dQ.review_text: Nice atmosphere.  A bit more upscale than I typically frequent but a great place for business trips.  We started outside with drinks while we waited for a table.  They have some great locals on tap including Anchor Steam and Lagintas IPA.   A great patio area with a nice harbor side feel and an aromatic border of rosemary bushes.  We started with a couple of Rosemary Focaccia & Olive Plates.  Very tasty.  Most of us had the Hickory Burger.  Solid but most weren't cooked as we ordered.  Some more, some less.  One from our party deviated in ordering and got the French Dip and he loved it.  Great mashed potatoes.  Not much to complain about.  A very reliable place.

bgZZxwc3Y6afTNWl_WSgXQ.review_text: Hillstone was good, but it wasn't great.   For the price of the restaurant (after tip, around $170 on 2 meals, 2 drinks, & 2 salads), I expect a lot more in terms of atmosphere and food quality.  Positives First: The ribs were very good, and very tender.  My wife liked the sauce a lot, and she's extremely picky on meat sauces.  I would have preferred some choice in the sauce, or maybe something with more kick and less sweetness, but either way, it was good.  The caesar salads were also very good - it was an eggless caesar dressing (I assume olive oil -based), and had just the right amount of kick from the anchovy.  However, when you go to a fancy restaurant, you expect shaved (or at least grated) cheese on the salad - it was sprinkle cheese, like the kind that comes out of a can from the grocery store.  Maybe they finely chopped it up themselves from real cheese, or maybe not - I didn't notice anything fake tasting about it, but it had a very cheap look to it.  Croutons were good though.  Jazz.  Live jazz is awesome.    The not-so Positives: I don't understand restaurants not having tables for couples.  They set us down at a booth that could have easily fit 8 people (and there weren't many people there), and we had to talk extra loud to hear each other.  Also, it was one of those booths where it's far enough away that you can't actually reach the table properly without sitting up away from the seat back.  The fries were bad.  I would like to think they were fresh, but they looked and tasted like fast food fries.  Okay, that's hyperbole, but they definitely didn't taste good.  My wife only ate a few of hers, and I only about half.  The steamed broccoli was mushy.  I steam broccoli all the time, and I get steamed broccoli at restaurants whenever it's available.  I've never had it mushy.  It's supposed to have a firmness to it, a crispness.  I couldn't eat it.  The atmosphere of the restaurant had the trappings of high class, but beneath that, it felt cheap.  The waiters dressed nice, and everything looked clean, but the tables & booths felt cheap, and everything in the area we sat in felt very crowded.  By the time it started filling up, I could hear everything being said by any other groups around me.  It got really loud, really fast.  We were some of the first people in for the dinner hours, and the volume was a nice, soft restaurant ambiance (with live jazz).  However, as soon as we were no longer the only people in our section, it started getting really loud.  I don't know if it's because of the floor tiles, or no window treatments, or what, but in combination with the size of our booth and the amount of other people also talking much louder than normal conversation volume, my wife & I felt like we were having to yell to hear each other - which of course, would stack and increase the overall room volume.  There were only two dessert options... Again, I don't understand high-classed, high-priced restaurants that have these kinds of options.  We would have loved to have a nice, "homemade" dessert of some sort, but choosing between nut-brownie with ice cream and chocolate sundae (more ice cream) isn't really a choice.   Anyway, that's all.  Basically, I would say that we were not upset with our visit, but we were somewhat disappointed, and though we don't feel like we were gypped, we would not go back and spend money there again.  It's a shame, because everyone (including the bus tour guides) kept saying this was the fine dining place to try, but what we ended up feeling like was that it was just okay-dining, dressed up as fine-dining to increase the price of meals.

2f7Ug4HoAss4aSdlKzw1DA.review_text: The chicago style spinach and artichoke dip is revolutionary in that numbingly simple "why didn't I think of that?" sort of way and a must order for every visit. And I won't attempt to argue against the finger-lickin-goodness that is their ribs. However there are two things about this restaurant that, you might say, lets the air out of the balloon for me.  1. On occasions where I'm craving something a little lighter than sauce and/or butter drenched red meat, I order the fish. I have tried their fish specials thrice now and have been continuously disappointed. I understand that they are a steak house and seafood is not their specialty but in the perfect restaurant world, if you are an upscale establishment charging prices of $30 and up for every dish, they need to be really good, specialty or not. 2. The service is really erratic. I seem to always get servers that fall on extreme ends of the spectrum. Either they are sugar and sweet and everything nice to a point of obnoxiousness or they're cold and inattentive, as was the case last night.  Just sayin - as much as I love their signature dishes, if it wants to keep up with all the other amazing steakhouses in the city, it needs to step up its game with the rest of the menu.  To end things on a positive note - the location and ambiance are pretty unbeatable - smack dab on the embarcadero and sporting a sleak, dark, romantic interior lined with comfy leather booths. If it wasn't for the messy makeup smearing finger food this would make a great date spot.

zOTRY-eBs_GPGujkfDo9rw.review_text: We had a pretty poor experience here. I am aware this is a chain but given this I expected reliably good service and well-prepared food but I feel they did not come though and the evening was a disappointment.  I came here with a group of friends and my mother for a special night as she enjoys the Hillstone location near her home in Arizona.  We sat down and immediately the waiter was pushing the spinach dip as if reading from a script. - it felt like Applebee's.  We ordered some artichokes and a salad along with a round of drinks. The appetizers showed up within five minutes maybe (guess they want to turn the table) but we waited quite a while for the drinks. The food showed up long before any beverages with no apologies from the wait staff.   One person in the party asked for a glass of water and the waiter brought one glass of water and did not offer any to the rest of the table.  We brought a couple of expensive bottles of wine for our celebration and after the appetizers the water opened the bottles but never never offered to pour - we had to do that ourselves for the remainder of the evening.  Maybe the wine threw them off but after the main courses were delivered we felt somewhat neglected for the rest of the night.  Throughout the meal we had to ask for glasses, water refills, appetizer plates to be cleared when could get a servers' attention which was not easy.  I requested glasses of water for those of us that did not have any but none was ever provided.   Most of the food was fine. One of my dining companions ordered crab cakes. They did not taste fresh and were not especially good which is surprising since it is crab season around here.  Otherwise everything was pretty good as expected. Not great but good.  That said the whole thing felt like a waste of our dining dollar.  Rushed inattentive service that was fake-friendly at best.  Not a fan.

R14-G3t5OGyEmP6nOnza2w.review_text: I haven't been here since they changed the name, but I've been to Houston's a few times, and I have to tell you...this is the best steakhouse-type place I've ever been to. And I'm not even a steak person!  Their rotisserie chicken is great, and anything with artichokes is fantastic, but really their best dish, which I go back to time and again, is the veggie burger.  Yes, I said veggie burger!  While not a steak person, I do enjoy a good beef burger, but have also been known to partake in veggie burgers from time to time, so decided to try it out on my first visit.  Holy cow!  I've never seen a "meaty" establishment put as much attention and care into a veggie entree like this burger possessed.  Richly flavored, made of beans and grains in such a way you could actually discern much of what was in it (I like this), just wow.  The ONE drawback: b/c it's house-made and not full of junky fillers, oh and HUGE, it can tend to fall apart.  Be prepared with either a fork & knife or lots of napkins.  Totally worth it.  Service is excellent as well.  I seem to somehow go there when it's generally not busy, and you can see the staff turning the sugar packets and salt/pepper shakers so that everything is facing the same way.  This attention to detail is carried through to their service at your table as well, and is consistent across locations of this non-chainy chain restauarant.  At a different location, my brother ordered a burger, and after a wait short enough we didn't even realize we were waiting, the manager came over to inform us that they'd run out of ground beef.  My brother's face hadn't even finished falling when the manager continued to tell us that they were grinding some fresh for him and they'd give us a dessert on the house for our extra wait.  A freshly ground-in-house burger and a dessert for an unnoticeable wait?  Um okay!  From what I've seen, you can expect this kind of service at any of their locations.  I feel like the prices are appropriate.  I like to suggest Houston's/Hillstone for occasions that are special, without breaking the bank.  I couldn't afford to go here every day, but it feels fancy enough that I'm not sure I'd want to if I could, yet it's still affordable for when you do want something just a little extra special.

4lCnSPJ0phGIu8fc49Q-Hw.review_text: I love this place!!!  I have been to Hillstone (formerly Houston's) many, many times and it's always great.  From the grilled artichokes, Hawaiian Ribeye, fish sandwich - okay there are just too many good things to list.  Must say the cocktails are fantastic, best Ice Cream Sunday ever, and the service is always great!!!

7INSbfEagqxqyRXK6uq0LA.review_text: So disappointed with everything about this place except ambiance. I find it difficult to enjoy my dinner if servers are switching during service without any explanation, can't get the orders right, firing entrees way too early, opening dessert wine while we were halfway through with our steaks and the bottle of red (Shafer Hillside select). At the end we left most of our dessert wine (Palmaz Muscat Canelli) cause we felt rushed.  Manager (or whoever was in charge for closing walk-troughs) was walking around with the flashlight checking under tables while servers were following him around. Sadly, this place left a lot to be desired.

JcKk7zEd46yj0hnuSQUwXQ.review_text: Arrive early for drinks by the fire!

n8zo_DJYs9jgxqbX6pMbbg.review_text: My mom loves Rutherford Grill so we went here for Mother's Day. What a delight everything was amazing from the ribs, to the burgers to the spinach & artichoke dip but the real delight was the French Dip. Our server was Cassie who is a delight. I look forward to going here again.

z5VGf197EBrPyqKYtlmP1w.review_text: Today I had lunch here with my dear/best friend Francesca. We sat inside which it was too hot to sit outside. Our hostess was very nice, she gave us an option for us to sit in or out.  Our server Chris was at our service. He was so nice and very welcoming. I had order the Ahi Tuna Steak and Francesca order the ribs. All I can say is please take my word. But the food was dam good!!!! I swear we both eat all of out food and shared from each other. I was ever so satisfy when I left Houston's and will come back for dinner. So glad that we came here.

-Qcy6ZxWRING3kxooXgrRw.review_text: I wanted to like Houston's, but the mixed food quality and inattentive waiter service stopped me from ranking Houston's higher.    We had the french dip, which was basically sliced prime rib on soft french bread - the meat was tender and great, definitely something to try.  We also had the baby back ribs which were a disappointment.  It was dry, flaky, and way too salty - give this a pass.  I was surprised since I figured ribs would be a forte here.    The ambiance is definitely nice.  There are roaring fire pits visible long before you get to the restaurant and makes it a cozy hangout, with a bar menu to boot.  Houston's has the dark, steakhouse-ish lighting which I like.  Service was inattentive - long waits for water, I had to ask multiple waiters for bread, and pretty much saw my waitress only twice - to take the order and for the bill.

lRO78-T5lnMry0pL7KdUzw.review_text: Came here Monday afterwork for dinner.  The ribeye was really greasy, but juicy enough. Atlantic char was not good.. it was dry and tasted fishy. Plating was not pleasing to the eye. It was more like diner food than restaurant quality. Better spot for tourists.

57MS2UYQuOXk50sjK4g90g.review_text: I'm what you would call an absolute elitist when it comes to restaurant chains. Simply put, I try to avoid them like the plague because, to me, they're like public school lunch served to the masses - one recipe, cooked the same way in pretty much every corner of the country, with absolutely nothing that separates it from the food they serve in prison (not that I would know what prison food tastes like, but I'm sure it's not that bad, but not that good either). Anyways, this brings me to my point...Houston's is one of those restaurant chains I don't mind going back again and again...and again.  I haven't been to Houston's since my rodeo days back in good ol' Texas when I was traveling back and forth between Houston, San Antonio, Dallas, and Austin for work. Houston's was always one of those places I always ended up in during business trips. And not once has it failed me.   So I found it quite nostalgic when I found myself back in Houston's today, after an almost three-year hiatus. The Caesar salad was fresh and flavorful. The grilled artichokes was perfection - and OMG, don't even get my started on how amazing the aioli is. A mixture of mayonnaise, mustard, salt, pepper, lemon...and I dunno...crack?...made the aioli something I want to literally inhale in spoonfuls alone. The burger - huge, meaty, and flavorful. And as a little plus, they put butter...yes BUTTER!!!...on their toasted sesame bun. But if I had to rank the burger, I would have to say it's much better than Burger Bar and NOPA, but still not as good as Sideboard (Danville) or Father's Office (LA).
