I'm sure the 600+ Yelpers who have already mentioned the steaks is convincing enough to tell you to um...try a steak there...so I'm gonna leave it at that and say...yes, go for it. Inhale a nice slab of cow.

OXY_hrHYwRZtmft-juWhnA.review_text: Dude, hillstone is the best! No corkage fee, so bring your bottle of wine!! Love the great live jazz that plays every night starting at 6:30. The service is fantastic - very quick, and very attentive.   What I love about hillstone is the attention to quality. Everything I've had here has been delicious and top of the line. They have the best cheeseburger I've ever had in my life, and their fries are the best. We are regulars here, and we've even had the chef decide that the fries weren't up to par so we got a couple other sides for free instead! Talk about quality control.   Their hot fudge sundae is an excellent ending to a delicious meal, with great service, awesome jazz music, and free wine we bring from home. It's a winner!

1m4Hmm7IbgGjVupM7CQSMw.review_text: The plotting, the planning, the whining and gossiping. So much goes down at Houston's it's no wonder all the ad dwellers in the hood pick it as their number one place. I'm here almost once a week. You'd think such a meet-up spot would befit a dark mafioso type atmosphere, but no, a wood oven, fireplace, comfy booths and outdoor seating in the summertime is the vibe of Houston's, our rendevous spot.   Veggie burger, no bun, and a side of either the maple glazed carrots or brussel sprouts....mmm... if I eat the bun (which is delicious) I tend to fall asleep in my powerpoints by 3pm.  Sit outside on a warm day, just look over your shoulder to make sure your plots and plans don't involve passers by. ;)

z9ECS1Tb47DfyGOx58bJfw.review_text: Blackened Rib eye was amazing, good service and great music!

lg-6HiY8QL0f3_ttCYdt9A.review_text: My former college roommate and his wife were staying in the Wharf area while visiting their son, and grandson who moved to SF a few years ago. We agreed to have lunch together and I picked Hillstone for its convenient location.  I'd eaten here once back in the late 1990s when the restaurant was Houston's, and the food was good. Recent reviews have been favorable, too.  When I made my reservation in person the day before, the young man at the front desk was very cordial, and when we arrived today a young woman was similarly welcoming. We were seated in a spacious, comfortable banquette which was ideal for our group.   Waitstaff here is excellent; our server was very friendly and accommodating and she cheerfully answered questions about menu items.  I had the SPINACH & CHICKEN WALDORF SALAD which was very good and I'd recommend it. The salad was quite large and fresh tasting with healthful ingredients.  Other items served to us (chicken sandwich, grilled artichokes, plus other salads) looked good. My guests seemed to be pleased which is what mattered the most for me.  I believe that the food, service, and overall comfort level at Hillstone is excellent.

Nb-t33H6uJB3RS6uAnPAng.review_text: I work across the street so this is my treat every now and then.  Service is friendly, they smile.... dressed in all black..  Food is excellent, there isn't anything I won't eat here... Drinks are good.. lemondrop SLURPS! pricey for a beer, so upgrade and get the lemondrop!  there is something about the buns they use for the burgers and sandwiches.. YUUMMERS! I want to order 'buns' to go, please!! Fries.. yes, fries on the side please.. yes, I know I get fries with my burger but i want fries on the side...   Crispy Chicken Sammich, YUM, same bun, same fries...  can't go wrong!!!!   could be a little pricey .. but again, it's a treat once in a while!!!  I just went there today.. yummms... had the 'mexico city' soup, crispy chicken sammich and extra fries... shared of course with a co-worker... the truth i say!   go there if you can.. it's worth it..

gAGuKI_WQFxBwYWztyI9oQ.review_text: Horrible!!!  Reservations mean NOTHING to this restaurant.  We arrived at the restaurant 5 minutes before our reservation time at 8pm, and were told our table was being prepared.  20 minutes later, after still not being seated, we were told the people at our table were eating dessert and would be done soon.  Then, 10 minutes later, we were told the people had paid and would be leaving soon, but they were never told another party (our party) was waiting.  40 minutes AFTER our reservation time, we were finally seated.  The manager, Jonathan, was rude and clearly did not know how to manage reservations for large parties.  Although our server tried to make up for the restaurant's and the manager's poor management skills, our night (and our mother's 60th birthday celebration) was ruined.  We are never returning to this restaurant, and highly advise others with parties over 4 people to go to another higher quality restaurant such as Bobo's, Harris', or House of Prime Rib.  Reservations at this restaurant are not recognized or respected.

ffMnIH-CHY-fH8OBxfr98A.review_text: Get the artichoke dip! The food is great.  One irritating tidbit - they made my dad take off his hat, and was adamate (sp?) about it, and he was really not wanting to take it off. I thought for casual CA, whats the big deal? Its not 5 star dining? The broad next to us had her tits hanging out of her top, and they didnt tell her to tuck them in.

4hN_0-9l0gffb5rOu6OAtA.review_text: Houston's might be the only chain restaurant I'd give 5 stars to.  For one thing, it doesn't feel like a chain.  The service is exceptional and the food is delicious.  Also, the decor provides privacy and an air of sophistication.  The food has never disappointed me.  MUST-HAVES - Veggie burger.  Best veggie burger I have ever tasted.  (Be careful, I've heard the ketchup isn't always veg) - Hamburger.  Delicious. - Veggie plate.  Kind of a grab-bag, but always satisfying.  My favorite items are the brussel sprouts, beets, coucous and roasted vegetables. - Spinach and artichoke dip.  This is done really well here. - Biltmore chicken sandwich.  Amazing flavor. - Steak salad  Some of the sides and desserts are good but nothing okay.  And unfortunately this Houston's doesn't have the off-menu chicken fingers a bunch of other locations have.

e2MIDX_YWVVQl7-t-SJf-w.review_text: Delicious and FREE corkage?!  This must be LOVE.  PS.  See my review for Los Altos Grill for more info.  Since they are of the same "chain," they are very similar.  Ribs... YUUUUMMM.

FS8QWByZ2UkJaeA51O_ClA.review_text: i like'd this place alot when it was Houstons,now that its Hillstone im still a fan,the only gripe i had was that they seated several people before us,i cant bitch to bad, i was 10 minutes late for our 9pm reservation,i guess a 20 min wait to eat was my penalty,but the food was great as always,and didnt have brake the bank for diner,$84.00 for Steak,Salmon,drinks,and desert. HAS

RKpbixLKrH2AzqV36NS5AQ.review_text: My wife and I took some friends from Atlanta to the Hillstone Restaurant on the Embarcadero in San Francisco on July 27.  This restaurant is part of a chain of restaurants - the first one opening in 1976 in Houston, Texas - and now comprises a repertoire of 11 establishments. The Hillstone is in an ideal location on the SF waterfront and looks right out on the Embarcadero. The ambiance is great, the service is fantastic and they have live jazz in the evening.  Everyone is friendly and accommodating, from the hostess, Christina, to our wonderful and charming waitperson, Ariel Noricks.   We started off with clam chowders and Cesar salads.  Our entrees consisted of two white snappers with crab, a grilled Salmon with a very unusual but delicious cole slaw, and a chicken salad.  For desert, we shared the most incredible key lime pie I have ever tasted.  And to top it off, we had a bottle of Rombauer Chardonnay.  That stuff is good! The only negative aspect was that the moment we sat down, we were bombarded by screaming and misbehaving young children at three tables that surrounded us.  The ambient noise level was high anyway so with the added screaming it was almost unbearable.  Ariel was wonderful and sensed our displeasure.  A table in the corner and away from the screaming opened up after about 15 minutes and she arranged for us to change tables.  We very grateful for their valiant effort to mitigate our discomfort.  Too bad the parents of these kids were so insensitive to the commotion they were causing.  My kids would never think of behaving that way in a restaurant. The din was exacerbated by the low and flat ceiling and the general design of the interior.  There were no sound absorbing features so the sound waves just bounced around and around and around. It was too bad because the food was delicious and Ariel was wonderful - probably the best waitperson I have ever encountered - charming, helpful, knowledgeable, and beautiful.  I think we would return some day but first check out the clientele to make sure we were not going to be seated next to any families. Their website is: hillstone.com/hillstone.  Click on "Embarcadero" But for the noise, I would rate this restaurant five stars.

3_ddCeA0bZMY0et4G1uFeg.review_text: My boyfriend and I frequent here a lot! At least a few times a month when we have time.  We moved here from palm beach so were regulars at pbg.  We love this location. The food is always amazing and service is always above and beyond. Thats why I will always no matter what city Im in, will go to a hillstone!

go45_agzpmuSmqMyqj199g.review_text: Houston's is like a pair of your favorite sweatpants:  Comfortable, dependable, even bliss-inspiring, to be sure.  But you aren't exactly going to shout your love from the rooftops... Alright, so I like my sweatpants, and I like Houston's.  A lot.  Damn it.  Food:  Consistently good for basic American fare, and I mean consistently good.  If you liked your meal once, you will like it the next time, and the time after, etc., and so on, yadda-yadda, you get the idea.  Meat's the focus here, and they got it down--prime rib, ribeye, pork chops, rotisserie chicken, smoked salmon (appetizer).  Veggies are good, too (grilled artichoke is a standout).  This is not about daring or avant garde cuisine; this is about well executed standards.  Never had a bad meal here.  Service:  Efficient, cordial, again, consistently so.  My advice is to hold off on ordering your entree if you want to savor your appetizer, since the entree is likely to arrive fairly soon after you place your order.  We counteract this issue simply by waiting until we are halfway through our appetizer to order our entree.  The servers are so well-drilled, you can expect them to return to your table to ask if you are ready to order with alarmingly clockwork precision.  That is not a complaint, just a testament to how well-managed this joint is.  Atmosphere:  This is a nice, comfortable place, lighting not too bright, not to dim, nice comfortable booths available, nice bar area, nice live jazz music...nice...nice...nice  Does this sound a little bland and corporate to you?  May I remind you of my sweatpants?  Couldn't you use a nice pair?    Try Houston's on for size.

w6SaPljfM2KfW9guNXCkGA.review_text: The no corkage fee is fantastic, simply because it means I can afford to come here much more often. We never get any attitude when we bring our own bottle which is so great!   While not ideal for maintaining a girlish figure... I just can't stay away from the cheeseburger and ribs here. Usually my boyfriend and I order one of each and share them. The burger is sooo juicy and delicious. Second in the city only to the burger at The Front Porch. And the fries? Houston's has the best fries ever. So skinny and crisp! I can down them with a side of BBQ sauce in about 5 minutes! The ribs usually also come with a side of coleslaw, but I always sub it out for corn or brussel sprouts. Their veggies are definitely not short on butter but taste soo good. (already raved about all these things in a previous review, but having been there a few times since then I thought I would just reiterate!)   Of the appetizers, I love the smoked salmon. It is pretty much a meal by itself though so I usually go straight for the burger.   Also has a great bar, nice patio, and they make home made dog biscuits. If you live in the area, stand outside the front door with your pup and they will bring out a Houston's made treat just for your pooch!

NEMUQwB2bnEWCmerr8-dQQ.review_text: This was my first time in this upscale eatery near Levi Plaza in San Francisco. After a small glitch in getting served, we had a pretty good dining experience. We were sat in a booth and then forgotten. No server, no drinks, no anything. I got up and told the hostess that we somehow were not on anyone's radar. We were told that there was 'a mix-up in communication' and when our server Gabby arrived, she apologized sincerely.  It's really amazing how this could happen. First day opening up? Nope. First time seating customers? Nope. Confused about how to seat a customer and then take a drink order? Maybe.  I told my friend that when restaurants go out of business, they always say that the competition was too fierce or that 'it's the economy', but neither is true. They go out of business because so few have the ability to simply get it right: seat the customer, and ask if they would like a drink while looking at the menu. Assuming that the food is good - and I think that most established, upscale restaurants have pretty good food - then the other KEY factor is service, and how the customer is treated.  I couldn't believe that in a high-priced restaurant, I had to get up and actually ask for service. In truth, there WAS a mix-up, and we really were forgotten. No back-up plan, no follow-up from the hostess, no checking to ensure that all customers are attended to. Hmmmmm  OK, enough whining....... After our server arrived, feeling bad that we were ignored, everything was great! Gabby - our friendly and helpful server - was terrific. She came back several times to check on us, and was very professional. She apologized for the mix-up again, and bought our drinks. She was everything a good server should be. Friendly, helpful, professional, and knowledgeable.  I had the ahi tuna salad and my friend had the cheeseburger. Both were outstanding, especially the tuna salad. It's a bit of a pricey place - my ahi salad was about $23. and my friend's cheeseburger and fires were $18. But, it's a very nice place with great food, and try to get Gabby as your waiter.

wz1_t7H_s7mOVeoIb7_qfA.review_text: It has been freezing cold in the San Francisco Bay Area lately.    What a warm welcome going to Hillstone.  Literally.  They have a fireplace outside the front door burning if you happen to have to stand there for 30 minutes waiting for friends to finally arrive for dinner.    Late friends don't have the usual San Francisco luxury of saying "parking was hard to find" either.  Not only is there a garage nearby with a "weekend special flat rate of $10" for the suckers...there is plenty of street parking within 1 to 2 blocks of this place.    So, finally, inside...where it is warmer; this place is pretty crowded on a Saturday night.  Waiting for a table, though, didn't take more than about the time it took to grab a Vodka Soda from the bar...less than 10 minutes?  Not even enough time to realize I should take my jacket off!  Quickly after followed a great dinner for all.  A Spinach and Artichoke Dip appetizer . The Thai Steak and Noodle Salad [Highly Recommended].   Prime Rib with a loaded Baked Potato.  And, not surprisingly, a good-sized wine list (try the Napa Valley Mi Sueno Cab).  Hillstone is good enough to go "out of your way" for, even on a cold Winter night in January.  I look forward to going again!

ZTv26RUeZm6etyt5oJLWjg.review_text: I live across the street and they won't take my "to go" order over the phone.    food is average, good enough for an occasional meal if desparate (home late for work), but there are plenty of places within a short drive that are more accommodating.

0KMJ0ah7Ce2dMlvhHwrL8Q.review_text: I used to come to this restaurant when it was called "Houston's". I believe the menu is still relatively the same.   Although pricey, you do get what you pay for. The meat is cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection. I have not met anyone who did not like what they ordered here. I ordered the Hawaiian Ribeye and it was simply amazing, definitely a flavorful and satisfying dish.   Parking is my biggest pet peeve here, but it is close to the embarcadero and the piers., which makes it a lovely place to walk around at night. Definitely will come back!

sOhv5LHFsyf8t1JpgnocMQ.review_text: Hillstone definitely loses one star because it used to be known as HOUSTON'S. I think that it should have stayed "Houston's" and that it would make more money as "Houston's." The ambiance is nice. The employees seem professional. The menu is okay. I am not always into this type of indulgent American menu. It's not the cheapest or most expensive menu. Overall, it was fun to go to for lunch. I had a hickory burger.

W-k23QYJjbWmieyH6sWAMw.review_text: I love their food! It's so tasty and delicious. PLus you're in and out of here quickly if you have reservations. There's not a lot of waiting down time which is a huge plus when you're super hungry.   However-- I feel the staff could be more personable. They definitely set the mood with the dim lighting.. but I feel the staff from front desk to waiters are a little cold sometimes. I've been to this location about 3x and it was just our most recent visit at the end of December I felt this way. We weren't even checked on often at all... only to drop off our food and refill our water glasses once.   I left with a  bad taste in my mouth.. despite the food tasting delicious!

pHGvulAeyC5SFOMfE-h4eg.review_text: we started with the clam chowder. it was just ok, nothing like a boudin's bread bowl.   we both ordered the prime rib. it was just ok, nothing amazing.   the potato was really dry, and then the meat was really salty on the outside, and the inside was just ok, not too bad.  it was 86 dollars before tax..  wasn't impressed

9eFAzAZKfd8-39d-v6g4xA.review_text: I highly urge you to eat a steak here.  They just know how to 'restaurant' here.  They are reliably very good in food, ambiance, live music volume / type, and service.  We go a few times a month, always during a weeknight to avoid crowds.  If you go here, have the steak.  If you have to go to an extra spin class or fast the day up til the meal, the steak or ribs here makes the sacrifice worth it.  The fall off the bone ribs are hard to beat.  Even the Thai steak salad is impressive with a very generous serving size of steak that will fill you up.  I've had almost all desserts here and like them all.  Key Lime special was quite good and worth the extra workout.  They get it here - service is quiet but prompt- there whenever your wine glasses near want for refilling but never hovering.  The live music is just there if you listen for it and watch for it.  The open fireplaces both outside and in are available for you to move to if you like.    I have to mention that we love the no corkage fee - so wonderful.  But they have good wines there as well. If you don't bring your own, I recommend the Gamba zinfandel -nicely smooth with any of their carcass dishes.

XfdwyPNRpxcfzkD-6hlqoA.review_text: Reservations? They're a joke.  8:30 reservation for 8 got us seated at 9:15 on a weekday.  When placing the reservation the hostess asked us if anyone in our party was "fat".  The hostess was absolutely unconcerned about having to make us wait.  After asking the manager regarding the failed reservation he made the excuse that when making the reservations we should have been informed (we weren't) that it was a "non-traditional" reservation and so we shouldn't expect to be seated.  Honestly?  Yes, the food can be good, but there are many places in SF to get a great dinner at this price.  Don't waste your time here.

4AfrlTflL31x2cGcvchIJQ.review_text: Ok this place has some very positive attributes, good to very good food, excellent cocktails and, nice atmosphere. On the down side do not and I mean do not order your food for take out. They have the bar tenders managing the process including paying and handing over the food. Of course their main priority is serving customers at the bar and not people ordering take out. For the past 3 times the food was cold and very delayed in picking up. Take a clue from their sister restaurant, The Los Altos Grill and have a totally separate wait and pick up station. Customers will feel much more attended to and be willing to actually enjoy a warm meal.

nXaSrT0aqPhyb1-zQYE9Ow.review_text: Still a fan of Houston's (I mean Hillstone ;)  Good wine list - enjoyed a hearty pouring of the Edna Valley Pinot Noir... and, fabulous veggie burger (only $15!)  Ask for veggies or cous cous instead of fries and you'll be very pleased.  My friend went for the cous cous and I added brussels sprouts with bacon bits.  Fabulous.  I love this place for it's openness and umpteen booths.  There's also a special spot for two right in front of the fire place. Order a nice red wine and make your way there with a good friend or a date.   If the weather is decent, sit outside on the Embarcadero and people watch. Or grab a seat in front of the fire pit at the entrance.  Food, location, ambiance, it's worth returning over and again.

7-WAlOP8llmqimVWcGLv8Q.review_text: Wow... Is all I can say. First to start off the manager greeted myself and my guest as soon as we sat down. Next the waitress samara was the most knowledgeable service I have ever had the pleasure of encountering. My guests and my self had the steak, one the hawian ribeye and the roasted ribeye. The meals were cooked to perfection and also were the best steaks I have ever tasted. I hope I visit San Francisco again soon so I can experience this wonderful restaurant again. Also as a bonus they give away homemade dog biscuits to the local dog owners and then add in the no corking fee for the bottle of wine we brought and this place truly becomes a neighborhood gem!!!

DvcGLctH2BqT4tYsvscI0A.review_text: First off, I love restaurants that allow you to make reservations through Yelp. Also, they call you to confirm/remind you. Gold stars right off the bat!  They are located right along the Embarcadero, so you have somewhat of a pretty view (if you don't mind looking at cars passing by). And the restaurant itself is cozy & beautiful. I've usually gone here during lunch time but I was told that they usually have live music at night which I have yet to experience.  But let's go over what I know/LOVE about Hillstone...  Their service never disappoints, I want to make that known. But I want to highlight the food:  THAI. STEAK. NOODLE. SALAD. I can never have enough of this! I've recommended this to others and every single person enjoys it as much as I do. Also, it's the perfect portion... better yet, perfect everything!  Crispy Chicken Sandwich You could totally share this between 2 people. If I'm not mistaken, the sandwich is served in 4 pieces. I tried this from a co-worker who couldn't finish it and brought it back to the office and that in itself is good. So imagine getting it fresh...   You get what you pay for, so I usually go here for special occasions or to take/meet any friends that are visiting.

nVp4TbSUYaSWRRhdPUfZkw.review_text: I went here for my younger brother's graduation lunch and it was fabulous! I particularly enjoyed the BBQ ribs and the variety of desserts.

crjYvHR75dylqUeidozOYg.review_text: This is my go-to place for great food, excellent service, no corkage fee, comfy seating, outdoor patio seating, and the dark-lit ambiance. My favorites on the menu are the Hawaiian ribeye, home smoked salmon appetizer, the BBQ ribs, and the rubenesque sandwich.

DYnwxeHxbdrXihK-B_uglQ.review_text: Situated across from Alcatraz landing and a short walk from the Pier 39 tourist mecca, Hillstone offered a pleasant reprieve from the hustle of the street. We stopped in for a relaxing lunch to rest our feet and enjoy a peaceful meal. The tortilla soup was creamy and spiced perfectly and while the spinach and artichoke dip was good, the artichokes were not abundant and a few minutes in the broiler would have given a much needed accent to the dish.  Overall, a pleasant experience and worth the above average price given the location.

Z9boj3QdTXyw4glpJ84Cog.review_text: Personally: overpriced, not really San Fran feel and well, trying to suck tourists in.  What the rest of my group thought: fun, expensive, let's dress-up-and-go-out-on-the-town kind of place.  The food was good, but we had been walking around all day so really, anything would have tasted good at that point.  The lighting was so dark, I thought I was in a frat-house party and someone was about to trick me into drinking something I didn't order.  The atmosphere was very ritzy, and while I was wearing what I consider nicer clothes, I still felt a little out of place.  I would suggest the Prime Rib as it just melts in your mouth, but also be ready to pay for it.  The Tuna Burger was also very well made.  Tips: If you have poor vision, find somewhere else, otherwise bring a flashlight.

2x0qKCEC0i8xm7LvIb4n9g.review_text: Good food, liked the ambiance, and hit the spot.

Sqk1SP4mcDdwm9ZnyDhuDA.review_text: Great location and great atmosphere.  Also very accessible as there are a lot of street parking.  I loved the decor as there was a fireplace inside and live jazz music! We tried the artichoke dip which was amazing.  I got the cajun red trout which was decent, it was a bit dried and burnt.  Lovely as there is no corkage fee for certain parties  Also has a great bar area when waiting for the table, all in all i was impressed!

0rdtzeopvGVsWvRZaTXiNg.review_text: House salad Ribs Five nut walnut brownie  heaven  Still my favorite chain of all time

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: I've come here for some drinks and lunch and I had an enjoyable experience both times.   Its definitely a more upscale place but its nice to come to because the food is excellent and the service is great.  Right off the Embarcadero you see the water and Bay Bridge from some parts of restaurant.   We ordered spinach artichoke dip as an appetizer which had the whole artichoke and was really tasty.  Didn't even have to ask for more chips and they brought it right away.   I got the "Famous" French Dip and it was really good.  Very greasy and unhealthy but very filling. I also asked for roasted vegetables instead of fries and it came with a very eclectic bunch of veggies including brussel sprouts and carrots.  Loved it.   I can see this being a great dinner spot.

5gbkhlWANGVzQYi_0m3vOQ.review_text: DEEElicious. I wish my stomach was bigger so I could eat more.  The Thai Salad with Fillet contains a whopping 6 ounces of meat. The meat was kind of smokey and tender, and the lettuce was shredded cabbage of some sort. I wasn't a big fan of the dressing, but I love the idea of the ingredient combination.  The Hawaiian Rib Eye was cooked perfectly and very tender. I just wish the marinade was less sweet.   I can't wait to come back to try the other cuts of beef!

bTFZ-cepM91pdS2PFpvJiA.review_text: Half stars, yelp.. you need HALF stars.  This place was too good to leave it with only 3, so 4 it is.  The decor also reminds me a bit of yardhouse, which I like.  The boy made the observation that it's a bit as though they bought out an old denny's, changed out the leather to red, and dimmed the lights.  Works though - different atmosphere, with the bar next to the booth seats and the open kitchen... I don't have anything bad to say.  Our waitress was a total sweetheart.  Attentive and helpful, Kudos!  The boy's parents LOVED the house? or beet.. salad with all the random yellow beets and fun veggies. I think the boy's dad even might have said, "it's out of this world good?"  1. The filet - yes, would do it again. 2. mashed potatoes - meh, nothing special can't have more than a few bites.. then over it. 3. jumbo crab cakes - would not do again. glad i didnt order it for my main! =/ 4. Carmalized Onion Soup (soup of the day) - YUMMMY!!!! It's like French onion soup..but BETTER. 5. Lemon Drops - lemony with quite a bitta alcohol.... would do again.  6. Ice Cream Sundae - I don't usually like to share desserts, but you gotta share this one.. ... 7. "worth the wait coffee" - was indeed worth it. nice way to end the meal  I liked the location.. a bit further down the Embarcadero but just before it gets crazy at Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf.  Liked the decor, food was good.. I left happy, but my heart still belongs to HOUSE OF PRIME RIB!!!!

XrOtG_35xrtTYazoBk7dpg.review_text: I remember going here a few years back for a friends bday dinner. NOT a good place for large groups. I don't even know why she chose this restaurant, I know it was her favorite but they can't accomodate large parties. We didn't even get to all sit at the same table, we were however right next to each other in seperate booths. There were about 12 of us. I just remember the food being pricey, and not worth the price. But it's in a nice location, on the Embarcadero walking distance from the Piers. Elegant ambiance, more for a nice romantic intimidate dinner.

UjjlmqOgpyowAiOIcOaTfA.review_text: Boyfriend and I went for his birthday a few weeks ago to eat at one of our favorite places - so we thought. They have changed the menu so neither of us could order our favorite dishes. I was disappointed to see they took away my salmon, the subsitution was not satisfactory. The best thing was our drinks period. We wont be coming back at this point. I hate when places chagne the menu. I'm all for spicing things up but the old options should still be on their hidden menu as an option. So sad!

KXmovFNsj5VS44h4RrLhBg.review_text: We had dinner reservations at 5:30pm on a Saturday. There were plenty of metered parking spaces on Montgomery Street. $2/hr (price drops to 50c/hr after 7pm) isn't too bad. Hillstone also validates parking (1/2) off at one of the garages half a block down.  For a party of 8 (4 adults and 4 kids) we were seat in a large C-shaped booth. It would have been a bit tight had it been 8 adults.  We were greeted almost immediately and our drink orders taken. Cassie, our waitress, surprised our friends when she said she remembered them from a few months ago and even recited their dinner order! The waitress even brought over 4 "doodle pads" for the kids to play with.  BTW, no corkage fee!   We had the following: Spinach and Artichoke Dip with Chips Grilled Artichokes Prime Rib Hawaiian Rib Eye House-made Veggie Burger BBQ Pork Ribs Apple Walnut Cobbler Hot Fudge Sunday Coffee "Worth the wait" Fresh squeezed lemonade French fries baked potato  I can safely say that everything we had was excellent! Their hawaiian rib-eye made it into my top 5 list of the best steaks I've ever had!  They automatically added 18% gratuity since we had 8 people but on the receipt they stamped it red "18% added". I know people who have double tipped at places not knowing it was already added so I felt this was pretty class of them to explicitly tell us.   I will definitely be back.

7lqyNsIm3af0uwSjz47vMg.review_text: My wife and I have been eating at hillstone/Houston's since for over 15 years.  We usually came on Saturday's for chili and cheeseburgers ( before the gluten free days).  We are done-- can't justify the high prices for four since they have massively reduced the kids menu. We brought the kids here for years.  My son would get a filet (and eat it for two days) and my daughter would get rotisserie chicken from the kids menu.  This trip we learned that they had removed most of the items from the kids menu.  Apparently, they felt some people were taking advantage of the kids menu.  Never paid a bill here where I thought I had gotten over on anybody.  I suspect they want to discourage guests from bringing kids.  Not only no gluten free options for kids but only two choices; grilled cheese or a cheeseburger. Spoke with Anna Garay, the executive chef.  Not pleasant or informative.  She would have me believe that no one in the restaurant industry had ever found a way to have choices for children without being taken advantage of by adults.  The solution to offer very scant choices is pitiful and small-minded.  What happened to this place.

Eq9QZc1LC-EgCFUB8RmT-Q.review_text: I went here for my birthday dinner last week. I gotta say it was excellent. The atmosphere and location rock. The service was good. The food was excellent. I had the pork chop which was HUGE! But it was cooked just right. And then for my birthday I had to order the ice cream sundae which was one of the best I've had.  I definitely recommend this place. A little expensive but a great restaurant for a special occasion.

rpwaF2wCSmFvmUxhtSDVDA.review_text: The food was excellent and there is easy street parking because it is on a dead part of Embarcadero.  The drink service was terribly slow, so I dinged them one star.  Anait was our waitress and she was an absolute pleasure.

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: Love this place. Love the cocktails, love the ribs, love the french dip, love the atmosphere...you get it. Typical American fare that never disappoints.  I heard they ended their no corkage policy which slightly saddens me. My ONLY complaint is that it's hard to get a cab or other form of transportation home from this place.  That won't ever stop me though! The food, service and atmosphere is more than worth it!

fqIWhF0pL2TI4VHsM7rOLg.review_text: They do a lot of things right here. Had dinner here yesterday, to celebrate the end of another semester at school. We had their famous "fall off the bone" baby back ribs, which were fabulous! Bonus points for the hot towel to clean my hands afterwards. And to round things out, had a hot fudge sundae dessert. Mmmm! Check the photos, yum!   I save going to Hillstone for special occasions, but really anytime is the right time to go there. You can taste the difference in the fresh ingredients they use. The service is friendly and professional. Great place to go with friends. They also have an outside patio, nice for the warmer days of summer.

v8zBE-b2iaNsMhMew-JbWw.review_text: A-ok is right. The beauty of going to a chain restaurant is that you have a set level of expectations and consistency. Hillstone is definitely consistent and fulfills the average level of expectation I have for this place. The food and service are both decent. The ambience is nice and they have live music during dinner hours (I can't remember if this is daily or just on the weekends).   Warning - there is usually a long wait for a table during dinner hours (at least 45 min). They have an adequate bar space so if you are a party of 1-3, I suggest this as your plan A.

xoNpQ_DnzNuTbkFPPO0Lgw.review_text: We went here awhile back (maybe 2 yrs ago? For a friend's birthday. Yea, I'm trying to catch up on my reviews!) I had ordered a Hawaiian burger (I had already eaten) that was done really well. My friends ordered the Roasted Prime Rib and the Filet Mignon. Both were really juicy and tender.  Great place if you want meat done right!

b0Jzt-A0Ng8x_h_x4IBEIw.review_text: Love their smoked salmon appetizer, Hawaiian ribeye, and their ice cream sundae!

7SJBvTrDaRKeON6BgyZJ-g.review_text: Overall: Been here at least 15 times within the last 1.5 years. Every time has been great. Rarely messes up (but if they do, probably because there are just so many people. We're all human.) Wait tends to be long on a Friday or weekend night, but there is a bar where you can order drinks and appetizers already. Well-worth the wait.   Ambiance: Suitable for couples. good if you're on your first few dates because it has a lively atmosphere and sometimes live band (Piano, Double Bass, Guitar). Diffuse out any initial awkwardness.  Suitable for group of friends. lively atmosphere and large plates that could be shared or kept to yourself.  Good eats: - Artichoke dip!! with chips: another good recommendation is at Skates on the Bay in Berkeley Marina (Artichoke crab dip with focaccia bread but only go during Happy Hour) - Prime rib: it's different from House of Prime Rib because the edge of the rib is crusted with pepper and salt, so when you take a bite into that piece with a peppered and salted edge, mmmmmmm; medium rare is the juiciest. The ultimate orgasm is a piece with some fat, pepper/salt crust and juicy meat all in one bite. - French dip: another good recommendation for French dip is Fenton's Creamery in Piedmont Oakland. But the meat here is a lot juicier.  So-so eats: - Their fish dishes - Smoked salmon appetizer

gfgkvix7q5umHHeZgDdFuw.review_text: Great Food! Seriously, there's nothing on the menu that you can go wrong with... Even the cole slaw is GOOD! LOL!   Must try: Ribs and the Hawaiian Rib Eye

VmlShd8k2tq7-O4TVx5R1Q.review_text: Still after 5 years Hillstones is still my fav restaurant  Consistent in service and food Great atmosphere Great food  Love this place!

RYCwT_maafjhypEGR9E3sw.review_text: This is my fiance's favorite restaurant. we go for her birthday.  The wait was long, even with reservations, but the food is always good.  thai steak salad and ribs are faves.

iefGX05wSgB7PP6JUc-lyw.review_text: You cant go wrong with their Hawaiian Rib eye and Grilled Artichokes.  However the reason I'm giving them the rare 5 stars is for their service.  I have tendinitis in my right hand and basically cannot use it to eat.  I asked the waiter if the chef would be offended if I asked him to cut my steak for me, and he jumped in and said he would do it for me.  Sure enough, as soon as my food got to our table, he painstakingly cut my entire steak.  I was so grateful because seriously, who goes to Hillstone and doesn't order steak?

Qv0xMxEs9XHEqI_9zb8vcQ.review_text: Had a wonderful dinner Sunday evening with my wife.   With so many choices to pick from in the city, we just picked this simply because it looked like a nice place. Right on the Embarcadero, it set a nice mood for the evening. The restaurant itself was modern and oozed out some class, but not too much to a point that you felt underdressed if you weren't in a suit and tie. I'm sure many tourist also frequent the place as seen by several families we saw dining at the time. The lighting was very dim. It does assist in setting the mood properly for a date night. Some may consider it too dark, but it didn't bother myself or my wife.  I had the Prime Rib, and my wife had the steak and fries. My prime rib was requested medium and it came out just right. It was a nice thick cut. Definitely more than enough leaving me so full at the end of the night. Mind you this is without any appetizers or bread which they do NOT provide if you were wondering. So NO, if you were wondering, there is no complimentary bread. My prime rib came with a fully loaded baked potato and a side of horseradish sauce. The potato was ok, nothing spectacular, but everything you expect it to be. Overall the prime rib was good. Would I recommend it over House of Prime rib? I forgot the price of the prime rib here, but I know it was around the same price as a smaller cut at the House if Prime rib. So if you want a bigger cut for same/similar price you can't go wrong here. But all the additions at the "House" may consider that to be the go to place. I did fully enjoy my prime rib here and would get it again. My wife ordered her steak medium well and it came out just as it should. It was tender and very tasty. They had a marinate on it that really was evident with each bite.   Overall, we had a splendid time here. The staff was very nice and the food was good. It wasn't mind blowing good, but I had no issues with my experience. Your in a prime location in the city, nice dining atmosphere, and good food. Can't go wrong, and didn't during our time here.

trQ_mHssgXOqKPEO5LNMtA.review_text: My girlfriend and I have visited this restaurant several times. We love their roasted artichoke appetizer. This past visit was with two friends and their baby. Food was excellent.  Service seemed intentionally inattentive to us. Beverages were never once refilled and our friends' stroller (we offered to collapse it and stow it under the table mind you) was first whisked away near the piano and then re-parked near the fire place. Felt like we were dumped when they saw we had a baby with us and presumably no alcohol ordered to rack up a bill there.  Great place to take out-of-towners from smaller places who may not have a daring taste for non-American dishes. If you have kids, you risk being snubbed and may fare better elsewhere.

qurv1eJZswxUZaZqN53Meg.review_text: OK what? The sign inside still says Houston's...I'm sort of mad because this used to be Houston's and I feel like I got tricked!... I don't like chain restaurants, so I definitely wouldn't have come had I known.  ** -- Food -- ** - PS no free bread, what?? blasphemy. - Smoked salmon: decent, a bit fatty and a toast points were plain and sort of boring.  - Focaccia: $4 for mediocre at best focaccia with a few olives, not worth it - Trout: decent but nothing spectacular, broccoli it came with reminded me more of some like chili's or applebee's kind of thing. undercooked and over garnished with some pre-grated parmesan - Prime rib: friend enjoyed this large portion, but it didn't seem to be anything out of the ordinary.  ** -- Desserts? They only and a few options that didn't tickle my fancy (they also did not have a menu for it). Unfortunate.  ** -- Net net --** Large portions here reminded me too much of some chain, not a nice place. Service was decent, but this wouldn't be my 1st choice given the price and  taste.

_lbgVbWTvxV9VTVWU0YnwA.review_text: I know this is long, but trust me, you'll want to read it.  SPIDERS AND MORE!!!!!  I live down the street from Houstons.  Because of this and some of their delicous menu options, my bf and I would dine here often.  After last Saturday's experience, I doubt we'll be back ever again.  We got there on Saturday (March 21,2009) around 8:00.  We knew they'd be busy, but didn't know that we'd be completely ignored.  We put our name on the wait list and proceeded to the bar to get a couple drinks.  We sat and waved at the THREE bartenders FOR AT LEAST THIRTY MINUTES.  By the time we FINALLY got the guy's attention (the ONLY GUY behind the bar) he litterally looked at us, shook his head and rolled his eyes.  I WAS DISGUSTED!!!!  I wanted to leave right then and there.  My bf on the other hand, really wanted the burger - so we stayed.  We tried to rationalize that this guy wasn't a bartender, but maybe a bar back.  In any event, he could've just said so rather than rolling his eyes and shaking his head at us.    Finally, one of the female bartenders served us and 5 minutes later, our table was ready.  As we started to walk to the table, guess what we see?  The Jerk bartender guy pooring wine into glasses.  So, can anyone explain this to me?  Once we sat at the table, we ordered our appetizer and shortly after that, ordered our salads and meals.    Out came the app.  YAY, our favorite.  We started to dig in - 2 minutes later, our salads came out.  Now, I'm a little irriatated that I have to eat my app and salad at the same time.  I thought - I hope they leave us a little time to eat this before our meals come out.  10 minutes later, out came our food.  We still had a ton of salad and app left.  They tried to clear it to make room and I snapped saying - "NO, can we please eat what we ordered?  We'll eat it with our dinner."  So at this time, we're pretty irritated that our meal was completely rushed, while it was impossible to even get service at the bar.  Finally, we finish and we're ready for the bill.  The server comes to the table and offers to box my steak.  I refuse and politely ask her to bring me a box so that I can box it myself.  As we're waiting for the box to come, all of a sudden, I SEE A BIG (I MEAN BIG) SPIDER crawling down it's web, dangling over my steak.  I freak out because I HATE spiders, grab the web, and throw the spider to the ground.  At this point, I look at my bf and say - "I REALLY JUST WANT TO LEAVE NOW!!!"  I had my legs propped up on his seat across from me, scared that the spider would crawl up my leg.  My bf on the other hand was quiet calm and just shocked by the entire chain of events.  The waitress finally came out, gave us the box, and I boxed up my steak.  Mintues later, as we were about to leave, my bf jerks and slaps his face.  SPIDER GUTS ALL OVER HIS FACE.  Now at this point, he's pissed, disgusted, and we left.  Sorry Houstons - I realize you're a chain restaurant, but, you need to learn a few things about customer service and perhaps have an exterminator visit your place

52oH4DrRvzzl8wh5UXyU0A.review_text: When that heat wave came through SF, I walked here to cool down. I love the location, right on the Embarcadero and such a cozy spot. They have an outside patio where you can bring your dogs to eat too. And they have a nice fireplace going on outside at night. It's usually busy here so you sometimes have to wait for a bit but they have a nice outdoor area with benches you can chill at and people watch.  Is it just me or this place is way dark inside? I know they want to set the tone, but it's a little TOO dark in here so ladies, be careful not to trip. But otherwise, the atmosphere is nice and cozy and the live group on the pianos and violins add to the ambiance. The service is always superb from the hostess to the waitress. Everyone in my group except one ordered the famous french dip sandwich. It's good, but I'm not a fan of that anyway, but it is the best one I've tasted. I ordered it cause it was one of the less expensive dishes on the menu and I didn't really feel like eating a hot steak on that hot day. What I REALLY love is the humongous fully loaded baked potato. I know, heart attack waiting to happen, but hey, sometimes you just need one. It's NOT as good as how I can make it though *wink* but it's still great =D   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! Couples, friends, parents, tourists etc. Try sitting out on the patio on a nice evening and bring your doggie along!

aw973Pm1nrTbRjP4zY9B9g.review_text: First time here was a recent trip for valentines day - made a reservation via yelp and it was an easseeeee!  This spot has a very nice decor and dark lighting for that romantic stuff - perfect to take the lady on a date.  After being seated promptly at one of the booths - I noticed they had live music playing which was awesome. They definitely know how to play some of the hits you hear on the radio  Anyways - ordered the following: 1. spinach and artichoke dip - awesome flavor and came out in a quickness; wasn't too cheesy either 2. Hawaiian rib eye - that marinade they cook it with is bomb dot com. get it medium or medium rare and that meat is going to melt each bite not gonna lie 3. flying tuna platter - tuna was seasoned perfectly and this plate   In the end - everything just blended well together and made a great complete dinner.

K4XEuv7IPklItlkgTR--PQ.review_text: Very very disappointed... So much so that this is my first review I have ever done on the net. Terrible service and even worse management. Shockingly overpriced.  With so many great dining choices in San Francisco I highly recommend you pass on Houston's.

-iU9QIGF87LCAxUL7zoryw.review_text: We went after work and it was a wonderful experience. I was happy with everything from the service to the food. Our waters were always refilled, were checked on frequently enough but not an overwhelming amount, AND the live music. Great.  We started off with a round of chips and spinach and artichoke dip. We went through so many chips and asked to get more chips at least three different times. Our request was always pleasantly answered with more crispy chips and never a small amount!  I ordered the french dip and it was perfect with the au jus and horseradish. The fries were a tad salty but overall, very pleasant.  My friend got the pork chop which was great then--and still great the day after which is saying a lot!  I'd like to go back and try the ribs one day and a burger in restaurant. Have had that as leftovers/take out and can only assume it'll be even better in house.  TL;DR: great atmosphere, service, and food + live music. Can't go wrong.

ACwVWtAzqZ1XTAGmRz6Mvg.review_text: As you walk up to this joint you realize that the outside has a nice firepit, which i assume would be used to keep the homeless warm, but instead it keeps the trendy and upscale nice and cozy. When you walk into the spot the greet you right away which was nice. I was told if you stand near the bar the chef tosses ya piece of meat. The price was high, trust me, this is a great date place but your going to drop upwards of 100 bucks, but you get some great food. My Jack'n Coke was mighty stiff and worth the $8.   The bread and olives were the bomb, the service is great, and if you ask for a hot towel it makes the dinner complete. Parking is decent around the area, also this place could be great for a happy hour and the lunch menu is kicking also.

dfYNTBw--CYlZbFz581kYQ.review_text: Houston's is a fabulous chain though, interestingly enough, the menu varies a lot by location. I love the San Francisco menu with all it's fishy and asian-fusion glory. I haven't been in a while but was particularly impressed with their asian-inspired salads. Yum! The bread is also delicious and the service tends to be stellar.   In SF, you can choose an indoor or outdoor table overlooking the Embarcadero and the water (beautiful!). You may have to wait a while for a table but simply pull up a seat at the not-so-busy bar while you wait. Enjoy!!!

EXKkKWAxWQAEmAWo-nL3Yg.review_text: My feelings for this establishment is a little ambiguous.   I usually have come here for weekend brunch or on the way back from wine country on the mission to self-defensive eating but also dinner like last night.  For brunch, this is a great place, the food is always enjoyable, I normally like the Ahi Tuna salad at this time of day. The real deal for me is the comfort of not ever having to wait at least to sit. Lines are my enemy at restaurants and in life and weekend brunches are notorious for them at Hillstone it was never the case and quit enjoyable for that reason.  For dinner if you like me, need to feel the comfort of fries and burgers sometimes especially at the end of the weekend this is it. And this place does not have the nervousness of new establishments but the comfort of a place that has been around a while, a bit like Zuni in that sense. Relaxed, warmer then Zuni too and the bar, my favorite spot, has great seating to eat and drink.  My ambiguousness boils down to the service, its never charming, sweet, happy or friendly. In fact I would say down right boring, inattentive, aloof and a little snotty. Apart from when the bill is served of course. We have had to wait a lot after being seated or seating ourselves at the bar. Last night a good example, we sit at the bar hungry and thirsty, the waitress seems to not see us, and as a side note I hardly go unnoticed otherwise and even if I did, even better reason to see us.   So we flag down the waitress just in front of us which apparently till that moment has been able to see straight thew us, and as a note is working there with 3 others, which should allow her the ability to see everyone she is supposed to.   When we finally get her attention the snotty, unfriendly attitude makes me wonder what is wrong with her that day, did she fight with her boyfriend or not get laid in years? Whatever the reason I really do not want it to be my problem, it was completely devoid of charm and appalling the way she carried out her little rendezvous with us that night and with food as good as this place has it the little adjustment needed to make the guests, such as ourselves, feel more comfortable should be so easy.

8xjQhDv1Fn2snFObsUfXVQ.review_text: I have been going to Hillstone (previously Houston's) and Rutherford Grill for many years.  The food has always been great, as well as the service.  Last night, however, I experienced a situation at the hands of Hillstone management that was beyond the pale. Specifically, I had planned a work dinner for 8.  We were seated at a round booth that more than accommodated our group.  Shortly after we ordered appetizers and wine, a spouse of one of the attendees decided to join us, for whom we had plenty of space at our table.  After having been sat for more than 30 minutes, the manager came over to our table and told us that he was going to have to split us into a table of 5 and 4, because they have a "policy" that does not allow nine people to sit at a table, regardless of whether or not there is more than enough space for everyone. As this was my work dinner, I was appalled and appealed to the manager to allow us to please sit there as it was not bothering anyone.  The manager, however, refused to allow us to sit there.  Instead he forced us to move to two adjacent booths and split up the party.  After a short time it was clear this arrangement would not work and I was forced to have everyone get up from dinner, and walk up the street to the Fog City Dinner, where they were more than willing to accommodate us.    I can understand if we were making another party uncomfortable or causing a safety hazard (such a blocking a fire hazard, etc.).  No such issue was present.  Instead, Hillstone management, in essence, threw my group to the curb for absolutely no legitimate reason.  I am incensed that a restaurant would act in such a manner.  It caused a ridiculous shuffling and scene that was entirely unnecessary.  And moreover they had three empty tables sitting there with no one to fill them.    I called to their corporate management this morning, and they could also care less. Over the years I have spent tens of thousands of dollars at their restaurants, which again, they could care less about.  Ok, that's there decision.  Very, very disappointed with the restaurant and it's management's attitude!

mWeqGkQ9rb6pC8naw87Oyw.review_text: My first time at Hillstone this past Saturday, Had a fab dinner of prime rib. Two friends had the ribs, all so fab.  We will return ASAP.  Our waiter Gregory was the best waiter ever. (not kidding). It's an expensive restaurant but it is worth it.  The only thing, double check on your reservation, they didn't write ours down. OOPS!

gbEipqvHnUNYl2NDSBB-lQ.review_text: This is my GO TO epicenter for a fantastic RibEye (Hawaiian, of course).    I've been eating at this establishment since moving to the Bay from Houston (get it).    After 15 years, I still love the ambiance, the food, and the service.    Thank you Hillstone for continuing to maintain that level of excellence.    I'll see ya'll soon!

cZ42NXqAN2jxqUgirS5Xww.review_text: After some convincing from my gf to come here, I finally did. I have no idea why I wasn't too fond of this place. Here I come Hillstone!  Came here on the 2-27-10 for my friend's bday.  First thing I noticed, it reminded me of the old Peppermill restaurant in Daly City, which is now the buffet place Moonstar. Dark and gloomy which I thought was a nice setting.  We had a party of 8, 30 min wait. First thing we went for was the bar. I must say, finally tried my first dirty martini, it was a weird experience.  Never had olive juice with my vodka. EXTRA OLIVES? SUREEE!!  Food was good, half the group ordered the prime rib, which I wished I had also. I got the BBQ ribs instead which was great btw. it fell right off the bone, comes with cole slaw and fries. Next time, I will get the prime rib, it was a nice thick slice with a fully loaded potato.   I noticed a lot of tables having 5-6 bottles of wine, which I concluded there wasn't a corkage fee. No wonder people brought 5-6 bottles, next time I need to go to Costco and bring a bottle of Kettle 1.  Bring a date, I bet he/she would find the atmosphere romantic.

_AkzLi-mwarhc6Xr7l8xpg.review_text: I'm not sure I get this place.  The food is good, don't get me wrong.  Actually, it's pretty great.  But the prices?  It just doesn't make sense.  I guess it's about location, lack of competition, etc.  The food is good and the service is nice.    I'll keep eating there on my company's dime.

2v3bge4NcSyxubv6YqtEgQ.review_text: Went back and it was fantastic, must have been an off night the first time. I strongly recommend the roast chicken. The manager Cameron runs a tight ship over there.

bYP0DYoLrjtA2qq_kNaDyQ.review_text: Hillstone (Houston's) is always one of our top choice for a first rate meal and happy dining experience, especially when we don't feel like taking chances exploring a new place and when we don't feel like dealing with the annoyance of bad service elsewhere. My husband and I have been dining at Hillstone for about five years, probably with an average of once per month, and I can say with confidence that we are always happy when we leave and always happy to go back. Even though this is a midsized family-owned national chain of boutique restaurants, the experience is on par or better than other high-end and "yelp-raved" restaurants.   At Hillstone there is no risk to be seated at a bad table or to be assigned to a bad waiter: the service is always excellent and pleasant. Even the host employees are always nice. Your order will not be messed up and if you ask for modifications on the preparation of your meal, they will be happy to accommodate them AND they will get them right. The portions are satisfying and the food is not heavy... so unless you eat more than you should, you will not leave feeling heavy and gross. And on top of all this, there have no corkage fee.   ---------- Summary --------------------------   SERVICE: excellent, always  FOOD: very good and always perfectly prepared  ATMOSPHERE: high-end but comfortable, low lights, comfy upscale boots and tables, live jazz on some nights, fireplace at one end, lots of dark wood.  BAR: great place for a drink, where you can sit comfortably and talk, with enough going on to make it lively, but not too loud. Great to also eat here.  PARKING: easy street parking - a plus when you don't feel like dealing with it.  TIP: they have NO CORKAGE FEE 7day per week!! So now you have another reason to stock up on amazing wine during your visits to Napa or Sonoma Valley!  -----------------------------------   MORE DETAILS:   Some of our favorite entrees:  The fish sandwich (which is not on the dinner menu, but most times they have it at night too, if you ask them), the "evil Jungle Salad" (also called Thai Steak Noodle Salad), the Double Cut Pork Chop, the Ribs, the seasonal Vegetables or vegetable plate. All the appetizers are great: the home-smoked salmon is our favorite lately, but the grilled artichokes are a close number two option.   For dessert:  You can't go wrong with the classic American five-nut brownie with ice cream (this one WILL make you feel bloated but it's yummy), or the Hot Fudge Sunday, which arrives with a whole gravy boat filled with melted TCHO chocolate!! Dreamy!   The bar is also very nice. I love the lighting and the atmosphere. Sometimes we purposely go to Hillstone to eat at the bar. And the bartenders are always nice, attentive, and make great classic cocktails.   Sometimes be the wait, especially at peak hours on weekends, and they don't take reservations.    SUGGESTION TO THE MANAGEMENT:  Can you get rid of the newer oval plates that say "Hillstone" on them? They look too mainstream and are a bit of a step down from before.

EDwgntEyg69iTtbjM2wHYw.review_text: Love everything about this place instead of the name...still love the name Houston's. What the hell is Hillstone?  Marketing a larger demographic at the sacrifice of its roots is sad.  But I love the food this is my go to for at least once a month.  Love the French Dip, Smoked Salmon....still the best Prime rib on Bone in the city for me.  Also love their Cesar Salad....  Finally I love their Sundae....5  Stars but the name is awful and I still call this place Houston's to all my friends.

jZL7x3WIaXkBtQL70x8-fA.review_text: Hat's OFF Again - WHAT???  We've been a devoted fan of Houston's, Hillstone and their many evolutions of fine restaurants at various locations for 28 years. No other restaurant group has such good management, food and consistent service.  I used to give them 100% , the past few years, maybe 95%. Still our go to place about twice a month for Sunday night, living in SF.  About 5 years ago, as we were being seated, manager announced to us that they had a "no baseball hat policy." Strange as NoCal started the whole business casual thing and we were dressed in cashmere sweater and jeans. As an embarrassing moment- best to be called away from the table and guests to address this but we thought - fine enough. Upon later visits, noticed lot's of baseball hats and sloppy dressers so chocked it off to someone had a new idea but no longer appropriate.  So on occasion, baseball hats return - don't give it much thought. After all, this is a SF restaurant with sports games broadcast over the bar and a friendly casual place. Not the Pacific or Bohemian Club.  So tonight we had guests in from out of town, one gentleman just finished a round of chemo, hair line isn't looking the best so he wore a hat. So tonight, we have a young hostess ask him to remove it as they have a no hats policy for men. Strange was the table next to us had a gentleman with a Giants hat on, on the other side of the restaurant, we found another. Needless to say this was unpleasant but more importantly found the management of such a frivolous and inconsistent policy, a policy which is not notated on the web or front door, ego, "Jackets Required."  So tonight, our dear friend, who is fighting cancer, who looked forward to a night out and who had no idea it would be inappropriate to wear a hat and who would then be embarrassed by a hostess who might have been doing her job but whose execution was a disaster.  If Hillstone wants such a policy, they need to give proper notification of such a policy and  polity address it by asking the guest by stepping aside and most importantly, be consistent.  Going forward, if we have a bad hair day, we might skip Hillstone but will certainly return because they serve great food. Will be interesting to see how this plays out.

I1I_I6jg8mK5joTGvZ7idA.review_text: Dining at Hillstone was a very happy accident. We had just put in a long day, (early morning, 12 hours straight, no breaks, no lunch,) and just wanted a place that served a decent amount of grilled (non-fishy,) protein.   Walking along the bay, reading each menu, examining the number of open seats, we bypassed location after location. Until finally, out of the corner of my eye, I spotted Hillstone across the street. Shaded among the trees, I couldn't tell that it was a dining establishment at first.   Luckily Yelp's iPhone app saved the day, and we dodged cars and train to arrive at Nirvana.   First off, the Rosemary Focaccia and Olive Plate could easily be a meal for one by itself. I have never had focaccia that was just so perfect! My only complaint, is that the individual pieces were huge!   I settled on the Prime Rib, I've somehow never had it bone in Prime Rib before. Let me tell you though, I am sold on that practice. This was one of the best pieces of meat I've ever had, even compared to the place in Dallas Texas where the owner's brother raised the cattle and only sent over the choicest cuts. Even better then what I and my degree in Grillology can manage in the back yard at home.  The Hawaiian Rib-eye was just as good, and simply sealed Hillstone as one of the best places for a side of beef around.

iN1eEF2Li96ap5q3Yoyg6g.review_text: First of all, When i was here i thought the food was great. Tasted very good and it as a nice venue and i liked the vibe. Why im getting it so low of a rating is because of the aftermath.   I GOT THREADWORMS. As embarassing as it is to admit this, its the truth and its because of the hillstone. My problems started right after this, and after a lot of googling i realized it was because they didnt rinse the salad i ate there good enough. So, im telling this to save the rest of the people who think about going here. Im sure this isnt all of their food, but i do regret eating their salad that i heard so much about.  So, i do not recommend this place, threadworms isnt the funniest to have. Thanks.

F9vGOVTz2td_SPveHxBH7A.review_text: I normally don't write reviews about chains restaurants.  I don't really understand why other Yelpers bother doing so either.  Chili's, Olive Garden, Macaroni Grill, McDonalds... come on now, nobody really cares about them - at least this food snob doesn't.  Besides, since moving to San Francisco, I've pretty much stopped dining at chains - there are just too many other options out there.  However, I had to make an exception for one of my favorites - Houstons.  I just realized that I've been dining here for over ten years now.  My first time was at the one in Woodland Hills (which has since closed down) with my Quake clan back in '99 (yes, I was a geek before it was "in".)  Had the rotisserie chicken, if I remember correctly.  But it wasn't until my friend Robyn introduced me to their prime rib that I started dining at Houston's regularly.  Bone-in and medium-rare, w/ a loaded baked potato and both creamed and straight horseradish on the side.  Yum.  I've probably had this same meal over 30 times now.    Their spinach and artichoke appetizer is second to none.  The aioli they serve alongside their grilled artichokes is unlike any other, and quite honestly, is one of the many reasons why I keep coming back (mainly because I haven't figured out how to make it myself.)  With the holidays, I've been somewhat overwhelmed with prime rib lately (yes, I know, I didn't know it was possible either) so on my most recent visit to Houston's, I opted for something different - their burger.  I usually get burned for straying away from the usual but felt a little adventurous that day, and am glad to say that I was not disappointed.  The patty was well seasoned, but the details that differentiated this burger from many others I've had were the fact that the buns were toasted AND buttered and  that the slices of tomato had their core removed.  Definitely one of the better burgers I've had in San Francisco.  No corkage fee doesn't hurt either.  Conveniently, I've always had a Houston's nearby.  Back in college, it was a short drive down Jamboree.  My first job out of college, my office was down Rosecrans from the Houston's in Manhattan Beach.  My sister even lived down the street from the one in Pasadena.  And now, I make the trek across San Francisco to the Embarcadero for my fix.  I think I'm a Houston's lifer.  At least until I figure out how to make their aioli :)

klXtHEpnfPE_67OflnQTmg.review_text: We left  another  place  and  could smell  this  one  a mile  a  way,  we  followed  the smell,  They treated  us  like  VIP.  I love my fish dinner,and my friends  had  steak  (  to die for),  then coffee after  wards. it  was  good  the price  is  $$$, but  worth it.  2  meals, 2  drinks, 1  coffee  ($120.00)  not  including  tip. You never  had  a  minute  you  did not  have  someone  helping  us.  and  I  am  picky  when it  comes to my  food  being  cooked  by  someone else or  where  i  can not see  it  being cooked. As we were  getting  ready to  leave, here comes  the  band i  had  to  stay  longer  and  enjoy it.

kFyVg2AL-eTTGdFACnLUCA.review_text: Because I went in november, there isn't so much that I remember about this place.  We were a party of 6 and couldn't make reservations.  But since half of us got there first, we put our name in and told them that once our party was complete we were ready for them.  So once the 6 of us are ready, we sat outside by the fire.  Now it was a cool November Friday night and I had no expectations but a good time with friends.  I shared a rib eye with my friend and i don't remember anything else we ordered.  I can't complain so much because i don't remember.    The location is very romantic and the outside seating is very sensual.  Inside though can be too crowded but we were very intimate amoungst us friends.  I had a great first experience there and i wouldn't mind going back there just because.  honestly, i can't really complain.

yvURfAFQ6ibwdG0dkFSECw.review_text: I was very disappointed to find out that this place is actually part of the chain Houstons.  I came to SF to sample local fare, not to eat at a chain restaurant present in most major american cities.  I didn't discover this until I actually sat down and looked at the menu- identical to every Houstons nationwide.  I don't have a particular hatred for chain restaurants, I just find the menu here to be uninspired- even for a steakhouse.  The hawaiian ribeye is pretty good but the prime rib is rather tough and chewy- not much better than what you get at a vegas buffet.  I'd much rather go to house of prime rib (but they were sadly all booked for the night).    Also, they jacked up their prices from the regular houstons chain (with SAME food).  Can someone explain that to me?

kDog5136RE61g9ugqtCSiQ.review_text: Absolutely fantastic,  Part of a chain--but it works!  Used to be Houston's.  Sister restaurant is Rutherford Grill in Rutherford.  Very similar menu too.  This place is clubby dark and comfortable.  Food is really great.  prime rib French dip is the best I have ever had.

CjfzA2dAmChK5HgS7YIdtA.review_text: Hillstone is fantastic for dinner.  I have been here at least a dozen times, and I have been more than satisfied every time.  The Thai steak salad is first rate.  The salmon appetizer is also delicious.   They have no corkage fee so bring a good bottle of wine, and enjoy the jazz and great service.  I love this place.

BgWaJDXga_iqOqxIYaxrrw.review_text: Nice atmosphere. No corkage fee. Outside seating. Amazing margaritas.  Food quality is great but WAY overpriced.  Artichoke: $14 Smoked Salmon:$17 Steak Noodle Salad: fillet ( one of my favorites) $24 Ribs: $32 (really?)  No corkage.

lAxylrkvlC7lEUvOAQD2RQ.review_text: Best French Dip Sandwich I have ever had.

1Cb9fUiWlYzE9v5OP2jcvA.review_text: We stopped in for a late lunch/early dinner a few Sundays ago after the race. Cassie served us at the bar and did a fantastic job. We just keep coming back.   We live in the south bay and have frequented Los Altos Grill for years, and I don't care how many locations they have. It is solid. Everything is good.   If you love a french dip, this is THE place.  Great atmosphere, food and drink  Update: We love this place, but last night was not the best. We ordered the usual, smoked salmon appetizer and the toast was stale. I didn't let it ruin the dish for me, I just ate the salmon. The chef should not let stale toast leave the line---very bad.

f5-0o_iBl6G0hiiTo55ZjA.review_text: Just had what may have been the best veggie burger of my life here tonight.  Service was impeccable, atmosphere was classy and sophisticated.  I hope I'll be back soon.

WGO4YWRhsyDr3-Q6nCcJzw.review_text: I miss the old name...but I'm trying to accept the name HIllstone as much as Houston's. However what hasn't changed with the name thankfully.... NO CORKAGE FEE. At a place where you can drop EASILY 60bucks a person it's nice to know you can bring in your own bottles yes bottles of 2buck chuck w/o a fee to soften the blow of that bill.  I highly recommend the following   Starters:  Grilled Artichocke's with the aioli mayo dipping sauce PHENOMENAL  Spinach Dip- they do it right served with chips, salsa, and sour cream. I recommend ordering the rosemary bread and marinated olives plate before this arrives so you can dip the bread in the dip...the chips can't hold a flame to that combo!  If it's Friday order the clam chowder...it puts all the wharf stands and their stupid bread bowls to SHAME...quality over quantity is the name of the game here and Houston has it in spades. BIg juicy NOT CHEWY pieces of clam, a light creamy soup base that isn't gelatin-esq or heavy on the flour, and the onions/potatoes are cooked perfectly.   Main Course:  RIBS RIBS RIBS....they marinated for days and are smothered in a great tangy BBQ sauce order a side of grilled asparagus if your not a fan of coleslaw (but I will say their coleslaw is high end stuff and not 80%mayo like many other places)  STEAK mmmm its worth it  PORK same as above and have it served with the mashed taters because the sauce they top the chops with goes great with them  Desert:  The sundae is so decadent....so rich...if you have room I highly recommend OH GOD the fudge sauce is homemade and is thick and gooey just the way you want it...none of that thin runny funny business.  The staff will take GREAT care of you and if you have to wait the bar lets you crack open that wine you brought free of charge ;)

MAfCgDeJdM61I0JoiKHN-A.review_text: If you have not gone, GO.    This is one restaurant that is on my repeatable list.  I love Houstons.  Location is on the Embarcadero.  Parking is available on the back street.  Its spacious.  There's outdoor seating.  On a sunny day, you've got it made.  Live pianist.  The place is smooth.   Service is wonderful.  Reservations are easy to get.  Bar is reasonably priced, plus there's no corkage if you want to bring in your favorite bottle.    Spinach artichoke.  Burger.  But wait --- Drum roll please---- Hawaiian Rib-eye... TO DIE FOR.  I may just have to end my review on that because it is TO DIE FOR.    Curtains.

tVFswIUZPi7j7v9cjMwmxA.review_text: Delicious food, beautiful atmosphere, and a wonderful customer experience with our waitress Natalie! She was amazing and made our Valentine's night a great experience.  I recommend the filet mignon! Definitely coming back again!!

JoBmWW62xDOkXr2anyxfag.review_text: I have been coming to this restaurant for years - back when it was Houston's and I thought this was the only one. Later in life I discovered there are Houston's all over the country, and that the company who owns this chain (Hillstone) also owns the Rutherford Grill, Los Altos Grill, and a whole list of other places. Ah to be young and naive.  Last night after not visiting for a year or so, I came for dinner with my grandma. We ordered the focaccia + olive plate to start. I remember when bread was free here, but at $3 that wasn't exactly breaking the bank. However, there were only 4 olives on the plate so they should probably rename this.   I ordered the thai steak and noodle salad. It was beautifully plated and tasted good, but I felt it could have been great, and that always bothers me. Here is what they should improve:  - Our waitress didn't ask me how I wanted my steak cooked. It came out well done... I like my steak medium rare to medium. - My noodles were undercooked. Either make them crunchy or cook them until they are soft. There is no middle ground.   - If avocado is listed as an ingredient in the salad, I expect more than 1 tiny chunk of avocado. No one has ever said, "there is too much avocado in this salad."   Our food came out quickly and service was good so overall it was pretty good, but at those prices I expect better than pretty good.

eaF8FXzdnEz48DQVm6zByg.review_text: Well I walked in about 10 minuets before they closed and I asked if they are still open all three employees welcomed me in with enthusiasm! I ordered and ate there and I knew at that point they were closed, they did not rush me out or make me feel rushed they were really cool! I had the MUSHROOM GRUYÉRE IT WAS THE BEST THING I HAVE EVER TASTED!!!! I highly recommend this place! I only wish there was one in Phoenix, AZ!!

3ebGuvvDgFEd5wu6GB2fWw.review_text: My lunch cost $35 and consisted of a veggie patty, some lettuce, a slice of tomato, a bit of diced white onion, and a baked potato with some sliced green onion on top. The coffee was terrible. It was the kind of soy latte with big dumb bubbles and the foam just sort of sits on top like a dumb foam guy. For $35 I also got a kale salad, which was delicious but small. There just should be better options than paying $20 for a morningstar patty and an undressed potato. (I can't eat dairy, hence the weird food.) I couldn't even order the roasted vegetables.  My dad liked his giant cheeseburger. I tried a few of his fries and I thought they weren't delicious.  I kept thinking, "how much could a banana cost? $10?"

vRziAXWI72nOFWNml4ldMA.review_text: So we went here a few weeks ago for a birthday dinner. About a month earlier we were at the same restaurant in LA and had a pretty decent experience. Had a good rib eye. Bar was good etc.  So we get there early and our table is already ready but we're waiting for a couple people so I get my standard bourbon on the rocks. They've got all my favorites so I choose Bookers. That is a plus. Tells me right away they've got a nice bar selection. A lot of times you go to a nice place and you go in expecting mediocre portions of food and drinks. It's kind of expected. You expect everything to be good but usually you're paying for ambiance and service. The bartender hand me my bourbon and holy! That was a huge pour. She hand my buddy a drink and the same thing. Awesome. I'll probably go back just for that reason alone.  So we finally sit down and there were 6 of us and one of the cool things about this place is they don't charge a corkage fee so we brought a couple bottles of our favorite wine.  Waiters make their money off tips including drinks so we didn't want to go overboard but two bottles we felt was not overkill since there was 6 of us. We still ended up ordering drinks and a bunch of food.  Everyone's food was great. My steak was perfect. No one had any complaints. Server was great. The one complaint we had was when it came to the wine we brought. It wasn't cheap wine that we brought but the server simply opened it left the glasses at the end of the table and then left. We kinda all looked at each like ummm ok I guess its self service on the wine since we brought it. That is the first time I've ever had to do that at a restaurant corkage fee or not.   Not a huge deal but we had some friends in from out of town and we all were puzzled by that. Not sure if the waitress was irritated that we bought our own wine or what. We're good tippers usually more than 20 % and we're pretty easy going, not very demanding.  Regardless when I'm the mood for a big hearty dinner Hillstone is the place I'd head to.

uLWq_iGulRVnzs--88_xPw.review_text: I was so impressed with this restaurant - not only with the quality of the food but also the amazing service.  Me & my boyfriend were visiting San Francisco for the day & needed a quick place to eat before our bus left. We were quickly seated & waited on. The server was helpful, nice, & knowledgeable. We ordered the rosemary foccacia & marinated olives as an appetizer and it was delicious. Later that evening, a busser & I were discussing the olives and I asked the name of one because it was fantastic & I had never had anything like it. Not only did he go to the kitchen to ask, he brought me more! For dinner, I ordered the Thai Steak & Noodle Salad. It was exceptional. Whole mint leaves, tender steak, fresh avocado.
