I was very impressed.  Since my boyfriend & I were in a rush, we asked that the check be brought as soon as possible, and the waitress was very understanding & fast.  A great experience!

QPgXLWsDRplZilp2OciAiw.review_text: Alrighty, first off - whatever the hell name you changed this to - you still serve the same stuff and everything about it is *still* Houstons.  Even the signage is the same color and font.  on to the food.  This place is not cheap, granted it's also not super expensive, but you can easily spend over 100 bucks with a couple of friends.  Most of the entrees are around 25-30 bucks.  There are burgers on the menu as well and those are closer to the 13 dollar range.  The last time I was at Houstons it was easily 8 years ago, and it was the one in Pasadena.  I ordered the exact same thing this time from then and it was exactly as I remembered.  Kudos to consistency and complete quality control.  I had the Hawaiian Steak with a baked potato.  Yummy.  Perfectly cooked and that's a lot coming from a girl that orders her steak medium well.  Wasn't dry at all.  Yeah, I said it.  practically well done.  I don't do the mooing cow steak.  Can't. Do. It.  The potato was perfect too.  Sorry, I was a bad Yelper and didn't take a picture of my plate. I know. I know.  We had great service, from the hostesses to the server.    Parking tip - the lot behind the restaurant (I believe it was 80 Francisco structure) - 50% off validation is available for their customers.  $7.50 is the max with this validation.  Sorry no valet.  My friends were saying that the street parking was free after 6. So that option is there as well if you can find a space.

fglNYTYtDPuep0T7Fq37tA.review_text: The spinach dip was mediocre, although the salsa that came with it was delicious. My wife's filet was delicious and had a wonderful crust on the outside. I had the Hawaiian ribeye, which had unique flavor and was pretty good. The included fries were not great. The atmosphere was upscale but relaxed, and the staff was friendly.

kz-yj64s-hyQ6DQ2rfL22A.review_text: This is our home away from home.  Our fave's are the Hawaiian Rib eye, the French Dip--Houston's is hands down the champion rib eye sandwich!, the sashimi tuna salad (now only on the lunch menu--boooo), the grilled artichokes (perfectly salted and grilled), the corn, the root veggies, the brussel sprouts.  And the french fries are the best.  They rival pomme frites in France!  Great wine list.  Great cocktails.  Chocolate sundae with candied pecans, chocolate sauce made here in SF.  Comfortable easy atmosphere.  We can show up dressed up, or super casual in jeans and sneakers.  The service is always excellent.

zRSPu8L_EDFTJP9Hw_muqA.review_text: A great place for lunch. Great customer service and food! I recommend the Famous French Dip!!

EKQMR2_QpEeT_a_uLCissw.review_text: This is my first and probably last time dining here.  I felt that the food was overpriced and not very good.  I gave it one extra star because the service was good.  But I don't dine at a restaurant just because the service is good -- the food quality is more of what determines my opinion about a restaurant.

lg3SyozfvfHtG5-i2QIPzA.review_text: Recalling my visit to Hillstone, my very first thought was that the atmosphere is absolutely breathtaking! The exterior supplies a gorgeous display of lighting, as well as a peek into the restaurant itself where the ambiance comes off as cozy, sophisticated, and classy.  The restaurant features a live jazz band that plays catchy tunes throughout the night, a grand fireplace with seating, and a full bar by the entrance.  The food is absolutely amazing! Their artichoke dip with chips and their salmon bruschetta appetizer plates satisfied every tastebud pre-entree. By the time our main course arrived, everyone dug straight in to their food regardless how much we ate during appetizers and drinks. I've got to give them mad props for their garlic-mash, which is better than any other mash-side I've ever tried at any other steakhouses (yes, including House of Prime).  Post-dinner, you must get their "worth-the-wait" (?) drip coffee. As full as I was, I still managed to down some of that simple-yet-orgasmic brew.  Overall, I had a great experience here at Hillstone. The staff are more than courteous. Though the kitchen did manage to mess up our prep-preferences, our waitress took back one of my more voiced friend's plate, who actually spoke up about her medium being done, and brought her a new plate and took care of the appetizers for us. We left more than happy, not because of the deal, but moreso for her hospitality.

df8OiJq0pcaj7qyD6zB_yA.review_text: This is a great american restaurant with friendly staff and good ambiance. The bar is great for meeting up with friends and quiet enough to have conversations... The food menu is a bit limited but is awesome. I had the ribs here and I must say one of the best i have ever had!!!

3AOuFaEvafDQ9W5Lr2WQXw.review_text: So i've heard some mixed reviews from friends that i recommended to this place, but overall it's solid.  I know for a fact you need to order the ribs, or atleast someone at your table should.  They fall apart when your fork pokes inbetween them.    They also have a great atmosphere, pretty good bar and awesome location.

Hg2V5megrKl-rydngVkfQg.review_text: Best Crab Cakes in SF! No question about it!

Jt9AI6o8aUw6nsaOCCUVRA.review_text: A friend took me to lunch here today and I loved it. The Reubenesque Sandwish was simply delicious. I said I was just going to eat half but ended up gobbling the whole thing. No corkage fee! How cool is that?

Zia61WCddJBqIc_Z5-7coA.review_text: We came here for my friend's bday dinner last night. Service was absolutely excellent. So much better than the other time we came. I didn't like the fact that they made us wait to be seated while CL was parking the car. Luckily he found a space pretty close by and did not take too long. For our appetizer we had the artichoke dip with tortilla chips and we all had salads to start. Main courses were ribs and the hawaiian steak with fries. Our server gave us some spicy mayo dip for our fries which was to die for. The food took awhile to come out of the kitchen but the manager came by to apologize. For dessert my friend had the brownie sundae, CL had the hot fudge sundae and I had the apple cobbler. The hot fudge sundae was SO good. The chocolate sauce that came with it was really delicious. My apple cobbler was okay but it had alot of walnuts in it. My friend enjoyed her brownie sundae. We all left stuffed and happy. We even got togo reusuable containers. Our server was super nice and really made it a point to refill our water glasses and ask us if we needed anything. Will be back for another celebration.

7n7nGZVpmZl19wVontB0Ng.review_text: Please don't get turned off that this is a chain restaurant.  Who cares?  It is so freaking good.  The servers, the decor, the chairs (I want so much to take home but couldn't figure out how to do it without them noticing)....now let's get to the food.  YUM.  I have eaten here for years, even when it was called Houston's, and I've NEVER had a bad meal.  The Thai steak noodle salad - to die for.  Not a kale fan (no judgement please) but theirs -- wow!  Wish they could teach me how to make it.  Then there is the French Dip Sandwich. If you're a meat lover -- and love horseradish as much as I do.  It's a must.  Side note: I told the waitress how much I loved her earrings, and she offered to give them to me.  They were only from Forever 21, but they were sooooo cute.  I said no but how incredible is that to offer?  They hire really nice people.

JdaePgzfG-ec17hDMN1Egg.review_text: Absolutely love this place! I have been coming here for over 6 years and my fiancé has about 10 years under her belt. The service  is impeccable each and every time. If you plan on dinning here I would suggest that you start any meal off with the artichokes and end it with the sundae dessert. Everything in between those two will just add to the great dinning experience!

8amY_cV52Sik5VV3zJyzLA.review_text: So I normally go to hillstone once a week cause I love the food. I went on Sunday after the giants game and revived the worst service ever. The staff refused to serve me alcohol cause my face is messed up from a dog bite. I was totally sober just  ugly from going threw a tramatic experience. The people at hillstone made it worst. I can't believe the horrible service my party received.

gmva_eeWbLm74SzIbqTYTw.review_text: We loved our dining experience at Hillstone  San Francisco!  Service and ambiance were great!  Food cooked to perfection!  Lively but still you can carry a conversation.  The small jazz band is a sure plus!  Not intrusive, just pleasant.  We will recommend this restaurant to friends. Small con, the servers take away your plate the minute you stop eating, even though other people at the table are still eating.  I know this is not uncommon, but we do not like it.  Other than that, Go to Hillstone!

OsQBba4uuYQ48uZcJSLOYw.review_text: My boyfriend made reservations here for dinner- good choice!   We came on a Monday night around 7pm, it wasn't busy and we were seated promptly. One thing I noticed right away was the crackling fire in their fireplace which gives a romantic feel. Also, there was a lit candle at each table which adds to the ambience. There was live music playing (piano, bass guitar) as well.  The quality of food here is excellent. I ordered the prime rib (medium rare), it was very tender and juicy- just the way I like it. It was served with steak sauce and a baked potato.  My boyfriend got the BBQ pork ribs, which were SO tender and practically slid off the bone as soon as they were forked up. His order came with fries and cole slaw (I think). The orders were generous portions, so it's not as if you're going to a pricey restaurant that serves food covering only a third of the plate. Steak and beer- an awesome dinner! You get what you pay for. :)  As another reviewer wrote, you won't be disappointed if you order one of these. Unfortunately, we were so stuffed there was no room for dessert.   This is a good place to celebrate an anniversary/birthday/romantic evening out. I'd definitely come again to try their other dishes.

tXb_ce3q91rTe6voTC_eYA.review_text: This is the place I take all my Japanese friends. Why? Because it has one of the few things you can not get in Japan, real BBQ. Yes, Houstons has among the best pork ribs I've ever eaten. They are slow cooked for 8 hours and the meat is so tender it comes off with just a fork, no knife needed.   Basically after I had ribs at Houstons I couldn't eat them anywhere else. Ribs at places like Tony Roma's, Outback Steakhouse, Hard Rock Cafe, etc are all just unacceptable now.  Of course their other foods are not bad. The spinach artichoke dip is a must try. The steaks, the prime rib is all good as well but it's the ribs that make it special for me.

T0dOxK97B1MkaJcrHpOh6w.review_text: Hillstone ceases to AMAZE me.  Not only is the food delish (I ordered the thai beef salad last night) & staff very attentive (our waitress even chilled our bottle we brought from home) but they now...   VALIDATE PARKING!

5pefANUSfME2qi2KzAePsQ.review_text: I was at hillstone with family in November. People are not lying about the Hawaiian ribeye it's really good. Not to sweet. Just perfect. I was a little drunk and did spill a drink and broke a hot sauce container. I could tell the waitress was annoyed but tried to put on a poker face and slow the service to get us out the door. I would recommend this place if you are near fishermans wharf and seafood is not really your thing. I would like to say thank you to the waitress for not kicking us out all together. I hope the tip reflected.

VUk3lcb1RzT5QrM6sXtfyw.review_text: I have always been a fan of the Houston's chain of restaurants, so I was really looking forward to this experience. Hillstone lives up to the stellar reputation of the chain (think Rutherford Grille, Bandera, Houston's, etc...). My husband had never been to any of their restaurants, so I was glad to share it with him, and we were celebrating his new job, so it made for a fun evening. We started with the shrimp cocktail and the grilled artichoke for appetizers. The shrimp were huge and perfectly prepared. The artichoke is perfection, love the smoky flavor it has.  Next, I had the sea bass special which was light and delicious, and I had their famous french fries with it - they were as addicting as ever. Get the spicy mayo with them. Husband had the filet mignon and garlic mashed - he loved both. We finished with the deconstructed cobbler for dessert - diabetes on a plate. So good! The service was perfect, I wouldn't have any constructive criticism at all. They had a piano and cello couplet playing, and it was just loud enough to enjoy, not so loud you couldn't have conversation at your table. My husband had an espresso and said it was very good, and he's very picky about that. There is plenty of street parking. We will be back often!

PABIXXEx_6ykhF7I6_Fu-A.review_text: I pretty much always get the ribs and a few lemon drops. They make the best lemon drops and I surmise its because they put in an orange twist instead of lemon peel.  A full slab of fall off the bone ribs come with french fries and coleslaw, but I recommend swapping out the fries for the colcannon mashed potatoes which are heavenly! They are basically rough smashed potatoes (no skins) with cabbage mixed in. Texture is awesome! These tots drizzled with some extra virgin olive oil on top and you've got yourself a perfect accompaniment to your BBQ!  Finish off with a fat wedge of key lime pie or a Ghirdelli sundae. Yum  Service is always on top of its game and the food is consistently great. A perfect place for after work drinks and real food. A++

IEiVTleM5IrIvzsIMmyLjQ.review_text: A must for San Francisco tourists! The Thai salad and salmon appetizers were to die for. Easy parking structure right behind the restaurant

NNj0r6EyOpD-S71KlhagTA.review_text: I love the atmosphere in Houston's, great for family night, but also very romantic. And the Patio is great for just hanging out and having a drink...  The service at the bar could have been better, but our waiter was very attentive and everything was right on time!  I had the Arctic Char w/ lemon dill sauce, Cabbage and Potatoes and my date had  a Mushroom and Cheese Omelet w/ mixed green salad and a side of fries (don't ask..lol) We were very pleased and happy to be full w/out feeling weighed down. The meal was excellent!

2myQR8oLNvyQPO0lxczdew.review_text: I'm a regular here, or I was. It had been a good year since I ate here until last night, I'll never wait that long again. Wow, I forgot what I was missing. I had the buttered Sea Bass special with corn side. It was amazing & I'm a super picky fish eater. My friend ordered the chunky crab cakes entree ( never thought of crab cakes as an entree 'till now) that was great too! Table of 4 and everyone was in a food coma by the end of the night, no room for dessert (love the brownie) just couldn't do it... Maybe cuz we had so many apps; here they are in order of likeness,  1. grilled artichoke (yummy)  2. house salad heirloom beets n feta~ very good  3. artichoke dip / cheese bread was a tie   I had a few of the BBQ pork ribs that were so soft the meat was falling off the bone ( I don't care for pork) damn good  only thing I didn't try was the Prime rib my other friend had but he said it was way better than House of Prime Ribs ever was. So there you have it. I would have given 5 stars but the service was a little slow & the bartender charged me for a Johnny Walker on accident, when brought to his attention he promptly removed it and comped the beer that he rung up wrong, so that more than made up for it.

i8eeA4HszgPAlrYhBtcswA.review_text: perfect place  we'd one of the most perfect steak I've ever had and the salads are also very tasty and the desserts...so perfect

gk7ZDdtOd70eT9z6zZN03g.review_text: I've been eating at Hillstone for years; even when it was called Houston's.  In my opinion they have the best steaks in San Francisco with service to match!

kVwvb9vW0sPBGryY8slB-w.review_text: It's not that this place is bad. It's just that for the price, you can get a lot better.  I ordered the steak and found it decent (which is never how you want a steak-experience to be).    Tip #1:  Parking is a little difficult to find.  There's some street parking but beware - the signs and times can get a little confusing (we have a $75 ticket as proof).  Tip #2:  The prime rib is extremely underwhelming.  Not worth ~$40.   Overall: SF is a hub of good food - there are plenty of other steakhouses where you can get better steak.

3e6oRPYP6gkSLoFYc_WMlA.review_text: Doesn't matter whether it's called Houstons or Hillstone... the Hawaiian rib eye is still the best steak you can get in SF!!!

n6GBeJVd1C2dszlSOBAfJw.review_text: Came here again for my papa's bday dinner since he wanted to come here for a couple years now. Happy we didn't have to wait and the service is still as good as it gets, friendly and fast.   Food wise, we tried the spring rolls today ($14) which was seared tuna, asparagus, avocado, carrots, mango with rice wrapped in a rice paper (Like those Vietnamese ones) and came with three different dipping sauces. For $14, I would of expected at least 2 rolls instead of one! Although it was pricey, it was really good.   For my entree, I tried the Baby Back Ribs ($28) with coleslaw and shoestring fries. I finished my shoestring fries before I even ate two ribs! It was so good. Crispy and hot with just enough salt. The ribs was fall off the bone! Don't even need a fork and it was finger licking yummy!  I can't wait to go back again!

1l_XL1p0RW3MeUZ8b-T4bQ.review_text: Consistently  good food here. Try the Hawaiian Ribeye, spinach dip and the knife and fork ribs... A few items that keep me coming back. One of the best chain restaurants that I know of.

kg8tWKYrB9I6VThlxTaD-A.review_text: The plus of working at Levi's Plaza is the excuse to go to Hillstone (or Houston's or whatever you want to call it) for lunch. I've been here about three times and made sure I ordered something different each time. Here is what I've ordered:  -Spinach and Artichoke Dip: it's all right. Nothing super special, but the chips that they are served with are warm, crunchy, and not super thin. Not sure If I'm a fan of the salsa and sour cream that it comes with---what? are we at Chevy's?  -Famous French Dip: the place is known for it's french dip, but it's my least favorite dish of the ones I've tried. It's pretty average and not all that, considering it's $18.   -Thai Chicken and Noodle Salad: so flavorful and a party in my mouth! Includes mango and avocado and it has the perfect amount of spice throughout. Would definitely order this again.   -Nicoise Salad: a nice, light salad when you are in the mood for something that isn't too heavy. The tuna is very fresh and I couldn't get enough of it!   -Reuben Sandwich with Fries: a very generous portion of the meat is provided. Very juicy and unapologetic. Great choice for when you're ravenous. It will definitely make you feel like you need to be rolled out of the restaurant.   The service is pretty spot on and it's the food is very good, but it's rather pricey for lunch. All in all, I would go here again when I'm in the mood to splurge on a $18 sandwich. I'm a fan!

Sl5pPtwzI-_BoOYhP0BCxw.review_text: My affair with Houston's started some years ago. A friend of mine was in the wine biz and on rainy Sunday afternoons we'd belly up to the bar, order a bottle of Conundrum, one of their big ass burgers with a side of fries and cole slaw, and spinach artichoke dip to start the whole thing off. After the Conundrum, we'd get down to trying the many bottles she'd had stashed in her car. Sometimes we'd have to try as many as 5 or 7 different bottles. At most restaurants, this might be a big problem. Not at Houston's! Corkage is FREE! We'd crack bottle after bottle, blather on about God knows what, mow-down on an amazing burger and dip and fries, peruse one of their newspapers, and while away the dreary Sunday. And let's just say, when you're trying lots of wine, the bartender gets to try some, too, and that sum's up to some good service. O, them's were some good times!   The next phase of my affair with Houston's was less festive. And less lively as no wine bottles were cracked open. Let's call it "The Honeymoon's Over Phase."  But none-the-less, still yummy.  I started working across the street and on sunny days I'd take my book or research or what-have-you out to the sunny patio and have a little salad or one of their delightful chicken sandwiches. Consistently yummy, though, maybe because I was so terrifically sans wine, I noticed that the service wasn't as warm and fuzzy as I'd remembered. In fact, I started to notice quite the opposite. Yet, since it was efficient, I figured What the Hell. I let it slide.  Next up, we have the "I-was-knocked-up-and-all-I-wanted-was-a-baked-­potato with everything phase." Pretty much all I wanted from Houston's. Which was unfortunate, as because I wasn't even indulging in caffeine, all I would order (at the bar sometimes) was the baked potato (which is consistently delish!) and, well, water. Unfortunate for me because service was really not so hot. In fact, it was cold as the iced water in my glass. But that didn't stop me from coming in. I even brought my sweetie in for dinner. We sat at the packed bar. We ordered lots of food. We did not order alcohol. We were pretty much ignored. I decided that (despite the consistently good food) my affair with Houston's must end. I will not be ignored! ;P  Now here we are at the present day and I have yet again sparked up a thing with Houston's. Today was all about getting out of the office. About a crisp green salad. I sat at the bar. I did not order booze. I got Houston's service. Not too warm. Not too cold. Is it my favorite service style? No. Do they make a great seasonal salad/baked potato/burger/etc.? Yes they do.   All-in-all, it's nice to know that some things are consistent. Even cool service. Hey, the food is good, the free corkage is great, and the location is perfect for days like today when I need to clear my head with a little salad of beets and goat cheese at the bar with a glass of water, just so I can feel connected to the greater world.

N-80o57pUpopYw2vgymtPQ.review_text: A chain (with many other names) - but still, one we like. It's our high end comfort food restaurant of choice. The cocktails are very good (albeit pricey). Although, I've yet to get a mixed drink where the exterior of the glass wasn't very wet with spillage - it can get awfully sticky if you have a sweeter drink - and this is even when the drinks are straight from the bartender when sitting at the bar.  Food is all very good - good meat options, salads, hot fudge sundae...all good. Thai salad has a bit more heat than expected, something that probably should be noted on the menu (I've had it twice). It could surprise those who like a more mild offering. It works for me as long as my water is refilled often. :-)  Atmosphere is slightly clubby - slightly, and very nice. Servers all all very nice, professional, smiling (love!), and articulate. I have a minor complaint though. On a couple occasions we've been 'educated' about their policies - and that's how it feels. The very nice, smiling server will say, "Oh - sorry you didn't know that adding steak to your salad is so much $$ (a lot more than I'd imagined), so we'll take that off your bill (nice), but now you know this for next time." Well, that is VERY nice/generous - but not *quite* right. Tell me that it's $$$ to add steak to my salad beforehand (or even better, add that on on the menu - but I realize this was my customization). It was good though, but the steak on the salad was cold. Same with the Thai steak salad. I'm used to steak salads of any kind having warm/hot steak on cool/cold greens. But, now I've been educated.   Other thing - salads are invariably overdressed. Knowing that, I asked for dressing on the side last time, but was told that it's not possible for the salad I had 'cause they use two different dressings mixed in the bowl. I was told to ask for 'light dressing' or 'regular dressing'. Still, I think 'on the side' could have been done using two different little ramekins (the way their sister property in Los Altos does it).  Still, we really like the place a lot, and we're never wondering "have we been forgotten." That's great. And, now, as we are more 'educated' about how they do things and have learned how to be a better customer in many areas (cough-cough/wink), we know what to expect.  Oh - parents - by the time your daughter is 15, she should know that you don't pick up an entire steak with a fork and gnaw around the edges, head tilted to the side, long hair dangling on/near plate. Sorry - just had to vent. I feel better now.

WSQr6BRvddaS8xuqJxBY4w.review_text: Poor service!!  Our party for 8 showed up for our 8:30pm reservation and was told that our table wasn't available and we could either wait or split up our party.  Obviously we didn't want to separate so we waited.  It would have been nice to get some empathy from the hostess, which had none.  We asked if they could uncork two wine bottles while we waited and did.    45 mins later we got our table and had our meal.  If you must go here the ribs were good.  We had two more bottles of wine during dinner and then when we got the bill found that we were charged $50 for corkage while we waited for our table.  Talked to the manager, a pimply faced guy who couldnt be older than 22, and never apologized for the wait or our inconvience.  He only rattled off, in his cracking voice, the restaurant policies of 'non standard reservations' and corkage fees.    Most restaurants in SF would offer at least sympathy or maybe a glass of wine when inconvenienced to wait for a table, but Hillstone will instead charge you $50 in our case to wait and open our wine bottles.  Poor customer service from the time we booked the reservation through to the end of dinner.  Don't waste your time with this chain restaurant!

R_E1c9mHOIvZT0DFnOSoxg.review_text: By far this place has the best hamburger.  Been here numerous times.  Never had a problem with the service.  I usually come here to satisfy my burger cravings.  Its pricey but well worth it.  The presentation is fabulous, pickles, mustard, all the goods on the side.  Just ask for it and they will deliver.  You put the masterpiece together.  It reminds me of how Scooby Doo makes his sandwiches, pile it it high!  Steaks are excellent as well, I recommend this place for all you carnivorous beef eaters.

F5n6NSL3aA6N373VhvAbcg.review_text: Fantastic rib-eye steak.  You can taste the smoked char from the steak.  The spinach dip is also a must.  Waitresses are super busy and forget to fill your wine glasses from time to time but they are very apologetic and no cause for complaint really.  Great place with a great ambiance.

-lSh8bzu8vbrmf_qH0wFDA.review_text: I've been here two times to eat - one with a group of 10 guys, the other with a lovely lady accompanying me. Needless to say, these were two very different experiences! Irregardless, they were both exceptional!  Obviously one of the best parts of Hillstone is the no corkage fee, a rare find in SF! I enjoyed one bottle on my latter experience, and the on previous, between 10 guys we polished off 22 bottles on a Tuesday evening. Suffice to say the couples and families around us were not amused by the end of the night. The staff on the other hand, were extremely good-natured about the rowdiness, and they deserve 6 stars for their service.   I've had several things to eat here  - the artichoke dip - if you're a fan of CPK's spinach dip (and by a fan I mean you can't stop eating it when its in front of you), then you will love the artichoke dip. It's served with chips, so I'd ask for a bit of bread if you really want to enjoy it right - the classic burger, w/ bleu cheese & bacon on top, was insanely good. Better than most gourmet burgers I've had (save for Father's Office in Santa Monica), it was done perfectly medium, and seasoned well - the FILET. This is the big boy, the badass that Hillstone *cough*Houstons*cough* is known for. It did not disappoint. I'm fairly sure it was dry-aged, and it was deliciously beefy. I ordered it medium rare (why ruin a great piece of meat?!), and while there was a bit of juice, I ended up asking for a side order of their mushroom sauce to add a bit of juicyness. The mushroom sauce (usually meant for the ribeye) was out-of-this-world. I'd recommend ordering a side of the sauce just to try!  For a SF steakhouse, Hillstone does not disappoint. Dinner for two ran about $80 including tax & 20% tip. I've yet to have dessert here, as I'm generally stuffed by the end of dinner, but it looks delicious.  A minor drawback, especially if you're looking for a quiet place to eat - it can get fairly loud here. There is usually live music (piano, bass) going on in the background, and with the low-ish ceilings, both the music and other conversations carry right to your table. It can be distracting and I found myself speaking much louder than I'd expect at times. Food for thought.

2QH6foX0Gi57AETyljjwPQ.review_text: so i live right around the corner from this place and have always wanted to check it out. leave it to a rainy day with a hot date with my girlfriend to finally put off procrastination and walk inside.  yes, it has a little bit of a mature vibe here. yes, its a chain. NO they do NOT hold back on flavor!!   We got the specials and although I kicked myself for not getting the halibut with shitake mushrooms (i chose the other white fish with spanish almonds and fresh herbs with couscous) and they were nothing short of DELICIOUS!   However all I need in life is their GRILLED ARTICHOKES!!! my taste buds put on a happy dance like its never done before.   We even got to celebrate friendship with some yummy tiramisu. tasty food and friendship @ Houstons. Yes, this was as good as it gets!!!!!

RkhSgjr0aAkBdJa42eaH5g.review_text: i used to work here and still come back, pay full price to eat everything here.  they make most everything in house:  ketchup, veggie burgers (best ive had), house smoked salmon (divine).    grilled artichokes, thai steak salad, prime rib, pork chop, any grilled fish or meat special, the veggie sides - especially the colcannon mashed potatoes, key lime pie, scharffenberger sundae, i can go on for days.    things are pricey, but portions pretty generous.  no corkage, so you can bring your $20 conundrum from costco, instead of paying $50+ for it from the restaurant.  service can be off, depends on which server you get.  but food is sent out quickly and although it is a very corporate chain restaurant (albeit family owned), is totally consistent and delicious every time.  it's really about the line cooks, nevermind the constantly rotating 'chefs' walking around in their fancy chef jackets.  ladies, be careful if you are walking around this restaurant in heels, the wooden floor, although pretty, can be very slippery - lots of people have slipped and fallen walking to the bathrooms, and up the dark carpeted ramps (lighting inside can be very low during dinner).  ps - the jazz trio that shows up sun-thurs makes for a nice dinner treat!

mwl0mcEoRxSjp2BF1nEh8Q.review_text: i was recently informed of their unbelievable corkage policy (namely, there is none for the first two bottles). mix that with good food, live music on saturdays and a view of the bay (ok maybe the view is a stretch away across the street) and you've got a weekend date that's hard to beat.  * i used to come for dinner 1x/month when i worked across the street (way back in 2007). the name has changed from houston's, but the menu is literally the same! veggie plate, omelet, fries, KALE SALAD. and 2 bottles of your wine of choice...makes me want to work around here just to eat here more often *

mOc1UGkFB6xKKPgrzICAXw.review_text: I usually order a takeout during lunch. The service is sometimes very careless and a bit obnoxious. Understandable - it is a busy part of a day, but does it really take 30 minutes to make a Cesar Salad ( really?), and today - they forgot to put bread crumbs in it. I ended up with a box of lettuce. I wouldn't might waiting longer to get my order right, but again, a wait for an order of salad shouldn't be more than 15 minutes. They won't let you call in and order in advance, so i have to spend all my lunch time on waiting. Which is really annoying.  Too overpriced to be this careless, IMHO.  The food is, indeed, delicious, there is no doubt. I'm a big fan of a Pork Chop. It is craftily marinated and cooked  = an explosion of juicy flavors in you mouth.

A9N_ROUJr4kqFtPWwUBOOQ.review_text: Dependable excellent fare--and no corkage fee! Bring in multiple bottles of wine, start with an amazing ceaser or artichocke or spinach dip and you are well on your way.  The steaks and seafood are great, and closing with the 5-nut brownie, sundae or cobbler can't be beat.  And did I mention no corkage? Grab a drink at the bar because there is always a wait.  But the $100+ you save on wine is worth it!

oUis60pUmjPxa2Ienrj8aw.review_text: Excellent food, great service....  A little pricy but worth it...  We will return when we return to SF...

D6zjUFFf7k_tTVBfcQR3kw.review_text: Wait so the pork ribs have been cooking for 12 hours? hmmmm, and you say the asparagus is served cold drizzled with a mouthwatering sauce, okay, I don't even like baked potato, but load it up with the works, I can roll with that... your going to start me off with the 'house' salad, it's not the typical basic bland house salad right? I'm in, let's do this...  The house salad was well portioned, full of delightful treats, you have the basics, mixed greens, sliced vine ripened tomatoes, toss in some walnuts, watch out now flavorful soft goat cheese, and ver sweet chunks of beets or another root veggie, I asked for blue cheese as my dressing, they don't have the dressing, just sliced in chunks, perfect.  Sprinkle a few croutons on there, and slightly drizzled with their sweet vinaigrette, a wonderful intro along with my Trumer Pilsner.  Enough with the silly details, It's all about those RIBS, they give you a steak knife, I picked it up in order to slice into my half rack and the slightest amount of pressure from my knife knocked the meat right off the bone, wait, what? yeah, their plating chef's must use magic to hover the meat onto the plate with ancient BBQ pixie dust, I swear one cough or sneeze, the meat will drop down onto the plate eagerly waiting your salivating mouth piece.  The ribs come standard with fries and cold slaw or two sides, we opted for the asparagus and baked potato, and it was an awesome combo, the asparagus was tender but crisp and full of flavor, the potato was solid, I'm not a baked potato guy, if you are, I'm sure this will make your taste buds do the running man, the best part was eating the skin at the end, yuuumay.  Yea, my first time at Houston's, food was rock solid, great service, atmosphere's good and dark, prices are steep.  I'll be back to try more on the menu.

-34NV3A5a5gcL-s8UH4KbA.review_text: We went there for dinner last night after the Butterfly partay. So it's... 8:45 maybe? We walked in, said hello, there were two. The hostess was really nice - she said hang out at the bar, it'll be about five minutes, and she would come and find us. I immediately liked that.  Bartender. Really nice. I'm getting a good vibe. Do we want to order at the bar? Why yes we do. Does he want to pour me a nice big glass of Pinot Noir? why yes of course he does! Hostess comes to find us before the Gimlet can be prepared. . . we transfer the bar tab to the table (it always shocks me at how many restaurants don't allow you to do this).   Watch the little step, the hostess says. Nice of her to point it out. We sit.  Nicole, our server, very friendly. Why is everyone so darn friendly here? We share a ceasar (average), and order the special rib eye (very fatty) - served rare (curbed my sometiimes insatiable desire for a thick cut of meat). This thing was like 2 inches thick. And it was huge. We split the steak and I still couldn't finish it.   On to dessert... bonus points for having soy for my cappuccino. Another shocking thing about restaurants, is when they don't have soy for my cappuccino. You would think that every restaurant and cafe in San Francisco (and the Bay Area) has a backstock of soy, but it's really not true at all.. .and shocking. So anyway, pretty good cappuccino. The Key Lime pie that it came with however...  home made whipped cream deserves a shout out. Key lime pie that tastes like it's made with actual key limes... even better. tarty goodness that is not compromised by whipped cream that you know has some sort of sugar whipped in (which this whipped cream did not, thank god).  All in all, a very nice meal. For a chain, I really like this place.  Plus, they are one of the few restaurants in the city who do not have a corking fee.

nOe5dewI3cYT9oWwPZ2XeA.review_text: Twice I've ordered $20+ salads from here (which is already ridiculous) and both times the food has only filled the palms of my hands. Overpriced and not enough food to make you even close to full!  The food tastes fine despite always being overly dressed or sauced, just not worth the price.

_oQteCIdZDS94QV9IjzUkQ.review_text: We found this restaurant after experiencing awful service and food across the street at Pier 39 the day before. We gave it a shot.  The Caesar salad was so beautifully dressed I could have had just that and be totally satisfied with the meal.  Then came the Center-cut Filet...  This filet was so perfectly marinated and cooked, I constantly told myself "This is the best (and most expensive) steak you'll ever have. Savor every last bite." And savor every bite I did. This entree came laid upon a one of a kind sauce that would just melt in your mouth.  The mash potatoes were also magnificently seasoned with the perfect texture and consistency.   The service was out of this world. Unlike most restaurants where you are assigned one server who stops by periodically (if that) to check up on your meal, the employees here work together. One would pass by and notice that your water was running low, and refilled it without a second though. Another would pass by to pick up dirty plates on their way to another table. Amazing team work. And our assigned server was just delightful. Genuinely nice, attentive, and pretty cute if you ask me :).   Although the menu is out-of-hand expensive, and the portions less than sizable, I would most DEFIANTLY suggest exploring this fine establishment. I know i'll be back to recreate this wonderful experience soon.

lr96UEmkivNPP4EyOCKozw.review_text: Prices have gone up since the place was known as houstons but it still has the best hawaiian rib eye and french dip sandwiches bar none.   Had their chocolate pot de creme dessert (which was a special) and it was fabuluoooos!

A4gliZTpkLatrSYkziiXEA.review_text: Try the ribs! Amazing plate of ribs and very filling! Delicious! Service was also very courteous. Waiter made great recommendations.  They have an amazing ice cream Sunday as well! You can expect a good solid meal.

kmRSvG7YQ025WYBZBK97ug.review_text: great food here! everyone loved it and though it might be a big pricey, they give you huge portions! baked potatoes were really good.  thai steak and noodle salad - really liked it tuna salad - YUM prime rib - first time having prime rib and really liked it though it didn't really wow me. HUGE portions though. a very big slice of meat encrusted on the sides with chunks of salt and pepper. i'm more of a ribeye girl though so i think i should have gotten that instead.  filet - ok  good food, good service and good company = win will definitely be coming here again

CA7Yk2ze-ydstb0yBzeBYg.review_text: We came here for lunch and shared the "Nice Little House Salad" and the French dip sand which. House salad was great and the French dip sando was amazing! Te meat was tender, the bread was perfect and the au jus was very tasty!! Will def come back here again for it!

M4x7LkzUqKoRNlV42uFo7A.review_text: Third time was Easter Sunday and this place did a great job.... again! the hawaiian rib-eye was cooked to perfection. I finished off with the cobbler and vanilla ice-cream which was really good too! great place to bring the family or a great girl that deserves a pricey steakhouse.

x1paA3aUHJTurbtFkBSOGg.review_text: Came here the other week for a birthday dinner and I'm glad the birthday girl picked this spot. I never would have noticed or knew about this place otherwise.. first walking in... I noticed that I wasn't a complete fan at how dark the place was.. but I guess they are trying to set a mood. The aroma of BBQ and firewood filled the air and made my stomach growl. I was super excited at that point to eat some ribs.. I looked at the menu prior to going and had my eye on the Hawaiian rib eye so that's exactly what I got and split half half with my friend who got the pork ribs. I basically got the best of both worlds that night. My Hawaiian rib eye was cooked to perfection.. a bit chewy due to my medium rare liking but that was okay.. the ribs were fall of the bone and wasn't overwhelmed with sauce. I subbed the fries in my dish with mashed potatoes which were good and the fresh cut fries with the ribs were good too.. they indeed were fresh and reminded me a lot of in&out fries. Everything was good.. service included. Had a good time and wouldn't mind coming back for a romantic date or something in that category!

FmgXIjIUrJc48bMpyHV8og.review_text: Went here for dinner with my wife and 11 month old son on 3/9/2011.  Our server was Emily D.  The place looks & feels very comfortable, and not touristy (that goes for the menu as well). There was live music (jazzy) and a fire burning in the fireplace.   We started off with the ROSEMARY CIABATTA & OLIVE PLATE, I had the FREE-RANGE ROTISSERIE CHICKEN (Half a roasted chicken with apricot glaze, served with couscous) and my wife had THAI STEAK & NOODLE SALAD (Marinated filet with avocado, peanuts, mango & herbs in Thai dressing).  Everything was delicious!  Our server was awesome!

dloRzJikRjGrafNyfYrfBQ.review_text: This place is kid friendly so don't let the appearance fool you, they give each kid a doodle pro to keep them occupied.  They also have the best Oak Grilled Artichokes, Hawaiian Rib Eye with a fully loaded baked potato and don't forget to leave room for the Warm Five Nut Brownie! I used to hate all types of Red Meat until I tried a piece of the Hawaiian Rib eye this is by far the best piece of meat I have ever eaten!

g1H0AMMBadg2Quq-Z3qdcg.review_text: A great thing about San Francisco is that the city has a wide variety of places to Drink, Dine, and Socialize, meaning that no establishment needs to satisfy everyone nor every need.  In the case of Hillstone it became the host for my office teams self reward for accomplishing several goals, and No We Did Not Sandbag On Expectations So Goals Could Be Reached :)  So with a party of 8, and some Petty Cash, 1/2 of our team headed out to make the journey from the South of Market to the Embarcadero and the environs of Levi Plaza.  With our office located next to a busy hotel, and the Giants playing away getting a cab just before Noon was a snap, though we had to give the driver the exact address of 1800 Montgomery so he could figure out the route via the navigation system. It was an easy ride, but 4 of us got delayed due to a conference call, and those of us at Hillstone had to wait to be seated since the host would not seat our party unless more then 1/2 the party was there (4 is less then the needed 5 when you have 8).  The positive of waiting was that I could check out all the Taxis roll up, and drop off customers many of which were wearing office/ dress jackets though few ties for lunch, Yup, good sign this is a good place for expense account lunches, and dinners. The space has a rich feeling due to how, woods, metals and stone are used, it is fitted with a large oval bar with hanging video screens so the game of the day might be watched for those that want to interact but may not feel the need to talk, and the dinning area is set with booth seating that is best for parties of 4 - 6.  Okay, so after about 15 minutes or so of waiting the balance of the party arrived, and with an extra chair added to the table our group was seated.  This was work, and lunch but we still covered a good portion of the menu, with the first easy recommendation being the Spinach Artichoke Dip, which the table started with. This was not only  very tasty. but even with 8 of us this was a generous serving.  Now to be fair I think that this is a great place if you are on an expense account, or if you are in the area, and just wanting a nice meal with a slightly upscale experience where price is not a huge issue. But that said, they have some nice beverages On Tap, and the dishes we had were all good, from the Burgers (including Veggie), Sandwiches like the French Dip (though the dip was just okay and did not taste like it was made from scratch), Salads, and Entrees with the Shrimp, Rib-Eye, Chicken, Barbecue, Prime Rib all getting good reviews.  The only thing that seemed lacking other then the value were the House-Cut French Fries that reminded me of Potato Sticks. So in short, Hillstone is a good choice if you have no issue paying a premium or if you are not footing the bill, and want a nice semi dressed place to meet a client or just have a nice meal.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: The first time I came here was for a Christmas dinner with my BF and a group of friends.  We ordered the center-cut filet and I remember the entire time, everyone had huge smiles on their faces and upside down smiley eyes (NO not because we're all Asian...bc it was SO damn-diggity delicious...you like my alliteration? :P)  I used to work on Chestnut and Lombard so my old co-worker and I used to treat ourselves to drinks here after a crazy work week, which was almost every week...  Our drinks would soon turn into a appetizer sampling extravaganza and I would have an unsettling feeling in my stomach when the bill came around.  YES, it's freakin expensive but the food is really good and the service is excellent.  The cheeseburger is pretty good -- very large (thats what she said) and the fries are the long, thin ones (thats not what she said) ~ yummy.    If you decide to come here, just be prepared for a hefty bill but also come with an appetite.  Portions are generous.

Z5hFOkQ_s-HHNdsklTcYHg.review_text: I've dined at two Hillstone locations...Boston and SF. First experience was winter in Boston, looking for a nice place to get out from the snow. Found Hillstone and took a chance. The food was excellent. The only thing that could top that was the service. I had the Hawaiian Ribeye. It was cooked to perfection.   Moving forward a year, the wife and I decided to try Hillstone in SF. Can the service and food be just as good? Let's see....  Picked up the wife from work and drove over, no reservations. Waited 10 minutes and sat near the Jazz pianist. Music was just what we needed and service,once again, was great. I tried the same Hawaiian Ribeye. The steak was just as good, maybe better.  This is my go to place. Try it and you won't be disappointed!

rpYGTrlEdGFEQ5lj5I0x1Q.review_text: Made a reservation for Hillstone for later tonight and thought I'd get on yelp and throw them 5 ninja stars! My previous review (for a different company completely, not a restaurant) was my first one star and it made me real sad to do that.. blah. So here it is ya'll...  I've been eating at Hillstone (formally Houston's) for about 10 years. About 6 years ago I moved 3 blocks away and started going way more often. The best thing about this place is its consistency in providing a great over all experience.   -The food is solid, you can taste quality ingredients and it is prepared well. Every time. While it isn't going to be the best thing you ever ate in your life or Michael Mina style hype, Hillstone's food won't disappoint you and will easily satisfy (or exceed) your expectations assuming you aren't some crazed foodie.   -No corkage fee!! Well, for your first  bottle (or maybe two?) anyway, but who is really bringing that much of their own wine to a place? I go wine tasting/buying enough to want to grab something from my own stash before I walk over. Especially if you have a great Cabernet that should be paired with a steak that you will never make yourself.   -The service is amazing!  I can't stress this enough. The staff is put together, friendly and on top of it! It irritates me to have an unprofessional wait staff, these guys could write the book on how to do it right! I don't think I've ever sat around with an empty drink for more that 5 minutes.   -The ambiance. Don't get me wrong, I'm  not coming here to get all romantic but you could easily do so. There is often a live jazz band (which has never been overly loud) and the place has nice mood lighting. If you're outside, there is a cool fire pit too.   Hillstone, lets stay together.. We've shared so much and I'm looking forward to more!

6-e5YLrY4MYLaKDE_veIxA.review_text: A poor value by any measure.  The food is good, not special, not unique, and simply good and very over priced. Expect to pay $15 for a burger or sandwich that would cost $9-11 elsewhere. While many rave about the ribs, the portion is inadequate for $29 and the taste is common to any rib joint, BBQ specialty establishment. To add insult to injury in the department of being inadequate; fries are one of their key offerings but when asked for malt vinegar, the reply was that they carry only balsamic and champagne vinegars.   Wine is the only reasonably priced item on the menu. If you bring your own there is no corkage fee, a big plus; I suspect this has a rather spurious kick to their rating.  Outdoor seating is nice but quite noisy due to the very busy location. The immobile tables and umbrellas make some covering such as a hat is must for avoiding excessive sun exposure.  Service is average for what you would expect in this area.  Note that they add 18% gratuity for tables of five (5) or more, yes five (5) rather than the more usual six (6).

LTI86BSXBclY6UsZXqKYXw.review_text: JUST Like Houston's in LA!  The restaurant is located right near the embarcadero across from the Alcatraz boat tours. It was a Sunday night and the restaurant was still packed. I enjoy coming to this place because its a nice place to dine at while still being casually dressed. It definitely offers the best of both fine dining and casual dining. The restaurant had a romantic atmosphere because of the dim lighting and dark oak interior design and there was also a live jazz band playing at the time.   FOOD: Spinach Artichoke Dip with Chips - Best dip I have ever had at a restaurant. The dip is amazing and instantly melts in you mouth and has a great flavor that pairs well with the chips. They also give you a sour cream and salsa dip. Best of all there are free refills for CHIPS!  Ribeye: I ordered this medium and it was extremely juicy and not dry at all. It came with mushrooms on top of it with asparagus and mashed potatoes. The cut was thick and well seasoned. You can definitely tell the meat is well roasted and cooked in the fire.  Apple Vanilla Ice Cream with Walnuts: I am a big fan of apple desserts and this one definitely hit the spot. The apple slices with the walnuts instantly melts with the ice cream. What a perfect combination on the palate!  SERVICE: Great service all around. The waiter came by multiple times to help us with our plates and refilled our water constantly. We also ordered a bottle of wine to top it all off and the waiter was always attentive with our wine glasses.  I will definitely be coming back again for another savory slice of steak!

iM97nzkQkv70DYmFGTqQjw.review_text: I've frequented Los Altos Grill and Rutherford Grill (both under the Hillstone Group) many a time and was surprised that there was yet another Hillstone restaurant in SF, just a short drive from my father-in-law's place. Was seated right away at 6:30pm on a Wednesday (and I noticed it was fairly easy to get a reservation via urbanspoon for not long after) Same menu,same ambience, and same friendly service. Live music was a nice bonus. Stuck with my usual order: hacked chicken salad (generous helping of chicken!) and a side of fries but laid off the hot fudge sundae this time. Although, I HIGHLY recommend it over all the other desserts. Had I planned on coming here, I would've also brought a bottle of my favorite pinot noir (not so crazy about the ones they offer). Gotta take advantage of the free corkage!   Definitely a great place for an after-work beverage or just a tasty, well-done meal.

ZZlylZYQK2YgkugH42ieOQ.review_text: I was expecting to come to Houston's but when I arrived I noticed that their sign had changed to Hillstone so I got a bit scared that one of my favorite restaurants had closed down; it turned out that the name had changed but the restaurant hadn't.  I still think this is a great restaurant, but they seem to be a bit inconsistent. The last time I came here, the server gave us a basket of delicious olive bread to start but this time we didn't get any bread whatsoever. My party even noticed that there was some bread on someone else's table; perhaps it is no longer free? Maybe.. Maybe not. I ordered the prime rib for dinner and requested that it was prepared medium rare - a reddish/pink but when the steak arrived, it was at least a medium - a dull pink. The meat was not exactly as I had requested but it was still tasty nonetheless.   I'd recommend this restaurant to all and I would highly recommend the Hawaiian Rib Eye, it is absolutely delicious. The next time I eat at Hillstone, I hope the restaurant stays consistent and maintains their good quality meals.

QRy_y_xGbBj-XjvaP7UkMw.review_text: Two words FOOD POISONING!!!!! Go to this restaurant at your own risk. I have been to Hillstone about 4 times and each time is more disappointing than the last.   Any who long story short I believe I received horrible food poisoning from this establishment. I called to let them know, because personally I would want to know if I was a manager that one of my customers thought they received food poisoning from my restaurant. I also understand food poisoning is just a consequence of eating out in some cases and only restaurants with obsessive hygienic habits are able to produce food with a very low possibility of this type of situation and I also cannot be absolutely certain it came from Hillstone however the only other thing I ate that day was a coffee soo...... it seems rather suspicious too me. That said, what really bothered me was the fact that I called to inform them that I thought I received food poisoning from the Hawaiian rib eye. The woman I spoke to on the phone seemed upset and concerned about the situation and she told me a manager would call me back to get further info. I never received a call back and while I understand restaurants get busy, it is a pathetic excuse in my opinion to ignore a food poisoning complaint. Also we spent 150$ on our meal and while that might not be considered crazy expensive by SF standards, I look at it as paying 150$ for near kidney failure and fever for 4 days straight. Really Hillstone? get your act together.

Wlb-k9jXifJHotEhiAcRRg.review_text: My partner and I decided to go to Hillstone since we both thought that it is the same thing as Houston's and we've both enjoyed Houston's restaurants in the past.  The patio is a great place to have lunch as long as the weather allows it.  I ordered a salad with the protein being ahi tuna.  Since I'm allergic to fish I asked if they could just substitute chicken for the tuna.  The waitress went to check and returned seemingly embarrassed to share with us that they don't do substitutions.  I get that in most cases but I didn't feel that my request was anything radical or that Hillstone was a type of restaurant that would fear losing the artistic integrity of a dish by putting a piece of chicken on the salad.  My partner had also asked for bread.....not too crazy since he had ordered a bowl of soup....and they said they could but they would charge us for it.  Not that big of a deal but the whole experience felt unwelcoming.  Not what I tend to think of when I think of hospitality at least.

XqihdVwSLKUHvAJNTMh-0Q.review_text: Great food. Pretty food. Chickens great. Ribs great. One of my fav. Love this location by harbor.nice for date nite I guess. Nothing but the best girl..haha.

EoWvfs7oWq3GZVDr7pghTA.review_text: It's been exactly two years since my first/last visit to this establishment and lemme tell ya, it's still fan-freakin-tastic!  Yes, you read that right. Fan-freakin-tastic!  As an opener, we ordered the spinach and artichoke dip. We got this the last time and it's still as scrumptious as I remember. For entrees, I ordered my favorite Thai steak & noodle salad and she got the Red trout. I swear both dishes are out of this world. Seriously. No joke. I don't even know if you could put my dish into the category of salad because in a way it makes it less important. It's so *bleeping* delicious it needs its own category. No doubt about it. My mom's trout was especially tasty! And how'd they get it to be crispy, moist and flaky all at the same time?! By the way, it's a huge filet of fish. I finished it for my mom after demolishing my "salad."  For dessert, they brought over that walnut fudge brownie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on it and a lit candle. They knew it was my birthday so THANK YOU! My mom also ordered the apple crumble dessert. She  died over it. I ate all the ice cream. I admit it. No shame here. 'Twas my birthday so I did not give a *bleep!*   I also must comment on how well their food travels and stays fresh. I ordered take out for my dad because he wasn't able to make it to lunch so we got him the famous Hawaiian ribeye. Now my dad eats all his cuts of meat medium well so most people think that the end result would be a drier dish. NEVER. From the time we received his food till when he actually ate it, 5 hours surpassed... and it was still as juicy as ever! Not to mention flavorful! Wow. I could not believe it. Crazy.   Moral of the story, Hillstone still reigns supreme as my favorite restaurant. Although it's pricey, you pay for the quality.  Thank you for an awesome birthday, Hillstone!

JbMsdp3PfwywtAPgACdl_A.review_text: My husband and I love Houstons and the food served at all their chains, including Hillstone.  However, we won't go back to this location.  We lived in Orange County for 7 years, right new Houstons and Gulfstream, both in Newport Beach.  We loved these restaurants and were pleasantly surprised to learn Hillstone is in SF (we live in Alameda).  However, the service and attitude at Hillstone is unacceptable.  We have visited Hillstone on each of our birthdays.  The first visit (March 2011) was my husband's day.  After dinner, it was pouring rain and we requested the host call us a cab (we were staying in the City).  The host refused indicating they "don't call cabs...".  We ran through the ran and entered another restaurant, soaking wet.  The hostess there then called us a cab.  We went back to Hillstone last night (August 2012) hoping for nicer service and to celebrate my birthday.  Again a severe disappointment.  When we arrived and were standing at the hostess table we saw a waiter carry out a dessert with a candle in it.  While I was in the restroom, my husband approached the hostess table and indicated it was my birthday.  He was quickly told "we don't do birthdays!"  When he inquired about the celebration we saw earlier, the hostess rudely advised "that table must have brought their own candle."  In essence, the attitude we always get is "you are not good enough here..."  It just feels yucky in light of the fact that this is just a regular restaurant and we were there to celebrate.    Houstons (and other locations) is already a bit over priced, but then to have rude service is not worth it.   If you are looking to check out this chain, I recommend that you wait to go to Orange County and check out Houstons or Gulfstream in Newport Beach.  I know we will be.  SF has too many other amazing restaurants to waste your money and be treated like we were here.

otwf4pFnOKoZf6GsxQd5hA.review_text: After spending the afternoon on Alcatrez, we were very hungry.  Looked across the Embarcadero and decided to try Hillstone. Maybe it was the hunger, or this food was awesome.  We each had a different type of burger--ahi, veggie, and beef.  We all raved about them.  It's nice that they allow you to choose your side--not just fries.  I had heirloom tomatoes--yum.  Others chose the shredded cabbage, cale, or spinach.  All very good. We discovered Hillstone for a midafternoon meal, but I'll come back to try dinner.

JaK1daIwjVDavae73eNPrQ.review_text: This is our family's go-to place in the city if we can't agree on where to dine - even way back when it was still called Houston's. Their French dip with au jus never disappoints.

rAvt4RpvwdbHo_bdMnDjqQ.review_text: I really enjoy this place. I've been here a few times for dinner, and since I started work in the building right next door, I've had lunches there too. My recommentations:  Woodgrilled Salmon w/ Couscous: the salmon is very juicy and b/c it's placed in it's woodfire grill it has a smokeyness to it.  Prime Rib: it's a thick juicy slab of roasted tender prime rib. this also comes with a fully loaded baked potatoe.  Veggie Burger: I usually grab this for lunch. This or their regular house burger. They're both really good and comes with shoestring french fries.  My only gripe about this place is that they don't do call-in to go orders. You have to actually physically walk into the restaurant and order your food..then you gotta sit/stand there and wait for your food. this to me is a hassle when I need to get back to work quickly.

rXvAk-fxNwyY3Iuy17MAKQ.review_text: This place is Houstons, and I still refer to that name. The French Dip is still on the menu, and still great. The location is easy to get to right on the F line. The food is good, and the price can get away from you if you eat with a friend. No matter, the food makes up for it.  My only issue is that they didn't want to seat me till my reservation time even though there were booths available.

q35o54dDJ5ciM2M3F5DRRA.review_text: I don't even know where to begin...  Artichoke grilled to perfection.  Delicious "Nice Little" House Salad.  Filet mignon... EXACTLY how I asked for it: Medium rare, more on the rare side.  The ambiance (lighting/mood) was perfect and the booths are cozy.    The service was perfect.

h_JzhQeMURYAcLfEdIobVA.review_text: When my husband and I decide to splurge on a nice dinner, we look forward to great food, wonderful service, and a great atmosphere. Unfortunately, while the food tasted good, the service here was really atrocious. We had many different people stopping by to drop things off or pick things up without saying a word. When they did speak to us, most of them seemed hurried and rude. Our food took an extremely long time, and when it did come out, it was cold.

52-B7TATqvZKIJZ4W02fbA.review_text: Great veggie burger and service to match. A little overpriced for my taste but I can see the appeal. Went on a Friday night and got to enjoy some live music. Next time I'll bring a bottle of wine and take advantage of their free corkage.

hubNn6t32_3KjdV7SWJH4w.review_text: Great ambiance, excellent service and the best steaks in town.  Very nice for a special occasion or just a casual meal.  Love the live music.  The light fixtures are so pretty, too.

BksNhcduRFM4bNWF3vnqBA.review_text: My boyfriend and I love coming here for whatever occasion. We always leave satisfied from the food & service. Once we came here for my birthday dinner, and they somehow messed up our order or forgot about it, so the server informed us right away and told us not to worry about the bill because it was on the house. We didn't even notice we were waiting that long!   I even introduced it to my friends for our Christmas dinner and they loved it!  Sometimes if it's a super long wait, the cooks offer fries behind the window. There's also a waiting area by the fireplace. It's really a nice atmosphere there. Once they were completely booked for reservations, so we just did a walk-in. They sat us within 10-15 min.?  My favorite things to get are the cheeseburger w/ shoe string fries and artichoke dip. YUM!

2t2HCw37rOKKWnT8C_yDng.review_text: Hillstone, formerly known as, Houstons is located along the Embarcadero.  I remember going to Houstons for their French Dip (when I used to eat beef).  It was delicious!  Times have changed...  We went to Hillstone after visiting the Exploratorium on Easter Sunday.  I was expecting a wait, but we were quickly seated.  After being seated, our server quickly asked if he could start us off with a beverage.  Really?? We barely warmed our seats and didn't even have a chance to look over the menu yet.   The food selection was better when it was Houstons.  I felt Hillstone's selection was very limited and the appetizers consisted mainly of salads, which they also have a separate section for salads on their menu.  Items ordered:  Famous French Dip ($22) - Served on a house made french roll with thinly sliced prime rib and au jus.  Beef was tender, but not as good as when it used to be Houstons.   Grilled Chicken Salad ($21) - Decent size and portion, but don't think it's worth $21.  Came with fresh greens, crisp tortilla strips, and chicken.  The honey-lime vinaigrette, peanut sauce had lots of flavor, but next time I'll ask for it on the side.  My salad was drenched with the dressing, which made it salty.    There was nothing bad about our meal, but also nothing great either.  Service was average.

rZxws9qLlU1JIROBqhL8OQ.review_text: Wouldn't seat my pregnant wife in the empty restaurant until I returned from parking the car.  Did not offer us bread (at a $25 plate restaurant?) and then charged us $3 for 3 pieces of faccacia.  Cool ambience and nice bathrooms. Delicious fries.  Cajun trout was quite greasy.

WF1o6AyXm6-NovD5dFnMOg.review_text: This is turning into one stellar week. The opening of Rickhouse, and now dinner at Houston's.  ----- This is my kind of place.   From the one on one service, to the large plates, and the soothing dim ambiance of the venue, Houston's is an oasis among the conquering FiDi trunks.  After organizing a successful volunteer symposium ( OakTown MeetUP ), a friend and I decided to celebrate by grabbing dinner at Houston's.   Situated on Embarcadero, Houston's rests as a modern day Sinatra hangout. Perfect for that late evening dinner, with a straight up menu, and a bustling vibe cloaked within the mild lighting.  We sat at the bar, situated perfectly by the patio windows and a clear view of the flat panels for nightly highlights.  As a burger guy, I was repeatedly told that the veggie burger here was something to experience, and while there was a regular cheeseburger on the page, the look from our server pushed me into trying their specialty.  I don't have the widest spectrum on grading a veggie burger, as I've probably only had a few in my life, but this one was spectacular. The chopped onions, the warm jack cheese and a crisp bed of shredded lettuce and tomatoes made this burger evaporate.  It came with a side of grilled corn and white beans which coupled with the burger perfectly. I was celebrating the 4th again.  The guy next to me ordered the ribs, and I can guarantee you I will be coming in soon for those...  Houston's is a place I could put my name on. Our server was a gem, she was one of the multiple highlights of the evening, and was a pleasure to get to know and meet.  Save me that seat, I've found my in-city vacation landing spot.

mx6ATpiz0kgqSwIGwgr_pg.review_text: I had Ahi Tuna and my friend had Filet, I have to say, the tuna is just average, but the salad came with tuna is really great, the sauce for salad is great as well. For steak, they usually cook a little bit rare than expent.  What i like the most is the live jazz music.

7jV2Qau5BbTf7aZspPLweg.review_text: Maybe I was expecting too much from this place, but I was thoroughly disappointed.   If you state on your menu that you charge 18% gratuity and stand by your service, you better live up to it! Our waitress didn't seem to know what so was doing at all. She would bring us food that we did not order, and then take it away to the right table. Or she would be gone without coming back to take our orders or even bothering to check in with us.   After I read all the great things Yelpers had to say about the Hawaiian Rib-eye, I decided to give it a try. Boy, did I regret that choice! The cut was not tender and the marinate was too sweet for my taste. But the baked potato side was delish!  Surprisingly the lamb was very tender and juicy. I must add that I was not impressed with the mashed potato. The chopped up bits of green onion did not add anything to the mashed potato. Should just leave it out.   Overall, I think they need to expand on the appetizers. I still can't believe they cook lamb better than steak! I mean this is a steakhouse, right? I'll just stick to Ruth's Chris and Morton's for my steak. Most likely not coming back here for steak or the service.

9mHeWgJpq9moP9Ct8BmROg.review_text: Five star as usual!  Whenever I'm craving a delicious hearty meal or a perfectly cooked ribeye steak, I think of Hillstone.  I've never had a bad experience here, service is excellent.  Hillstone is my go to place for a great meal and wonderful time with best friends.

_fb2pni0aZLpcFVmR-_7zA.review_text: hillstone's parent company is Houston's.  my dinner last night was delicious, highly recommend the Hawaiian ribeye and the Arctic char for fish lovers.  the ambiance seemed really noisy when you first enter but the space is open and well designed, leaving your party to be able to have a personal conversation without yelling at one another.  be careful of the wine, they pour a lot for one glass !!  one odd thing is how they have office chairs for some tables so I would probably ask for a booth next time.

JVTcskIsqBgyw7jTQC9GYQ.review_text: It's true what they say about the spinach & artichoke dip. Very delicious and quite addicting. I could eat about three of these, along with several glasses of IPA. The french dip sammie is good, but expensive. The staff tries really hard to help out, and they earn bonus points for the service.

WNRmgAmR_LR-ey8bOzJ8Og.review_text: This place is fun! I love the service, the ambiance and the food is delicious! Great place to have dinner and drinks and hang out with your date or friends. Must try...  Order the French dip: one of my favorites here.  This place use to be called Houston's.

hSU4P5OqzJjsxqp5ylCaEg.review_text: Descent food, they always have availablities for reservations .

VygN3XApGokSlIocW1Uzrg.review_text: The salad w/ the grilled meat is to die for & I don't even like beef that much.  The dessert is phenomenal & the wine list is outstanding.    This restaurant was listed in my baby guide book, but it wasn't baby-friendly at all.  But they do have changing tables in the restroom...?

d4NZ62Jirx_LSik6KGAF3A.review_text: The staff was amazingly friendly and welcoming.  The location was a pleasantry being close enough to the pier to provide a view of the Bay, but far enough to allow for ample parking.  On a warm day, the patio is nice and relaxing.    The food is a bit on the pricey side for what you get but its still very good.  Everything we ordered was delicious, from the appetizer, entree to the dessert.  If you are an artichoke fan, their roasted artichokes are a  "must order".

sU1RzyP1H-_s3HHuU9zL3g.review_text: Stopped in for lunch during a business trip and it was worth the stop.  Delicious, fresh food and great service.  Started off with spinach artichoke dip.  You can never go wrong with that choice.  I ordered the Hawaiian Rib-Eye.  Great size, juicy, flavorful and delicious.  Chose mashed potatoes instead of fries, and it was yummy.  Friend ordered the Bbq ribs.  Great as all always.    We finished the lunch off with an Apple Walnut Cobber. It was bombbbbbbb.  Overall great dining experience.

9mr1YgKEKOD0Si4v46nqNA.review_text: Growing up where artichokes sell for 20 cents at local farm stands, spending freaking 12 dollars for grilled 'chokes is clearly against my religion, but yelp made me do it.  Holy schnikes they make a good artichoke.  I tend to prefer mine steamed and unfettered, but whatever these were marinated in, rang my bell. And I will be damned if I don't try to grill my next batch.  I will never buy it again, but there are no regrets. Bravo Houston's.  The ribs do exactly what they advertise, I barely had to chew due the fact that they were so "fall-off-the-bone"-tastic. And I don't usually eat coleslaw as I can't hang with the usual vinegar mayo combo, but let me tell you, what I couldn't fit in my aching belly that night, I brought home and ate promptly the next morning.  And I practically licked the box.    Yelpers, I must say that I was disappointed with your recommendation on the sunday.  It was a huge pile of ice cream with some hot fudge on top and some tasty nuts. But all 4 of us kept on digging and digging for the cookie, brownie, fruit, something on the bottom and never happened.   Felt like we got half way through a Cracker Jack box and realized we got no prize.  So disappointing.   As for the ambiance, you may be on the Embarcadero, but you are as far away from San Francisco as you can be.  This is a lil piece of Texas in San Francisco.  And if I may make a note to the ladies: this is where the brothers go.  If you want to find where the hot black men are in this city, look no more... They are at Houston's.

Ygf4qt7_6uY-7wV4BXYyJg.review_text: So I have always wanted to go to Houstons as I drove by the location many times.  I still have not been able to get to Houstons as they changed their name to Hillstone.  Anyhow, the company took me out for my birthday lunch, here are my ratings  Corn Chowder soup with rock shrimp: 4 stars, about as good as soup can get, very flavorful, corn was not overcooked and the rock shrimps were nice a big. French Dip: 5 stars, my friend told me that this spot has the best french dip in SF, he was not f-in around.  The bread was nice and flaky, crunchy and chewy at the same time and the top bun was like a french bread and croissant made sweet love and had a child.  Mashed potates were whatever but the au jus was great as it was not too salty as some places are.    Will definitely go back and try some other stuff but might give in a get the best french dip in SF again!

ZV8RLCOj3md_R8FLapdCSQ.review_text: Consistantly great food and excellent service.

Ym-aCrR1WyQTVzQmf-vI6g.review_text: Ok, I've only heard good things about this place so when I ordered my chicken, I was surprised that it was so dry and that the couscous had no flavor and was actually pretty gross.  I guess that's what I get for ordering chicken at a steak/burger joint.  I've learned my lesson.. I think?  The drinks were super strong which means no complaints from me!  The salad was deliciousioso!!  My friend ordered the steak and it was cooked perfectly and I had to take a bite, but that only made me angrier at myself for not ordering steak.. =( The service was very professional, and really polite but kinda slow. This was also the only place that didn't have a 3 hour wait on a Saturday night! woo hoo!

cEwFrAP4yAMJ202tKj9CsQ.review_text: I come to Houston's (Hillstones) for one item and one item only...the house made veggie burger.  The actual veggie burger is a combination of black beans, grains (barley), rice, beets (yes, oddly enough I'm not a fan of beets by themselves) molasses and bbq sauce. It's served on a butter toasted roll with jack cheese (I add avocado) and shoestring french fries.   I love it so much I searched the 'net high and low to find a recipe for it and stumbled upon one that is quite similar. It's now become one of my families favorites!

aIISk4lrzKp6rQJpgwj_fg.review_text: 3 Stars for the restaurant overall, but 4 Stars for the Hawaiian Rib Eye! But has it always been $31? Really?   I loved this place formerly known as Houston's. The prime rib is good, but as soon as I tried the Rib Eye- it's been a fave of mine. But other then that, the restaurant has lost it's appeal.   The rest of the menu isn't very impressive- take a look for yourself. 4 appetizers to choose from and one is Cheese Toast!   Unfortunately, I crave the Hawaiian Rib Eye so I come back for more but it leaves my friends having to pick from their lacking menu.

FQTfUYsCnBryER6L8NFyYA.review_text: Lunch is always great here. The service is excellent and I just love the ambiance. If they had better parking I'd give them 5 stars!

5zPetI6kdmeF2DX0C6ImSQ.review_text: hands down...one of the best burgers around! and NO corkage fee!

EYyRqS3rHMUMMSArRZ7fPw.review_text: Great food, great service. I love this place! My boyfriend and I come here all the time. I always try to make it on a Tuesday or Thursday, because they have the best tortilla soup EVER (and you can only get it on those days). Hillstone is the best!

yamCDZmpEdv3Wi9L79_FdQ.review_text: It was better when it was Houstons. The artichoke appetizer was just okay. The prime rib, I've had better. The loaded baked potato came out loaded but the cheese on top was not melted and cold! The Manhattan's were the bomb, though. Probably won't go back.

X_Cx2TX8pJVl8J6BzOrJLQ.review_text: A little overly hyped as another reviewer stated.  We arrived early, so we ended up waiting in the bar for out table.  It took me 10 minutes to get the bartenders attention, he was too busy...I should have just jumped over the bar and made my own drink!  After finishing my watered down Captain Coke we were seated.  Our hostess went down the list of daily specials, and was very well versed on the wine list.  We ordered the Grilled Artichokes, Smoked Salmon for starters; and Grilled Sea Bass (special), and the Hawaiian Rib-Eye cooked medium.   I must say, the grilled artichokes were exceptionally tasty, but I've had better smoked salmon.  The grilled sea bass was cooked perfectly, but my center Rib-Eye was over cooked to medium well.  The hostess apologized for the mistake and offered to have them remake it.  Unfortunately, time was of the essence, so I ended up eating a medium well rib-eye :(  Overall dinner experience was just okay, but nothing really to write home about.

qVWzlwN6Y4K4wh7gsncpng.review_text: My babycakes brought me here for my birthday. I had always known this place as Houston's and wasn't aware they changed their name until i step foot into the restaurant. This place has a nice ambiance to it. We got seated at a nice cozy booth and just listened to the jazz music as we awaited for our food. Per many yelpers recommendations, we got the spinach dip and the Hawaiian rib eye medium rare.
