The spinach dip had the pefect combo of cream spinach and artichoke. the chips weren't too over powering in flavor but added the perfect crunch to each bite. Salsa and sour cream was also provided and paired greatly with the dip. At first we thought we weren't going to finish but by the time we finished, we felt we didn't have enough! shortly after, our main course came - the rib eye. at first bite i was like O.O this is sooooo soft. The rib eye melted in my mouth and all that pineapple juiciness just exploded in my mouth. it was pretty delish. the portion size was great too. i actually didnt finish. the rib eye also came with a side - we opted for the loaded baked potato and i did not regret my choice! the baked potato hmmm so good. loaded with everything from butter and sour cream to bacon and cheese. the potato was so soft. wasn't like any bake potato i've ever eaten... My bf kept  saying he was full and that he would give the rest to me for lunch the next day... but he ended up eating it all before he realized .....

T-ql1LmgkTRnTH9fsaqtSw.review_text: Houston's is a great place for a poser pseudo-vegetarian like myself to go and happily order a salad or plate of veggies while the rest of my party gorges itself on steak, lamb and other assorted dead animals.  Add in the lack of a corkage fee and you've got the makings of a good party.  The only downside IMO is that it's really popular and the wait times without reservations can be pretty extreme.    And while you're there, don't forget to induce a food coma with all the free bread or you just haven't lived.

4ULkSSMp3-JH8HegrlfgzQ.review_text: I really can't say enough about Hillstone.  I'll put their food up to anyone's in a taste test.  I've been to many of their sister-restaurants, and they are all abso-fuckin-lutely amazing!   My wife and I chose Hillstone for our 6th Anniversary dinner last night.  We set a really high standard, and as usual - Hillstone exceeded our expectations!  We started with a couple of drinks and a Grilled Artichoke appetizer.  The chokes were absolutely amazing!  For our dinner, my wife ordered the Thai Noodle Salad with Rotisserie Chicken and I had the BBQ Pork Ribs.  I will literally call their ribs the best EVER.  And their loaded baked potato was no slouch either.  My wife called her Thai Noodle Salad, the greatest salad she has ever had.  That is a lot of "best evers" to throw around.  For dessert, we enjoyed their Belgium Hot Fudge Sundae - the hot fudge comes in it's own "gravy boat" and the candied walnuts add a little extra umph to it all.  All in all, a really good place to eat.  I stand behind this place to anyone that may feel up to trying a great spot.  They also have sister restaurants in Napa and Los Altos.

k5wIVQtBZQx2IROdJoMg9A.review_text: Started my evening with a perfectly prepared Grey Goose Martini with 3 olives.  Our wait person actually asked if we wanted onions, olives or a twist. nice.  The starter dish of spinach-artichoke dip was major yummy, my son was straving and devoured the whole thing, which is always a good sign.  My Hawaiian Rib Steak was hands down the best and perfectly prepared hunk of meat I have had in a long time, just the right amount of tangy sweetness to it.   Baked potato was awesome and I usually order fries, but with yelpers recommending the potato - went for the hugely stuffed monster potato.  Dessert:  huge hot fudge sundaes (as a person who consumes 3 pints of ice cream a week)  this only fuels my addiction.  And finally, a cappuccino worth having (coffee shop owner of 13 years standing). . . all in all my new favorite place to chow down. . .

2nL8vkgw9IN9PdTp_1FtMA.review_text: When ever I go to the city I always luncheon at Hillstone.  Good place to eat and watch the traffic go by the piers.    Always order the hamburger and fries.  Giving it three stars as the service can be so so.  Ever since Hillstone chain took over this restaurant, service has really gone south.

2KmVI2N9J6jYZtww018Ptw.review_text: I must say, I love the ambiance of Hillstone. Quiet, smooth jazz playing, low lighting........all the makings of romance, you guys.  Unfortunately, it's one of the only restaurants in SF with a very limited vegetarian menu. I ordered a Spinach Omelette for dinner. For DINNER! In front of coworkers. I looked even dumber than I normally do in this situation.  It's also a bit on the pricey end, but it's set up to be a nicer joint to begin with. I'd have to pass in the future due to my dietary restrictions. I'm sure the steaks are delicious though?

eJL_r0ICe5m6NisYePFWxg.review_text: We ate dinner here 'by accident' before the Alcatraz evening tour and were pleasantly surprised by the accommodating service (we were in a big hurry) and delicious food. We liked it so much we went back on our last night in San Francisco. We didn't have a reservation and the place was packed (on a Wednesday). We had a drink at the bar and were seated 45 minutes later. The bar staff are professional and make a mean mojito by the way.  We started with the foccaccio and olives. We'd been 'suffering' from the lack of good bread and olive oil on our 3 week vacation, and this $3 (!) starter hit the spot.  We had the Hawaiian ribeye and the ahi tuna, both of which were perfectly prepared and delicious. No room for desert unfortunately.  This was one of the best meals we had in California. We highly recommend Hillstone.

AqwTAjoyG5HfhQi2-ab4cw.review_text: We came here for dinner before the Alcatraz cruise on Saturday. First thing that struck me was how large the interior was -- it didn't look nearly as big from the outside and the design is gorgeous. We will certainly be back for a date night.  We split the French dip sandwich and the tuna burger. They use shaved prime rib in the sandwich and it was positively divine! It was tender, flavorful and melts in your mouth. The bread was good, too, and gives the sandwich a firm bite. It's amazing what good ingredients will do for a sandwich. There were no bells and whistles to zazz up the sandwich, just great bread and great meat.   The tuna burger was not what I expected. I thought it would be a big slab of fish, but instead, it was almost like canned tuna, formed into a ball and grilled. I wasn't much of a fan.   I saw the restaurant on Check Please Bay Area and their artichoke dip is suppose to be great. Will certainly try that next time.

YLy6HF5gqPjDgoT9VO5ZeQ.review_text: Best burger ever. Homemade brioche buns. Lemonade is homemade and not too sugary. Artichokes can be delicious, but sometimes a little too charred. All around good food, good ambiance. I've been going here for at least the past 10 years if not longer and the food is always consistently delicious.

wm_OPFMz8V6oVFtOI-qlRw.review_text: Best restaurant in the world.  Try the ribs, grilled artichoke appetizer, spinach dip, and Hawaiian rib eye.  Never a bad experience. Service is always excellent.

67xJpGhxaxDS0GaLrrHYLw.review_text: I'd give zero, but the server and manager were lovely.  Possibly the worst food I've had in SF since I moved here 4 years ago - except Harvey's on Castro, of course.  Seated us in a timely fashion, staff was cordial and friendly.  I ordered the secret NY Strip, they had one.  My partner tried to order the rib-eye, but they refused to cook it the way he wanted it.  He changed his order to the pork chop.  3 minutes later, they don't have.  He orders the NY as well- mysteriously, they had another though there are only 3 a night -  hmmmm!  Both arrive almost raw though I ordered medium rare and he ordered medium.  He returned his, I said fu$k it and ate my caveman style.  The wait staff could not have been nicer, I must stress this.  The kitchen is a bunch of amateurs, absolutely!  This is still Houston's at its worst!  Want steak?  Go anywhere else!  This is merely a glorified, overpriced Applebee's.

XZKop2mZm4Uigvh4o-7low.review_text: Time for another chance @ Houstons:  We arrived early for our birthday celebration dinner (party of 2) and 20 mins. after the reso time I went to check @ the host station...the party in front of me was doing the same...I figured same old Houstons (Hillstone's).  The hostess was apologetic & promised a table soon.  I returned to the bar figuring we would end up eating there.  Almost immediately Stephanie, FOH Mgr., appeared, apologized, offered apps and promised a table soon.  As soon as she left we were seated, our apps & drinks followed in short order.  Since we're both formerly industry guys we watched the service and Stephanie was all over the place and the servers were a BIG improvement over our last visit (actually attentive).  I spoke to Stephanie and she explained she's a 4-restaurant veteran of this company's and she's intent on elevating the service here (SF - we all agreed the food is AWESOME).  She was sincere and really - REALLY - professional and nice.   So many reviews of this restaurant complain about the service.  Let's give Stephanie a chance and I'll bet Hillstone's will be pretty unbeatable within the year.  Good luck Stephanie, keep it up & we'll be back,

csxREaNX4shKV-PZqNFyLw.review_text: One of the best restaurants for the money in San Francisco.  We've been coming here before the days when they were called Houston's.  Service is always good.  Food is always great.  Here are a few suggestions: Prime Rib, Burger, Pork Chop, Hawaiian Ribeye, Waldorf Chicken Salad, Tuna Burger.  Great desserts also which are large enough to share: ice cream sundae and key lime pie.  The place is also kid friendly with plenty of street parking available.

GKmrSVCU4m8-6rdjjtRNWg.review_text: The food here is freaking fantastic.  I had lunch here with a friend and both of us really enjoyed our meal.  I ordered the Center Cut Filet and it was cooked to perfection.  Maybe not the best steak I've ever had since I didn't get as much flavor out of the meat but definitely cooked to perfection and extremely tender beef.  My friend let me try her ribs and those were the best ribs I've ever had.  I'm not that into ribs but when they taste the way they do here, I'd get them all the time.  The only demerit I'd give to the food would be to the mashed potato side which had too many green onions for my taste.  The Diet Coke here is insanely good.  The service was great, as it should be for the prices, but I would have liked the waitress to have known more of what the preparations of the steak would mean besides the color.  The calculated tip on the receipt is tremendously helpful BUT I did knock off 2% from the 20% I was intending on tipping because of the 2% SF Hippie Health Care Tax.  I would definitely return but I would not consider this "fancy" since it does get tourist traffic as well as many business casual patrons.  All in all, a great lunch place.

UHmxE6l1bFxl_hynynY6nQ.review_text: We love this place been there twice and food is still serve with excellence !!!

33OzyvMjDhGTUJubr4CWIA.review_text: Spontaneous night of food adventure with my food buddy.  Glad we came here and had parking spot since it is located inside a quiet street. This place is already starting out good when you can find parking especially since this is in SF.  The ambiance was cozy, comfortable and homey. We started ordering:  - SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP = simply yet very delicious and addicting!  - Squash pasta = tasted odd, was disappointed  - their special of the night "ribeye" ( taste better than it looks!)  - flying tuna platter = fresh tuna and mango, what a hit!  Would love to come back here and try some of their other entree.

kp1SDNjwwBPFmdF1kadRmw.review_text: I've never had a bad experience at a Houston's chain, and last night, my parents and I had an amazing dinner at  Hillstone!  Here's what we loved:  1. No corkage fee for 2 bottles for 3 people. I'm guessing the number of complimentary corkages depends on how many people in your party, but 2 bottles for 3-4 people is plenty! Hillstone also has a pretty decent wine list themselves, so there's really no reason to bring your own bottle if you didn't have one in mind.  2. Kale salad. I'm not a huge fan of kale, but this salad was delicious! There wasn't much of the bitterness of the kale because of the cilantro and light dressing. The salad was a pretty good portion, but didn't fill us up before our entrees came. The peanuts added a nice crunch to it.  3. Awesome steak! My dad had the prime rib, which was so tender that I couldn't believe it was beef. I got the hawaiian ribeye which was wonderfully marinated and had just the right amount of fat for my liking. The meat was also really tender and flavorful. Both steaks went wonderfully with a bottle of Chalk Hill blend that we brought. It was one of the best food and wine pairings I've had.  4. Portion size. You will not go hungry at Hillstone! My mom's steak salad was humongous and she couldn't finish it. No matter what you order, you will get a hearty portion. But the portions aren't so big that you feel like a pig. The steaks were a good size and I was able to down 2 glasses of wine with mine.  Go to Hillstone for a solid delicious meal. You can safely pick this restaurant knowing there will be good food, with plenty of options for everybody. The quality of food and service is always consistent and something you can count on.

-zzSnUrAIEbYy_JLTU36eQ.review_text: I know this place is a chain, and not the quintessential SF restaurant, but I work across the street from the restaurant and I've gotta say, their crispy chicken sandwich is, in the words of our resident friendly Aussie, "the business."  Most everything there is delicious, albeit a bit pricey for lunch, and when there was a snafoo and they had run out of chicken sandwiches for the day but had misspoke when they said they still had 2, they were super super generous and comped our whole meal.  They even threw in a delicious kale salad.  A little goes a long way with things like that, and the fact they made that mistake and immediately owned up to the miscommunication sums up the food, the ambiance, and the service: classy.

FoZ6QIJGbd-2DZ12f34FtQ.review_text: SF Food Inspection Score: 92  Aw man I wish I knew about their free bread and olives!!! That's okay, we had their grilled artichokes and they were delish.  I had and fell in love the pan seared sashimi tuna. It was cooked perfectly and paired with a light but filling salad that perfectly dressed. Listen to me, I'm like a frickin foodie.  The BF had the French Dip and it was like budda. Melted in your mouth and soooo yummy.  The service was friendly and quick and better yet, this place NEVER has a corkage fee.

NibzGjnQIre2Xq3khW5CaQ.review_text: Oh Houston's, an undying guilty pleasure.  I started going here routinely about 4 years ago with an ex. The relationship (with the girl) has ended, but my insatiable desire for Houston's hasn't.  I go C-RAAZY for their artichoke and spinach dip and typically have their french dip au jus sandwich as an entree. I wash all that deliciousness with a draft Stella Artois, yum.  What Houston's lacks in service (some nights I'll have a phenomenal server, other times one who rarely pays attention to our table) it makes up for in extraordinary food. A great first date place for guys who want to impress a chick in this city who isn't a vegetarian and don't want to put too big a dent in their wallet (dinner for two is typically $100 depending on whether or not you get wine).

QI-oVGhqLNp5yO3fyGC8hg.review_text: The food here is consistently excellent.  I love the Thai steak salad, the ribs, and the french dip sandwich.  The hot fudge sundae is the best anywhere and the key lime pie is out of this world.  Service is usually great and they have live music many nights.  I enjoy their outdoor patio dinning area on a sunny afternoon.  They have no corkage fee so bring your own bottle of wine.

qVCGzJCDnjwut1dnHef2Og.review_text: Meghann is a Rockstar - great great service w/ an awesome attitude, good recommendations.   Met a friend here for dinner and this is really just the old Houston's but the old Houston's had great food and so does Hillstone. No corkage was amazingly great -we still bought several glasses of wine with 2 bottles that we brought. One was for work - terrible hard work that makes you taste wine to evaluate it. It's the hard life for me - and the other bottle was an A. Raffinelli 2001 - hmmm not bad.   We both had the special Rutherford Ribeye that was Delicious - really tasty and perfectly cooked. The bill was pretty cheap for 2 guys. Nicely done.

Xm8R_E6OLb7XtiR7uP_zQQ.review_text: I'm obsessed with their veggie burger.  It's my favorite (second only to Plant Organic's California veggie burger).  Also love it when their seasonal vegetable, brussels sprouts, is on the menu  (winter months).  I never dared to try brussles sprouts, (given their bad rep) until a friend recommended that I try them here.   Seriously, so delicious.    Also, must save room for dessert - apple cobbler is divine.    We always take advantage of the no corkage fee and bring in a bottle.  Only complaint is that they're really picky about having your entire party present before they can seat you.  Kind of annoying when your friends are running late, and there's no space at the bar.  What's the big deal?  Just seat us, and we'll order food and drinks at our table while waiting for the rest of our party.  Ugh.

JuOyx4y1L9DjysCkzHG3dQ.review_text: Below is my letter and the response from Hillstone management.  Hello Susan, thank you for allowing us to address the concerns of such a long time guest.  While it is true we can no longer serve the Grilled Chicken Salad dressing on the side, we can appreciate the compounded frustration of having had that exception made for you in the past.  This salad was originally designed to be dressed in layers, one of which is freshly squeezed lime juice, and an exception should have never been made for any of our guests in the first place.  That being said, we are truly sorry for your disappointment, Susan, and hope you will not let this deter your visits with us in the future.  Thank you again for allowing us to address your concerns. Sincerely, Gail Chesney, Guest Services  -----Original Message----- Sent: Sunday, October 13, 2013 9:30 PM To: Guest Services; Guest Services Subject: Guest Comment :: Hillstone - Montgomery St. San Francisco  ------------------------------------------- Subject: Hillstone - Montgomery St. San Francisco -------------------------------------------  I am a regular at this location. I live one block away and have eaten there for years. I frequently go when my husband is travelling as he doesn't care for the restuarant. I usually sit at the bar.  All the bartenders know me and know my "usual" order.  My main course is usually the chicken salad with the peanut sauce and dressing on the side.  I know the kitchen doesn't like it, but they always accomodate my request.  This evening a new manager, Jill Kanofsky, approached me.  She acknowledged that I am a regular and requested that I try the salad with the dressing already on it.  If i didn't like it, I could then have it with the dressing on the side.  I accomodated her request, didn't care for it and subsequently received one with the dressing on the side.  A few minutes later, Ms. Kanofsky approached me.  She explained that they would no longer be able to perform this accomodation in the future.  My response was that I come to the restaurant, because I like the salad that way..  She then reiterated they would not be able to accomodate this in the future.  I don't think my request is so outlandish or exceptional.  I feel that you have lost a longstanding customer for inconsequential reasons.

iXxKxE82fU9LI6pntR_9gQ.review_text: Quality bar food, great location and unparalleled service.  In particular Allison and Sassie Cassie behind the bar are awesome.

aSaoshfd5HTdtQeoR8Xopw.review_text: This is probably the worst place to eat-the food is terrible and the service is even worse. To top it off- the price to quality ratio of the food is terrible.and they try to be fancy with a dress code but really not worth going

6TR___zkR9Oqz-e1_M2MeA.review_text: Even though this place is a chain, I had my birthday party here with my family and all the meats were amazing.  I especially loved the rib eye.  Probably one of the best ones I've had in a very long time.  Nice job!

L5rw1x2M5I3SOrZq_WAi3g.review_text: Oh Yelp reviewers, you failed me. Hillstone DOES have a corkage fee. For parties of two, one bottle is free. For parties greater than two, two bottles are free. After that, it's $25 a bottle... which is still cheaper than buying a bottle there.  I love this restaurant. I've been going to Bandera for years. All of the food is delicious. Last night I had the Veggie burger which was delicious! And huge! Come hungry :)

bdZLmvZg7ibzD0YbLfru6A.review_text: I was over here celebrating a friend's special occasion.  After looking at the menu, the Hawaiian Rib Eye got my attention, so I grabbed an order of that.  When it came out, it looked relatively simple with the fries, but after a couple of bites, I fell in love.    Sometimes, you just have to keep it simple.

qme1ToF2gOFG3H98Ed1p1A.review_text: Love coming to this place, meet some of my friends here every time I come back to SF around the holidays and it has become a tradition to look forward to.  I typically get the baby back ribs which are a good portion, fall off the bone and are delicious.  The fries on the side are nice and crispy and I usually sub out the coleslaw for some sort of veggie to feel a little better about myself afterwards. 4 years in a row now I've been counting on them and they always deliver.  The prime rib has also been a hit.  Oh, and bonus score, they have a wine list but you can also BYOB without a corkage fee! Love that.  Servers are friendly and it's a good intimate cozy ambiance.

w-Ij_ENzcFuYShn5FmoDvw.review_text: Very nice ambiance, excellent food and service. Good spot for a nice romantic dinner date, not too loud. Overall had a wonderful experience and definitely will be going back

BjWB8q975QeTMmFD07FU2w.review_text: Hillstones is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco.  My family and I have been long term customers of Hillstones, for the last decade or more.  Hands down, they have the best pork BBQ Ribs in all of the Bay Area!   Everything they serve is delicious. Especially the ribs.  The chicken sandwich is also to die for.  And can't forget their Nice Little House Salad.  The food is so fresh and awesome, I could go on forever.  They also have an amazing bar and cocktails. The ambiance is romantic and chic.  The service is 5 star as well!

qK3Alt3qFVPHi9O3AcqwmQ.review_text: Stopped in for lunch after going to Alcatraz and it is so perfect! wasn't very hungry, got a salad, soo delicious! Nice servers and ambiance. Would recommend this place to anybody :)

QjNjVF-ZdWr-P4zUzXwpVA.review_text: This is a very relaxing place to dine. I enjoyed it from the moment I walked in as the hostess greeted us warmly, sat us down at a quiet table by the window and left unrushed.   We needed a place to eat late night and one of us refuses to eat anything not stamped with a USDA stamp on the side of roasted rump. I ordered the pork ribs and they were so TENDER and flavorful! The fries were hot and thin and yes I'm one of those people who love ranch with fries. They gladly obliged and dinner went without a hitch.   I didn't order any alcohol but the tea was exceptional and our server was spectacular. Dinner was delivered right on cue, plates taken away when the main course was served and she checked back on us during appropriate moments throughout the meal. I've heard awesome things about their Prime Rib and it looked good but I'm a bbq sloppin' rib girl myself so I'll be back for their ribs again definitely.

WYCv0Q-QIKCSIo8IqOLOfw.review_text: Hawaiian Rib Eye! So good. Tastes like Korean BBQ.   Ice cream sundae was amazing. Must order for their fudge. It tastes like Hershey's Milk chocolate kisses with Macadamia nuts.

hgtKEqVXwG1fgTXe8Lvq3g.review_text: Okay, I'm going to admit, I'm a pescatarian, but I honestly LOVE this place. I know, I know, it's a steak house.... whatever. EVERYTHING on this menu (that I have tried) is good!  My personal favorite is the veggie burger! The portions here are pretty large and their appetizers are quite tasty also! They have like, the BEST artichoke dip, omg, it's so yummy! Their service here is also really good and the atmosphere isn't too bad either. Every table has a candle lit and there's even a fire place!   But overall, the BEST part about this place is their desserts. All I can say is, OH MY GAWD. You HAVE to try their sundae. It has the perfect amount of vanilla ice cream, with their warm, homemade chocolate sauce, all topped with these really special nuts (not like some cheap kinds you get at baskin robins) , homemade, fluffy whipped cream, and a cherry on top.  BEST SUNDAE EVER.

wuvWKoyLUk0qP1WNsJqn8A.review_text: I RARELY give 5 stars to anything, anyone, anybody, let alone an above-average, high-quality, upscale chain, but HOUSTON'S gets the nudge here, for several reasons, beyond the fact that they are an extraordinarily wonderful restaurant that "gets it", and quite possibly makes the "BEST $14 cheeseburger" in America. Even my Jewish Mother, who hated the movie, "ET" loved this burger, so if she likes it, then it must be ok.   First off, a personal note...I have passed this establishment many times and never went inside...didn't even consider it. But I do a radio bit at  a nearby building and one day decided to try it.  Fantastic service! Bravo!! Who cares if its a chain in la-de-da San Francisco?--They make good food and they're consistent!  And yes, the aformentioned "BEST damn $14 cheesebuger, which by virtue of fate, led me to meet my current favorite female friend. I hope she's more than just a friend but that's another story...  I DIGRESS.  Houston's is a really cool restaurant; pretty good food, great bar, nice, friendly people, fantastic atmosphere and yes, a "damn good burger". I joke about the "$14 burger", but try it--I swear you'll call/e-mail all your friends; even your enemies too. It's that good.  And who knows? Maybe you'll even meet your future wife/husband too! Just don't forget to tip your wait staff or Guido may be on the loose!

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: I love this place.  Reliable deliciousness comes with a price but its worth it - steak sandwich is amaaaazing, so is the loaded baked potato.

5DhIf6kNjIejyrIwl5CvUA.review_text: So, I struggled with the star value of this place. Let's take a no-holds-barred look at the ups and downs, shall we?  Ups first, 'cause the glass is always half full!: -by far, the funniest/best server I have had in recent memory. Extremely attentive, kept using delightful little catch phrases like 'cheers' and 'just a tidbit more?' - very entertaining -the roasted artichokes appetizer. for $12, probably the most expensive I've ever seen this app, albeit at a nice restaurant, but completely worth it. I would order 2 and call it a meal -ambience - bustling, boisterous, but not too loud. a hearty crackling fireplace behind us warmed the chilly SF night and made our table glow!  Downs :( -the food, besides the delicious artichokes, were completely lackluster and overpriced. Roasted chicken? yawn. Their signature cous cous? Served chilled, and with far too much greenery. French dip sandwich? Meh. All in all, not the great food that should come out next to such high prices.  -also, a pet peeve of mine is when you make a reservation at a restaurant but then have to sit and wait at the bar for 20+ minutes anyway. just ticks me off!

hHTtgBpV_VT5EaRoNC-78g.review_text: We used to go to Houston's all the time on the east coast, and now we are regulars at Hillstone (They still have a Houston's sign at the front door on the way out). If you want to be sure you are going to get great consistent food, and service that is by far the best at any restaurant I've been to, try this place out. Our usual server is Brittany and she is awesome.

hf6_tmqkRdBdwlXwUbKyow.review_text: Chicken salad and fries. Will come back when I am around the area...GOOD!

FsE3Ol4yUfJZZX8pGV0Rvw.review_text: Had such an amazing Monday night at Hillstone. I love how this place is not that upscale but the ambience is very chill and intimate. They play live jazz music every night. Good service and good food. Their portion are enormous, even desserts, so it's not that pricey after all. Some insanely good recommendation: House smoked salmon, Hawaiian Ribeye.

AHQFJf5m9YtD3hNvzFsOXg.review_text: Hawaiian Rib Eye *hearts* me! Rare + puhlease! Baked potato mmmmm Beef & Potatoes! Beef & Potatoes!!!!  5 STARS!!! because we brought 3 bottles and only killed 2, I mean we coulda popped the 3rd.. but let's not take advantage okay? = P  Decor is a rung higher than Houstons. Service was great, my glass was always full, maybe she did want to open the 3rd bottle for us. haaha. Thanks to our lovely waitress!  ohh yeah.. have the live band stay a bit longer, they left at 9:30.. and we wanted to make a request.for the Bday girl.  = (*

PLdNNcecADe4Mt9V9d9J4g.review_text: I know Marge who used to be the general manager. She would always tell me to stop by and come eat at the restaurant. I'd always say, "I will someday soon, I promise!" She was right. The food is delicious.  Unfortunately, the service was not friendly. Someone should have told our waitress and the chef who brought us our food that it takes more muscles to frown that it does to smile. The person who greeted us when we first walked into the restaurant said something about us showing up early and they usually don't see customers this early. We only arrived 5-10 minutes before they were supposed to open so I don't know what the big deal was.  Houston's, Hillstone, Stonehenge, whatever they want to call it is cool in my book as long as they keep pumping out good food.

PDw3_Ihahz8JLiBfcKxqvw.review_text: Amazing Grilled Artichokes Best Au Jus with the French Dip Sandwich Ribs are extremely tender and delicious The fish they serve is always fresh and perfectly cooked  Still one of my favorite, somewhat affordable restaurants in SF.

ksonr4xKjpmznXtf_rB2jg.review_text: I had a man-date the other night and he brought me to Houston's.   I had the Prime Rib as I did in my original review with the same results. This time I topped off dinner with the apple cobbler and vanilla ice cream. My request to add cheddar to my cobbler was met with skepticism but they complied.   The service was good on another busy night. They also had Hall Merlot. Yum!  No, I didn't put out when we got home. He says, "i like to do my own meat."  -- original review 04/15/2007 --- Hodie and I invited a few of our friends to the city for a night out last night. Jeremiah eats only a few things (7 total.) Elaine is a vegetarian. Hodie and I just like to eat.   We decided on Houston's on a recommendation. We found nearby parking with no problems even though Houston's was packed. We found a spot near the bar to wait for our table. I had a glass of Chard. The glass had what appeared to be dishwashing soap stuck to the outside. Eww.    A table finally opened up for us and we placed our order of drinks, appetizers, and dinner. I switched to a nice Merlot recommended by our waiteress. However, the Merlot came in a similar glass with dishwashing soap on the outside or it was the same glass.   There was nothing outstanding about the menu or the food. Our appetizer was the spinach dip. It was pretty good but the chips ran out before the dip and the salsa tasted like a jar of Safeway salsa. Bleh. Surprisingly, Jeremiah sampled this spinach dip.   For dinner I ordered the Prime Rib, medium. I expected pink but got mostly red. I'm not too picky but this was not what I ordered. It was still very good. (Don't mind me, I'm a Libra.)  Kudos for getting Jeremiah to try something out of his comfort zone and the excellent Merlot recommendation. Booo for the seemingly dirty glass and my meat being rare.   Props to the waiteress for being attentive and honest despite the large crowd. I did watch the cooks work hard when we got there. So I can appreciate the effort and overlook the doneness of the meat.   Overall experience is a 4 star.

ratN35B_ZpcCN1WGDtjbmA.review_text: This is a well-run restaurant with a focused menu concentrating on what they do best.  The service is professional and attentive.  At a recent lunch, the ahi seared steak salad was memorable, both in terms of taste and presentation.  The menu mentions that their beef is sourced from Allen Bros, which may not mean a lot to most people.  Beef lovers know that this is an incredible old-school source of aged prime beef based in Chicago, which gives you another indication that Hillstone is a serious food place.  Highly recommended.

RbLr7NZwc9JZcMfBwhDNMQ.review_text: Visiting San Fran and I have to say I'm impressed! This restaurant was amazing!  We ordered the rosemary focaccia appetizer, the hillstone burger, and the french dip. The focaccia was my favorite. Not too light, not too heavy with olives on the side.  French dip was "the best french dip I've ever had", according to my friend. The only reason this place didn't get 5 stars is because my burger was literally separated on the buns with toppings on one side, and the meat and cheese on the other. Toppings were so thick it was impossible to eat it like a normal burger and put it together. I had to cut everything up, but the flavor was delicious.  Lemondrop cocktail costs 14, heads up VERY expensive liquor.

7AUE-LJTlByV2TTQOTnLIA.review_text: I ordered the french dip w/ fries. I highly recommend it. The prime rib is tender, juicy and sliced paper-thin. It takes almost no effort to really chew, except when you bite into the roll. And with the accompanying hot dip it's a snap. I finished my meal in no time at all. The house salad is also good. Fresh, light and a perfect way to balance your meal. I normally don't order honey-mustard dressing, but this time I did and it was very good. Not too sweet or tangy.  The desserts are decadent! I tried the apple cobbler and key lime pie. The cobbler had huge chunks of halved roasted walnuts in a rich buttery caramel sauce. Make sure you spoon a bit of everything into one bite. The scoop of vanilla ice cream is a great contrast to the warm apples and crunchy walnuts. The key lime pie is the best I've eaten. It is not on their regular menu, but that nite it was a featured dessert. The absolutely best part was the graham cracker crust. It was chunky with bits of nuts, graham cracker and something else - perhaps crushed shortbread cookies? The pie filling was just tart enough and it was topped with homemade whipped cream! The portions are generous enough for several people to share.   The only cons I have are - very dim lighting, fries could have been hotter/crispier and not enough accommodations for large groups. (We had a group of ten that squeezed into a large booth) We would have split up but a few of the guests were from out of town, so we all wanted to catch up together.  All in all, I had a great time and will be back.

K6dc6n-cGb6F5Tl45EGpTw.review_text: We had reservation on NYE and our party of 5 arrived 30 mins early; nevertheless, they seated us promptly.  Great ambience with live music playing. I ordered the Prime Rib and was able to substitute baked potato for fries. We brought in 3 bottles of wine as there were no corkage fee. The waitress was attentive and made sure our glasses were always full. Prime rib was in good portion - ordered medium rare but came out rare (I had no problem with it).   Comparing with HoPR, it leaves me desiring for more such as the many different sides and salad that came standard with the entree at HoPR.   *Artichoke dip and chips appetizer - small but they do refill chips *Cream corn appetizer - good portion size maybe not worth the price. *Fudge ice cream dessert - good size to share

s5S0V3lJKPAgQorv-vxxLw.review_text: Love the Salmon appetizer, artichokes, and kale salad. Did I mention no corkage fee? Only reason is it's not a 5 star is due to costs. They keep raising their prices. Even with bringing our own wine, we end up spending $150 each time we go for two and can never figure out why. The house salad is great to try too. It has beets and some type of goat cheese. The tortilla soup is great when they have it.

Gj7xu7J-aouzUzjcDI8QvA.review_text: Spinach Dip  Artichokes  Veggie Burger  All 3 the best I've ever had.  Great service, and many, many great memories at this restaurant.   Love it, Houston's never lets me down

WkBSBfRRloP6QFH7O8I5dg.review_text: When it comes to chain restaurants...I have to say that this place is pretty much off the chain!  I like Max's and I like to think of Houston's as sort of a Max's on steroids.  Several items on the menu really hit the sweet spot just south of the esophagus, ie spinach dip, ribs (perfecto), burgers, hawaiian rib eye...and who could forget my all-time fave dish here...the thai steak & noodle salad!  Have the bar make you a lemonade stella shandy to wash everything down & you're all good.

4bn1cbpU7pTZcDq_T30Tpg.review_text: This restaurant experience is going to set the bar for all other restaurant experiences.  My family went there (5 of us) after Wicked.  Got there around 5:45pm.  Seated right away with a smile.  Everything we ordered was really excellent - especially the side salad (they had this sweet yellow beet that tasted like a really sweet fruit - and I HATE beets!)    The most impressive entree was my dad's pork chop.  Huge thick chop, cooked all the way through, but so tender and juicy in the middle.  A cooking miracle, how do they do that?!  The waiter was super nice, quick, and our food came really really fast.  Like Chinese-food fast. We ate, we ordered a dessert to share among the five of us - and the check came right when we finished.  In and out,and DELICIOUS food.  My mom commented that rarely are you served this quickly in an American restaurant, but it didn't feel rushed.  Just efficient - and great, really really great food.  I will take SF visitors here whenever I can.  Nice ambience (roaring fireplace)  We were looking for the Houston's - and apparently they changed their name?  I think the food got better too.  So all in all 4 thumbs up!

rLWW2l6oXyHrzv3TrbuBHg.review_text: This is a chain restaurant but I feel it is totally underrated. You rarely need a reservation, there is no corkage fee and it has great ambiance. The food is straight up American yumminess! Filet is incredible and the rib will bring you back for more. Not to mention, they have a great little Jazz ensemble. There are not many places with great food and live Music.

rhfj5M-yR9ng42HNNpj4Jg.review_text: Consistently great service and a delicious variety of food. I can't fault it.

MdB3Y7zXBq396fxv7cq6kA.review_text: The the sundae is still the best dessert in sf!

4W5mSphlwe6_enJP5uo5SA.review_text: This was my second time visiting Hillstone's. The last time I visited was two years ago for a birthday dinner. It was a GREAT meal, but the problem was that on a Friday night--there were just WAY too many damned kids in the restaurant. Nothing infuriates me more than fine dining gone awry by unattended children making noise and interrupting my experience. Thus, I have avoided this location for a while.  I had a good friend visiting SF for the weekend and he was staying near the Embarcadero. Not wanting to visit my usual dining haunts, I decided to try Hillstone's again. This time a Saturday night visit was in order. I made the reservation, crossed my fingers and hoped for the best.  I was pleasantly surprised by dining at 8:30 pm than my usual 6 or 6:30. By then I guess people have to have their brats in bed, or they aren't dining out. I didn't spy any errant children in the establishment. I really like their big booths and the privacy they convey. All restaurants in SF are loud, but at least in a booth you don't feel like you have to be a part of everyone's conversation.  Our dinner had a variety of servers, which made the level of attentiveness a bit odd. Our main guy seemed to be all about getting the initial food info taken down, but then he wasn't very good about seeing to our needs afterward. Thus, 4 instead of 5 stars. The rest of his "support" staff for the evening did a great job of making sure that everything we asked for we got. He was there for the beginning and the end. Whatever, the food was delicious and I'm not dining out to make a new friend in a waiter.  I had the rib-eye that was the special. My partner had the ribs and my friend had the pork chop. We all raved about our various dishes. Even their basic house salad was divine. I WANTED the wedge, but I know better when dessert is a goal. I simply can't stuff myself with too much salad. With that said, the house salad is not small. It WILL fill you up to a certain degree.  The mashed potatoes that came with the rib-eye were enough to make me eat them. I DO NOT like mashed potatoes as a rule, so when I WILL eat them, you have done something right. These tasted like a combination between mashed and potato salad--if that is possible. Truly delicious is all I have to say.  I had the brownie for dessert but I'm not sure how I much I remembered of that. I was in a food coma after the second bite. The ice cream on top tempered the chocolate goodness. The other two diners had the cobbler. Nothing was left so I guess you could say they liked it. I also didn't get bothered to share my dessert--FOR ONCE. That's when you know the rest of your table is happy with their choices. No one wants to share.  We had a few cups of coffee and basically shut the restaurant down. They didn't try to hurry us out. It's a great place to catch up after you've consumed your mountain of food.  This is why we journey to San Francisco to dine. The choices in other parts of the Bay Area just aren't on the same scale. They exist but the options are greatly reduced.

jNsPTMmg9EcqY7q2Q-Rm6A.review_text: Beautiful restaurant with a beautiful view. I visited Hillstone yesterday with a friend during the mid afternoon hours. We ordered the Ribs, Smoked Salmon, and a glass of Prosecco. The Smoked Salmon was delicious - I loved the particular smoky flavor that was of this dish. The ribs were slightly disappointing - for a $30 dish of ribs, I would have expected more. Yes, the meat was soft and did fall right off the bones, but the sauce was just so blah. It tasted just like A1 - nothing special or unique. It didn't taste crafted or specially made by a restaurant of this type of stature.   I'm sure the other dishes are good, but I would skip on the ribs here. Lastly, the service was also disappointing. Our server was slightly rude and just didn't seem to have the care in the world to be waiting on us. I strongly believe in excellent customer service, especially at a semi-upscale restaurant. Other than that, I really enjoyed dining in the restaurant. When I first walked in, it really reminded me of a restaurant I had dined at in Florida. Now thinking back, it was Houston's that I ate at, which is a part of the Hillstone restaurant group - neat!

Qq_fV6NFDnu7sKuScVS5Gg.review_text: I could go on and on about the food that I had at Houston's. The meat is fantastic. Really. It's amazing. I don't even like steak that much. I'll only order it if I know it's going to be worth it, and man, was this worth it. Everything just fell from the bone and was juicy and tender. And because there is no corkage fee, you can bring a fantastic bottle of wine to go with your meal and now pay a ridiculous amount of money for it.   I went here with a friend and my boyfriend. Amongst us we orders the Baby Back Ribs, Ribeye Steak and a Skirt Steak. They were all mouth watering. I think that the most tender piece of the Ribeye was the best part of all. It just dissolved when it hit my tongue. But it was all fantastic and I can't wait to go back.

s-MJRu1hhyM3MS5oVamvEQ.review_text: Great Dinner the ribs are out of the world and the service is impeccable I wish every resturant had service like this it really makes a difference

tlxpbxBH8tNdM5bUmt4iww.review_text: Oh Houston's! I really wanted to give you all 5 of your stars, but you had several downfalls that forced me take keep that one star.  But let's start with the good, shall we? -The ambiance: romantic and cozy. nice dim lighting with a pretty fireplace at one end. a live band came on for a little bit, but they made the place a bit too loud for my liking. -The food: Uh-mazing! I had the crab cakes.. the $32 crab cakes.. the most expensive two crab cakes, cole slaw, and fries I've seen/had in my life. They were perfect, though. Not too heavily breaded and I could taste the crab meat so well. The sauce was not too rich, either. Someone else in my group reported the pork chops were extremely good. Our vegetarian diner reported the vegetable plate was awesome.  -Service: They were attentive and quick with the food. Two thumbs up. -Desert: Two of my friends and I ordered all three deserts on the menu so we got to sample the brownie, sundae, and cobbler. My favorite was the brownie, but they were all delish! -No corkage fee? I wasn't sure because someone in my party did bring wine and I failed to ask, but according to another reviewer there is no corkage fee. That's a definite plus!  And now for the bad: -We had a large party of 9 total. We tried to call ahead for reservations. Initially (meaning a week prior to the event) we were told reservations could be made. When it was a day or so before, we were denied reservations. -So we figure what the hey we'll just go and wait. We arrived at 6:45 (possibly earlier than that) and were not seated until 8 pm - mind you this was a Wednesday night! We ended up splitting the group into two tables so we could get our tables faster. -On the same note, good for groups? I think not. They have a note somewhere that they split up groups of 7 or more. So in my opinion, this place isn't so good for groups. They way they are set up is better suited for groups up to 5 or dates of 2.

VelO71GL9TL1347hq44y5Q.review_text: I absolutely loved my prime rib, it was charred beautifully, crusty salt on the edges and perfectly cook to med-rare inside.  Hubby on the other hand, appreciated his Rib Eye steak, but said it wasn't flavorful - although it's better than some other places who have claimed to be great.  Yes, watched it on "Check Please Bay Area", but the food is decent, but reservations are a must and parking can be challenging.

ArEOjGosnXWsFMvV6evHjw.review_text: Why exactly has it taken me since the conception of Yelp! to write a review on Houstons? After all, it IS one of my favorite places to frequent in San Francisco; aside from BIX it's one of those places I tend to 'default' to when eating in the city.   Is it the ambiance? After all, dining on steak covered in a peppercorn sauce while sipping on a really nice glass of pinot, surrounded by rich mahogony; is very nice. I'll even go out on a limb and say it brings a sense of 'fabulousness'.  Is it the food? Filet covered in any sauce is my favorite. Theirs happens to be VERY good. Desserts are 'ok'...but I usually like to get those at a separate venue afterwards anyway.   The location maybe? LOVE the embarcadero. And eating outside on a nice summer evening; PERFECT!  The answer readers: all of the above.  5 stars and a big recommendation to you if you have company coming to town.

jXIBRG5g1sTziRDzIfjAHw.review_text: The food is great; servers are nice and since there's nothing to eat in that area really unless you want to get stuck on one of the piers with the tourists, this is a nice spot, but I removed 2 stars................WHY? We asked for bread and a plate of warm sliced bread was delivered. We ate and then we got the receipt. We got charged $4 for the bread. Here's the thing: they want to charge extra for the bread, that's fine but please let us know that there would be an extra charge of $4 so that there are no surprises.

psvC7bj9A5Sn0NU3QVvE8Q.review_text: This place will always be Houston's in my mind.  I'm not sure what the whole story about the name change was but the name changed to Hillstone.  We made reservations for 7:30pm on New Year's day.  Parking in this area was street parking or wherever you could find an available spot to walk over.  The whole restaurant had a dim interior which made this place feel it would be a good date spot.  We were seated right away after we told them we had a reservation.  This place was pretty busy and I doubt it was because of the day (though it could be).   I looked at their menu online which was similar, if not the same, to the menu in the restaurant.   We ordered Roasted Prime Rib ($37), Hawaiian Rib-Eye ($36), Barbecue Pork Ribs ($36), Caesar Salad ($12), and Rosemary Foccacia ($4).  We were hungry so that was why we ordered so much. Lol I don't think we waited long before one of our orders came out.  I will only comment on the food I tried which was everything but the Caesar Salad.   The Rosemary Foccacia was good and the bread was very soft.  Our waitress said all of that bread was baked daily.  While I didn't eat any of the Caesar Salad, I thought it looked like it was enough for one person's appetizer because it wasn't big enough for a meal; however, you wouldn't order a Caesar Salad from a place like a steakhouse like Hillstone.  That was just what I thought.  The Hawaiian Rib-Eye was delicious and I would recommend it to anybody having trouble deciding what to order.  The Roasted Prime Rib was good especially when dipped in their sauce.  The Barbecue Pork Ribs tasted similar to what they did the last time I was here.  The meat pretty much fell off the bone and the BBQ sauce was not bad but added some flavor to the ribs.   Hillstone was great for dates and the food was delicious.  I'll be back whenever I'm in the area.

hbcjX4_D4KIfonNnwrH-cg.review_text: I been going to this place since 2007 & this place never fails. Great service, very clean place & nice people around you!  -  Appetizer: Spinach Artichoke Dip w/ Salsa -  Entree: Prime Rib w/ French Fries  -  Dessert: Ice Cream w/ Choc Syrup

tcXbDFbFKrEA3Bks_zAm0Q.review_text: I liked this place. Nice big comfy booths, outdoor seating options. Good music. I never order French dips but it was really, really good. The homemade bread was perfect, the meat was a big portion and tender and flavorful without fat, (I was told their beef comes from Allen Brothers which is good just no organic, grass fed or free range meat unfortunately), the horseradish on the side was so good- I didn't even use the au jus because the sandwich was just THAT good. (The French fries are on the skinny side which I prefer)! I like the kale salad too but ask for the dressing on the side if you prefer a lighter coating of dressing- they are too generous with the dressing when you have them put it on. I like the warm spinach dip but the salsa that comes with it was not good. The shrimp cocktail appetizer is huge and filling. There were 5 HUGE I mean HUGE shrimp -even large for a prawn. Meaty, not fishy, served with a mayo based sauce and a cocktail sauce. Everything we tried was very good and service was excellent.

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: Something for everyone:  - Carnivores will rave about the marinated and then grilled rib-eye.  - Pescetarians will dig the ahi tuni and mango salad. - Vegetarians will say the house veggie burger is one of the best ever.   Fortunately I swing all three ways, as did my two lunch companions, and we shared every delicious bite. Not cheap, but you won't mind, especially if someone else is footing the bill (I scored on this one).  P.S. Everyone will love the honey glazed carrots and steamed broccoli with a dusting of cheese sides.

Xj0O2l0bp633ebmG468aZw.review_text: I sort of wanted to not like it because it's a chain, but they have this dog-gone thing down. The food is really good. Service great. Ambiance cozy and nice - awesome jazz in the background. All in all, really enjoyable. Sorry, San Francisco, for legitimately liking a chain. Oh the kale salad was particularly KA.  -1 point for being a bit overpriced.

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: 2 1/2 stars.  Really good French dip.  It is like a Houstons, but they jacked up the prices! And why? No lunch menu, thus their prices for lunch are totally ridiculous. WTF? No lunch specials?  I might come back here for a steak.. similar prices for those at Alfreds, maybe Ruth Chris, Etc.

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: $11 for a martini?! Really?!   Also, I liked the name Houston's much better. Hillstone sounds like the name of some cheesy hotel that's trying to sound fancy but is really no better than Motel 6.   Veggie burg was still awesome, though.

bzPAvndfmgUA4Q0rcwsecA.review_text: I went to Hillstone specifically for the ribs. My bf and I have been on the hunt for the perfect rack of ribs. We have had a couple of expensive disappointments, but this place was not! After reading the reviews I knew that this would be the place to win his heart. The ribs fell right off the bone and tasted delicious. The sauce on it wasn't too spicy (which is a problem for the bf at some places). The mashed potatoes and cole slaw that came with the ribs were equally good, and we don't really like cole slaw either. I ordered the french dip, very meaty and very filling, it was good. The service was fast and courteous and they thought of things that we needed before we asked (like a warm wet towel to wipe hands from the ribs).  My only issue I had was that I had made a reservation for 7pm and I wasn't seated until about 7:30-7:45ish. Also, I wish they had a bike rack closer to the restaurant, we had to lock our bikes to a tree.

xARauVaUGPQZ-LipZQiEfA.review_text: A packed restaurant = good food  We had reservations so we skipped the long wait and got seated within 5 minutes. The place is loud and the waitress had a hard time hearing me but her service was impeccable.   For starters, we had the Mexican style chicken soup. Very tasty and all the vegetables (zucchini, tomatoes, avocado and beans) were all fresh and added later so it was still crunchy.   For my entree, i got the Roasted Prime Rib Bone-In. The thing was massive! Much bigger than House of Prime Rib and i'm not sure if they offer with the bone-in but it was succulent, juicy and cooked just right! They also give you a whole cup of the au jues sauce to be added to your own liking. It comes with a loaded baked potato compliments the prime rib.  Aftermath: Too full for dessert and wobbled home a happy camper.

byUZpVzun-vVMMCFMXvdXQ.review_text: It's too close to my apartment! Seriously, in 5 to 10 I'm there and simply cannot have portions that size for dinner very often.   So I went with 2 friends recently and had a good experience. We started with the artichoke dip which is accompanied by sour cream and salsa. Like my girl Suzy C said, the salsa tasted like canned Pace Picante, but the dip is quite good. Suzy, you are kind of a snob...lol!  The NY Strip was excellent and I went with the brussel sprouts instead of potatoes. Good choice in my opinion as I'd like to be able to move after eating. One of my friends let me try the ribs and I loved 'em! During the meal I started with a glass of Pinot Noir followed by a glass of a blend they had which was a Zin/Cab/Cab Franc and liked them both. Unfortunately, like many places in town, no real red wine glasses to help the wine find itself. Such a bummer when they get everything else right and serve you with these amateur glasses. Oh well. I guess I'm a snob too Suzy!  Overall, good experience. Very cool server, great and generous portions, and some decent wine to take it down with. I'll be back.  Hey, did I read there is no corkage fee?

LksuiNKspbDOZYNOkDx1bA.review_text: Everytime I walk into Houstons, I think of how great a date place it is. Although I've only dined there with big groups, the dimly lit seating area, live jazz band, and fireplace with couch seating in the back corner all scream one thing: first date place!   I recommend calling in advance for a reservation but remember that they don't take any reservations for over 4 people. Make sure to ask for a booth and bring a favorite bottle of wine (or two or three) to take advantage of their no corkage fee policy.   My hands-down favorite dish there is the chicken sandwich. It isn't the fanciest item on the menu to order but I promise you will not be disappointed. The entree portions are substantial and come with a side of vegetables or some starch. I recommend the baked potato. I've ordered the seasonal vegetable before and its either a hit or miss.   Other favorites are the spinach and artichoke dip, the french dip sandwich and the tuna tartare salad. I've ordered dessert twice before and although they were tasty, I don't recall them being that memorable.   Go eat at Houstons, you won't be disappointed!

MRfRgHHlgPib7Inq2d4umA.review_text: Went there for dinner tonight after a nice, freezing SFO day sailing in choppy waters..  Service was choppy - our server kept disappearing. But the other waxy blondes responded when we called them. Meats were fresh, but there was a wire (yes, a wire!!) in my husband's burger. The manager immediately switched out his burger and took it off our charge.  My roast chicken sandwich was exquisite and the brownie desert was fantastic. It turned out the wire was from the grill baster The only reason I'm giving this place 3-stars is because depending on who you are, their service varies. They took care of us because, of course it was a potential liability issue.  However, the meats were really good, and I guess worth the $16 per person prices.

F5rPOOrJQBKuEA7RtuLnWg.review_text: Houston's (formerly known as) is a favorite of mine for many years even back in NJ and NYC. So, I was psyched to find out there's one here in SF. The layout of the restaurant is nice but I was a bit disappointed to find that they didn't have the club sandwich at this location. Albeit, Hillstone is known to have slight variations of their menu from location to location. The ribs were spot on, as expected.  And as always, I ordered the spinach dip and cheese toast which, while they might not be original, are worthy Houston signatures.  While the attire is "casual", the atmosphere is slightly more upscale than casual.

S34qI4Jvdn-Nn5rfuKzgYw.review_text: This is solidly, undoubtedly, my favorite chain restaurant.  A.  The swanky old school decor is classic, making me think that I was a cool cat among Sinatra and the likes. B.  Live Jazz C.  Super friendly waitstaff--- you know they are centrally trained and held to high corporate standards, unlike some chichi eateries with their too cool for school servers who roll their eyes at you for asking for bread. D.   BYOW, no corkage. E.  The food is delicious.  Their prime rib is better than House of Prime Rib.  Yup I have said it, and it's been agreed upon time after time.  Last night we shared a salad and soup as the appetizer: Deliciously well tossed greens with beet and cherry tomatoes, and a delicious French onion soup.    F. Friendly price tags.  Nothing beats a nice meal at Hillstone.

HSvPwM9glqRFbbFfQuvDkw.review_text: Best artichokes!  Grilled with live oak chips! Has Colossal Shrimp so good. Recommend their famous French dip too...made with their freshly baked bread!

elMekVOtLXd4yVFf5P33Ag.review_text: Very good from salad to steak.

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: Food = fabulous.  Comfort food but more upscale.    Drinks = yummy lemondrops and other fufu drinks.  Great wine list too.  Service = great.  They're always so friendly and quick!  View = nice.  Decor = modern, but home-y.   Prices = pricey.  So we go here for special occasions only!  Parking = street.  There are garages around here, but it is tourist-y.

WZnC2ox0faAWiUnVvwhhww.review_text: I've been wanting to come here since it is known for their steak and service. When I joined my new company and it was down the street from here, I was happy that it'd be within a stone's throw.   Came here for lunch with my coworkers as a welcome lunch. I splurged on behalf of the company and got the Ribeye Steak & Frites. And I LOOOVE ribeye... but I was disappointed slightly with Hillstone.   First off, the steak was thin and overcooked. It was tasty with the marinade on it but that's about all that it had going. It also wasn't very big, which is fine, but not for the price. It came with shoestring fries which were tasty. But bleh for around $40 for LUNCH, it was very lacking and disappointing, even though it was a free lunch on my company. I'm so glad I didn't come on my own and shell out the $40 for something that was lacking.   The highlight was coffee and offering it in a to-go cup so we walked back with it. Their coffee was very flavorful and delicious. Kind of sad that that was my highlight of the meal.   I would hope this place is better for dinner, but lunch wasn't very exciting and my coworker's meals didn't look much better.

PP7pUJj_b6WHx1GgQnGpKA.review_text: I love this place. I used to work in the area and would come by for lunch or happy hour. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Food and drinks are very tasty. I used to order the fully loaded baked potato for lunch which was only $5 and it came with all the fixings. The roasted Brussels sprouts there are also aaaaaaammmaazing!!' The grilled artichoke is by far my favorite... Yea the steak is great but I loooove those vegetable dishes Beautiful decor and great for happy hour and a night out. If I were in the area a lot more, I def would frequent it a bit more.

Ji2YvtEOP5JFfXuRC9D3jQ.review_text: so freaking good!! Ruben sandwich is to die for!!!

Ir66rDQkPIFibQSh4VnnZQ.review_text: I am never disappointed in this place. It is consistent. The food is always very good (I love the veggie burger).. The wine list is good and the cocktails are always fresh and delicious! The staff is very friendly and efficient. We never wait long for a table, but if there is a wait, the bar is a great place to hang out. The patio is awesome on a hot day.

wtp71-5l5fR206Z0ZWYoKA.review_text: Really nice special cocktail and burger for a special occasion with my honey. Great service, great food and wine, cocktails, a must-go.  Great burger, appies, and drinks.

eAGTnGbJB6htV_FavFDBCg.review_text: It's all comfort food. We have so many favorites from the ribs, to the sashimi salad, the French dip, the omelette, but this was the first time we were with someone who wanted the veggie burger. It will not disappoint - and for healthier reasons, I will venture to choose the veggie over their perfect cheeseburger. The flavor is wildly delicious for having no meat, but has fresh vegetables.

XuO2YQud6sbX0iUxQSfGig.review_text: The food was amazing. We had the French dip and the ribs. Hands down best French dip I have ever had.. Now onto the service, it could be that we looked like total tourists who just got off the Alcatraz tour (which we did :) ) we got shoved in the back away from all the more well dressed people. Our waitress never came an asked if we were okay or how our food was. We only saw her when she dropped off our food and check. So you might want to look a little more presentable when you come here lol. The food was absolutely amazing though!!!!

Mu0iyLV3BwzpuJBfP4LBfQ.review_text: We probably hit a bad night, dunno. Houston's filet used to be the best steak in SF. Four steaks ordered at our table the other night, all over cooked. A few were  sent back and the kitchen replaced each with steaks cooked more carefully. But even when grilled correctly, we all agreed the filet themselves were flavorless. So on top of the grilling faux pas, it seems the grade of the filet has dropped off significantly. And on top of the that, the price has soared! The $34 filet went up to $45! Kind of drag to pay more for less. Would have given 3 stars, since that better reflected the quality. But $45? Really. Wow.

ZXrbak6duP4opU2laz3z3g.review_text: Hillstone restaurants always delivery quality ingredients, and are consistent when it comes to food and service. I really like this restaurant collection, and have been to several locations. One standout is the Embarcadero (San Fran) location. It offers a nice option away from some of the crazy tourist trap places on the more northern piers. There is also a lovely outdoor seating area framed with rosemary bushes - combine that with the bay breeze on a sunny day, and it's one of the best choices in the area.   My hometown, and favorite, Hillstone is Coral Gables. I'm a regular, for good reason. Hey have the best mojo to in town, and a fantastic sushi bar. The food and service is consistent, and consistently on point. The few times I've had a mediocre experience, they've immediately made it right. Great restaurant management shows.

NYKYWXl5F3C2DCseZmW_0w.review_text: Horrible service, over priced food, a complete disaster!  I wanted to treat my daughter and her friend to a nice classy lunch and a day in the City.  Instead we were promptly seated and ignored.  The restaurant was only 3/4 full on a Friday lunch time.  No wait to be seated and plenty of empty tables around us.  Even though we were seated in the front of the house you would have thought we were on the moon.  Took our server 15 minutes to bring us our first round of drinks.  Two salads and a sandwich took 45 minutes to arrive.    Was on the verge of walking out but thought it would be worth the wait.  It wasn't.  When the food finally arrived it was a complete disappointment.  Caesar salad that looked like something you can get at any sandwich shop, ahi tuna salad with the fish smelling "funky", my sandwich was decent but didn't blow back my hair for over $20.  Incredibly poor.  Run away and save yourself the disappointment!

LBpyhtXRflK7kKFW5Uij1g.review_text: Ambience and crowd aren't typical SF.  The food was not seasoned well.  Place seems like a Cheesecake Factory without the cheesecake or the big menu.

rp9my_uNCGKYgAh4FN29Pg.review_text: This place gets high marks for consistency. I love than when you dine at Hillstone (Houston's) or Gulfstream, you can count on huge portions and delicious food.  They pretty much serve expensive comfort food but don't let the prices deter you because you are paying for a tasty meal in a cozy setting with live jazz music if you are there for dinner.    I highly recommend this place if you are celebrating something special, or want to treat yourself to a good meal. The ambiance is warm and inviting and the staff is cheerful.

nNd1B29J81jXEpNs3qUtVg.review_text: This place is one of my top 5 go to dots in the city and probably rates the highest in ambiance. The staff has always been professional, clean cut and kind. The food is always consistent. I know the menu front and back. I always get the prime rib, the Asian steak salad or the prime dip. For apps I never miss out on the artichokes. They will get you on the cocktails so beware. Once I ordered an "Irish coffee" with no specification on the liquor and they charged me $15 something. ($15.25 maybe) seriously??? Luckily for them everything else makes up for it because that's some highway robbery. I still kick myself for not second asking about that...  Oh and the piano jazz band is quite romantic.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: I hate chain restaurants but I LOVE Hillstone!!! Until this past weekend, it's been over 2 years since I've last been to Hillstone (formerly Housten's) and it's just as good as I remembered it to be, perhaps even better!  I'm not a fan of chain restaurants because I see most as glorified processed food, but Hillstone is certainly an exception; they use fresh, high-quality ingredients. Hillstone is a well-oiled machine, the food and service is consistently top notch and I've never been disappointed, so for this I have to award them with 5 STARS! On Saturday, 7.30.11, my friend and I came to Hillstone for dinner at 8:15 PM (this was my fourth time). It took about 10 minutes for us to be seated with reservations so we grabbed a drink at the bar first. We both got a Goose Tonic which was stiff, but for $12 each + tax? That's a bit pricey and more expensive than most clubs in SF. They offer NO corkage fee, so definitely take advantage of that instead! F O O D There 3 best things on the menu are the BBQ Pork Ribs, Hawaiian Rib Eye and Roasted Prime Rib. Order one of these and you will NOT be disappointed. *pinky swear* *SPINACH & ARTICHOKE DIP ($12): 4.5 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/_D1E… Hillstone has one of the best spinach and artichoke dips, if not the best in the city! The dip is filled with spinach and artichoke chunks that's tender but still has a bite to it. I like that the dip is creamy but not overly creamy so you can really taste the freshness of the veggies. The warm tortilla chips have a nice hearty crunch and the accompanying salsa gives it a fresh brightness while the sour cream gives it a nice layer of creamy tanginess. *ROASTED PRIME RIB w/ a Loaded Potato ($30): 4.5 STARS yelp.com/biz_photos/_D1E… The huge slab of prime rib was roasted to perfection and my rare cut was pink throughout just the way I like it (I've since been ordering my meat "rare" since many places tend to overcook my meat when I request "medium rare"). It was so soft that it cut like butter and with minimal effort. With a touch of au jus, I was in prime rib HEAVEN! Each bite was full of rich beefy flavor that literally melted in my mouth. The prime rib here gives House of Prime Rib a run for their money; it's seriously THAT good! The loaded potato was topped with butter, sour cream, cheese, real bacon bits and scallion. I'm not much of a baked potato person but this "loaded" potato was sinfully good. The potato was soft, tender and fluffy and the combination of the butter, sour cream and cheese added a rich decadence with the bacon giving it a smoky porkyness. It's definitely not for the faint of heart. My friend ordered the Hawaiian Rib Eye and it was the BEST rib eye I've ever tasted. It was uber tender and had the perfect balance of savory sweetness. It was like eating Korean kalbi in a steak form; I'm definitely getting this next time! S E R V I C E IMPECCABLE! The entire Hillstone staff is well-seasoned professionals which is evident in their customer interactions. Our waitress was very friendly, courteous and attentive without being intrusive. Even in a packed restaurant, our food came out quickly and we were in/out in a little over an hour. A M B I A N C E / D E C O R Rich woods, candle lights and the pianist created a classy yet casual feel which is perfect for dates and small parties. The outdoor patio is perfect for those warm summer nights which unfortunately seem to be a rarity these days. Even when busy, noise level is usually at a medium and conversation is easily made without having to shout across the room. P A R K I N G Easy street parking. Please note, meters are in effect till 11 PM. As a foodie who is always on a prowl for new restaurants to go to, I rarely go back to the same restaurant twice. However, Hillstone is not your cookie-cutter chain restaurant, so I plan on coming back again and AGAIN...

OfWGzwXQLFfQCw7s3VRhCQ.review_text: I Had a problem but I gotta tell you it was resolved ASAP with the manager she was wonderful and kind. Thank you for that, we will be back again thank you for getting back to me.The Lemon drops are to die for, and the food is amazing! try the french dip it melts in your mouth! Christine

TBEwOVvbCReLB7BZYHE9Pg.review_text: This our go-to place.  I love their grilled artichokes.  The service is always excellent, and the food is consistently good. Their corkage policy keeps us coming back as well.  We went to Hillstone in NYC, and it didn't hold a candle to the SF location. We had our first date here... ate here the evening of our engagement, and expect to celebrate here for years to come!!

Ud-sKWKetTaxkdaXcGWrOg.review_text: Service was great, but the food tasted mediocre and was over priced.

NFQkgj8AJtCZW_In48f3cw.review_text: *3.5 stars, but I'm bumping it up*  I like the lighting - it set the mood nicely.  There was a jazz band playing and the music wasn't so loud that I couldn't hear any conversation.  We started out with the spinach artichoke dip that was widely recommended by Yelpers.  It came with warm chips, sour cream (which I don't understand) and what tasted like salsa from a jar.  I was not impressed.  Moving on!  Jeff ordered the prime rib, rare.  Yuck, I know, but what am I gonna do?  I ordered (with Roy's recommendation) the Hawaiian Rib Eye.  Both steak dishes came with a baked potato.... and that's it.  No veggies or anything green.  That disappointed me.  The plate looks naked with just a piece of meat and a potato on it, right?  No dessert because I wanted some tiramisu, but I have to go italian to get that.  I don't know if I'll be back, but our waitress was extremely nice and helpful, the food came out pretty quickly, and best of all to all you winos - NO CORKAGE FEE.  That's a value in itself.  2 people, an appetizer, two steak dinners and a beer - $105 after tax and tip.

jVhlurk38CXFynoRfBmwZw.review_text: Dude, if you want the best Hawaiian marinated ribeye this side of the world, go here! Great Kale salad too:)

UDkX3Vmm8wYcFDDxc9uWwg.review_text: We came here for dinner after trying to find parking in North Beach for an hour. Yes, one full hour. Parking here was easy compared to the rest of San Francisco.   The atmosphere at Houston's was nice, and the food was decent. We sat at a table outside because it was really warm that day. Our waitress was very attentive and kept refilling our water glasses and asking if we needed anything.   What made it a five star experience was this--two of my friends ordered their steaks medium rare and when they came out they looked like they were well done. We told the waitress, and she took the steaks back and brought us some bread to eat while we were waiting. The manager came out and apologized, and told us that the entrees would be comped.   Free food AND good service? Definitely five stars.

uhppLSN0QXm9knX2uZteTg.review_text: Food and atmosphere are terrific. Servers are lovely. Hostesses always have an attitude. If my office wasn't reimbursing me, I'd never go here because of the prices. A typical lunch: 2 salads + 2 ice teas + 1 grilled artichoke to share = $80.

EcFUfOvZLQSgS-KHWKJSUg.review_text: Absolutely the best French Dip I've ever had before.  The artichoke dip was also really good, perfect spot to go before taking the boat over to the tour of Alcatraz.  Highly, highly recommended.

PS0uGpc0Cwx40hMk6zolag.review_text: it's been 5 years since our last visit. and the food is still as wonderful!  we had :  spinach dip smoked salmon thai salad prime rib with loaded baked potato hawaiian rib eye with shoe string fries  the hawaiian rib eye was delish! the prime rib was slightly too salty. somehow i remember the prime rib coming with the bone-in. or was it something else? hm. but it was still good, nonetheless.  the restaurant was busy - the server we had didn't have much time to take a pic for us. after snapping 1 pic, the server walked away. i guess 1 pic is better than nothing.

pAS8E1tONhFA5cDidtMaBA.review_text: This restaurant just got better.  I just love the decor, ambiance, soft but good lighting, furniture, all this before the food even. Live jazz on Tuesday evening 2/5/13, and NO Valencia St. Posers! The food is awesome. I love a good steak and the NY I had last night was perfection! It simply melted in my mouth. Hillstone is not cheap, But it is just perfect. There's no pretentious "foodie" aura there, the servings are a reasonable size, and the service is simply stellar. Compared to Delfina, which is more expensive, Hillstone kicks a**! When the server overheard me mentioning my dog, she later brought out two uneaten meaty ribs for him. Now thats a way to impress me! The entire bill for four of us with wine was over $400. I just cannot wait to go back there again.

LhdIGJbwAgfslLaruuQq3A.review_text: 11:19 Rebecca haters gonna hate, but i love houston's  11:20 Alexis I've never been, but I've definitely always wanted to go  11:20 Rebecca when you go, get the spinach dip it's not on the menu  11:20 Alexis seeecretsssssssssss love  11:20 Rebecca it's the reason i go  11:21 Alexis didn't they change the name of the one in SF it's like the same place, but a different name like Taylor's is now gotts  11:21 Rebecca right  11:21 Alexis oh fucker they are spendy, right?  11:21 Rebecca a little, yeah i don't get drinks when i go i get the spinach dip and the grilled chicken salad winner every time  11:22 Alexis mmmmm ok good tips you should write a review just copy and paste this thread

jisQEtwfrOKBmssWoiXljg.review_text: This place looks really nice inside. One can easily be fooled and think it's an expensive restaurant, when it's pretty reasonable (not cheap, reasonable :))  I love their cheeseburgers here ($16, comes with fries). There are so many other options on their menu, but their cheeseburgers are just so good, I get it every time. If you get it medium rare, the meat is so soft, tender and juicy. With the toasted bun and everything else, oh it's just heavenly. I'm a simple gal. If one thing makes me happy, I'll stick with it. It has never failed me.  If you're in the mood for dessert, get the hot fudge sundae. The hot fudge comes on the side and you can pour as little (or as much) as you want with each bite. It's a fun dessert! Also comes with roast sugar pecans. Alot of calories? Probably, but worth every bite :) If you're feeling guilty, share!

dBrFv8iwboVNxE5hX74EVQ.review_text: We heard the steaks at Houston's are delish.  And because I can never pass up a golden opportunity to try a truly fabulous steak, we went.    Not dissappointed at all.  The steaks were both fabulous- he ordered the hawaiian ribeye and i ordered the center cut filet.  Both were grilled to perfection.  We also ordered the Artichoke dip appetizer, which strangely comes with "sides" of salsa (not fresh- think *Pace Picante*...yech) and sour cream.  The artichoke dip was really good.  We both ordered salads as well.  I had the Traditional (lettuce, bacon bits, egg, ranch) and he ordered the House (vinagrette with goat cheese, nuts, and fruit pieces).  The house was much better and preferrable to the Traditional.  Our steaks came with big baked potatoes with the works- butter, sour cream, chives, bacon bits.  We couldn't finish all of our plates but it was yummy!  Another oddity- the host asked my boyfriend to remove his newsboy cap (we were both dressed business-casual, definitely not t-shirts and jeans status) but yet there was a guy in a t-shirt wearing a dirty Cal baseball hat no further than 2 tables away from us.  What's up with that?  The atmosphere is chic (borderline snobby for what it is).  The food is really good- expect to pay at least $100 for a party of two.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: I promise it is not on purpose I choose places because of their reeeally reeeally cool bar... But I have to say, Houston, I love this bar!  Not only is the food fantastic, but eating dinner at the bar isn't wrong here. This is a great place to casually post up at the bar and have a fabulous dinner.
