From the phenomenal bar you will appreciate great views of the front door (for people watching), flat screen tv (for a great game), and good looking bar tenders( I prefer a hot  male, but not going to lie the girls are cute). There always seem to be good company close by or walking in. A place you know where to find your friends at.   Enjoy the Ahi Salad with a glass of white wine! I forgot the name of my favorite, but it is something --- vine.  Cheers!

rBRuie_HNzxCkMDF-ooRog.review_text: This review is purely on how the cost jacked up (everything else about what I love of Hillstone hasn't changed).  Perhaps I didn't notice it before when I'm on a date... but seriously, the baby back ribs were $29 not too long ago.  Now it's $36.  Well I'll make sure I suggest another place when it's a girls night... or make sure I just order the Kale salad:)

k0ma9kBYhmyrSusJP9RWNg.review_text: Every time I passed Houston's, I'd think: gotta try. So one fine Sunday, I did :)  I can't say I was blown away by the food, but I certainly enjoyed it and left very very full. Portions are huge and reasonably priced. My baked potato rocked my socks off.  Service was all right and the décor was cute but nothing special. All in all, Houston's is pretty average. I'd come again, but not for awhile.

xpRAjmgL-pIcIY_9iOpcQw.review_text: With the notable exception of In-N-Out, I don't eat at chain restaurants.  Really, I don't.  Life's too short.  I first discovered a Houston's in Manhattan Beach way back in the early 90s and fell in love with the spinach artichoke cheesy goodness.  I ate there quite a bit, and also frequented the Scottsdale Houston's  But I've been in San Francisco for 12 years and never came to this one.  I felt like it would be akin to going to an Olive Garden in North Beach ya know?  But my snobbishness has done me a disservice.  I'm now living across the street from this place and have been going fairly frequently, and you know what?  It's good.  Like really pretty damn good.  Great bartenders, very serviceable wine list and a solid menu...all of which can be served at the bar.  I've got a friend who's like 96 pounds, soaking wet, holding a brick, and even she gets fired up over the slab of ribs!  Sunday nights it gets a hopping crowd...surprisingly of people I know...and perhaps more surprisingly many of whom don't think I'm a complete ass.  It's also made my short list of 3rd to 4th date locations (I did mention it's across from my house right?)  So I'll keep them at 4 stars.  They got an extra one for allowing Sonny on the patio, but I took it away because they got snippety at a friend of mine for putting her feet up on a chair.  P.S. - As Phil H. just reminded me, Houston's has no corkage fee, which would be nice if I could find a woman worth dipping into my cellar for.

N3NwFoMjMNAIcixYY7HM0g.review_text: A big fan of Hillstone restaurants. The wife loves the Houston's in Pasadena where the French Dip sandwich is her all time fave - the San Francisco Hillstone doesn't disappoint! Same great menu, same great service with one exception. The Pasadena restaurant refreshes my wife's martini with a chilled glass.

w5hZ8Tth9FS6GSE5ZZ6VOg.review_text: When a restaurant elevates your perspective of what a classical dining experience needs to be, this obviously warrants a 5 star rating.  Hillstone has proven to me its reliability in quality food and service, and above all, its character.  Before I talk about the technical details (food quality and ambiance), I feel that I should spend a few moments praising the staff, who have given my friends and me the "warm and fuzzies."  All of the waiters who we've encountered whenever we visit are humble, honest, prompt, and graceful in their interactions with us.  For instance, one of our steaks had a touch too much char (though the texture was absolutely fantastic otherwise, just the flavor profile was a bit compromised by the cooking technique), and the waiter immediately handled the replacement and completely wiped off that order from our bill with a genuine smile.  This is only one example of how Hillstone is serious about delighting the customer, though it is already impressive and seldom makes missteps, and I think other restaurants and even other American businesses can take a few tips from.    You can come to Hillstone with some friends or business partners expecting to have a classy yet fun time eating an impeccable meal.  I like to describe Hillstone as a place where American classics are done upscale and done right, so expect to lick your plate of unctuous barbecue ribs or decadent Apple Walnut Cobbler.  Your mixed drinks are either the perfect palate cleanser or that catalyst for a good hardy buzz.  I'm a fan of the White Russian or a drink called "The Trinity", which was named after my friend whom the bar tender customized it for.  The venue design affords well-dimmed ambient lighting and a controlled volume for that special night with your buddies.   To start off a meal, I'll recommend the artichokes.  They're well-seasoned and well-charred, and pair perfectly with the tartare sauce.  Their prime rib, barbecue ribs, and crab cakes demonstrate clean yet complex flavors and superb structural integrity.  Fall-off-the-bone, no knives needed; this is when you know meat is cooked with a passion.  And you definitely HAVE to make room for dessert, no exceptions.  That Apple Walnut Cobbler will take you back to your childhood memories with a vengeance.  The depth of the hot caramel that coats the earthy walnuts and soft apples, which perfectly juxtaposes the cold vanilla ice cream will knock you into a happy place.  No restaurant is perfect, but I am thoroughly impressed with this place's consistency.  Their integrity reflects in the food and in the people, and convinces you that impressive sequels do exist in the world.

zN7XLPA1S5vHgWFpFTwaVQ.review_text: Must order: --Hawaiian Rib Eye - juicy, tender, sweet marinade --Classic Sundae - good vanilla ice cream, awesome house-made chocolate sauce to pour on top and the works of course.  Preface - I'm not a huge steak fan and would occasionally eat a few bites of my fiance's steak. You could say it takes a lot to impress me since a steak is so simply prepared.  I gobbled up every bit of my OWN Hawaiian Rib Eye here! Best steak I ever ate. It's a really tender, juicy, and well marinated steak. Picture this...party of 8 with 6 boys and 2 girls. Every single one of us ordered the Hawaiian Rib Eye. Enjoy!  My next runner up to this would be the Bone-In Filet Mignon (dry aged) at Boboquivari's Steakhouse in SF. Dry age makes the meat extra tender. Tons of marbling with gives it flavor. Salted just the right amount to bring out all the wonderful beefy taste to it.

FqzpP2N7rf2er5f0OiubLg.review_text: Had a wonderful dinner with my bf here. The service was impeccable, our waiter was polite and deserved a nice tip. My date and I had juicy burgers, delicious soup, and refreshing beer on tap.  I loved how there was actually live music playing - a band in the back playing soft music by the bathroom. And the bathroom also smelled so fresh and clean and even had lovely flowers sitting by the sink (at least that's how it was in the ladies' room). When we were ready to leave, the host was kind enough to call a taxi for us and even walked us out to the car. I had a great experience here and would recommend this place.

DIsr8FUzz-7kuxBcO7-E7Q.review_text: The saving grave of this place was the service!  While this was not my typical type of food (too chain-like), it was fine!  Ask for Andrea when you get there - you won't be sorry!  She knows how to treat people, checks in on you and isn't intrusive!  Also makes appropriate recommendations and is spot on with stuff - like magic!  I had a veggie burger, which was good and also cheesecake for dessert!!  It was all just ok but again, the service was good!

eMsdpzU8jwYE0Qsw3Twawg.review_text: This is the very best restaurant in San Francisco, we been in San Francisco 15 days ago, the service is awesome, food amazing flavor, specially steaks and hamburgers,  they grill the burgers with oak wood that gives a special flavor and smel to the meat. Thank You guys, you have the most exciting ambience in San Francisco, high end restaurant,state  of the art,  Very Kind. Mr. Arturo Aguilar

WALNtcSZlONK4Yj-o3pzKA.review_text: As serious ribists, we must consider the...  E== Off-The-Bone-O-Meter ==3  [_] Fall-Off-The-Bone [_] Slide-Off-The-Bone [x] Easily-Removed-From-The-Bone [||] (Baseline) [||] Clingy-To-The-Bone [||] Work-To-Get-Off-The-Bone [||] Muzzafuzzin-ON-The-Bone  My ribs measured "Easily-Removed-From-The-Bone" and close to "Slide-Off-The-Bone". Quite respectable, considering the only SF place I visited where the meat literally Sandra Bullock x George Clooneyed itself off the bones is now defunct. #riphilo For the rib-curious, #lgbtqqaisbbq Hillstone's sauce was tomato-based & very sweet.  C.R.E.A.M.Y. (Coleslaw Rules Everything Around Me Yolo) Coleslaw could've done with less cream, #thatswhatshesaid but a crouching flavor hidden herb(?) nuance made this non-standard recipe worth savoring by itself - it's not "just" a side dish or something to mindlessly shove in your mouth. #thatsalsowhatshesaid  Service operated in #teamwork mode, with a total of 5 people overseeing my experience (hostess / seater, initial drink server, order taker / main server, order bringer, check bringer). Doesn't Voltron also have 5 parts? #justsayin #coolpoints

cHiKdJkqz6HI0cuVxtW1dQ.review_text: I don't know why this place only got 4 stars from me.  It's always been our go-to dinner place when we're looking for a good steak even before we were married.  Now that we're older, wiser, and with a toddler, we go here even more now!  Again, consistent food, consistent service, great live music every night, and my kid is always welcome.  Aaaand they still don't have a corkage fee.  Win!

B35Nwmd15-0WNdI-8jISOA.review_text: I'm torn between 3 and 4 stars and here's why:  I'm obsessed with open kitchens and the kitchen at Hillstone is very well set up.   I love being able to watch the cooks cook and plate the food!  The table settings are nice, and the knives have a good weight to them.  And let's not forget the best part: no corkage fee.  That said, I still find the place overpriced for what the food is.  I got the French Dip sandwich and shared the apple dessert with 3 others  and dinner ended up being $25ish.  Not too bad, but still a little over priced for what I got.  That said though, another blah point was the service and lackluster we were greeted with my the hostesses.  I've worked in the restaurant business in the past and felt that for a Thursday  night three hostesses, too much for the front of the house.      I'd probably not recommend this place in the future, but wouldn't object if it was where the gang wanted to eat at.

BhkkJQbSy_womFDYIYTgQg.review_text: Before coming here, I had not had ribs in awhile & wow - this place reminded me of what I was missing! The ribs were cooked perfectly - they were soooo tender! Service was great & the setting is perfect!  I definitely want to come back & be seated outside.

NpFvjy3AHPDNfqwtmYFzmQ.review_text: This places looks awesome.  There's live music and it's dark and cozy, but still loud enough to talk.  The waitress was really friendly.  Overall for ambiance, I give it a 5.  But food wise, it was just alright.  I got the pork chop with mashed potatoes.  My friend SWORE on those potatoes., and i LOVE mashed potatoes, but  something was missing.  The FLAVOR was perfect, but it think it was just a tad dry and crumbly.    Porkchops can go very good or very bad for me.  I'm very picky, so maybe it was my fault, but it just wasn't the best.  It MAY have been because after we ordered and after they were already cooking it, the waitress came by and said they were out of the sauce.  That's weird right?  You should say it before we order or before you make it.  I also tried the ribs.  These were solid, meat is falling off the bone, ribs.  BUT, there was something in the sauce I didnt' quite love.    The bread was good.  We brought our own wine, which was good.  But yah, not sure if I would come back.  Apparenlty the steak is amazing, but alas I am not a steak girl.

yiYYR5GHzeteyEnb4qIKXg.review_text: If you're Jewish, forget about it for an hour and eat the damn pork chop! You will be bitter that you have missed out for so long. I'm not a big pork eater, but I after having their pork chop, it's hard ordering anything else. It comes with a side of amazing brussel sprouts glazed in some kind of brown sugar and equally great garlic mashed potatoes. If brussle sprouts aren't your thing, you can substitute them for sauteed spinach.  Definite things to try:  Pork chop Ceasar salad (best of the best) Spinache artichoke dip Spring rolls  The portions leave you perfectly satisfied, the service is friendly and helpful, and the food is amazing.   As far as the atmosphere goes, the fireplace, live jazz music, comfy booths and awesome artichoke shaped ceiling lights make for a pleasant break in the day.  Your wallet might not like you for eating here too often, but your stomach will love you.  Oh, and if you're planning to go later in the evening make sure you have a RESERVATION.

yoG9AQpUTOdsIficXFRbBQ.review_text: We had lunch here the other day and loved it!  The Oak Grilled Artichokes were a great appetizer. It comes with 2 full artichokes, cut in half, so 4 halves, which is perfect to split between 4 people.   The Famous French Dip sandwich (thinly sliced roasted prime rib on a house-made french roll served au jus) is phenomenal! And perfect to split between 2 people.   They don't charge a corkage fee, which is awesome. So we brought a bottle of wine from home to have with our lunch. Our server brought out wine glasses for us, opened the bottle, and poured it for us, free of charge.

qPGhjScyxtuHrWXN4A8VXg.review_text: Some things say "Hillstone" but the lights inside say, "Houston's." Sort of confusing. What isn't confusing is my love for their grilled artichokes. Holy jeepers, are they delicious!   We split an artichoke appetizer and a small salad while we waited for our mains. I got a steak (I know, I'm terribly predictable) while he got this monstrously sized prime rib. The only way we were able to fit these in our artichoke-filled bellies was to neglect large portions of the generously sized potato things we had on our plates. He got a generously filled baked potato and I had a mash of potato and onions.   My dearest had enjoyed a lovely cocktail while I entertained myself with my can of Coke. I appreciated the ice-filled frosty glass but I couldn't help but find it terribly amusing that I was served a can. I think the last place I got my soft drink in a can was at that hot dog stand in Alameda.   Anyway, come for the artichoke thing and amaze yourself with the size of their prime rib. If you can somehow split this between two people you might actually succeed in making it to dessert!

Fmop8R9xo4ttxBkOz097hw.review_text: I'm from the Napa Valley, but live in Oakland now and I was excited to find out that this was a sister property of Rutherford Grill in the NV.  I came here with a bottle of wine (no corkage fee!) and ordered the ribs and famous french dip.  We ordered the ceasar salad and grilled artichoke to start. Everything was amazing and we will be back!

91Mo2-qrDaZsFC2zM8Yuqw.review_text: Yeah...  Food? Good. Service? Horrible.   Our maitre'd was fantastic - seated us with a smile, knew exactly what we needed with our specific reservations (it was a surprise dinner), helpful. And for the first 30 minutes or so things went well while we waited for our friends - our waitress Casey was nice enough to open our bottle of wine, to take our appetizer order.  Our friends arrived and things went downhill. Requests for extra plates were taken but never fulfilled. Our waitress didn't even remember to get one person's order and after bringing this to her attention, gave no apology as if we had just wanted extra time to figure out his order - is this supposed to be a commonly expected occurrence? With her reaction it sure seemed like it. Although most of the food was good (french dip, cheeseburger, ribs) with the fries being especially tasty, the rib eye gave our friends a chewy workout. When we finished I asked for a box for my leftovers. Considering the type of restaurant I was expecting her to take care of packing my leftovers. Instead she brought me a box to do myself... normally I wouldn't be so offended had she not made multiple mistakes earlier in the evening already and had we not been paying a good amount of dough to eat here. Coffee took about 15 minutes to come out (really?) and nobody ever came by to offer refills.  If the service is bad enough to overturn the lure of the beautiful ambience, the nicely balanced music, and the food, that's got to be pretty bad. I don't think I will ever feel inclined to return to a restaurant where I am given the opportunity to pay $40-50 for a meal with service that is to say the least, indifferent and cold. Only reason for 2 stars? The food. Lucky them.

ADaFN4i2layZbwWsJmKSdA.review_text: Great food. And no corkage fee! I got the grilled chicken salad and felt totally satisfied.

HRIZZ1zjJvQuVydIcmVCcg.review_text: I love this place! I've been here numerous times with my boyfriend, friends, and family. Nobody has every been disappointed. The service and food are both great. Sure- it might be a chain restaurant, but who cares?! They even have live jazz music on Friday and Saturday nights :)

ueKYqAmRBsZkyehZgiJ4vg.review_text: First off: I've only had lunch here a few times.  It is always very good.  Most recently I had the "Famous French Dip" after a day on Alcatraz.  Yes, this is a place you can go as a local doing touristy things and have a nice time.  Consider this place fills up with business lunches during the week, btw.   My girlfriend had a pretty good lookin' burger.  I want to go for dinner, and bring wine - NO CORKAGE!!!

djWl0HKJwEwWlY-0vo7oRA.review_text: Came here on a Wednesday night and I was surprised at how crowded both the bar and restaurant were. Another surprising thing is how this place is a chain restaurant. It feels like and tastes like a San Francisco restaurant. I love the comfy seats and the bustling atmosphere. It is a bit dim, but I guess that adds to the effect. They even have a live pianist playing, although depending on where you sit, may be drowned out by all the people talking.   Food: Home Smoked Salmon - great starter! creamy, not too salty, good portion Smoky Rib-Eye Special - perfect touch of smoky flavor and tenderness Center Cut Filet - deliciously cooked to perfection (I got medium rare), tender, juicy, good flavor Mashed Potatoes - yum! Mi Sueno El Llano cabernet - excellent and indeed very sweet!  Service matched the excellent food. Overall, loved everything! Great place to grab dinner with friends, especially if you love a good steak! Oh yeah, parking isn't bad either.

uU7GIgzs4-5Dtp9Vuymb3A.review_text: I really like this place very casual and at the same time sophisticated with great food. Being that they are known for ribs, we ended up ordering the ribs (sauce on side) with sides of coleslaw and steamed vegetables. The ribs were really good, very soft and had a great rub to it (3.5 stars). Omg, I am in love. The coleslaw was sooo delicious, a must (5 stars), I can eat this alone. The steamed vegetables were seasoned really well.  The prime rib medium rare (bone in) was pretty good (4.0 stars), I thought it was a little bit dry in certain areas of the rib. However, pretty well seasoned (gets salty towards the bone). You must ask for fresh horseradish. The side of spinach was excellent as well, topped with some kind of cheese.   Dessert time, omg I am in love again with their brownie topped with different kinds of nuts and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. The brownie was so soft and moist, I couldn't get enough. Darn ruined my diet, but well worth it (5 stars).

qWVMEzQSHmw3VuOavi4jsQ.review_text: Their focaccia with olives is definitely worth trying, but if you really want a reason to come back over and over again, you have to try their crab cakes. I mean, it's San Francisco, do you know a restaurant that doesn't have crab cakes? I had all sorts of crab cakes everywhere in the bay area, and I can say that the ones I ate at Hillstone are by fare the best I've ever had.  Live jazz music every night, cool cocktails, very very high quality of food, attentive and nice waiters... everything is way above average. I would definitely recommend this place.

IlYuwBxMyt-WN9pIwklhgg.review_text: Hip, dim lighting, polite and prompt service  it's good, but not memorable.  I'd liken this place to a ritzy chili's.  Don't get me wrong, the food is great and there aren't any snot-nosed teenager serving attitude with your food but at the same time there's nothing adventurously interesting about this place.    Still, it's a nice solid restaurant where you can get great ribs/prime rib. I'd say it's a date restaurant, a nice night out with your lady/man and you can enjoy each other's company in their comfy leather booths.

vg64AHoj5SIIdVdtDY_-Fw.review_text: Ahhh, Houston's!  I've been here twice and each time has been a wonderful experience.  Two of my good friends took me here for my birthday and devirginized my Houston's experience.  Houston's has great steak and delicious desserts.  My other friends got the baby back ribs and they enjoyed it quite immensely.  They have a bar at the entrance (on the right) which is loaded with wines and spirits.  Also, they have an open kitchen (on the left) where you can see the cooks prepare the food and that just wets your appetite and gets your anticipation going 100 mph.    Two things I didn't like is that we set reservations for 7:00 pm and we didn't get seated until 8:15 pm.  This happened twice!  I thought the purpose of setting reservations was so you wouldn't have to wait to long by "RESERVING" your spot.  Is that too much to ask?  Houston's, you're just too yummy to hate!  Damn you!

8TamMN4wgncGG3nVRK-MIQ.review_text: Used to be Houston's, now called Hillstone.  This is my second time eating at this restaurant.  I can't remember much about the first time eating here which was many moons ago when it was stilled called Houston's, but tonight had dinner there with a few friends for my buddy's birthday dinner, and must tell you, the experience was great.    We didn't have a reservation and needed a table for six.  We were told the wait was 45 mins, so we went to the bar for drinks and apps to kill the time.  We actually only waited maybe half an hour for our table.  From the hostess, to the waitress at the bar, to our waitress during dinner, everyone was exceptionally friendly and attentive, and the food was amazing.  I had the pork chop and it was just perfect, and my friend had the prime rib and that was delicious.  Huge portions.  We brought a couple of bottles of wine, and there is no corkage fee, big plus.  Highly recommend this restaurant for everything that a dinner experience should be.  There was also a live jazz band playing in the background, exceptional.

4sLhuOs4K9mov0bBj7HaYg.review_text: Have been to this place a few times in the past when it was "Houstons". I thought maybe it had changed ownership, but no. The name change has to do with the owner having a winery up north named Hillstone and they wanted the restaurant identified with the winery. This place was always solid in the past and I was pleased to find the menu and good food is the same. Definitely get the grilled artichoke appetizer! Hubby got a yummy cheeseburger that he was kind enough to share. I got a yummy lump crab meat crab cake (I shared too :) Dinner was great. The only disappointment is that they only have a hot fudge sundae, or brownie sundae for dessert. Otherwise, solid food, solid service, and a great place to go.

4jPFBQaXtoUM0I2RV0wpUA.review_text: We came here for my friend's farewell dinner before he left the best coast for the east coast. Everyone got some variation of the famed Prime Rib, whether it be on the bone or in a sandwich or in a burger.   Pros:  - fabulous Prime Rib, I asked for medium and it was cooked so perfectly UGHH! - live music playing - other variety on the menu to suit the budget conscious (friends still in college!) - party of SEVEN seated.. within MINUTES!   Cons:  - too much meeat makin me giddyy

EwadMhTHfOh_ntXyaOCnTA.review_text: ATTENTION YELPERS!!!! ANNOUNCEMENT:   NO CORKAGE FEE AT HOUSTON'S.  **************  Shocking right? And it's for as many bottles of wine as you like. P and I saw a man walk in with charles shaw wine!! CAN YOU BELIEVE IT?? How awesome is this??  +great customer service (really understanding and nice hosts who knew my party was running late) +nice booth by the fireplace  +grilled artichoke (GET THIS, it's perfectly grilled) +hawaiian ribeye steak (mouthwatering!) +prime rib (in P's words: "Better than House of Prime Rib's!") +burger (bigger than my face! ok fine, an exaggeration but still pretty darn big & juicy) +ahi tuna salad (perfectly seared ahi tuna!) ++++++++++++++ for the NO CORKAGE FEE (P & I picked up a bottle on the way to the restaurant)  but nothing is perfect so there were two blemishes: -no reservations for parties larger than 4 -super dry dry DRY sea bass  I'm sorry, this would have been a  five star review if it wasn't for the cruddy sea bass they served my dad. It was EXTREMELY dry and if you had cooked it right, sea bass can never be dry! You disappointed my dad. :(  But overall, I will still heart you, Houston's.

TOURvgatroL8ovosZnBWTQ.review_text: Great waitstaff - friendly and attentive. was a very pleasant staff. Food was great and certainly a place to go for a nice time .

PMGnRUlv6UBsMP-haXd5cw.review_text: Review Drafted 10/9/09  classy upscale atmosphere w/ a vibrant bar good steak good ribs roasted artichoke harts was really good   recommended to sober up or drink up after a Giants game.

APv1iIfzkQ977TLw4nZjcg.review_text: Came here on Wed for lunch. Good service and Great food. I love the sear tuna burger! I'm not a big fan of burger but this burger was sooo good. It was juicy tender and perfect. The portion also HUGE! it's totally worth the price. I'm plan to going back and try more food in the menu. Great food with Great service! One of my favorite place in SF!

CRlIhFoFQZQPw0GAU65YsQ.review_text: A perfectly cooked non/hawaiian Ribeye along with a BYOB (no corkage) bottle of wine makes this a great dinner. We had a toddler and a 3 month old so the stuck us in the back corner next to no one which meant that we didn't have to stress about the kids. I think the back corner is for all families since the the table opposite to us also had kids.

l6zQ30HYypLhHe-MTygskA.review_text: We had a great dinner. Service was amazing. The kale salad is the best. I wish they would open up in menlo park or palo alto!

gAYp-W4vcn2Fw3YIIlSh8g.review_text: Food is really awesome here. I had the trout which was great, and tried the tuna which was even better. One of my friends also got the steak and it was very close to perfection. Absolutelly stellar food.  The ambience decor is classy and confy. Its dark and romantci and great for a couple's night. We got this nice table near the live music, it was a really really good xperience for me and my friends. Drinks are also very good. The service is prompt and friendly. Our waiter was the niciest guy ever!   However it's a little overpriced. I feel that it would be a restaurant to go once ina  while, as with the drinks it definitelly adds up. But Ill definitelly be back to Hillstone, I dont even know why it took me so long to hear about this place. It's great!!!

OOZ24VD1nQSi5EDfld1BYA.review_text: Me and my husband's favorite restaurant in SF hands down.  The food is sooooo good.  I always order the Hawaiin Rib Eye.  It is always cooked perfectly medium rare, has great marbalization, and is absolutely delicious.  The mashed potatoes are great too!  The ribs are amazing also.  Definietely the best BBQ ribs I have had in SF.  They fall off the bone when you barley touch them with your knife.  The sauce is delicious, the coleslaw is creamy with a hint of mint, and the shoestring fries are great.  I could care less that it is a chain restaurant.  Sorry, but you are a snob if you diss Houston's just because it is successful and has been replicated in other places.  The staff has always been very friendly and service is very good.  Price is definitely low considering the quality of food, the ambiance, and the service.  The resturant is beautiful, and sometimes has jazz bands performing.

YklfpGFHiC8EdLZhdBHlPA.review_text: I used to work nearby so ate here regularly when it was called Houston's.  I went back for old-time's sake and was sorely disappointed.  The spinach-dip appetizer tasted good.  The guacamole lacked flavor.  The Reuben sandwich contained three thick slices of Swiss - way too much.  It was also dripping from the cole slaw's mayo.  The pastrami was of medium quality.    Afterwards, my dining partner and I both had headaches and felt slightly ill; the food was too salty and rich.  The service was very good and the ambience is still warm.

FKeN1kcoqeAHU6eXLP3RhA.review_text: As a SF resident I don't often find a reason to come to this part of town. But hillstone is a very good reason. Once again we are completely happy with our lunch at Hillstone! Great service, great food, quiet easy going atmosphere. We come here for the ribs: yum!  Fries and cole slaw really good! Parking was tough today though.

qxTg4ncYVsK4zGlKQnULfw.review_text: I'm a fan of Los Altos Grill and Rutherford Grill but have not been to Hillstone. This is more for the service. Food is consistently amazing just like Los Altos Grill and Rutherford Grill, service was only OK, we had reservations and checked in early yet others who checked in later with a larger party got seated before our party of 2. My fiance finally had to say something about it. Crowded, definitely make reservations ahead of time.   We couldn't find our server throughout our meal, we finished our drinks AND our water and no one was around to either take a 2nd round of order or refill our water. Forgot to mention, I had to ask what the special of the day is! He didn't even introduce himself when he asked if we were ready to order.   We ordered a dessert to share with a few request and asked for it to be sent back because it came out wrong (we ordered the apple pie/crumble and had the ice cream on the side, not a big deal) but we saw that it was covered with caramel which was not described to us by the server (we wouldn't have ordered it if we knew it was drenched in caramel sauce). Then he suggested the brownie and he described it with NO mention of NUTS. If you're not going to have a dessert menu and your brownies have nuts in them - please make sure your servers emphasize which ones have nuts or potentially all of them may contain nuts! I was tired of sending stuff back or asking for things, so I ended up eating it since I'm not allergic but  come on - gluten free, allergies, vegans, it's so common especially in SF!

jx-Ju34y3HzTQKgVxLv9pQ.review_text: "Inconsistent food, inconsistent service" should be their motto.    We waited for 30 minutes despite having a reservation on a Wednesday night.  "You know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to *hold* the reservation and that's really the most important part of the reservation, the *holding*. Anybody can just take them. [insert hand-waving motion here]"  We finally got seated (without apology) only after my husband asked the hostess about the wait, and there were AT LEAST 8 empty tables.  We had a F-ing reservation!!!  (Yes, I was livid!).  But I was willing to let that pass... Our waitress was dull and obviously uninterested (the minimal 15% tip was coming her way...) and only checked in on us once throughout the dinner.  We re-poured our own wine glasses with the bottle we had brought in.   Yes, we were hungry (we waited 30 minutes!) so we ordered right away. Five minutes later our salad arrived and two minutes after finishing our salad our entrees arrived. (We've had the opposite experience of waiting a good 30 minutes between courses).  The BBQ pork ribs that I so previously loved were horribly done.  Thin tiny ribs (from an immaciated pig?) poorly overcooked and tough.  The cole slaw was bitter.  The fries were really the only good part of this meal.  My husband's prime rib was good - at least his meal was satisfying.  That was a wasted $80 meal....   But I may decide to give it another chance after a long hiatus... jury's still out....

mXGWO1sBX-Ew3qhKrZFKKA.review_text: Great atmosphere with a fireplace, live jazz, and a bar. Food was really decent. I had the tuna, and it was very well prepared. Fish portions are a bit small though.

y1nqu0J8Eq1560qpMQvjfg.review_text: My first few years in the City (when it was Houston's), this was my favorite place. I went weekly with friends and my mom. I ordered the same thing every time- the veggie burger. Depending on who I was with, the spinach dip was a favorite as well as the brownie with ice cream (with a side of hot fudge). I was recently in the City for a business function and I was very excited to have lunch at the now Hillstones. I thought about it all day. Unfortunately, my veggie burger was cold, my side of honey mustard was just weird- a mixture of yellow mustard and maple syrup and ice cold. To make matters worst, I sat at the bar and the bartender was more concerned about the Oscars preview show (it was Sunday afternoon) on the TV than service. Such a bummer.

1UOTsXkq54pGB5jnFreTdQ.review_text: Came for: Weekend din with a small group to toast a fresh bottle of red Will come back for: no corkage fee :)  Yes, Houston's is now Hillstone; part of same restaurant group and the overall decor still seem to carry a similar tune.   + Ample space: the big 4-sided bar at the entrance, plenty comfy booth seating, and even a live piano player + Ambiance: the dark-lit modern wooden decor somehow makes the big space seem intimate (the live piano music doesn't hurt either) + Wide range of food/price: from ~$17 sandwiches/burgers/salads to ~$27 entrees, the menu offers a good variety for different palates and purses/wallets + No Corkage Fee (enough said~)  - Food: the chain/restaurant group food was rather mediocre; I had the Flying Tuna Platter (slices of seared tuna) which although was a generous portion, was quite salty - Service: (probably a one-off instance) our server was not quite versed in serving wine; no need to empty out the wine bottle on the first pour, especially if that means over-filling our wine glasses...  Take-Away: A good option to keep in mind especially when you want free street parking (weekday evenings/Sat and Sundays) and want to BYOB

9NYwLBkxd8pr7RDWtX7vJg.review_text: Nice location, my boyfriend and i hv a great time there.  Love their food presentation and atmosphere, and very good quality of food.  The roast prime rip can be done better, well is pretty good at this point. Recommend to people who want good food and good atmosphere!

yqA1PnTInr00MeazSsL0zw.review_text: No corkage fee. Decent food. Outdoor seating. Great customer service.  They were more than happy to accomodate a small group of us on a Saturday afternoon, even though we brought our own bubbles and just ordered appetizers.

e_fGOO7pkjEplOXjPg9IAA.review_text: I love checking out new restaurants.  I love living in a restaurant town.  I almost never eat at chain restaurants.  Hillstone is the big exception to the no-chain rule in my dining out life.  When you want consistently good food at a reasonable price with service that is always conscientious and earnest if not always perfect, this place gets it right every single time.  Bonus: this is the best place in town to eat while watching the Giants when they are on the road.  Best French Dip sandwich ever.  I had forgotten about this dish entirely before Hillstone.  Now it's a sandwich destination.  No corkage.  I've never taken advantage of this, but keep thinking it would be a great place to bring a bunch of Champagne to for sitting on the patio on a Sunday afternoon (free, house-made dog biscuits, too).  Baked Potato Loaded for only $5.  I could go for this alone.  Good wine list (especially considering that this is a national chain).  Huge glass pours.  It's a chain.  Let it go.  It's still more than worth it.

u474u_0jbgz93GFHU8lGNA.review_text: Once a Houstons now Hillstone. I don't care what you call it as long as the menu and consistent quality stays the same. I have been to Houston's in Phoenix, Scottsdale, LA, Woodland Hills and Irvine. When I found out that Hillstone is part of the family I couldn't wait to go, especially since we have missed going to our favorite place. We are never let down. We always know its going to be a good, quality meal with attentive, friendly service. We will always return.

YGTefRmhNo1ONyU3ZqVEnA.review_text: I tip my hat to hillstone for providing a homemade veggie burger, given the carnivorous nature of the rest of their menu.  At a place like this I would normally hope and pray for a frozen boca burger, so this was a nice change.    I thought the burger was good.  I love the plant much, much more, but it was good.  I also like the ananda fuara grain burger much better.   That being said, my husband can't get a huge, tasty prime rib at either of those places, so life is all about compromise.    I had the kale salad (hold the cheese) to start, and it was good.  The fries with the burger were just ok, more towards the matchstick variety (not my favorite).   The burger bun is sadly made with egg, so not vegan appropriate.    They had live music, which was nice.  It was loud, which helped my baby sleep well, which was awesome.

KG53owgHt1LaLc4XO7FXOQ.review_text: great place to take the grandparents

0WcUP0kdhdx4A-L9d7mHgw.review_text: With a bloody mary to sip on in this incredible heat wave, there wasn't much to complain eating here today.  But why one 3 stars?  Well, let's just say the wait staff wasn't very....  what do you call it?  Like they were very polite, but maybe it was the sun that made them seem....  what do you call it?  Hm, I'd say even the heat couldn't melt their demeanor.  The food was good enough, especially the fries.  I had the chicken sandwich, and it was great because they leave the yummy flavorful skin on!  YAY!  I love skin when it's cooked of course.  Artichoke dip was yummers.  And the tuna sashimi salad was also cooked well even though the salad it came with was a little creamy, which made the dish seem heavier than I like.  But not bad at all.  I just hope the wait staff gets over the heat because we had to ask for water 3 times before we got it and it was near the end of the meal.  Lucky, I was feeling the bloody mary or I would have been P.O.ed.

w4ZBwrYODc__W4-Lx0p5kQ.review_text: Great food, drinks, ambience and service. Their French dip (beef roast sandwich served with jus and horseradish) is to die for. It literally melts in your mouth. Wash it down with a martini and you can't ask for anything more in life! Their salads are fantastic too. Kale salad is great - if ordered as a side, they'll charge $5 but their standard side salad still is as good. Spinach and artichoke dip is a good starter.

SlIfiia8tgux6a-1rVg9fQ.review_text: Food was cold, service slow and the something was still moving on my salad, nuff said. NOT MEMORABLE...

iChrn349gyWB-8UGyn8a6Q.review_text: I've been to Hillstone twice now, and more recently I came here to celebrate my birthday. Yes, Hillstone is a chain restaurant and normally I dislike chains, but this one is different.   Oh, before I go on! There are three important words I must share with you: NO CORKAGE FEE! Yes, you read that correctly, so go ahead and bring that bottle of wine with you to dinner, without having to pay a $25 fee!    If this is your first visit to Hillstone, be sure to order the prime rib with the loaded baked potato. Now, HOPR serves up excellent prime rib, but Hillstone's prime rib isn't trailing too far behind! Watch out now! Honestly, because the atmosphere and decor of Hillstone is more my style, I'd actually prefer it over HOPR. But, that's just me!   C O N C L U S I O N The food is delicious, the service is excellent and the parking isn't as bad as you may think (way better than trying to find parking on Van Ness)! I'll definitely be coming back to Hillstone to get my meaty fix!

J5tJo-hoZtG6FNvllUDaJA.review_text: This is my go-to steak house in San Francisco.  Nothing beats no corkage fee and the Idaho baked potato.  Free parking can be found if you walk one block.

dnGIi-OjEui4OSsmLQ2lPw.review_text: Hillstone is actually Houston's. In Sacramento, it's Bandera.   For starters, you should know that when my family "entertains," which they have done a total of once in the past 5 years, they like to go here.   Menu. The menu is brief, and in this case, the brevity is much appreciated. It's better to do a few things and to do them well.  Small Plates. I usually have the smoked salmon as my entree--it is so good, and you should know that I'm generally not a big fan of smoked salmon. The creme fraiche spread is so good, it's nutters. If you can only choose one small plate, choose the salmon. If you can do more than one, the artichoke is delicious. I also like the spinach dip.   Main Course (Lunch). Their French Dip might be the best one I've had. The only minor issue I have with it is that the meat is cooked medium rare, and sometimes the sandwich arrives a little too cold for my tastes. Other than that, it's pretty yummy. The horseradish aioli is a must--it's certainly way more important than the au jus. Many of my colleagues order the spicy chicken sandwich, which is cut into three, topped with avocado, and looks pretty appetizing. I've had a couple of the dinner entrees, but I feel like I haven't been here for dinner in so long that it would be unfair for me to opine about those dishes.   Wine, Beer & Cocktails. I *forced* an Anchor Steam (draft) at lunch. They also have Lagunitas IPA (not appropriate for a "working" lunch) and Trumer Pils on draft. They have an extensive wine list and a full bar.   Ambiance. Clean and white with dark cherry wood.  Classy but minimal. Huge, oversized booths can accommodate large parties.   Reservations. Call well in advance to reserve your table. Their prime location makes Hillstone a perpetual FiDi hot spot.  Headed east? This is going to sound crazy, but I actually prefer Bandera in Sacramento. Maybe it's the company (my family), but they also seem to have better execution of their dishes. Plus they have colcannon, which is absolutely fabulous. I don't know if they have it in SF at dinner or not.   Overall, pretty good times.

Dhq1fZBc3m3EL9pIre297g.review_text: Boyfriend and I celebrated our 9 year anniversary dinner at Hillstone a few weeks ago.   Boyfriend is a vegetarian but I am a steak lover so finding a nice restaurant to accommodate both of us is challenging. Hillstone, however, accomplished this task wonderfully!  We brought a nice bottle of wine with us (no corkage fee, woo!) and the servers were quick to bring out glasses and open the bottle for us.   I ordered the filet mignon (came with mashed potatos and sauteed spinach, if I remember correctly) and the BF ordered the veggie burger. We enjoyed our meals while listening to the super classy, live jazz band.   Our waitress was very friendly and helpful, especially when it came time for dessert and we couldn't decide what to order. We left the decision up to her and the ice cream sundae she brought out did not disappoint. It seems simple but my god it was delicious and the perfect way to conclude the meal.   We were unable to finish the entire bottle of wine so she offered to re-cork and give us a bag to take the remainder home.   Thanks for the very successful anniversary dinner, Hillstone!

xdavkX57NzkwLGqe_2fwsw.review_text: the prime rib has never let me down.

RKfETgoe0wuZds8EMDBw0Q.review_text: Its time for an update for this fine establisment.  I work across the street and this place annoys the hell out of me.  Why? Well, because I work downwind and every day when I get off work the smoke from the grill comes my direction.  I begin to salivate uncontrollably and my mind becomes instantly delirious.  My friends have to hold me back otherwise I would run across the street and probably get hot by a bus.  Damn them!  Occasionally, when my friends and coworkers, cant hold me back I do run across 5 lanes of traffic and I stop in.  Everyone greets me with a smile.    You can sit on the patio, at the large circular bar, or get a table.  Last night a trio was playing smooth jazz at the far end of the restaurant.  Over there right by the fireplace.    My favorite dishes so far: the red trout.  Its a fillet of trout with paprika and its delicious.  Comes with a head of broccoli.  Its just so good.  No bones.  So light.  So good.  Did I mention it was soo goooood.    They have several wines on tap but also a large wine list. Of course with no corkage, bring your own too.    For desert, my favorite is the Sunday.  They use dark chocolate from TCHO down the street.  A big ball of vanilla ice cream.  Whip cream.  And pecans.  It is sooo good.  Do not even think of sharing this.  You were a hero today, you get it for yourself!

1yeS87Cj8DhbLXSLYxzIzw.review_text: Braised artichoke hearts! They're an app but so tasty, I could make a meal out of them. Oops . Just checked the price. You'd need two platters and they're $14 per! Yup, app is the way to go, sharing with your mealmate.  Here with 101 ladies for birthday club! Happy birthday Martha.  Judy and Linda!  Fathers Day with my men.

tF-c0sIGrAfBlmZl4_RpYQ.review_text: The place is really nice in the inside (upscale). The serve was great (fast). I came here with my boyfriend to have a nice dinner and that's exactly what we got. This place has no corkage fee for you wine lovers. The food was great and pretty filling!!

b1Iu7lgKqMB6i-6-bXjmfQ.review_text: LOVE the Rutherford Grill in Napa - and who know, that a 20 min walk from our place is Hillstone on the Embarcadaro - same menu, same owners!

SeXaoH1rJgzGbiqfQqnzSQ.review_text: Last night, my girlfriend and I hopped into a cab.  All I wanted in the whole wide world was a grilled artichoke and some ribs.  "Take us to Houston's!", we cried.  The cab driver then politely informed us that the place that was Houston's is now called Hillstone's, and touched off in my life a crisis of Faith.    Why would God allow Houston's to close?  I'm such a good person.  Why would He do this to me?    I've never had a bad meal or anything short of exceptional service at Houston's.  It is one of my favorite places to relax with a solid meal, nice scenery, and pleasant company.  It always seems crowded, but never gets too loud to enjoy a good conversation.  Basically, it provides a great venue for the vast majority of occassions, and has been known to lift me out of a bad mood when I thought the sky was falling (how can the sky possibly be falling when these brussels sprouts are so good?).  Could the economy be to blame?  Because if it had been, I would have sponsored a personal bailout.  Houston's in my mind is like AIG: too big to fail.  The Titanic: unsinkable.  If only I had known, I would have hosted a bake-sale, found a way...  We decided to see for ourselves.  If Houston's had indeed closed, whatever replaced it would likely be at least a decent endeavour to afford that space, and obviously I was going to need massive amounts of wine to cope.  We walked up to the building.  The neon sign outside had changed, but the "No Corkage Fee" sign on the door upon which I've come so utterly to rely after trips to Livermore, Napa or Sonoma, was still firmly in place.  The hostess looked familiar.  And, importantly, it smelled like ribs.  Thank you, Jesus.  You are truly a merciful God.  The waitress explained that Houston's had long been owned by Hillstone Group, and that it had (along with the location in mid-town Manhattan) been promoted to a flagship site, and thus re-branded.  I'm all for promotions, especially in this instance.

9svQPocWUQMTPYV_rDBxRw.review_text: best prime rid ever! came here on Thursday night with my older brother and his friend! we made a reservation, it was all packed on a Thursday night, it took our 15-20 mins for the wait! but It's really worth it!  honestly, I really care about service, and I think the food and the service here is worth to wait ! Best Prime Rib ever, my brother got a Hawaii rid eye steak, It was good.. I got the prime rib and it was So So good, juicy, fresh and tender! after the first bite I decided to order another prime rib take out for my boy friend, and of course he loves it so much and wants to come here !

vLeEYl6PyV5F_RBslbZFJQ.review_text: Hillstone's is always a safe bet.  The spinach dips is great the filet and the ribs never disappoint.  I've eaten here a lot, and the prime rib is sometimes amazing but about 1 in 5 times I'm disappointed which sucks.  Not that it's ever bad but when you expect greatness and get acceptable it's a let down.   The baked potato is great as a side.  I rarely order a baked potato anywhere else but I almost always get it here.  They will load you down with toppings and it is delicious. Staff is attentive and friendly whether you are having a quiet dinner or boozing it up with a group of rambunctious dicks.  Ambiance is very laid back classy.  Dim lights, Jazz band etc.

SS3sFA9ksCT9bjocM3Wbug.review_text: I didn't eat anything because I wasn't hungry but I was here with my family (about 13 of us) for an outing of lunch and shopping. The food looked amazing and everyone kept saying how delicious it was! The service was great! The staff was so patient without large group and was able to get everyone's order correct! Hopefully my stomach won't be a factor next time so I can enjoy the food!

eZNhFI6m07dvu1zfLfJc-g.review_text: **WARNING** If you have over 6 people in your party, you will be split into two tables!!  I was so sad that had to happen, but we were across from each other so we snuck each other waves occasionally :)  On with the food, I had the daily fish special, the Hallibut. taste great with lemon juice squeezed all over, and pepper every bite! It came with broccoli with some kinda garlic sauce.  If you're going for dinner, remember, the Pier still charges for meter parking after 6pm! Starting from 7pm, it's 50 cents per half hour, so remember to pay at the pay machine, or find a 2-hour parking area.

GSonSiVa1yLif4KYHkecFQ.review_text: I only live a block away so this has become my "cheers". The bartenders actually do know my name. They're so great...  Friendly staff. Good food. Full bar. Pricey but the quality is consistently high. Btw, it used to be called Houston's but it's still the same restaurant (also same as Bandera), just with a different name. Same owners.   The/my "usual":  Spinach and artichoke dip is money. Fresh chips. Dip comes with sour cream and mild salsa. Odd combination but when you mix them all together (on your chip, not in a bowl) it's incredible.   Cheeseburger - always cooked exactly how you requested it which is a rare feat at restaurants these days. Cheddar sharp enough. Kaiser bun delicious. The elements are always fresh and you can really taste the quality.  I would recommend substituting the shoe string fries for spinach which comes al dente, seasoned just perfectly, and sprinkled with Parmesan chunks.   Also features outside seating patio which is very pleasant. Firepit.   The clientele is quite unique, which I really like. The atmosphere and the price of the dishes, to me, suggest a young professional/30-something/"the marina"-minus-the-douche-baggery crowd but I often find hipsters, regular old sports fans and families frequenting the joint.

IUyPbylpHYwzxD4uZf5F1w.review_text: Very convenient parking lot across the street on francisco. $18 but convenient. The view isn't much seeing how this place resides across the street from the water and is on level ground. You can people watch if you like though.   The server was welcoming and attentive. She was ready to refill our drinks and was friendly. Graciously tipped.  The venue was comfortable and homey with a live jazz band (which I actually didn't notice till my friend told me) as well as a fireplace. I thought the place had a nice set up (large comfortable booths, sturdy tables, nice lighting) but that the crowd was a bit more casually dressed than I had anticipated.   As for the food, I ordered the pork ribs with coleslaw and a fully loaded baked potato. The ribs were pretty good but half of them were a little burned and chewy for my liking. The baked potato in all of its sour cream, bacon, cheese, green onions and glory was delicious. The coleslaw was disregarded and I dived into my potato and some of my friends delicious french fries. He ordered the rib eye and upon sampling I agree that it was cooked perfectly and was very tender and tasty.   Overall the place was very good and I'd love to return again someday.

uEWr-uNAq3VAWOL9VaMLLQ.review_text: This is a great place! Definitely a can't miss, money spot. Always a perfect meal. I'm a burger fan, always seeking the perfect one. This is definitely one of them. Only thing I was disappointed with this time is that they are no longer serving the apple walnut cobbler. The waitress said it is not on the menu now but possibly may be in the future. I really hope so, because if there was one thing I could count on w/this place is both a perfect burger & an amazing dessert. Please bring it back & keep this place awesome!

09mqjdI-Rb9WuZ30WDHRsw.review_text: This is where I go when my husband and I need a good meal. They are consistently  good with their food. We have never had a bad experience there. We have been going there for 4 years now. Bbq ribs #1, French Dip no comparison, Hamburger out of this world and not to mention their home made salad dressings are the best. If you want a good french dip this is the place to go.   Also their service is top notch servers are great and really nice they make sure you are satisfied with their food and service.  I have my wedding anniversary their and everyone in my party loved this place!

NyfHK34rymV3cTjWd_6EGQ.review_text: No corkage on the first 2 bottles for your table.  That is all you need to know to give this place five stars.  But if you need more, here it is.  This a nice steak house on The Embarcadero.  Comfy banquets and very nice service.  If you do bring a bottle, I encourage you to ask your server to bring a glass for the, so they can have a taste.  Order your cheeseburger with bacon and a fried egg.  The San Francisco loco moco!

blUK5EHDfwPFT2mcZe-Q-g.review_text: Been here several times and their food and service are always consistently fantastic.  Their ribs (soft fall off the bone) and fries are so tasty together!  Great ambience and they had live music the night we were there.  The place always fills up quickly, so definitely recommend making reservations first!

OkA8y7Bz9SvkOIqvtlPXmg.review_text: This place is one of my fav. restaurants!  Awesome ambiance and great location - right off the Embarcadero, and fantastic service.  If you come on the weekends, don't forget to make a reservation first as it can get packed.    We started off with the spinach and artichoke dip, which was absolutely delish, came out piping hot with huge chunks of artichokes and crispy chips.  My bf ordered the hawaiian rib-eye, medium, and it came out just as he ordered, not too red nor well-done.  I had the thai steak and noodle salad.  The steak was nicely marinated, tender and juicy and the thai noodles gave it a nice kick.    This restaurant can be business casual - perfect for lunch meetings or casual - as you come strolling in after the farmers market on a Saturday afternoon.  They also have a live jazz band on the weekends, definitely worth coming in with friends over drinks and appetizers.  I definitely recommend Hillstone to my out of town friends or anyone that is craving a good spinach and artichoke dip.

tSvytk0PoqUJ__zHbVw3SQ.review_text: Popped in with a friend to celebrate his becoming an American citizen and was rather taken with this place. The bar staff are wonderful, there's a smoking area and it's not a tourist joint.  The drinks are very, very good. At my friend's suggestion I had the gimlet (gin, lime, syrup and some other stuff) and it was sublime - but lethal. Two of those and I was three sheets to the wind. I was so drunk I ate a McDonalds on the way home and liked it.  Which brings me to the food. It's good, but massively overpriced and undersized. Three and a half stars, reduced from a four and a half just for getting screwed on the food.

b6ZGanMrmUvM7rAaSyAvTw.review_text: We were a frequent patron of Hillstone, even back when it used to be Houston's!  We were there last night for dinner and was shocked to learn they no longer had the clip on seats for babies, nor did they replace them with high chairs.  Most of the time when we were there before 6pm, half of the room were families with children.  I guess this is a sign they do not care about families eating there.  Point taken Hillstone, you won't see us there again.

qRBTAUOEWrBY9N1JszH1ow.review_text: Ok, this place has THE best veggie burger in town, hands down!  I'm still smiling over the meal I had on Saturday.  Our table of two split a side order of asparagus, which was drizzled in this delicious creamy sauce, a veggie burger (yes, the most scrumptious one I've EVER had!), and a nice little house salad (that has goat cheese and walnuts, yum!).  We got a table outside, which faces pier 33 and the water, what a nice view.  The weather was gorgeous and it felt incredibly great to be there.  Service was terrific too.  From the bartender to the hostess to our waitress, everyone was friendly and really professional.  Lastly, price.  For one app, two entrees and one drink, total was $45 with tax and tip.  NOT BAD at all.

czIHMzmascJmct_qT7O04g.review_text: Quality freshness, flavorful food and excellent service.   Forgive me but I've forgotten our waitress' name but my bf swears it's Stacy. I really hope it is, or close to it, because she was really one of the top 3 best waitresses I've had. From the beginning, her suggestions were knowledgable and un-pushy. We indecisively asked dozens of questions and she fluently replied the preparation of each dish.   My prime rib was juicy and cooked just the way I like it, complimented by the punch-packing creamy horseradish sauce. I couldn't decide whose dish was better. Mine or my bf's crab cakes with yummy mustard sauce. He's from the south and he was even torn by its deliciousness, fearful he might break his loyalty of southern seafood meals. That good.   We had several glasses of ports and muscat to top off our molten fudge brownie dessert served warm with ice cream. It was an almost perfect dining experience.

OGH2D8gH2aGKX3q-5TLEMw.review_text: cause I had to use the restroom & my dad was trying to rush, my mom decides to eat here. cause we already had plans to eat elsewhere, we decided to just get two things on the menu. our server was super nice! we ordered the house smoked salmon & spinach & artichoke dip. those were just starters. it was just yummy! this may be nothing compared to the actual food here, but food is food & it was good :)

JjLlqIulW0OaC62S_RzxUA.review_text: Horrifying.  On every level.  I'd rather eat crayons served by imprisoned gypsies.

lonqMmT2FVoOKaus-jeNuw.review_text: Awesome place! Everything on the menu is delicious. If you're into salads the ahi tuna is amazing for me however it's all about the meat - pork chops, pork ribs and prime rib. Sound like too much deliciousness to enjoy in one meal . . .  guess you'll just need to make multiple trips.  Local hint: Bring your own bottle of wine - no corkage fee!

OniLiyqsK0qKv4kptqzipg.review_text: Hillstone's prime rib sandwich is au jus.

80nJzs9ShcqyZiMyqB6uHA.review_text: Came here for my husband's 40th and sister's 45th birthday dinner in mid-December.  We had a relatively large group (9) and they seated us at what looked to be the largest booth in the restaurant, down in the very back corner, RIGHT by the "band."  Made for a very loud experience and we had to practically yell at each other to hear.    Take note, the corkage is LIMITED, which means that the first two bottles are free, then they start charging you every other bottle starting with the 3rd bottle (I think it's $25 per bottle).  They had told us the first three were free and then corrected themselves later, which was annoying.  Someone came by to acknowledge the error and apologize and offered to honor the third corkage free, but we ended up not needing it.  The food was excellent and I enjoyed the level of service overall.  Just extremely loud given where we were seated.  I would come back but would prefer not to be seated so close to the band.

EB_GTNmfWN8U6IaeyHnt5w.review_text: I did not have the pleasure of eating at this nice little gem of a steak house until last weekend during my visit to San Francisco. I know they have these scattered throughout the nation, but we decided to give it a try on our trip.  I ordered the Rotisserie Chicken and it was pretty yummy. Not too dry, and the marinade they used was tastey enough to outlast the slow cooking of the bird. The side that came with it was actually better than expected, the Dirty Orleans Rice. It was like a Mardi Gras rendition of Asain style fried rice. hmmmm. I liked it a lot. I also had a couple bites of the prime rib (wow) and the Pork BBQ Ribs (double-wow). I should have gotten the ribs. Meat that falls off the bone is hard to find in a restaurant these days.  To wash all of this down with, I had the house Merlot which wasn't bad for the house selection. I actually liked it, since I ordered a couple more glasses throughout dinner.  Therefore, Houstons was damn good and I highly recommend trying the Ribs on your first shot, you'll be sold as a repeat customer no doubt.

zrHhzP4omVmB2yCFDzR00Q.review_text: Came back again tonight with my friend and, I must say, everything was wonderful as always!   Even before we approached the hostess, she already had 2 menus out and immediately sat us at a table. My friend, as always, had the BBQ pork ribs with mashed potatoes and coleslaw while I tried the ribeye special this time. The ribs were a little tough but still delicious. My ribeye was cooked a perfect medium rare with a wonderful mushroom sauce! It was better than the ribeye at Alfred's! Our waitress came around at perfect intervals and our wine glasses were never empty.  As always, bring a bottle of wine because there is no corkage fee! Hillstone, you are my dependable and delicious restaurant in the FiDi!

r-H0xR52CjM2Trrkwvspew.review_text: While visiting SF for a weekend, we were meeting up with my cousin from SJ. He emailed me a list of potential restaurants and told me to pick. In all honesty, all I did was look them all up on Yelp and see which one had the "Good for kids" mentioned. We had my 15 mo old daughter, so that was the biggest criteria. of the 5 restaurants he gave me, Hillstone was the only one! so there we were!   They had a really good location... parking on the street with meter was easy. it was a Saturday evening. There was a lot of people at the restaurant that day and i saw a good number of families with kids (good sign!). My husband and cousins started with a drink at the bar while we waited for our table to be ready.   we sat at a cosy booth and they had the little kiddle seat right in the middle. It was great. Tried the artichoke dip - YUMM.... had to try the hawaiin steak that everyone on Yelp was talking about... and it was YUM! the mash potatoes were good too! Also tried the fish of the day and it was well cooked and tasteful. I would agree that its on the pricier side, but $ wasn't an issue for my cousin from SJ who was treating us out... so glad we had an opportunity to try Hillstone out.   omg... forgot to mention... tried dessert: the brownie a la mode - Sooooo good. it was perfectly baked, not too rich, melted in your mouth and amazing balance with the ice cream.

RLsHM4k6TYIzM65PgULaNg.review_text: Inviting ambiance, superb service and really tasty food. I overheard the host mention that they bake their own doggie treats, so if you're ever walking by in this neighborhood, stop in and ask for some!   I had the veggie burger, which seemed fairly home made and was very tasty. I'm usually more a fan of the "tastes just like meat" Boca-type veggie burger, but in this case the crumbly, textured patty really won me over. Fries with my burger, but these are the super thin cut fries I'm not a huge fan of. Next time I'll ask to see if they serve steak cuts.   Our waittress was really friendly and attentive. It's funny, but see if you're reminded of being in a Robert Palmer video when you see how the wait staff is dressed.

_0r-2JvUk279ugyz-Dj7Hw.review_text: Hillstone's/Houston's is a treat! It's right by my office so my coworkers and I go there a lot (luckily they usually treat, bc it isn't a cheap bite by any means). However, this neighborhood has fairly inflated prices in general, so for a few more bucks than nearby Fog City Diner or Pier 23 you can have an excellent meal in a high-class establishment.  The food is GREAT. Anything from a "simple" ahi tuna salad or bean soup, to the famous french dip sandwich, ribs, are all beautifully presented and oh so tasty. The service is so friendly and professional all the time. They definitely train them well here! And the drinks at the bar are also nice, they have a good wine selection and nice service there too. They also have jazz most evenings (perhaps just weekend, not sure), and it makes for a great place to go on a romantic date or just for drinks with friends.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Yummy yummy yummy I have Sea Bass in my Tummy!   My sea bass was cooked perfectly, served on a bed of flavored rice with some clams and fresh corn kernels....TO DIE FOR!  Portions were also very generous, I took fish and rice home for the next day!  The service was fantastic and the ambiance was dark and sultry.    Im reminded how spoiled we are in the bay area to be surrounded by amazing food!

hYIX-Hh1jMWb__EJ3Vwwfw.review_text: I can't come up with a single bad thing to say about this restaurant. My husband and I are there probably at least twice/month. The food is reliably great. There are so many delicious side dishes featuring the freshest farm products, and they welcome substitutions on meals to allow you to sample these. Service is always great, the bar scene is chill, and the environment is warm, inviting and bustling with couples and groups of friends having a great time. It is also worth noting they feature no corkage fee for BYOB!  Three pieces of advice: Try the grilled artichoke appetizer, don't miss dessert (especially the warm five-nut brownie), and call ahead for a reservation on weekends (no OpenTable - this is old school).

J2j0PBxPAXU5i7M0rrgfGg.review_text: The food is certainly more than just one star.  But over all customer service was not in store for me and my guest.  I felt I had to managed where they were in providing a table--I came during a busy time and was told 45 minutes.  I checked in 60 minutes later and were continually told the table was almost ready--instead a true estimate should have been given.    The wait staff member seemed promising in the beginning and perhaps had too many tables to manage. I thought the very beginning encounter was something would not stretch into the evening.  Over the course of dinner the service faltered severely; between each subsequent meal service the lag time got longer.  To get someone/anyones attention was north of impossible for the check; once the check arrived another endless wait to get credit card charged.  The lack of service was so unforgiving that I forgot the quality of the food and presentation.  I wasted nearly 4 hours of my life trying to get feed where I could have gone elsewhere and eaten in half the time.  I am very careful and think about what I am going to write, deliberate and think again about the experience.  This experience was solidified and I had no problem to thinking about giving Hillstone a one star-- the rating is accurate as a response to any concern for adequate customer service.  Waiting for the check was certainly Waiting for Godot. I would be hard pressed to go back.

C-moRc6wwPyOGNO7Rx_A1g.review_text: We came here on New Years Eve, the restaurant had a great ambience with live jazz band. Ordered the house smoked salmon which was fantastic! For main we both had the prime center cut filet which was perfectly cooked, then for dessert we shared the ice-cream with fudge sauce. Everything was delicious and service was attentive!

mLJPd4jqQkGPeb8ASp0Xsg.review_text: I've had way better food  it seemed to be better when it was Houston's.  Everyones food was bland.

fUiLqBsvSehJ-5-N0BWMSQ.review_text: The thai steak salad was the best!  The steak was cooked to perfection and it melts in your mouth.  the salad ws very fresh.  its very busy, so make reservations before you go!

2uRMA5bKnIenKyOUxl6SZA.review_text: It's our go to spot... No corkage fee on two bottles ... And two words ... Hawaiian ribeye... Yum!

AWl4FLAkFf_siv6UEldC-w.review_text: Just went on Tuesday for lunch... my second time at Hillstone and it was just a great as the first time (about 6 months ago).  Service is one of the things that makes this a 5-star rating from the time you walk in to the time you leave.  Friendly, knowledgeable staff make it easy to select menu items and have a warm experience.   Both times I have selected from the specials.  Last time I had a pork chop (perfectly cooked and served) and this time the crispy chicken sandwich (sort of a chicken milanesa with lots of vegetables surrounding it that made it a healthy choice). Sidenote:  their lemonade has real lemon juice and pulp in it.  Not a flavored mix.  I understand the evening menu is more extensive so it's definitely on my list for whenever I find myself on the Embarcadero.

Tk_FWXueutKii3f9yJFsdw.review_text: I always recommend this place to friends of mine who visit The City. The food is a bit pricey here though. The artichoke appetizer was recommended, and my friends and I loved it! Very good to start off the night at this upscale restaurant. Great gourmet burgers! I've had their garden burger (since I gave up meat for Lent), and it was delish!   My favorite thing to eat here is the dessert! SOOO GOOD! You have to have their sundaes!

OXqUFsnWcTcpnnErxf3XIQ.review_text: Hands down, best place to enjoy a delicious steak.  Live music, wonderfull staff, great location and delicious food.  Hawaiian Rib-eye, ooh how I adore you!

iaP8F3HlSpZAE8gB5mFj3A.review_text: The chain that is not a chain. Have never been let down and always impressed by the food, service and decor or the SF location. I'm no "foodie" so I like the straight forward approach and ability to order most anything and be satisfied. Recently we had a great experience with the management & staff where we brought in a gift certificate that was purchased at an auction a few too many months back- it had expired... The management team of Natasha and Jonathon kept us totally satisfied by accepting it.   Yes we will be back for more Bourbon, Ribs, Ahi Tuna Salad & Cobbler- Solid!

qGsxD1jBApPpn9eAps8ApQ.review_text: Service was great. Our waiter and the host were extremely kind and attentive. The spinach artichoke dip was pretty good. Ordered the filet, which was cooked perfectly-true medium-and seasoned to perfection.  The sides could have been a tad been more flavorful. Overall, great experience.

W9C9GRrRObZGV05aW6FRpA.review_text: I am a long time patron on Hillstone/Houston...I am in real estate. In addition to my own enjoyment, I have referred countless clients, industry associates & family over the years. I have never had a bad meal, the consistency is simply amazing. I do have to say that the #1 reason I return over and over again is the team that provides such wonderful service. It starts with the welcome as the door opens but it is absolutely the team behind the bar. They are all exceptional. I have come to know quite a few of them personally and sadly it is time for several to move along. It started with Jillian disappearing, now Rachel :(  too many talents to mention!! Yoga  Diva (despite being published..continued on to be a pro) and Ben...:( All extremely talented and will be sorely missed. A few other Super Stars...Randy..always a breath of fresh air. Happy & up beat..Always! Claudia...the Godess of dance...has returned and thank God!! An extreme delight. Exceptional in her service. Caitlynn and Joe are holding strong.... This group of young professionals and all their contemporaries that I do not have the pleasure of knowing are rare. I come from a corporate background. It is hard to miss the presence of a heavy handed corporate structure behind the scenes at Hilstone. Despite the energy at times...this team carries on without a hint of notice. They are true pros...consistently.  I do hope that the organization who built this wonderful chain of restaurants does not underestimate the talent pool that exisits. We live in a city where there is a wealth of good restaurants with great food. I cannot say in 25 years there is any place in the city I would rather revisit over and over again. The number one reason is because of the people who provide the service and the experience. !! Highly recommend!!

dUL9TUH6B_jUkPgC6562hQ.review_text: Hillstone SF blows all my previous 5-star reviews out of the water and puts them to complete and utter shame. What sets them apart from any restaurants I've ever been to is not the quality of food (don't get me wrong, I ain't complainin' at all!), but their impeccable service. The hub, best friend and I spent the last half hour of dinner thanking our servers, Brian and Michelle, for being incredibly good to us. We made sure to let them and their bosses know that they have completely won us over and we'll be coming back. On a regular basis, too. Like my hub says: "I want to give them my money."  That's saying a lot because the three of us have impossibly high standards, especially when it comes to food and dining. You know 'those people' who always have a negative opinion about everything and analyzes--no, criticizes--everything down to the very last diminutive detail? Yeah, that's us. We are annoyingly hard to please.  Here are just a few examples of how Hillstone has done right by us so far:  1) One night I couldn't decide on a drink, so the bartender suggested something. It was gooood. After 4 of them I asked our waiter if it had a name. It didn't. So I recommended the name "Trinity" (gin, grapefruit, elderflower). A few weeks later I returned and asked for it by name, thinking they'd be clueless. Sure enough, the waitress returned with said drink. This shows how much Hillstone listens to their customers.  2) Last night the hub ordered the special, NY strip. It came out too charred on the outside and left a bitter taste to an otherwise perfect medium-rare. He was reluctant to place a complaint. Our waitress, Michelle, did not for one moment question him  or act and look inconvenienced. She was so incredibly gracious. So incredibly gracious.  3) Brian, who I assume is her supervisor, took the time to come by and apologize in an unobtrusive manner. He explained how the steak is prepared, which was rather unconventional and why it left a char, but reassured us that they'd try and prepare the steak as close as possible to what he desired. Listening to your guests without compromising the chef's vision and expertise? That's classy.  4) While there was some confusion regarding the bill, it was handled exceptionally well. When we called Michelle over to get some clarification, she already knew what to say and do.   5) They took the NY strip off the bill! Because to them, our loyalty to the restaurant is more important than a $44 steak. Of course we included the price of the steak in the tip we left. That was the only decent thing to do. It was a 30% tip that was well-deserved.  Needless to say, we left not just happy but amazed. And actually, a little inspired. All businesses--not just restaurants--can learn something from Hillstone SF. They operate like a well-oiled machine and the end-product keeps hard-to-please customers like me happy and loyal.

_Gm6Mb6ivDAIVPjZoQNuNg.review_text: Food and service, this pace is excellent.  Period.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: THIS, my friends, is how mid-range dining should be. Between three of us: snapper topped with crab meat (that's right, crab meat), filet mignon, and ribs. Oh, and the greatest artichoke ever. And a brownie/ice cream dessert. And a slice of key lime pie. And free corkage. And excellent service. And the fact that I feel like I've escaped the city while inside here. This is love.

jOZheuOkUGKp4htT0xHIlA.review_text: This place is quite impressive.  The decor is beautiful, the staff is overly accommodating (in a good way), and the food is top notch.  5 stars all the way!  My aunt had raved about this place for years while it was still known as Houston's.  Although the name has changed, it is still part of the Houston's family & serves typical steakhouse fare with an emphasis on grilled & roasted meats.    We arrived without a reservation on Friday night.  Since one person from our party was delayed, we asked to be put on a waitlist as we enjoyed a glass of wine on the patio next to the fireplace.  The hosts were very gracious & said to let us know when our 4th person arrived so they could get us a table right away.  They did, almost immediately!  I was shocked seeing that it was a Friday night & the place was packed.  Score one for the host station.  Their menu has lots of choices for meat lovers & vegetarians alike.  I was eyeing the house made veggie burger, but decided to go with the wood grilled salmon.  It melted in my mouth & the simple spinach side was amazing too.  We also ordered a kale salad for the table & it was so delicious that we promptly ordered another one!  My aunties split an order of the barbecue pork ribs.  I snuck a bite & agreed that they were some of the best ribs I had ever tasted.    Here's another great perk when dining at Hillstone:  no corkage fee!  They have a decent selection of wines by the glass & bottle too.  No fancy dinner should be without some decadent desserts, so we went for the brownie a la mode & the apple walnut cobbler a la mode.  So yummy!  I'm not sure what type of coffee they serve, but their decaf was amazing.  I could sit there all night sipping coffee & enjoying the ambiance.  Love this place!

mJnOua0hVBJ2eeu1mErJQg.review_text: I've been here a few times but this weekend was the first time I have been here since I turned 21 and it was much more enjoyable. The typical 30 minute wait here was much more tolerable when able to sit at the bar and socialize.   After a couple beers we were seated and ordered some appetizers including the spinach & artichoke dip and the oak grilled artichoke. The dip was amazing and we asked for more chips but the grilled artichoke was just so-so.
