For dinner, I ordered the halibut with grilled veggies, I know I got the fish at a steak place...., but it was very tender and when I mixed it with the au jus from a friends prime rib dish, it was that much better. My friends also had the filet, veggie plate, and the warm nut brownie was probably the best end to and dinner ever. The brownie was sooo warm and soft and perfect, it is a MUST if you ever go here (my mouth is watering right now...)!

RXmBvTHOZcjNr90b1PxtsQ.review_text: Great french dip, dessert, ambiance, and service!  I was never a huge fan of french dips...before THIS place. I've actually never noticed this place before being taken here one day. It's relatively close to Pier 39 (as in, its definitely walking distance if you're a walker). The restaurant has a feeling of old school casual class to it. You could probably dress it up or down.   The Goods:  Famous French Dip- $19; 1 sandwich in 2 halves--enough to share-- & fries- Okay, for a sandwich in the afternoon, its on the pricier side yes, but the prime rib is extremely tender and when drenched in sauce makes the sandwich delectable. The bread they use is truly a SOFT roll, in that its so soft and fresh that it will literally soak up the dip in an instant of 'dippage'.   Warm Five Nut Brownie-$8; Good sized brownie with vanilla ice cream-Very tasty. Very sweet. Not for the faint of heart. The brownie is served warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream drizzled with caramel and whatever 'champagne custard' sauce is. If you have a craving for something heavy on the chocolate get this. It's 'hella' good.

RuMTrArIbDDFHlXJYPZFfA.review_text: As soon as I walked in, I was treated rudely by an employee when I asked how to go about getting seated.  She responded like I was asking the stupidest question ever.  (The host's desk is actually in the center of the restaurant, not near the entry door - sorry for not knowing this in advance, condescending employee).  I sat at the bar, and the bartender was kind and attentive, so a star for that.  The Traditional Salad exceeded expectations and was delicious, a star for that.  The artichoke dip which is apparently amazing I thought was meh, and the entree I ordered, which I can hardly remember, was mediocre.  Oh, and they served in a rushing manner, serving me my next plate before I was even close to done with the one I was currently working on.  I think this company makes their money on the "quantity over quality" concept.  Fast-paced, so-so food that appeals to a wide array of people and serves high volume every night.  That might make profits, but it didn't please me as a customer.

xmbctgi09ub-6qNgLJ-9Hw.review_text: I had a pretty darn good cheeseburger. I didn't mind paying 16 bucks for it. The shoe string fries were OK. Which was fine. I was able to eat more burger.  The bloody mary I ordered at the bar was gross! I don't like sweet and this tasted like  they used a cup of sugar! Gross... Not worth the 8.95 price, but if you like sweet, this might be the drink for you.  We had a party of 16 and they split us into tables of 4 with separate waiters and checks. They still charged us the 18% gratuity which I think was ridiculous! Especially since our waitress was horrible! She was never around! This was the reason I gave 3 stars

jMV_J2YwgBtiYZu3OCl4Ow.review_text: Went here for dinner on a Sunday night. Attentive bartender, attentive host. There's a three-piece jazz band, and I'm not into jazz at ALL, but I liked them a lot. My only complaint was it was too loud, between the music and all the people - it was very hard to hear the people sitting with me. Hillstone - sound insulation: look into it further!  The food was excellent. Was there with five people, all enjoy different levels of healthiness, and each person really loved their food. Be warned: the desserts are huge - too big to eat alone. There's a gas fireplace, there's outdoor seating, the waitstaff is on top of everything. Hillstone: great job making a first impression!   The bathrooms are clean, and the soap is not industrial. I plan to go back, and bring various people.

cFYC07QgTSFK2NhN7jP6yQ.review_text: First time here and I'll probably be back.  The grilled artichoke was really good.  Caesar salad was a bit tangy but was still pretty good.  Ordered medium rare prime rib and got medium but was very tasty.  Loved their homemade fries.  The apple cobbler was excellent.  Worth a trip to this place.

VH5ia_13wVbbE2etBDSo5g.review_text: First, let me disclose that I worked here over 4 years ago.  Well, i did for a month and a half, which was the length of my bartending career in the restaurant industry (it just wasn't for me).  After the trauma of working here wore off, I actually enjoyed being a customer here.  The service is always very efficient.  There is a very comprehensive wine list, but quite honestly, since there's NO corkage fee (which is totally awesome), I'd much rather bring one from my personal collection.  The food, while a bit overpriced, is always consistently good.  Tonight, I tried the Steak Noodle Salad, which was very flavorful with lots of steak and avocado.    But they definitely save the best for last.  You must try their Hot Fudge Sundae.  It honestly will change your life.  It's pricey, but it's massive, so it's definitely something to split.  It's about 3-4 scoops of vanilla ice cream with candied nuts and whipped cream, but the best part is... the TCHO chocolate sauce, served in a tureen, which is absolute perfection - not too sweet and wonderfully chocolate-y.  I'm not a huge chocolate or sundae person, but I absolutely LOVE this.  Make sure you save room!

vW4FYNT2aZLLO_E0AuQpYA.review_text: This place has the best French dip sandwich great service  very nice people We will be back

ASvjSBCYRd4GhOtSIn8Gyw.review_text: Great since I didn't have to pay (May or June 2009?) !  I love being treated out to restaurants like this!   Thanks to my exchange-student's family for our treat to Houstons! I've been here a second time too in Aug 2009, dining before a jaunt to Mighty SF to get SALTED (see: yelp.com/events/san-fran… ) with Househeads - Jesse and Denise (see: yelp.com/user_details?us… ) Food, Drinks, Service and Ambiance are always on par for this restaurant.  Yes, prices are up there but this is a great spot no doubt for business dinners or for out-of-towners looking for a great meal, service, and ambiance. + Portions are generous.   + Rib Eye = perfect + Prime Rib - Incroyable!  Better than the House of Prime Rib, Gullivers, etc... + Ribs Awesome. + Artichoke & Spinach Dip = consistently decadent and sinful junk food + Crab Cakes - WOW + Desserts to die for! I'll be back. I'm a fan!

Ap209Lxo2kidYcjFdoMJcA.review_text: Came here on two occasions: 1) for my cousins birthday and 2) for my boyfriends birthday.  First experience coming here was alright. Cramping 8 people in a booth was pretty difficult so I was a bit unhappy about that.  I ordered the veggie burger and that bun that came with it was amazing!!!! The burger was mehh, wish it stayed together more.  Second experience coming here was definitely better. I ordered the Dungeness crab cakes and they were so damn good!! I love that it wasn't pan fried on both sides (bread on the one side that it was pan fried). It was basically full of crab meat! Just drooling thinking about it! My boyfriend ordered the baby back ribs are they literally just fell off the bone, a whole chunk of meat. It was incredible to see and my boyfriend enjoyed it way too much.  The ambiance here is amazing, i love the live music playing! Makes the food so much more enjoyable and tasty!  Had a great time and will definitely be back. Parking is always a breeze.

-ftBqr_QpcdVKx3rONjLYA.review_text: So delicious, they offer a really good service. The ambience is excellent. Some meals are quite expensive, but in general this restaurant is really good.

AY56bYUFqedmZYMg_ygBXA.review_text: Oak Grilled Artichokes+ Hawaiian Rib Eye with fries+ Spinach and Chicken Waldorf Salad+ Warm Five Nut Brownie+ Cakebread Sauvignon Blanc+ Fiddlehead Pinot Noir+  =Perfect Saturday evening with my fam bam.

NxWi5n4GRChPkInQrV-sOw.review_text: Love love this place.  Yes its a bit pricey , but it has the best vege burger in the world.  the kale salad kicks ass, and you can't go wrong with the artichokes.  the bartenders have an amazing attitude with how crowded it gets. thanks hillstones

g5nRWb8Ly3TYMcSH0heB8w.review_text: Before I was fortunate to explore to different steahouses, I'd have to say this was on the top of my list before.  Very cool location near the piers, and it has an awesome ambiance.  The environment is not quiet, but it's kind of dark and black in there which makes it feel modern in its own way.  The steak is good, but I wouldn't say to die for.  The filet and their cowboy rib eye I enjoy.  I also do enjoy their hamburgers that come with these really thin french fries! YUM!  Place is cool to hang out with friends to grab a bite to eat.

2xZ682Kr23ar3SYWNTK7rw.review_text: great service food was great . will be back soon

JzPDFW16B9RuRpVS_nigyA.review_text: "Oh what a day... what a day... what a day..." -Erykah Badu  Let's just put it this way... I go to Hillstone's when I'm having a bad day.  I always get the same thing.  Seared ahi tuna salad, a side of french fries with roumalade for dipping and I order an ice cream sundae as the piece de resistance.  By the time my meal is done....  1.  you have to roll me out of the restaurant because I'm so tired from eating 2.  I have the silliest smile on my face due to pure, unadulterated happiness 3.  the air seems crisper, the trees seem greener and the seals at pier 39 are even more adorable (hard to believe it's possible, but yes, it's true)  I've heard their other salads are good as well as the french dip, but you can't veer me off the path I know is tried and true.  The service is excellent and try to sit on the patio on a beautiful day.  You can get your grub and tan on!

qC50T_ldJ96wPBNDD6vtEA.review_text: I've been to Hillstone a couple times - once with my parents and once for my birthday.  Hillstone is a great place for a classy dinner or celebration.  While the wine menu is extensive you can just as easily bring your own wine.  The free uncorking fee only works for the first two bottles, after that they will charge you $15 per bottle.  Both times I was here everyone I was with kept remarking about what an amazing place this is.  The food is phenomenal, the jazz music adds to the ambiance, and the staff is helpful and accommodating.    Most recently when I was here for my birthday, one of my friends was running late, and the staff had no problem seating us without her and directed her to our table when she arrived.  We were lucky enough to get the best booth in the place - the 7 person rounded booth by the band.  It definitely made the experience special.  I also booked through open table a couple weeks in advance and called a week in advance to change the reservation slightly.  I tried to make the change on Open Table (adding one person to our party) but Open Table wanted me to change the reservation time too...and I did not want to do that, so I called the restaurant instead and the hostess had no problem accommodating my request.

ZWH5gJZSfZ4-UA9XqbXo_w.review_text: I think as San Franciscans we get too carried away with finding hole-in-the-wall, mom and pop, 250 square feet kind of places.  Hillstone, a chain and formerly known as Houstons is a solid choice for some tasty American food and a lax corkage policy.  I am far from a vegetarian but the veggie burger is one of the best burgers I've ever had.

Pxi1YSerIqfDaTRW0A7z_Q.review_text: Different name but it's still the same Houston's steak house that you know (and love).  I had the prime rib and it was really good. Nice thick cut of meat, seasoned and cooked perfectly and was reasonably priced ($38.00).

vYxAdwDBIpR2MAkHUQjEOQ.review_text: My husband and I go her to eat often I can't really think of anything on their menu I don't like. They are a little pricey but the food always looks and tastes great. When they have carrots as their seasonal vegetable it is awesome!

4FRXWn2HP3frGLgU-uSSmQ.review_text: Great environment - 3 options: sit down formal, open bar informal and outdoor...while the staff can bounce between business and friendly, they always get it done...order the kale salad with Thai steak or the burger...one of the few places that stays open throughout the day.  JA

wxSKcdjtluS4BKZDSc_Apg.review_text: *** Celiac Friendly ***  While they do not have a gluten-free menu, servers have always been more than willing to work with the chef for me.   The food easily gets five stars. It is imaginative and delicious! Dishes to check out are the house-smoked salmon and the ribs. If you were thinking "lox" then don't. The salmon is smoked but it is really more like cooked salmon then the smoked salmon traditionally eaten on a bagel. It is moist and oily and the flavor is delicious!  Unfortunately the service barely gets two stars. I am a local and come here fairly frequently.  The service, provided by bored but beautifully-coiffed teenage girls is consistently lacking.  Expect to have to search out your waitress (or someone else) for anything, including getting your water refilled and paying your check.  Getting your check is another story. They will drop it the instant that they notice that you have stopped eating.

k7vY4cteg3nq1O-Ff4f8GA.review_text: This is one of the better places to have barbecue food in the bay area.  I ordered the bbq pork ribs, with Louisiana-style dirty rice and sauteed spinach, and enjoyed and finished all my food.  The rib meat was well cooked, tender and just the right firmness, not too overwhelmed by the bbq sauce as some bbq restaurants do.  On the flip side, the wait time during dinner hours can be quite long (we waited around 45 minutes), and all 7 of us had to squeeze around a table for 6.

DTEiEY6CrQcyLBfZKbpKMg.review_text: Fantastic. Everything about this place is great. Friendly staff, great prices, hot jazz band every night, fine steaks, and even a bar and fireplace. No corkage too! The ambiance is nice and quiet and the lighting is understated and low. If there is something wrong you will get comped. Make sure to call in advance to reserve especially on weekends. I've probably been here 15 times and plan on coming back regularly.

lWrDnoHn3g8GH1ppd6L_0g.review_text: You can't beat the location right on the embarcadero. Although Hillstone has a modern look the environment was warm and inviting. I appreciated how patrons could dress formally or casually. A jazz band was performing when we got there and sounded amazing (I don't even listen to jazz).  My wife had the baby back ribs and she was happy. I snuck in a rib onto my plate and became very envious but I quickly turned my attention to my hawaiian rib eye. I ordered my steak medium/rare and it was cooked to perfections. It was seared on the outside locking in the juices and the flavors were outstanding. I appreciated that the steak had a hawaiian flavor to it without having a thick glaze or sauce. The mashed potatoes and asparagus complimented the steak well.  I love to try new restaurants and I recommend this place 100%. There are so many places to choose from in SF but next time we go back we are definitely stopping by Hillstone.

jjHMbNsNYV3sQ13bh4lOCw.review_text: Because of the ambiance I give this place a 4, it's lively and the booths are spacious and circular which is awesome for a larger group (in our case there were 6 of us). It's very dim and there was live band playing during our meal. We started with the artichoke and rosemary bread and then our entrees- I had the veggie burger which was interesting- it crumbled easy, not like a usual veggie burger. We would have gotten dessert but there weren't any fruity types of desserts... I'm a sucker for a good apple crisp or any fruit cobbler served with ice cream.

q3x249UGWYz0x6FsYg9Zmw.review_text: Came here for lunch after a doctor's appointment after passing by several times.  Location is great, beautiful views from all sides, pretty patios, decorated modernly elegant.  We sat at the bar.  Service was excellent, waitresses/bartenders were very pleasant and helpful, although they don't explain much on the menu unless you ask specifically (like the couscous... it wasn't explained that it was more than just couscous).   Drink/bar menu is fantastic... lots of choices and variety in the brands of the liquor and spirits.  Water is chilled in bottles in fridge, which is very nice and a favorite point of many of my top restaurant choices.  Food was quite good.  My husband ordered the French dip sandwich and it was amazing, done perfectly and melts in your mouth.  He ordered the mashed potato side and they were very good too.  I wanted to do a bit of mix match, so I did a couple of apps/sides... the spinach/artichoke dip and couscous. The Spinach & artichoke dip was really good but I didn't like the chips it came with... I prefer pita or breads of some sort... I actually asked if they had bread or if I could do a side of bread and all I could get was the focaccia bread and olive plate... so I had to spend a bit more getting this additional app, wish they could have accommodated a bit with the bread... the bread was very good though and the assortment of olives/peppers were great... just became too much food with that additional add, since I had done the couscous too.  The couscous, from what I could tell, changes daily.  The one I had was very yummy but not what I was expecting... it was served as a cold dish with mint, lemon, raisins, and a lot of other ingredients.  It was really good, just not what I was expecting.  Only low point, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, as you do pay for good food, but it can be a splurge, it was a pretty big lunch bill.  Prices don't vary too much from lunch to dinner.

erxFvHWM214X2Lj0uja4wA.review_text: not sure what is going on with restaurants now a days but they seem to all have started the tradition of not wanting to take large reservations and you can't even try and get a table next to each other if you have to split up your party.  too bad.

1_fHWLVBU0-oLBlXGkFDnQ.review_text: The food is delicious and the service is great. I went for dinner with family on a rainy Saturday night. The ambience was very comfortable and inviting. They had live music and a nice warm fire going which worked nicely into the refined rustic interior. The place was very busy and felt like the place to be. A great choice when you're in the city if you can get in. Definitely reserve ahead of time.

P5bUL3Engv-2z6kKohB6qQ.review_text: Im trying to remember when they changed their name away from Houston's. THe Hillstone group has always had solid restaurants. Bandera, Los Altos Grill, etc. The no corkage is always awesome but since their wine list is so ecclectic, Im not sure there's a reason to bring your own unless it was something you saved for an occasion. But even then, take that bottle somewhere else! Roast chicken, Hawaiian rib eye are both solid. Add classic cocktails and already mentioned wine list and you have a good solid meal. Staff are very well trained and always take care of you. 4.3 stars.

-wbVnj6P-YgGHKqLbJ-XWg.review_text: Hmm. I can't say I'm that big of a fan of Hillstone. I came here for a friend's birthday and the service was okay. Nothing spectacular.   Anyways, I went ahead and ordered the broiled salmon with green beans and fingerling potatoes. The salmon was uhm, a bit overcooked in my opinion. It was dried out and a bit scratchy... BUT I have to admit that the green beans were delicious! I would've preferred a big bowl of that over the salmon any day!   Overall, I find this place just meh. I definitely don't think that little thing of salmon and green beans was worth $30. MEHHHH.  PS. My friends who ordered medium rare steaks, pretty much got well-done steaks.

Ml10-gUsa35Li928lthq8w.review_text: We used to love it as Houstons, just ok as Hillstone. With so many places to dine I will not be going back.

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Food: 3 Decor: 3 Service: 4  Came here with a party of 7 for lunch. There are only 3 tables that seat more than 6 in the main room, so try to get reservations early if you have a large party.  1. Spinach & Artichoke Dip with salsa, sour cream and warm tortilla chips, 14 ~Pretty good. We got 2 for our table, and it comes with bottomless chips.  2. Hawaiian Rib-Eye pineapple soy ginger marinade, with hand-cut French fries, 35 ~Pretty good. Marinade complemented the steak nicely, but the fries were disappointing.  Service was good.

ZGo7Xu99ainm04cfexo-Uw.review_text: Really enjoyed my first visit here. Came a few minutes early for a 6pm reservation, so I was able to watch the chefs in action in the kitchen while waiting for a table. I had the spinach artichoke dip, which I really enjoyed. The dip was warm and tasty and the chips were HUGE!  I then had the jumbo crab cakes with the famous French fries and coleslaw. Crab cakes were crisp and flaky and the French fries were crispy as well.  Service was attentive without going overboard.  Yes, it was expensive (I paid around $70, which includes tip plus a 2% charge for SF's Universal Health Care initiative). However, the food, the service and the light jazz band playing in the background made it worth the money.
